description:
This review is solely about the WINGS!!
Hands down the best I've had in the Bay Area period. They're the "stop" in Wingstop because once you've tried HSNP you'll stop going there lol! 

If you love wings you have to give these guys a try!
author: Brittney H.

description:
This place is a small little shop that serves fried chicken and has literally one of the most expansive collections of hot sauce for sale. 

Fried Chicken: This place serves fried chicken wings, sandwiches, and a sandwich where the bread is waffles!....and I obviously got the waffle sandwich. The Chicken on its own was delicious. Good pieces of meet, great fry, and most importantly...good taste. 

Fried Chicken Sandwich: Taste-Good. Practically-No. It was delicious and had a nice kick with the cole slaw and siracha. Now, it is probably one of the hardest things to eat since it essentially just falls apart. Worth trying...but eat in the company of close friends. 

Store: Super small with around 2 small tables to sit and an outdoor bench. So to go might be a good route to go. Now what is great is they have an amazing selection of hot sauces to purchase and something you should definitely do before leaving. 

Drinks: Some drink for purchase. As a note, water is bottle purchase only. 

Get here: MUNI, Cable Car, or Rideshare. If you dare to drive, it is street parking only
author: Chris O.

description:
The best wings ! Chris is my favorite, going to try the other flavors. I've been told all the flavors are super good. 


UPDATE: 
I've been back since I first came here. I tried all their flavors and YESSS they're good as hell! Also I tried their potato wedges and let me tell you when I say they are delicious alone just with ranch.. I'm not being dramatic lol they're super nice there as well which is just a plus because the food comes out fresh and hot (which is what I love) this place has became one of my spots for sure!
author: Alyssa B.

description:
This little hole-in-the-wall is definitely a hidden gem! It's a chicken wing to-go shop and a retail store selling an impressive number of different hot sauces! There are only two tables to stand and eat at, but no seats. No restrooms either. While it's a no frills kind of space, the food is definitely something to write home about! They make their wings in small batches, and they are made to order.

I had Ultra Goliath Waffle Sandwich, which contained fried chicken, cabbage, and sriracha-sushi sauce. It definitely had a kick to it, but it was really flavorful! The waffle can get a little soggy after a while, so try to eat it while the waffle is still hot and crispy! I also tried the Panko Parmesan Wings. These were one of the wings on the menu that are not eligible to be made into a combo. The wings were doused in sauce and definitely finger licking good! Can't wait to try some of their other flavors!
author: Lisa Y.

description: This was a life changing experience. I'm not a big wing person, but holy shit this place has changed my life. I like crispy wings, no sauce usually, but these wings had sauce on it and they were still crispy and that's crazy to me! Sauce and not soggy?? And the chicken slid off the bone easy! This is the perfect wing experience. We also had the waffles which were delicious. They also sell hot sauce (some seen on Hot Ones which is v cool). My fave wing flavor was Honey Salt & Pepper. We also had some molasses parm one, pad Thai and buffalo. All amazing. There's not much space to sit and eat but who cares when the wings are that bomb. I love you Hot Sauce and Panko. Also take a look at the decor inside! Some interesting reads!
author: Caitlyn S.

description:
They ain't kidding about the hot sauce here... If you're a weak sauce like myself (who had to purchase milk across the street mid-meal), best not risk it. 

3/5 waffle sandwich: had their infamous fried chicken waffle sandwich, and was sadly disappointed. If you eat it fast enough, maybe you'll be ok but the waffles get soggy. Quickly. 

2/5 seating: it was like 4pm on a Saturday, and there still wasn't enough seating simply because of how small the place is. There are 2 standing tables inside and one bench outside. Definitely a take-home place unless you get super lucky.
author: Olivia C.

description:
BEST CHICKEN WINGS... EVER!!!

Right on Hyde in Nob Hill, this wing spot is hands down one of cutest eateries on the street. Not very accessible by public transport, and kind of poop for parking...but this spot is definitely worth the trek. 

When you enter, you immediately notice the open kitchen in front of you. As you approach the counter to order, you'll spot the large wall of 300+ hot sauces for purchase. This is definitely a take out spot, seeing as there is literally one table in the front left window with no seats and it's pretty cramped, having space for maybe two or three people. If you're lucky enough to eat in there, they have really funny and witty decor. But if you plan take this to a park or eat outside, make sure you have some hand wipes handy! It gets messy real quick.

The menu is definitely Asian inspired. There are so many different options; it can be overwhelming. Pick a couple back ups because sometimes they run out of stuff over the course of the day. I've been here several times and can't think of one thing I didn't LOVE. I highly recommend getting a waffle with your wings as well, and definitely say yes to the whipped butter. I'll definitely return until I've tried EVERYTHING.
author: Navila H.

description:
This is definitely my favorite spot for chicken wings because they have a huge selection of flavors to pick from and they are made fresh. I ordered Chris's - honey salty pepper and Garlic - Parmesan and bacon. Each order came with 6 wings and they were cooked to perfection. I wish I had ordered more since they were so tasty!

The last time I came here was when they were still located in the Richmond district. Parking was easier at their old location. Now that they are located closer to downtown, parking is hard to find so I'd recommend taking public transit. The place itself is more of a hole in a wall takeout place. There are only 2 tables inside where you can stand and eat your chicken wings.
author: Ashley C.

description:
Wowwwwww so goood! I heard about this place from a friend and I was trying to find a reasonably priced yet creative spot for some grub with my family! This place stood out for its neighborhood location but big city bites. 

Everything was phenomenal here! The sweet thai chili wings were bursting with flavor. The Goliath chicken and waffle sandwich was the perfect mix of savory and sweet. The belgian waffle, cabbage, sriracha-sushi sauce, and chicken went together really well. I pigged out and got the duck confit fried drummettes as well. It's hard to beat crispy duck skin! This place really knocked it out of the park! Don't know why anyone has ever given this place a 1 star review..sheesh
author: Maurice C.

description:
We stumbled across this place one day after getting stuck behind a cable car on Hyde Street. We had no time to stop but marked it down on Yelp as a place to try out.

As you can tell from the photos, it's a pretty small establishment, and they certainly carry a lot of different types of hot sauce.

There are only two tables, maybe three, so I'm guessing that most folks order take out. When we finally did stop by one day, we had only 15 minutes so we placed one order of the honey and pepper wings. We contemplated making them spicy but decided that, for this first time, we would have them "original style" (our term, not theirs).

We were not disappointed. The wings had a lot of flavor and were crispy without being dry. I should have ordered them spicy!

We are looking forward to coming back and when we've tried more of the menu, I might make this five stars. I'm really looking forward to the return visit because the wings were some of the best I've had in a while.
author: Paul O.

description:
VERY TASTY UNIQUE FLAVORFUL WINGS! Five words in my mind that very well describes this hole in a wall! They got cool and funny art works (satires). They have a list of different types of wings you can get. All very saucy and crispy. Wings came out pretty quick, in less then 15 mins. The wings itself was very juicy and tender, what a great plus am i right??? I got the bacon bourbon wings and yaki wings. I like the yaki wings a lot, the bacon bourbon wings were really good as well but i do wish the bacon was a little more crispy, but the wings compensate itself for being so tender and juicy! Seating is very limited but i manage to grab the round table for my friends and i to enjoy the wings on a fine beautiful Thursday in the city! I cant wait to come back here and try out the other wings they got! 

P.s. they have a large variety of hot sauce you can buy!!
author: Kevin K.

description:
Hot sauce and panko has some really unique wing flavors offered

I tried the green (cilantro jalapeno ginger), chris' (honey salty pepper) and the ramen wings

Chris' was my favorite of the three
The green one was okay
The ramen wings were coated in ramen and dusted with ramen seasoning
It came with lime and some spicy mayo sauce
These were quite heavy, the batter was pretty thick
But they were surprisingly good

It's around $7 for an order of 6 wings

Seating inside is limited
Or nonexistent.. there are just 2 small tables for you to stand at

Walked over to a nearby park to enjoy my dinner with a view :)
author: Mai L.

description:
Yooooo, this girl loves chicken wings!  Sooo naturally, when I found out about Hot Sauce and Panko I bookmarked it right away and was intent on having bite once I was in the city.  

What caught my eye initially was the cheese buldak -- the KJU (aka Kim Joon Un - It's Buldak) and then I looked at the rest of their amazing menu that offers truly unique wing flavors I've never tried before like Ramen, Old Bay, Bacon Wrapped Bourbon Molasses, Pad Thai, etc. Wing selections start at $6.89 for 6 pieces (reasonable for SF if you ask me!) and they also offer sandwiches, fish n chips, tempura wedge fries, and waffles for those that want to go the chicken & waffles route. 

I went semi safe with my choices:  Teriyaki, Garlic Bacon Parmesan, and Kim Joon Un. I would've ordered more, but it was just me doing the eating.  ALL flavors were really good, but my favorite had to be the Garlic Bacon Parmesan, OMG yum!  The teriyaki was so delicious too.  My tolerance for spicy is weak, so I was only able to get through 2 KJU's before tapping out.  I think it would've tasted even better though if it was hot & fresh with the cheese still melted.  I had my order delivered to my hotel so by the time the KJU got to me, it wasn't melted anymore ;(

In any case, I love that they offer the delivery option via Postmates & Caviar.  Definitely convenient if you are staying further away and don't want to make the trek like me!  It allowed me get a taste without having to leave my hotel.  

I would've ordered again, but they were closed the last 2 days I was in the city.  Will definitely have to try them again and try the rest of their flavors!
author: Maria P.

description:
I want to thank the wing Gods and my friend, Bianca B, for introducing me to the best-kept secret in SF. 

Popped into Hot Sauce and Panko for Easter. I went with the wing + Belgian waffle combo. When I asked which flavors were the most popular, the lady pointed straight to the Korean and Thai Spice flavors. I opted for the Korean wings and they were just straight delicious!! Spicy and sweet, eat all six, just do it. I tried one of the Thai spice wings and it's noteworthy to mention there is a solid distinction between the two orders. 

This shop is serving you chicken wing realness. Oh, and the waffles? Do yourself a favor and make it a combo.

(-1 star for lack thereof seating space; it's technically a "to-go" spot)
author: Sarin P.

description:
Hot Sauce & Panko is a tiny hole in the wall spot that sells hot sauce, fried chicken wings, and waffles. By tiny I mean there are two tables inside and a bench outside. It isn't meant for groups or dining in. Better off trying to park close by and eat in your car. 

This place has a ton of hilarious signs and artifacts to keep you entertained while you wait in line to order or for your food to come out. 

Excellent crispy, flavorful wings. $15 for 12 pieces of wings (6 each) which isn't too bad. 
Bacon garlic Parmesan
"Green" cilantro ginger
author: James B.

description:
These people clearly know how to do wings.

The Chris wings are honey and pepper-- feels pretty Asian. Crunchy skin, although a little drier meat than the other two wings given the thinner / lack of breading. 4/5.

Although I can't say I loved the ramen wings (very unique idea!), it felt like  there was a puffy layer of air between the wing and the meat, which really added to the mouth feel. You can really taste that jalapeno in their sriracha. 3.75/5.

My foodie experience wouldn't be complete without at least one type of wing of the store's namesake, so I got the parmesan panko. The parmesan was visible, but I couldn't taste it. Good texture, but probably my least favorite of the three. 3.5/5.

--
Edit: My coworkers were lovely enough to let me get a taste of the green, sticky, and Korean wings! Maybe it's my stuffy nose, but they weren't as good this time around. The Korean wings were covered in a thick gojuchang sauce, but otherwise were somewhat dry. The sticky wings (a combo of parmesan and garlic) were sticky, yes, but also a bit dry. The green wings were my favorite of the 3. My coworkers still liked the Chris wings the most. Those tempura wedge fries were great though-- like steak fries in elementary school but actually fried. Super creamy mash in the middle.
author: Nicole H.

description:
Oh my. It is quite hard for me to be impressed by chicken wings, but I am impressed. Hot Sauce and Panko offered so many unique flavors, it was SO difficult to choose from. The staff told us the first 3 on the menu were the most popular. So we got the Chase's (Same as Chris': Honey Salty Pepper, but hot) and the Green (Cilantro Jalapeno Ginger). Chase's was my favorite, it had a really nice kick to it. 

We got lucky and were the only ones there at the time, so service was pretty quick. There are 2 very small stand-up tables, which I'm sure are occupied the majority of the time. So plan to dine to-go. 

This tiny little gem is full of history and personality. I enjoyed all of the fun and witty things they had plastered all over the walls and shelves. They also sell hot sauce here, hence the name. 

10/10 would recommend to a friend. Can't wait to return!
author: Jessica C.

description: The wings were delicious! It was the first time we tried this place. It's a little hole in the wall on the corner. Parking is difficult to find on the street.
author: Jay M.

description:
Wow, a tiny spot with two square tables and maybe every hot sauce in America on their wall. 

I got the waffle and wings combo for $10.99 with a friend. We each got 2 different types of wings, the Chris's and the Korean.

The best part about these wings were its extremely crispy yet light fried exterior. This part alone makes these wings worth it!

The Chris's was a honey salty peppery style sauce but it felt a little too sweet. I would've preferred a tad more balance between the sweet and savory aspects of the wings, still tasted good though!

The Koreans was a delicious gochujjang sauce with a low level of spice. I thought this flavor was tastier than Chris's and the gochujjang really stands out.

The waffles were just your regular run of the mill waffles with butter, nothing special. I do like my waffles a little crispier though as these were pretty soft. Next time I'd just get more wings instead.
author: Joshua H.

description:
I've always known this place as a hole in the wall Chinese restaurant.  I was curious to see why all the sudden there were large crowds waiting outside on weekends.  Little did I know, this place had turned into a no non-sense neighborhood wing joint. 

On the menu, there were so many different flavors to choose from.  I ended up ordering the Chris' Style (Honey Salted Pepper) and the bacon wrapped bourbon molasses wings.  The wings were crispy with each sauce having their own unique tangy flavor. 

Outside of the wings, this place is extremely simple.  Be prepared to either eat while standing outside or take your order away because there is hardly any seating.  There also seemed to be a lot of uber eats and call in orders, so don't be surprised if wait times are slightly longer.  I had a solid experience and I would definitely come back to try the rest of the flavors.
author: Mitch T.

description:
The place is somewhat small, and quite cramped, but looking beyond that, the food was delicious! I came here for "brunch" and my friend and I had waffles and some wings which came out to be about $11-12.

The wings were delicious! I had them korean style, which is in the gojuchang sauce with some sesame seeds on top, and the wings were cooked really well. The texture was excellent, the flavor was on point, and it was nice and crisply delicious.

The waffle was okay, but I guess it was more for filling up on rather than coming here for the waffle. They had a choice of regular syrup and marionberry syrup. The marionberry was a little lighter in flavor than I had hoped, and was mostly sweet, but it was still pretty enjoyable.

Overall a great place and I need to come back to try all the other different flavors!
author: Tyler T.

description:
This is the among the best fried chicken places in SF. The place is very well-run and clean. Only trouble I've had here is parking, and we've found our way out of this - call to order ahead, pick it up while my boyfriend drives around the block. This place is also good for delivery. 

I LOVE their fried chicken waffle and all flavors of fried chicken. They are always juicy on the inside and the sauces are finger-licking good.
author: Jessie L.

description:
First, they do something in the cooking process that weakens the connective tissue and cartilage normally found in most wings. This results in wings that come apart and are deboned very easily. 

Next, the texture. Each variety has been carefully chosen for mouth feel, it seems. The parmesan wings were crispy and held their heat for 20 minutes before I got home to try them. The crispy chile wings were sauced but not soggy and stayed piping hot on the inside 30+ minutes. Excellent. 

This place does wings well. Maybe the best in the city.
author: Aaron W.

description: Amazing wings (had the bourbon bbq wrapped in bacon) and awesome fries. Best wings I've had - hands down.
author: Mark D.

description:
This place is small but worth the visit just to see them working and the hilarious decor inside, I found something to laugh at at every turn and eye level. Eating the food is just a delicious bonus. 
Came here after a shift with my gf and omggggg it was so lightly crispy, tenderly juicy, and perfectly saucy!!! Chicken and waffles will never be the same for me again after this place. Would recommend ordering to-go after you admire the place 'cause there is little to no space to sit and eat (one table inside, bench for waiting outside).
author: Amy H.

description:
~ Happy Veterans Day Weekend! ~

what better way to celebrate the best country's best servicemen & servicewomen than w the best food: FRIED CHICKENNNN!

i'm a busy af murrican so got delivery in an hour not bad.

(^_^) Pad Thai Wings $7
f carbs all meattt really tastes thai #twss

(^_^) Ultra Goliath Waffle Sandwich $7.5
always a classic miss the ltd ed versions tho

(-_^) Har Cheong Kai Shrimp Paste Wings $7
faint flavor of shrimp chips; wish lil stronger

almost got ramen wings bc epic yelp chick drama but tried spiritual successor pad to the pone thai.

haven't physically been to this new location; i hope it has cray signage & tons of rules like the orig.

* to all past present & future members of the U.S. Armed Forces eternal respect honor & thanks *

AFRIEDCHICKENMERICUHHH F YEAH!
author: Dan B.

description:
i just found and it is my neighborhood,i'm happy to adding the place my one of favorite place.
its good first time order is combo with honey wing and big waffle!love them both yummy and good portion
author: Tokibox 6.

description:
Great wings make me happy. Wings from hot sauce and panko make me happiest! Its a tradition to pick-up from Hot sauce and Panko when my fiance and I have dates in the city. Always pick up to-go.

Lime wings: Our number one!! One time they did not have the sauce available and I was very sad. Lol perfect amount of fish sauce and lime! Best fish sauce wings Ive ever tasted

Bacon-wrapped hot: Mouthwatering the bacon is crunchy the chicken is cooked thoroughly! Just the right type of spicy

Chris's: not a big fan of honey flavored wings so this was just okay for me.

Ghost pepper: Holy shiiiit. This is spicy!!! This has Carolina Reaper in it. Same pepper in that spicy chip challenge. If you enjoy your mouth, ears, and later on behind burning then give it a go lol

Also tried the Korean and green and they were average.

The place itself is set-up for to-go orders. Theres one table inside the place and it gets pretty crowded. Always people outside waiting for their orders! Cause its that good. Ranch and other sauces are an extra 25 cents. Orders are usually 6 wings for $7 or so. Highly recommend if you want to be happy!!! Lol pick up some wings from hot sauce and panko to eat at Dolores park when the weather gets better!
author: Ayla L.

description:
I loooove chicken wings, and stopped by this hole-in-the-wall with some friends to grab a quick bite. The flavor menu is extensive, which is amazing. I was able to try Chris's (honey salty pepper), Serg's GBP (hot garlic bacon parmesan), and Chili (crunch). All were absolutely amazing - I cannot pick a favorite. A few of my friends also ordered the Ultra sandwich, which they all really enjoyed. 

Service was nice and the food came out quickly. I also enjoyed looking at all the different signs and posters they have along their walls. Very funny!
author: Lillian B.

description:
Overall this place was really good and lived up to the hype flavor-wise, but ultimately we were mildly disappointed with the size of the wings. 

Our ratings of the three types we ordered are as follows:

1) Chris's Honey Salt and Pepper - The definition of finger-licking good. Slightly sticky thanks to the honey-based sauce, it felt like the ultimate salty sweet blend.
2) Garlic Bacon Parmesan - It was hard to rank this behind anything, as these were incredibly delicious. I loved the classic flavor profile and would eat a whole bucket if I could.
3) Sticky Garlic Pepper Cheese - These were a charred-style wing that was interesting to taste but ultimately not our favorite. 

We would definitely order the first two again, but would want to try something interesting like the Pad Thai or the Satay next time. We also got the wedge fries and thought they weren't bad but nothing really special.

On a less important note, we really loved the vibes of the shop - nothing fancy and riddled with quirky posters and artwork all over the walls.
author: Jenny D.

description: 5 stars for tantalizingly tasty wings! Small wing operation with all hands on deck serving up the tastiest of the tasty. No place to sit so be ready to get it to go. Went with KJU, Chris', Sriracha Caramel and Sticky Wings. KJU and Sriracha Caramel were my hands down favorite. Crispy and budding with flavor. KJU has a nice little after sizzle, but no burn whatsoever. They don't sell alcohol but are conveniently located directly across from a Liquor store so you can grab a six pack to wash down those wings. Enjoy!
author: Mike C.

description: Visiting from Texas and wanted a place to eat. As soon as we walked in we were hit by the smell of waffles and fell in love. Very unique place that place music for all types of lovers. Funny signs all over the store making it a nice atmosphere. BEST WINGS WE'VE EVER HAD HANDS DOWN! SO MUCH FOOD!! I don't want to go back home without this place :(
author: Russel R.

description:
Found this place on yelp. Hole in the wall spot. Ordered to go. I specifically ordered a combo, with the waffle. I ordered the honey glazed pepper wings. And a side of wings, mango habanero.

They charge you $.25-$.50 for a side of ranch or dressing. Totally forgot some syrup for my waffle. Their wings was made to perfection. It had meat on them.

Service - 5

Queenliness - 5

Food taste - 5

Price - 5 very reasonable

Service -3.5 this was my first time coming here, I didn't know where the utensils. And I had to ask for Syrup. But, overall I will be returning
author: Paris S.

description:
One of my favorite things to do as an SF resident is to check Yelp for highly rated one $ restaurants between where I am and where I'm going.  Tonight, driving between Bernal and the Marina, the map was wide open.

I settled on Hot Sauce and Panko due to their amazing menu and strong reviews, including one from my pal Jim B.  I have long believed that SF's secret food expertise is in wings, because once you blow past the standard buffalo, there are some amazing preparations here.  Today I felt like I hit the absolute proof positive.  

My 11-year old daughter and I (She says "Five Stars!") tried three kinds:

1)  Yaki (Teriyaki) - her favorite because she doesn't like any heat.  To me it tasted as expected... nothing particularly distinctive here.

2)  Korean (Gochujang) - whoa, not like bulgogi sauce at all... this one's got a medium kick to it and a sweet and pungent flavor.  Winner.

3)  Chris' (Honey Salty Pepper) - wow, this is complex.  You taste the honey and salt first, and then the pepper, and then the pepper heat... there's a real progression of flavors here.  And then you want the next one to figure it out.  I also thought this was the best pairing of the three with the waffle and maple syrup.  Big winner!

I'm sure if I lived within walking distance of here (parking on Nob Hill - no fun at all) I'd be trying everything on the menu, then going around again to make a personal ranking.  Bravo, restaurateurs!  And you gotta like the funny magnets and knick-knacks on the walls.
author: G M.

description: Great hole in a spot, perfect for grabbing your fixings for chicken. Best to-go food. Plenty of flavor and the chicken wings are crispy. I got the green and it was flavorful with cilantro ginger. You can combo it with waffles so that's a plus. Will definitely be back to try all the other flavors. If anything just try out the wings because I didn't really need my waffle, but great regardless.
author: Derek V.

description: I'm usually one to skip chicken wings, but I love the gochujang chicken wings from this place!! It's more sweet than spicy in my opinion, but I still love it. Wings are small, standard size, and six of them don't fill me up, so definitely order more than six per person! They have a ton of different flavors and some sauces ready to go in small containers ($0.25 each). There's very limited standing room for eating, so I suggest you get it to go and eat it at Ina Coolbrith Park! It's a park half a block away on top of a huge hill (parking may be tough to find around that area but it'll also save you the torture of walking up steep streets).
author: Annie S.

description:
Super tiny little spot that serves the coolest and best tasting customize wings! There's so many flavors to choose from with all these unique sauce and batter. 
They do have a good deal combo option of chicken wings and waffle.
author: Majes W.

description:
First try - yum yum
My husband and I ordered a waffle combo with Chris' wings, and an order of KJU wings and fries to go. We traveled about 10 minutes to a park nearby and quickly devoured the wings. The waffle tasted good but was just soft and spongy by the time we opened our food container. Also - no syrup. Do we need to ask? The fries, however, remained crispy on the outside and were thoroughly delicious dunked in the siracha ranch we ordered on the side for 25 cents. The KJU definitely tasted like kochujang. Both wings were meaty and scrumptious. We are looking forward to coming back to try more wing flavors!
author: D Q.

description:
OMG waffle and wings! Yum. Go there, trust me. I have ordered there several times in the past month and have not been disappointed. I think I've even tried about 75% of their wing flavors, the "Sticky" flavor has been one of my favorites so far. It's a small, but cute neighborhood restaurant, it has fairly priced menu items and offers a short wait for your meal. Are you going? I'm so excited for you! 

Ps. Maybe ask for extra syrup...they give you a little cup of syrup for your waffle and I always seem to need more.
author: Jon P.

description:
It's always great to find your new favourite wings place in a city you'll be spending the next four months living three blocks from. With over 20 flavours of wings that all seem pretty awesome (and some component of heat!) at a reasonable price, Hot Sauce And Panko doesn't fail to deliver. 

And deliver it does, and super quickly too: took roughly five minutes to get my order. With a constant flow of people coming in and out, they're probably constantly frying up batches of chicken. The restaurant is super crowded, with only two standing tables, and two benches outside. They'll give you a little beeper to let you know when your order is ready so you make your way outside for the shortest wait for wings you've probably ever gone through. I'd suggest heading to a parkette (or home if you're from the area) and chowing down, as the inside of the store gets super hot on warmer days. 

If you're on the lower side of spice tolerance like me, I'd recommend the Chris's (Honey Salt and Pepper) or Green (Cilantro Jalapeno Ginger) which is what I got on my first visit. I'll be updating this as I go through the list of flavours (and other fun stuff like waffles!).
author: Kevin N.

description: These are probably some of the best wings I have ever had. Highly recommend Chris's! The wings are cooked perfectly and the service is fast!
author: Tiffany C.

description: It does live up to the big reviews! I am also a fan of this place. And considering I live super close, it's even better. The wings are of decent size and they definitely have a wide variety of flavors. The waffles, to me, were just waffles. It's all about the WINGS!!! There really isn't anywhere to sit. The hours are sort of weird though. They close at 7 p.m.
author: Olive R.

description:
FOOD: These were hands down the best chicken wings I've ever had! To be honest, I don't eat chicken wings that often but a friend recommended this place to me so I had to try it. We ordered the Chris' Honey Salty Pepper. It was the perfect savory taste with a kick of sweet! Two of us shared one order (6 pieces but they gave us 7) and It was just the right size for a snack as we had dinner later that night. But taste was definitely 10/10!

BANG FOR UR BUCK: not the cheapest, maybe a dollar per wing about but so delicious that it's something you need to try. And it's not like you're ordering sides and a ton of other things so totally worth the price in my opinion. 

SERVICE/WAIT: Staff was extremely friendly and there was no line when we went. One man ordering ahead of us but that's all. They're quick even with people trickling in constantly. 

ATMOSPHERE: This place is a hole in the wall. There's barely enough room to fit two standing tables but it's such a cute place. You walk in to the counter to order and there's a sauce wall on the side. There's also really funny art such like funny sayings. Loved it!

Overall i really want to come back! Told my friend who loves Buffalo Wild Wings that he has to come here. Wish they had more locations outside the bay!!
author: Taylor M.

description:
As far as wings go, there is no better place in the city in my opinion. A small mom-and-pop shop with standing room only, this place specializes in wings of all assortments. It had been on my bookmarked list for a long time and I was excited to finally try it.

Got the mango habanero and green wings. The mango habanero was the perfect balance of sweet and spicy, while the spices on the green wings were excellent. There are so many tasty looking combinations I'll have to be back to try more.

The family and service was quite friendly, despite the many amusing signs and posters inside. Good for takeout as well.
author: Tim X.

description: I tried the Korean wings here (unfortunately not the Chicken and Waffles which I love to try everywhere).  I liked them but I didn't fall in love with them like I thought I would. It was my first time here and I fully expect that I will try other flavors as well so I'll keep it a 3 star for now since there are several other establishments in the city where I prefer wings for now.
author: Rod M.

description:
This review is for the waffle sandwich -- I appreciate the industrial/hotel irons Hot Sauce uses but definitely eat the sandwich quickly as the waffle gets soggy fast under the weight of chicken fingers + spicy mayo + cabbage. There were pockets of spice due to where the sauce was as the cabbage is otherwise unseasoned/chicken is salt and pepper only. Love the concept, but will probably stick to trying the wings out!
 
Also, +100 for the hot sauce wall.
author: Heidi L.

description:
Crisped to perfection wings and the seasoning was just right. Also got the chicken sandwich and even though I'm not a fan of wasabi, the sauce was a really nice pairing with the sandwich. 

Will definitely come again. Lives up to the hype
author: Matilda H.

description:
Made it right in time before closing (7pm on a Saturday is kinda early)! Bad part is now I have nowhere to eat the delicious hot wings.... I saw a bus bench across the street and sat there and ate it

Ordered 4 flavors: green, Joce's sin, Thai, and Chase's. Joce's sin is my fav and I'm drooling about it right now. Chases's would be my 2nd choice from the bunch. Right by the order station, there's info on how the prepare the wings (see pictures). Each wing will be "crispy crackly and crunchy outside while moist and juicy with little distinct fattiness inside." I also ordered a waffle combo. The waffle wasn't anything special but it's good to have dessert on hand. I used their berry syrup (I think it's marionberry) and that went well with the butter. 

Parking is a real hassle but I walked 12 minutes from near Another Cafe and it was fine. Wish this place wasn't so far, I'm craving wings right now.
author: Avita S.

description:
I cannot believe it took me this long to discover Hot Sauce and Panko. I guess they were just outside my usual stomping grounds.

The wings are awesome. Love the Green, the Korean and Chris' honey and pepper.
author: David T.

description: Best wings in town!! The only downside is this place is pick up only. They have two high top tables but hard to enjoy for a long time because of the people walking in and out. My favorite are kfc and Chris's! Highly recommend!
author: Theresa H.

description: This place is okay. I got wings and the combo, and they only gave me wings. Had to wait a bit longer for the combo, which includes a waffle. I thought their wings would be dumb good but it actually came out slightly raw after 25 minutes of waiting.
author: Cary T.

description:
SWEET BABY JESUS THESE WINGS ARE STRAIGHT FIRE! I NEED MORE IN MY LIFE!

I always praise small places that have a lot to offer and this place is no exception. Expect to stand up, eat outside, or take it home because it is that small. Despite the size, this place still has such a huge variety of flavored wings! And even more awesome is that they have an entire wall of different hot sauces! So cooool! My friends and I shared Chris', KJU, Pad Thai, and Garlic Bacon Parmesan wings which were all so unique and flavorful. 

Our favorite was the KJU which is a mix of Korean (Gochujang) and Chili Crunch. I highly recommend! Chris' is a honey salty pepper wing which is kind of like San Tung's, but next time I will try Chase's since it is the spicy version. The Garlic Bacon Parmesan was surprisingly good because it had REAL BACON BITS and you can taste all of the distinct flavors. Next time I will try Serg's GBP since that is also the spicy version. The Pad Thai Wings were unique and had a sweet tamarind taste with chopped peanuts that is very iconic. 

With over 30 different wing flavors, waffle chicken sandwiches, and a variety of hot sauces this place is just amazing! Plus, all of the wings are fried to perfection, super juicy and plump, and fall off the bone. This is literally a tiny shop on the corner that knows how to do wings right! I can't wait to come back and try the rest of their menu!
author: Ryan J.

description:
I love super sticky and crunchy wings, and my expectations were met and cravings satisfied with this one! 

I ordered the green and Chris's. I definitely love cilantro (like seriously LOVE it) but when I eat wings, I like the sweet/savory/crunchy type of wing. this wing was definitely more dry and though I enjoyed it, I would probably spend my money on two orders of Chris's. 

Now Chris's, this is something to talk about! There's a reason it's the namesake. It salty and sweet. It was exactly what I was looking for! I really liked this flavor wing. 

My experience here was great. the food came out quickly and I snagged one of the two tables in the place. I'm also the type to have no shame about eating chicken wings on the curb, but I recognize it's frowned upon by some. 

I would come back if the cravings lead me here.
author: Tina Y.

description: I never thought in my wildest fever dream that there would be a wing place that also carried one of the best hot sauce collections in town.  But I just had to visit hot sauce and Panko to realize this dream.  I have tried the fried chicken sandwich, great! The Chris' wings, tasty! Habanero mango wings, yum! The ghost pepper wings, ow and ow and mmmmm.  The Korean wings, so good.  I need to check out the new location to see the new digs.  I sure do miss them.
author: Chris G.

description:
I did not order at restaurant but postmate the wings. I ordered Chris's, hot, parmesan bacon, ramen, salt and pepper. The parmesan one was really cheesy so if you're into that this is for you. The hot was not hot for my taste, I could have gone with the super hot but nonetheless still tasted great. Chris's was alright, not my most favorite. I love the ramen one, tasted great super crunchy even after 30 mins of my postmate driver picked up the food. Same goes for the fries! It was double fried and stayed crunchy with great seasoning. We also got the waffles which were so fluffy but nothing special that's different from other waffles places.

Overall
Taste 4/5
Price 4/5 was worth it for some of them
author: Thanasri T.

description:
I was never a huge fan of chicken wings...until I came here.

It's a very small (mostly to-go) operation that's spunky and quirky.
They always have a short line/people coming in to pick up phone orders.

The only problem with this place is that if you don't live nearby, you'll feel completely depraved between visits.
The parking isn't GREAT, but you can usually find a spot a couple blocks away.
It's not pricier than standard wing chains and WORTH EVERY CENT.

There's only a standing table in the restaurant, so you'll need to find somewhere to eat these delicious babies.
The wings are sizable, not as big as bonchon, but definitely not small.
They are juicy and moist and seriously mouth-watering.
It can be a bit of a wait because they're made to order.
I've had them as leftovers (even burnt them a little) and they were still amazingly delicious.

They have a ton of flavors, dry rubs and sauce; I'm more of a sauce girl. I've tried a ton of different flavors, my favorites are: 
Chase's
Korean
Old Bay
But everything I've tried is great.

I always check to see if i'm in the area to see if I can get more.

Bottom line is, where or not you like wings, you'll seriously love this place and want to bring all your friends back!
author: Connie T.

description: Pretty good wings had the srg (hot garlic bacon and Parm) and the panco covered wings with the waffle. The waffle was tasty but the waffle was a little soggy from the butter. Will be coming back taste all the other flavor of wings. Don't forget to take a look at all the hot sauces
author: Ricky D.

description:
Amazing. Everything is great. The best waffles too. I've driven from Sonoma County to SF just to eat these wings.

Absolutely the best wings I have ever tried.
author: Bryan B.

description:
Yesssssss finally found our wang place in Frisco. Coming from Atlanta and moving to the bay, chicken is an essential staple of this here diet, y'all, and Buffalo Wild Wings just ain't going to cut it.

Found this through the Yelp gods on our way back from Mendocino and had to stop in to check it out. The place is small and busy busy busy. I would say this is more of a pick-up-your-wings-and-go sort of joint, rather than a place where you hang out and chow down. There is a small bar table where yoo can stand and go to town on the deliciousness (shout out to the guys that had taken up the spot and were eating about 100 wings at the speed of light).

I picked up the smoked, beer (hot and BBQ) and Thai (sweet chili) wings and all were delish, but we certainly were partial to the beer and smoked wings. Cannot wait to go back and get some more of that. Their chicken sandwich and wedge fries are also tasty, but the wangs are the star of the show, as they should be.
author: Joanna R.

description:
Food: 5/5 
By far my favorite mashup of fried chicken & waffles. The waffles are great, fried chicken is tender, the Korean slaw refreshing, and the spicy sauce and honey are a must in my book.

Service: 4.5/5 
The servers are friendly and very efficient considering the daily volume of customers. They give the space a family feel (I think it's family owned), and they've never once been short or rude.

Ambience: 4/5 
I wish the space was larger; there are basically only two or three small standup tables. However, the decor is quirky and fun, and I enjoy my food equally whether I'm eating over one of their tables or three blocks away on someone's stairs.

Value: 5/5 
Personally I don't think you can get much better quantity AND quality than with the Goliath fried chicken & waffle sandwich for $7.50. It's enough for 1-1/2 to 2 meals but always consumed in 1 :-)

4.63 - I plan Saturdays and Sundays around trips to SF solely for Hot Sauce & Panko.
author: Sammi L.

description:
Amazing! So glad we chose to order from here. Food was delivered pretty fast and it was and amazing. We order numerous different wings and I ordered a waffle to go with. 

5/10/17
Came here again/ ordered pick up. Was ready super quick, didn't have to wait long at all! We Ordered a waffle for me and tons of wings. Didn't disappoint at all. Glad  I decided on chicken and waffles today.
author: Brittany N.

description: Found this place on a whim and I'm so glad I did. The wings were so delicious and made so quick! My friends and I ordered Chris's, Korean and Thai. Although this is a more on the go type of place, they do have tables for you to stand and eat. Overall, it's quick, delicious and fresh!
author: Jasmine F.

description: I found out about this place recently and I really wanted to try their ultra Goliath waffle sandwich-fried chicken, cabbage, and sriracha sushi sauce sandwiched between WAFFLES!! It was a little too spicy for me but otherwise it was delicious. I loved the fluffy waffle and the crunch that the chicken provided. Space is very limited inside so I ate the sandwich on my way out. I basically inhaled the thing even though I knew that I couldn't handle spicy food very well at all. It was just sooo GOOD:)
author: Coconut W.

description:
Hot sauce and panko serves unpretentious fried chicken wings and waffles hole in the wall with a Korean flair. They have a comprehensive list of wing flavor (like 20 flavors), some I've never imagined to put together, and you can get it served over a basic waffle. It's 10$ for 6 wings and a waffle. I would definitely come back here if I am craving Korean wings.

The place only has 2 tiny tables, so it's a very casual place to eat at. I would just take togo. Service is nice, had 2 cute Korean moms welcome me ^_^

I ordered the special and tried 3 flavors:
Salty Sichuan (Dry) - my fave so far.
Korean (Gochujang) (Wet) - your basic Korean spicy wing
Lime fish sauce - that Viet flair
author: Sean W.

description:
The New Ghost Pepper Wings are FIRE!! If you love extra spicy, this is your wing. Cooked and crisped to perfection. Waffles n fries, also great.
This place is the shit!!
author: Codi L.

description: This place is not as good as i expected it to be. The wings were very dry and the waffle sandwich was way below my expectation. I would not recommend going to this place .
author: Manjil S.

description: We were visiting SF and a friend recommend we try the wings here. YUMMY!! thanks for the great recommendation
author: Lola D.

description: Stumbled across this place looking for lunch today. I have to say I find this place better than Wingstop hands down. The wings are tasty and the waffle is nice and fluffy. A bit small but I would call a head a take out . Will be coming back soon
author: kimiko l.

description:
I'm not a huge wing person, but I know good food when I have it!  And let me tell you, these wings are worth getting.

The parmesan panko wings are crispy and done with a dry rub.  They're SO good - I am actually thinking of the next time we can go back already!  And of course we had to try Chris's wings (honey salty crispy pepper).. They are also to die for.  They're exactly what they sound like: honey, salty and crispy!  The meat just falls right off the bone... They've got this nailed down.

We ordered ranch - don't do this.  You don't need it!

This is definitely a grab and go type of spot, but there are two tables inside if you're there at an off time.  Apparently noon on a saturday is a weird time for wings, so we were able to stand at the table inside.  It is a little bit on the pricey side for wings (if you ask me) but they are high quality and worth paying for.  Two orders (6 wings each) with ranch were about $17.
author: Kenna H.

description:
In order:

5 - Ramen
5 - Parmesan panko
5 - Joce's (Prawn paste) (Fry like zippys)
5 - Salt szechuan pepper
5 - Sticky
4 - Smoked
4 - Kublai's (Mongolian bbq)
4 - Mustard habanero
4 - Garlic bacon parmesan
4 - Serg's GBP (Hot garlic bacon parmesan)
4 - Pad Thai (Use lime)
4 - Chris' (Honey salty pepper)
4 - Duck (Confit-fried)
4 - KJU
---
3 - Tempura fries
3 - Waffle

Overall, "as good as it gets."
author: Mark O.

description:
Hot Sauce and Panko is a hole in the wall joint with two tables, an outdoor bench, a wall of hot sauces, and chicken & waffles.

I was visiting SF for the day and the BF insisted we come here. He's only eaten at Hot Sauce & Panko once before, but told me there were incredible wings.

We had the Green wings and the Joce's Sin. We did not get the waffles, but they're made fresh to order and smelled delicious.

The Green wings are standard wings with a minced jalapeno, cilantro, and ginger sauce. It reminds me of an Asian version of a chimichurri or gremolata sauce. 

The Joce's Sin are battered wings with prawn paste. The batter is light yet crispy, with a hint of funk from the prawn paste. I was hoping for something more pungent (maybe should've gone with the fish sauce wings), but the fact that they're experimenting with so many different flavor options is a plus in my book.

The meat on both wings were incredibly juicy, and well worth the price. There's meat on those bones, for sure.

I've never been so impressed with a restaurant among a single visit, but this place has already become THE place to go to every time I'm in SF. Will definitely return to try out more flavors.
author: Jen K.

description: Nice place to get chicken and waffles in the city. Lots of choices my favorite is Chris's (chicken) very fast service not enough space for customers to eat can be very crowded.
author: Sherisa W.

description: A must try! Tried three flavours Mango Habanero , Pad Thai and the number 1 Chris. They were all amazing and reasonably priced! 22 bucks for the 3 sets of wings which come with 6 wings each. The Mango Habenero and the #1 Chris I would highly recommend. They close at 7pm so be wary of the time.
author: Lana S.

description:
Hot Sauce and Panko is without a doubt THE chicken wing spot in SF. Never have we had a bad experience with the wings! 6 stars if possible are well deserved. 

Ultra delicious, tender tasty wings that pack an explosion of flavor and the waffles that come with it are amazing. Once I had the ultra Goliath sando and my god it was the perfect combination of waffle chicken deliciousness.

I definitely definitely recommend to anyone reading this to try the Chris's at least once. I love the flavor clash and they have this subtle crunch that I haven't found anywhere else.

Skip Sang Tung's. Grab your wing fix here. It's the best.
author: Kelsey D.

description:
This has been a spot of my to go list for a while and I got the opportunity to try it today! They have a lot of different flavors which was amazing! It sucks that they don't open on Monday and Tuesday but they open all other days! Seating are limited so you would have to stand up to eat, go to one of the local bars nearby or go to teaspoon on Polk street to enjoy these amazing wings with a tea drink. 

I originally wanted to get the Korean and green flavor but they ran out of the green flavor so I got the Korean flavor and Chris's flavor.

Korean flavor:
- very crispy and flavorful
- good amount of meat
- juicy

Chris's flavor:
- good but not to die for
- for some reason the wings were smaller for this flavor as well.

Overall the wings were good but not to die for. But it's definitely a spot to come back to again. Because I want to try the other flavors. It was a bit pricey at $7 for 6 pieces but can't complain about that since almost all of the best food in San Francisco is pricey anyways.
author: Christopher G.

description:
I love wings and hot sauce and buffalo sauce! And this place had it all. Food was good sandwich was good vibe was cool. The decorations were funny. The only thing that wasn't cool is that they don't have any seating. 
 Other than that I would give him a try again try other flavors of their wings. Definitely worth stopping by if you're a local or a first-time San Francisco Traveller such as myself.
author: Vito K.

description: I've been meaning to come here for months and finally made it. If you love wings...this is the place to go. So many flavors, and they are all delicious. No frills type of vibe, and the food comes out quick. Only two little tables inside - plan for a casual dining experience. The wings are on point! Perfect juicy with a bit of crisp on the outside. I can't wait to come back here.
author: Neda S.

description:
I have been watching a lot of kdrama recently (Goblin, aka Dokkebi) and the main character works at a chicken wing store, so I have been craving it a lot. Ordered the wing and waffle combo with the kochujang and garlic flavors. The meat was lean and perfect in temperature when it came out. I think it might have been the best wings I've had in my life - much better than Buffalo Wild Wings.

The layout of the store is quite strange bc you need to turn into the right side to order. There's a lone table in a corner where I stood to eat a wing, like a loner waiting for my Uber ride. 

I had such a hard time understanding "do you want butter on the waffle" that probably pissed off the fob employee. She will probably ask you this question, so keep your ears perked or just nod and pleasantly smile.
author: Juliana P.

description:
Wings were really delicious and had a lot of flavor to it. Looking into the menu I can't really decide what to order and so I asked for their recommendations:
KJU: For those who like spicy wings. It wasn't that spicy but it definitely had a good kick to it. Very delicious.
Kublai's: Very similar to Mongolian BBQ food - lots of soy sauce and very savory.
Teriyaki: Your classic asian wings - very sweet but also savory.

Definitely would come back to try their other flavors. Price was decent for wings in the Bay Area.
author: Freddie K.

description:
We've been supporting HS&P since their days in the Richmond district. We were sad yet happy they moved to a bigger (yes it's truly bigger than their last location) and more central location in The City. This business has grown into a successful chicken wing staple. We have tried almost every single flavor. Combined with other locals who support this iconic to-go spot, we have eaten every single wing HS&P offers. Order for pick-up or to-go. That's why it's called Hot Sauce and Panko TO-GO. Don't eat it there the place is too small and it gets super busy...go to a local park to enjoy these delicious wings. 

Our Favorites:
Green (my favorite)
Yaki
Mango
Pad Thai Wings
Garlic
Panko
Salt & Sichuan Pepper Wings
Bacon wrapped Bourbon Molasses
Ghost Petter
Ramen Wings
Fried Chicken Sandwich
Tempura Wedge Fries
*Wings and Waffle Combo special is a must

Best wings in the city. So many fun flavors. Thank you HS&P!
author: Shannon M.

description:
DUDE. My new favorite wings place in town! This place is like.. Lord of the Wings. (except for Santung, I still really like Santung). Holy crap, I've been wanting to try this place since forever, I kinda regret not going there earlier. I should be going here ALL THE TIME! They have a bunch of flavors, and I mean.. TOO MUCH. YOU NEED TO TRY THEM ALL!

Their wings are perfectly crispy, perfectly seasoned. Very well done overall. They make the wings to order so you usually have to wait 15-20 minutes. EAT THEM RIGHT AWAY or they'll get soggy and cold. The restaurant was so tiny that you have to take it to go, so I ate it in the car on the way home. LOL. Which was a good choice because by the time I got home, the wings were already cold. 

Chris's honey salty pepper 5/5
My favorite as of now! I love the honey and the pepper together. I'm not a fan of really sweet stuff and I think this has the perfect amount of honey. SO GOOD! MUST GET!

Ramen wings 4/5
Crispy in its own way, I really enjoyed the crushed ramen batter. The first couple of wings that I had, it wasn't very very seasoned. Only after eating a couple did I realized that the seasoning (probably ramen powder) wasn't evenly distributed, so some wings were very flavorful and others weren't. But for the ones that did get coated, it was good!

Pad Thai Wings 3/5/5
Tastes like pad thai, they did a pretty good job at nailing the flavors. Except... Why did they have to put those fried uncooked rice pieces in there? It does nothing to add to the flavors, and are extremely uncomfortable to eat. It keeps getting stuck in my teeth and they're super hard! They should remove this from the wings and it'll be great. 

I feel like they're constantly changing the menu and adding/removing flavors. Which is great, I can come here and try different things all the time! Shoot, I'm so sad. Because as I'm writing this reviews, I kinda wanna go get some. But they're closed on Monday and Tuesday. Sigh. I'll wait til wednesday. Oh, and you gotta go here before 7pm. They close super early.
author: Yen P.

description: I don't know how you can ask for better wings. I've eaten many a wing in my day (that's why I'm fat lol). I know my way around great wings. They fry these to perfection and coat them with tasty seasonings of all manner and variety. This place takes it easy on your wallet also. 10 bucks and you'll be stuffed. These are superlative wings by any measure!!!
author: Nick A.

description: I used to frequent Hot Sauce and Panko when they were at their original location in the Richmond, and this was my first time visiting the new location. I was hoping for more seating in the restaurant, but turns out they have even less seating now. A friend and I stopped by after our hike in the morning for some wings - we got an order of Chris's wings (honey, salt, pepper), an order of Korean wings (gochujang, which is like a red chili paste sauce that is savory, sweet, and spicy), and an order of Tempura Wedge Fries with Sriracha Ranch sauce. The sauces were great, wings were crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside. I'm not usually a fan of super-saucey, so the wings were a little heavy for me. The tempura fries were good too, I like the use of tempura batter. Overall the food was great, 12 wings and fries were perfect for the two of us, we were stuffed.
author: Elaine N.

description:
I have been wanting to try this place since I found out about it and well today was that day!! Go their today around 12ish and their was no line!! GREAT! Decided to get 4 different wings. Garlic parm, Chase double hot, Korean and Red rooster. 

For starters I wanna say the Korean was a disappointment. I read all these fantastic reviews about the Korean and that these are the BEST wings here. In my case that wasn't true the Korean wings were mediocre. 

The GARLIC PARM was our ultimate favorite the BEST WINGS out of all four!! If you don't get these then you are really missing out! 

My next favorite was the chase double hot! That pepper flavor was delish but it could use a bit more spice, it was as spicy as I would have liked them but they were goooooood! 


The red rooster the best way to explain these are your typical frank red hot wings. So good  but typical. We added extra spicy sauce to these wings to add more flavor. 

Its so many wings on the menu that I will be back to try more but every time I go I will always order the garlic parm with no bacon wrap!!!
author: Dorothy M.

description:
I didn't love living in Nob Hill, but I did love living right by Hot Sauce and Panko.

Three words: garlic, bacon, and parmesan. Holy moly these wings are amazing. A great way to treat yourself and blast the Sunday Scaries away. The hours of this place are a bit strange, but it makes it seem even cooler and more illusive.
author: Emily F.

description:
Wings are aite... Waffle sandwich is good but would have liked the waffle to have a little more crunch to help with the sogginess from the sauce.

All in all, it definitely satisfied my wings craving, but probably wouldn't go out of my way for it.
author: Rachelle T.

description: I ordered delivery from this place and the wings did not disappoint! I ordered the Green, Chris's, Sticky, Garlic Bacon and Parmesan, and their waffle sandwich! The wings were still crispy and each sauce was very unique. Under the flavorful layer of crispiness, the chicken remained moist. My personal favorite is the Green since I'm a cilantro lover. The Chris's had a good balance of salty and sweet without being too saucy. The waffle sandwich was just ok too me, but probably would have been better had I just gone to the location and ate it on the spot! Looking forward to trying out the other flavors, especially the Old Bay, Korean, and Ramen wings!
author: Sui N.

description:
Yummy and crunchy wings! I've been to the Clement location before it moved and have also ordered via Caviar to my workplace to share with some coworkers.

YES to:
- Chris' honey salty crispy pepper: most comparable to San Tung wings! I thought these were the crunchiest ones we ordered. Not sure why but the flavor combo was delish!
- Korean/gochujang: I love gochujang so these were the ones for me! A little hard to pick up and hold because they were slippery though haha.
- Lime: love the fish sauce!! Super flavorful!

Pass on:
- Green: these were sort of bland for me, the only thing I tasted was cilantro. Could have used a little more seasoning!
- Ramen: these don't look like the article you probably saw on thrillist SF. I think now, they grind the ramen up into a powder and use that as the batter, instead of coating the wings with the actual dry ramen noodles.
author: Tara A.

description:
If I can give this place more than 5 stars, I WOULD! I LA LA LA LOVE HOT SAUCE AND PANKO!  Coming here, I was not expecting much. In fact, when my friend suggested this place I wasn't too excited about it. Don't get me wrong, I love chicken wings. It just didn't seem too appealing to me at the time. But boy, I was blown away! The moment I bit into the chicken wing, I fell in looooove! Since there were 5 of us, we were able to try a few different flavors. We got 2 Belgian waffles, one order (6 wings, no splits) of the Green, Chris's, Hot, Korean, and Yaki. 

+ Green
This one is my FAVORITE! Clearly, there is a reason why this one is one of their best sellers. They top their crispy wings with cilantro, jalapeno, and ginger. I don't know if it's just me but it somewhat reminds me of the green onion sauce for hainan chicken. YUM!

+ Chris's
For those of you who like that sweet and salty combo, this is the one for you. It is a honey salty pepper flavor and it has a great balance between being tangy and savory.

+ Hot
Need I say more? HOT! It was pretty spicy at first but you get used to it after a few bites. Now, I can't speak for everyone because personally I love spicy food. One of my friends did say that it was too spicy for her liking but that's up to you to decide.

+ Korean (KFC)
I  gotta say, this is my least favorite one. This is made with gochujang, which is a Korean fermented chili paste. It has a mixture of savory, spicy and a hint of sweetness to it. It was still good but just not on the top of my list.

+ Yaki
My feelings are neutral with this one. The teriyaki sauce was great but it wasn't the best. 

+Belgian Waffles
Their waffles were so warm and fluffy! You can eat it with the wings or if you have a sweet tooth, they have maple syrup and Marion berry syrup for you to drench it in.

Each order of wings is about $7 but I recommend getting their wings & waffle combo for $10.99. It comes with one order of wings and a waffle, which I think it's a great deal for $4 extra. 

There is one tiny flaw to this place and that is its size. It is a very and I mean VERY small place with only 2 tables (standing only). This place is mainly for take-out orders and definitely not suitable for groups bigger than 4 or 5. 

Hot sauce and panko, I will be back for you!
author: JoJo C.

description: I've been here several times. Love. The. Wings. But I love the chicken sandwich the most. Something about the simplicity just makes it perfect! Seriously, you have to order the spicy chicken sandwich. Then get one waffle/wings combo, one more batch of wings, share with your husband and call it a day! Haha we love trying new wings. We prefer the Alex's over the Green, LOVE the mango, and while we delight over the bacon parm - you need a big appetite to finish those!
author: Zinia G.

description:
I Love this place! Great food, great service and the decoration is pretty funny!  
 
super recommend it!
author: L T.

description:
As a fan of chicken and waffles, you know I had to try this place!

It's a small shop with barely any seating inside so you'll have to take it to go. I ended up getting the wings & waffle combo with the Chris's Wings and I can't imagine getting anything else. The waffle was nice and fluffy and the wings crisped to perfection. The sauce was a good mixture of sweet and savory and is a great combination for the waffles. 

I definitely have to try the other flavors but it does live up to the hype of the place!
author: Keizzel C.

description:
These wings are solid. Perhaps a bit too much breading-to-meat ratio. But that is just my personal preference.

What was really disappointing was the quality of ranch dressing (hence the two-star rating.) This was the worst ranch dressing I have ever had. It seemed to have been severely watered down by the restaurant!

I could drink ranch out of a fondue fountain I love it so much. But this was utterly disappointing. If you are not going to supply free ranch or other condiments with your wings then you should at least have the wherewithal to supply quality ranch and blue cheese for your $0.50 surcharge; not this watery junk that is no doubt the cheapest ranch available in the contiguous United States of America.

I am generally a positive guy and have never left a bad review or customer complaint. But you seriously crossed the line with this ranch dressing. I cannot see myself ordering from this establishment again (unless it switched its ranch suppliers.)

God bless America. God bless Buffalo Wings. God bless Ranch Dressing. But not this establishment until it improves its ranch game.
author: Zachary S.

description:
Fucking incredible. Just order from here you won't regret it. Amazing wings!

10/10 would order again. Amazing sauces.
author: Ken B.

description:
Yes. This place is just... yes. 

Affordable, but blew my socks off. 

After seeing all the great reviews, I had to check it out. 

It lives up to the reputation. It's not one of those places with a bunch of stars for no reason people, they are well earned! 

The wings are crispy, and perfectly fried. 

The flavor combinations are harmonious, and the variety is shocking. 

If this place was in Portland, I think I would be in trouble.
author: Seiji N.

description:
Look at all of the Stars and then book an UBER to Hot Sauce and Panko!

Seriously, do it - NOW!
author: Melonie O.

description:
Everyone deserves a second chance right? I mean heck I have done my fair share of insulting people ( unintentionally.....and uh hum otherwise). So please forgive and give me a second shot.

Where was I?

I had tried Hot Sauce and Panko at there old location two or three times. I was never really blown away by the sauces or the wings themselves. It has been probably four years since I was at their Clement street store.

I must say the new location is a total pain in the rear to park and to eat at....but the wings are just fantastic.

 I ordered the KFC and Chris's wings: Chris's wings were heavenly....sweet and savory with salt/pepper and honey...get um they're good.

To contrast the sweeter wings I ordered the Korean style Gochujang (which is a fermented condiment made from  from red chili, glutinous rice, fermented soybeans, and salt). Damnnnn....that was good. Not too spicy. Reminiscent of Sriracha. Put me in a bathtub of that and let me swim mama.

I also ordered their tempura wedge fries which were actually amazing: hot, crispy, and fluffy inside.

AT $18 for roughly 12 wings and an order of fries...cheap it is not but it was pretty darn good.

If your driving hear...good luck as this is perhaps the worst place to try to find parking on the planet. 

Only two small standing tables for dinning in.

Did I mention this place is incredibly dinky....half the size of the original place.

Double park and get it to go. I'll pay the parking ticket!!!
author: David G.

description: Friendly staff ,yummy chicken wings and affordable price, what can you ask for more?!
author: Noktong H.

description: Came over to San Francisco due to the reviews of these hot wings. I ordered the mango habanero and the bacon wrapped hot wings. The mango habanero was very sweet. I expected them to be spicy but they fell short to that. Also my wings were a Luke warm. On to the bacon wrapped hot wings. I got just the hot not double hot. Those were fresh from the fryer. They were okay. You can def taste the butter in the sauce.
author: Dolores C.

description:
Ramen wings at first didn't taste like anything but once you had a few more it really did work out well 

As for the other flavors that I can't 100% recall, they were tasty and well executed

To-go is your friend as there is limited seating, I also went next door to get drinks/wipes as that was easier than grabbing stuff from the shop 

Overall Thoughts

A great place to grab some delicious wings!
author: Eddie W.

description:
Some of the best chicken wings I've ever had. Incredible variety of sauces as well.

My only reservation is that it closes WAY too early. Would love to hit this spot later at night.
author: Adam G.

description:
Food 4/5
Price 3/5
Portion 3/5
Decor 3/5
Custom Serv

1-never go again, two below aver, 3 average, 4 above average, 5 amazing

Food order/opinion:
So my friend and I ordered two wing orders (beer, and garlic) and a fried chicken sandwich. The garlic wings were extremely good and stands out compared to bdubs or wingstop, but the other two orders were just average.

price/portion of it opinion
Price and portion is pretty average

decor/roomy
Wish it had more space in the shop, seats, any stuff but was understandable why it doesn't. Has a lot of humorous things such as posters and what-not. Gave a nice funny vibe.
 
customer service
The servers were nice, everything went smoothly so i always consider that good.
author: Innocent N.

description: Today I took a walk to Traders Joe on Hyde Street.  I was at the corner of Washington and Hyde - and came across this place.  I love hot sauces and they had a wall of sauces.  There were three people in the corner having 4 different chicken wings.  I ordered the Korean wings and it was $6.75.  Smelled delicious and walked to Traders Joe to do my shopping.  By the time I came home my chicken wings were room temperature.  OMG, I don't normally eat wings but I ate all 6 pieces for my dinner.  It had a kick and it was flavorful.  Need to go back and try the other favors.  Great experience- service was fast and friendly and my order took less than 5 minutes.  Can't wait to try the rest of the chicken wings!
author: Stephanie C.

description: These are amazing wings - best in the Bay. Expect ally love the Chris' flavour. They are also great by delivery.
author: Corey C.

description:
I LOVE YOU HOT SAUCE AND PANKO. Loved you at your old location and I will travel across the city to your current location. Please never shut down and I hope you're here for my entire lifetime. The best chicken wings ever and the fluffiest waffles. They are the absolute best when it comes to chicken wings and waffles. 

My boyfriend took me to the old clement location three years ago and I want to come back when we get married and then I want to bring my children here. 

Fucking love hot sauce and panko.
author: Becca W.

description:
These are the best wings I've ever had!!! This place is perfect for the hybrid wing consumer or hardcore purist.  Recommendation:
Go with the traditional buffalo sauce wings, their salad equivalent (Green) wings, Chris', and Sticky.  You won't be disappointed, and if you are then...wait...not possible.  Enjoy!!!
author: Gregory B.

description: This is my all time favorite wings spot in the world. There's about 30 wing varieties to chose from. You can go with sweet or salty or spicy and saucy. They've got flavors from the east to the west. Want your wings fried? Or wrapped in bourbon molasses? How about bacon wrapped wings? Hot sauce and Panko has it all! My favorites so far have been the bacon wrapped bourbon molasses and the pad Thai wings. The wings are not only tender and juicy but the toppings are spot on! Colonel sanders, step aside! Cause Hot sauce & Panko is in town!
author: Virginia Y.

description:
Super hole in a wall looking place with pretty restrictive hours. That's because they're the best and their business is booming. 

BEST WINGS IVE EVER HAD IN MY LIFE. only thing is none of their flavors are particularly spicy but that's ok because their wings are creatively delicious. 

Favorites are the Ramen and KJU.
author: Jen W.

description:
BEST WINGS EVER!!

Some friends and I were headed to the Giants game and wanted a quick bite. This place showed up as the closest food spot in walking distance of where we were at. The cashier said the top 3 chicken flavors (Chris's, Green, and Korean) were the most popular so we went ahead and ordered all 3 for about 4 of us. 6 wings per order = 18 wings total plus a waffle on the side. We demolished ALL OF IT! All 3 flavors were delicious and we had no complaints. The chicken itself was fried perfectly and super juicy on the inside. Ughhh...we even tried to come back after the game for more but the place closes early. My friend and I were even craving this place the next morning!! Soooo good...

As mentioned in other reviews, this place is not a dine in type place. Only 2 small tables in the corners and no chairs. I'll be back for sure to try the other flavors!!
author: Marissa C.

description:
Really cool place. Very small inside with some interesting political decor and a massive, uniquely-named selection of hot sauces.

We ordered wings, french fries, and two of the fried chicken waffle sandwiches.

The bacon, garlic parmesan wings were awesome. We also had an order of Chris' wings which were also very good. To be honest, the french fries were surprisingly the star of our order. We finished them so quickly and they had us wanting more. Overall, the wings and fries were delicious and I'll be back for those.

However, the fried chicken waffle sandwich was not very good at all really. The waffle was really dry and somewhat soggy. We actually both ended up taking off the waffle and just eating the fried chicken lol.

Overall a good experience & will definitely be back!
author: Aaron M.

description: Yelp is dumb but leaving a review to combat the stupid people who like to complain about everything. I frequently use Caviar to order delivery from Hot Sauce & Panko for my office parties- usually around $600-800 an order and everything always arrives warm and crispy! Our giant orders are always correct and everything arrives on time. So no complaints here- lots of love for the flavor variety and the spicy flavors!
author: Kajal G.

description: One of the few affordable spots in SF thats one of the main reasons I love it so much. The large variety of flavors are all so different and tasty. My personal favorite is green.
author: Staja T.

description:
Do not come here and play it safe. Ordering Teriyaki wings would fall into this category. If you only order one flavor you have to try Korean or Gochujang. Green is also very unique. Our favorite place to eat in the City. No place to sit, but who cares, we will take the wings and waffles down by the bay and have a picnic. The fresh waffles with syrup and butter are amazing. 

My favorite flavor a of the wings is the Korean which is deep in flavor from the Gochujang sauce you would typically find on Korean Pork. 

My wife loves Lime which has a fish sauce flavor with chili sauce similar to a Vietnamese dish. My sons favorite is Chris's or the hotter version Chase which is a sweet peppery wing that is dryer.  Green is everyone favorite if the put enough cilantro jalapeno sauce on top. There are three things you can count on when you go here. Unique wings, a long line, and no place to park.
author: Bill S.

description: This is thee best hot wing spot in the city. The wings are crunchy and moist. The flavors are on point. I highly recommend the garlic and bacon and parmigiana. The customer service is great. Standing room only.
author: Austin C.

description:
Delicious! We were walking to Japantown and decided to stop by here for a quick bite. Had the mango habanero wings with a waffle - scrumptious! Good fry and good flavor. The waffle was also light and crispy. Great combo!

I was also impressed by how quickly they were able to prepare our food. There was a bit of a line, but they moved fast. Will definitely try a different flavor when we're in the area!
author: Larissa M.

description: Delicious wings, worth it. We had the Korean and cilantro habanero wings.  Both good but we liked the Korean best.
author: Kasandra V.

description:
HS&P! One of my favorite places in SF and let me tell you why.

On a selfish level I was so bummed they moved locations, but on a non-selfish level I was happy their business was doing well. But since the move I hadn't had a chance to go back.

I got delivery from Postmates and had the wings for the first time since they moved. Is it just me or have they gotten better!?! Reheated at 350 for 10 minutes and I was in heaven.

We ordered
1. Pad Thai 
2. Panko Parmesan
3. Hot
(+) Hot sauce, bleu cheese and the sauce that comes with Pad Thai

Best wings I've ever had, easily, even reheated! 5/5 all around. Would highly recommend to anyone and am definitely going to start having their wings again now that I know they can be delivered (this post is making me sound so lazy....but parking in Nob Hill, come on!!!)

PS shoutout to whoever runs their Instagram account *drools*
author: Emma B.

description:
Been wanting to try this place for awhile due to the high star rating. I ordered the Korean chicken wings which were pretty crispy, covered with KBBQ sauce and sesame seeds. 

They have a lot of flavor options and the most hilarious decorations. There's only two small tables so expect to do takeout.
author: Brian G.

description: With all the great reviews here, I think I was expecting more . I ordered 7 different flavors of wings. One was excellent, the salt and pepper honey wings , I could eat these all day. I was also pretty impressed with pad thai flavor, didnt think this would be executed very well. I was wrong, these wings were unique and had awesome flavors. The rest were either ok or not good. The salt and pepper honey wings alone will be a reason why this place will see me again.
author: Shavonne B.

description: Best chicken wings in town! The selection of different flavors and sauces are a delicacy to my pallet. Great for outings with friends and family.
author: Grace G.

description: Don't go for the ambiance, run here for the wings and waffles! I ordered the Honey fried salt and pepper chicken wings. They were sweet, well seasoned and crispy. The waffle was served hot off the griddle with a big dollop of butter. This more than enough but I couldn't pass up the tempura battered wedge fries. Also delicious with blue cheese dressing. It's standing room only with two pub like tables in the corners. I found the knick knacks hilarious but a bit risqué for little people. I would come back to try more flavor of wings for sure.
author: Sypress P.

description: Ordered on cavier- delivered faster than the ETA! Delicious and perfectly cooked wings. The hot sauce and salt & Sichuan were bomb!!!
author: Adriana R.

description:
Background: I do not normally like wings.  

Decided to order delivery from Caviar because well, the picture was featured on the app and it was free delivery. 

So many wings on the menu. But my honest to goodness favorite thing was the FRIED CHICKEN SANDWICH. Not the fancy thing. Just the fried chicken sandwich with their normal sauce. Oh and there's a giant long pickle that comes in it. Kinda odd if you ask me. But the chicken is crispy and flavorful. The slaw is fresh and yummy. And there's a hint of mustardy kick in it. Wow that sandwich is filling and so good. I don't need to go over to Berkeley for a good fried chicken sandwich anymore!

Of the wings, tried these:

Hot - it's as the name says
Lime - fishy and saucy. 
Green - dry rub green. Not too spicy but just right. 
Ramen - my favorite. I have no idea what they do but it was yummy. Deep fried and coated. With a great dipping sauce. 
Salt and Sichuan pepper - not super spicy or out there. Just a good simple crunchy wing. 
BBQ -  it was a little more dark and smoky BBQ. I was hoping it was more the sweet and tangy BBQ
