I was surprised how good the wings were for delivery. Nothing was soggy or messy. It was absolutely great. The packaging of the wings is neat - if you order multiple types they might combine in one container so if you are particular with how you want it packed let them know. But they out foil under the lime one cuz it was liquidity so that it wouldn't make everything else soggy. 

I have no idea how small the restaurant is but I can tell you the food delivered by Caviar was yummy and quick delivery!
author: Traci H.

description: I absolutely love Salt and Pepper Chicken wings. This place is up there with the best ever. Amazing food.
author: Mark D.

description:
Every time I'm feelin wings, it's probably at the end of the night, and hot sauce and panko closes pretty early at 7, so I never had the opportunity until today. This place has is definitely a fun place to go to. Very small shop (has two tables to stand and munch), and there is humor all over the wall decorations. Right before you step up to the cashier, there is a wall of hot sauces, syrup packing station and wings in the window that's just waiting to be eaten. 

There is a multitude of flavors on the menu from fish sauce wings to garlic bacon parm.  I went for the garlic bacon parm with a waffle. Couldn't resist the chicken and waffle combo.  6 pieces of wings and a fairly large waffle for about 11 bucks. A bit oily for me, probably just because of the bacon bits but still amazing and packed full of flavor!

Will definitely have to come back to try all the other flavors!
author: Wesley L.

description:
BEST WINGS IN THE CITY!

I definitely had my doubts based upon the outside appearance, but don't judge this book by its cover. The wings are so dang good! The fries are unique. Le bf and and I have tried a lot of the different flavors and they are all really good. They come out perfectly cooked, crispy on the outside, tender inside, and always hot. We have also always managed to snag a seat at one of the 2 tables whenever we go. Wings just don't taste as good if they are delivered.

Pro tip: Don't miss out on the Chris's wings. Those things are bomb.

We have been here countless times and intend on going back very soon.
author: Carolyn Z.

description:
Best chicken wings in the Bay Area by far. My girlfriend doesn't even like chicken, but she loves the chicken from Hot Sauce and Panko. 

The double dumbass Trump wings are my favorite while my girlfriend loves the green wings
author: Thien L.

description:
My new favorite wing place. 

Hot Sauce and Panko adds a bit of Japanese style to America chicken wings. The menu covers the full gambit of spices from sweetness to hotness, wet and dry. 

I sampled the chills lime and ramen wings. Chile lime was a bold mix of sour and spicey that needed no dipping sauce. The ramen wings were an unusual treat, as the wings were breaded in what appeared to be noodles that were broken into a fine powder and seasoned with miso. They weren't too special on their own, but when combined with the sirachi dipping sauce and lime juice provided, they just popped. 

It's also worth mentioning that the chicken at Hot Sauce and Panko practically fell off the bone, something I've never encountered with chicken and felt so satisfying when I bit down on each wing. And for those wanting to take the heat to go, Hot Sauce and Panko sells a nice variety of hot sauces to enjoy. 

You can count on me to try every single flavor of wings in this awesome establishment.
author: Nadav P.

description:
Great for a quick snack break if you are near downtown or the piers! 

NO splitting of order for different flavors. 

My friend and I split the Chris's (honey salty pepper). It came in 6 pieces (2 thighs, 4 wings) with plenty of the flavorful sauce. Burnt my tongue a little too since they came straight out from the kitchen, which explained why it took 10 min or so for the food to be ready. 

There are only 2 standing tables and space big enough for 3 people at most per table. Most people call-in for take out or order and go. There is barely any space to stand and wait. 

Best to come here with (multiple) friends so you can try out a bigger variety.
author: Wendy F.

description:
Best chicken wings in the city. A bit pricey but each flavor is better than the next. 

The place closes at 5PM during winter and at 7PM during summer.
author: Vamsee V.

description:
This is quite an unassuming wing shop on a corner street in a residential neighborhood. It is quite small with only a couple of small tables, so most of the clientele consists of people from the neighborhood getting takeout orders. What really stands out is the huge rack of hot sauces. I've never purchased a bottle, but reading the comically amusing names on the bottles helps the time pass by while you wait for your order. 
 
Hot Wings in House Buffalo Sauce:
spicy, buttery buffalo wings, yum.

Red Rooster (Sriracha Lime Cilantro):
delicious, but all the spicy wings were making my mouth go numb. After a few wings, I couldn't tell which was which.

Thai Sweet Chili:
Most of the flavors are spicy, but of the spicy ones, this one seems to be one of the milder ones. Or perhaps, my mouth was still numb from the previous flavors, so I couldn't tell.

Panko Parm - panko crusted parmesan with srirancho dip:
This is one of the only non-spicy flavors of the menu. Thoroughly coated and fried in panko, and lightly dusted with parmesan, they also come with a sriracha/ranch dip. As tasty as all the options are, this one is my favorite simply because I can chew on the chicken without taking swigs of milk every other bite. 

I'd try some of the other flavors if they weren't so spicy. I just can't seem to handle spicy foods as well as I used to.
Everything is very affordable, around $6-$8 for an order of wings. If you're in the neighborhood, it is definitely a great place to pick up a few orders of wings to go, or get a large catering order, or a box of wings to to enjoy in the comfort of your home, in sweatpants, in front of the tv.
author: Joy W.

description:
The wings are good with a large selection. A lot of creative names and even one that insults Trump. It's hard for me to remember which wings I ordered but personally I like dry wings. The waffle is a regular waffle so it's good as long as it's fresh and hot. 

I remember their walls are full of memes or puns, they are fun to look at while waiting for your food. 

They have like two tables inside? I think. It's a really small place. I don't blame the restaurant but I do hate it when people take their sweet ass time at the table even after they are done eating. You can't have your conversation outside? You want to hog the table and pretend to not see the people eating with a box in one hand and wing in the other? Be considerate, don't be an asshole.
author: Henry C.

description:
I almost took one star off because i had to follow up for the second waffle. But I decided to still give them 5 stars because the wings and waffles are so good and filling. We got Chris' and Parmesan Bacon with each of our wings and waffle combo. 

If I wasn't that hungry, I'll probably split a combo and add another order of wings on the side. I can eat but it was still a lot of food. 

Awesome, awesome.
author: Rori G.

description: I really enjoyed the decor, with their Trump figurine and whatnot, it's a really charming place. Chicken is juicy and tasty, and there are a bunch of flavors to try. 35
author: Kira S.

description:
Was in SF for 3 days. Ate here for 2. 

Honestly the most delicious waffle I have ever had in my life. Desperately wish I lived in the bay area.
author: Sidney W.

description:
May have been the best chicken wings I have ever had! But maybe that's not saying much as I really don't go to chicken wing places... Other than BDubs. This little corner shop in SF is a teeny tiny space where basically you go in and order at the counter. Most people do take out and wait outside, but there are 2 standing tables if you want to eat immediately (which we opted to do). A little claustrophobic but it'll get the job done.

I tried a whole bunch of wings but definitely recommend the green, ramen, and Korean. Waffles were OK. But personally I was a huge fan of the decor of hilarious posters/paintings around the restaurant. And even though they seemed to be pretty busy, the orders still came out fast.

Check this place out! You won't be disappointed.
author: Vicky N.

description: Best wings in the city. Spent a long time in sf trying to find good wings and hot sauce and panko hits the spot.
author: Kunaal A.

description:
WINGS.

You don't know how glad I am to hear that they moved locations. Not sure if it was true or not, but the yelp account for the old location said they used to only open two days a week 12-6pm. Who actually has time for that?! Anyways, I've heard people mention this place here and there, so let's see what the fuss is about. 

Came here around 5:30pm, and I expected it to be on the front of a busier street. Nothing much around except for a Craftsman & Wolves 2 blocks down. It's a corner shop with literally no seating. There's two small high tables inside, but they're more for customers to chill and wait for their order to be ready for pickup. A really small store means it's more of a to-go type of business, but seriously, where is there to go nearby except for a couple of alright cafes?  Service is quick, and what's unique is that they give you a toy block instead of a number. So cool! They even advertise a lot of bottled sauce on standing racks to the side, assuming they use a majority of those in their recipe. 6 wings for about $6 a set. Must order each flavor as a set of 6, no adjustments.

FOOD
Korean: (5/5) These wings were tasty! Wasn't spicy really, but they're better than a lot of wings out there. I like the fact that they garnish with a dash of sesame seeds on top. Makes it look a lot more appetizing.

Chris: (5/5) MY FAVORITE WINGS. SWEET AND SAVORY. The sauce is light and peppery, and I just couldn't get enough of these! These are on another level away from San Tung's, so it's not really comparable. Get these!

Thai: (5/5) These were really good too! I love the sweet and sour chili sauce taste with a heavy scent of basil. Too good to pass up.

Man all there wings are so good that I just gotta try everything else!
author: Kevin S.

description:
WOWZA!!!! This place is so worth the hype!!!!

The BASICS:
1. They are super fast, you get your order in minutes
2. Even though they are to go, they have two tables where you can stand and eat only if you order to dine in (no to go boxes at the table)
3. Menu is super creative, delicious, and fun!!! 
4.  Hot sauces galore if you are looking for some heat to take home.

I ordered the RAMEN wings and KJU with cheese and they were both delicious but I will admit I did enjoy the ramen wings more. The ramen wings came with a delicious hot/ranch/sriracha? sauce. They were so crunchy and perfectly seasoned. There was also a ton of meat to the bone.

The KJU was cheese was supposed to be a buldak but it was not as spicy as I expected them to be. The cheese was caramelized on top and it was just perfect. But you have to eat this fast because the cheese hardens!

My meal came out to $17 because I also ordered an extra ranch sauce which I ended up tossing. I wish I ordered to dine in because there was a rare spot at the table to eat. 

I WILL DEFINITELY BE COMING BACK IF I AM EVER IN TOWN. This was the best thing I ate during my short trip in SF.
author: Eileen C.

description: Went to this place after a failed attempt at having breakfast at some other place. Me and my friends needed to redeem ourselves with delicious food and this was definitely the right choice. It's located on a cute little street with a cafe and convenient store on the other two corners. This place is small so I wouldn't call it a sit-down restaurant, because well you literally can't even sit down inside. This place is really cute and fun, they have an entire wall dedicated to special sauces they sell. The wings were delicious-- I ordered Chris's and bacon wrapped molasses. Soooo good. Would HIGHLY recommend.
author: Zion F.

description:
Oh my goodness gracious. Chicken wings are probably some of my guiltiest of comfort foods. And hot sauce and Panko gets it so right

They have a ton of different wing flavors available, along with a few other menu items including waffles (which I've yet to try). Even though they're marketed as a "Korean American comfort food" spot, there's only one truly Korean style wing on the menu from what I saw (which is delicious). Another favorite is the lime sriracha. But let's be real - you can't really go wrong here
author: Jay P.

description:
OVERALL 3.5
TLDR: imaginative flavors, decent price, but lacking crisp factor
==

I've been wanting to try this place for forever, since it was on 6th Ave in the Richmond District!

I was so excited perusing the EXTENSIVE list of flavors outside as I waited for my friend and even more excited as I smelled the aroma of fresh Belgian waffles in the air when we ordered.. and then seeing their LONG queue of takeout orders even though there was no one else in the store. That means it HAS to be good right?

I tried the Lime and Thai flavors, and flavor, texture, and amount of sauce was perfect, but it was just lacking the crisp factor. A bit disappointing :(

Do stop by if you want to try the imaginative flavors but I wouldn't make this a destination spot. I def see this as a good takeout spot for those living in the area!

PLUS for the cute little knick knacks and signs around the store. Take a look around at those and the huge rack of hot sauces while you wait for your food!
author: Emily C.

description:
I came here for the first time and I was surprised that it was just a little small store with only two tables to stand on. My boyfriend and I got a little carried away and ordered way too much food. We ordered the Korean, Chris's, green, and panko parmesan wings. We also ordered the Goliath waffle sandwich. 

My favorite was the panko parmesan hands down. It was so good because it also came with a dip that went great together. I also liked the green which had ginger and cilantro. I do wish that it had more flavor to it though. It would've been a lot better if it was a little more salty or something. The Korean was also good. It had a nice sweet and spicy flavor. My least favorite was Chris's and that's surprising to me because the workers told me that it was their most popular flavor. I just didn't think the honey and salt and pepper worked well together. 

And lastly but sadly to say, both my boyfriend and I thought the sandwich was not good at all. At all! Maybe it has to do with the fact that we brought all the food home, and during that card ride the waffle of the sandwich got really soggy. The fried chicken was fine but with only a bit of the cabbage and barely any sauce, the sandwich was just very bland. I wouldn't get the sandwich again but other than that, the wings were swell.
author: Annie H.

description:
These wings are HELLA good!  Their hours are a bit odd, one time I was waiting in my car instead of going to their door saying "open, open, open".  Didn't want to seem annoying or creepy over some chicken wings LOL!  But hot daaaaayyyyyyuuuummmm!!!

They open promptly at noon Wed-Fri and close at 6pm, except on Sundays when they close at 5pm.  Closed Monday & Tuesday, bizarre for an Asian place...whatever, it just means we get to crave it more.  I'm totally addicted to their Goliath chicken waffle sandwich, which consists of chicken karaage with cabbage sriracha caramel and sushi sauce.  It's worth crossing the Golden Gate Bridge, and it's worth trekking over from Outer Richmond.  Their shelves are stocked with unique hot sauces to purchase, some I've never heard of.  Of course they have "Slap Ya Mama" Cajun hot sauce, my kind of place.  You'll get a kick outta their witty signs, everyone needs a good laugh.  

All their wings are tasty; however, they don't let you mix them up...boo!  This place is tiny, not enough tables/seats for more than 5 people.  Unless you want to stand outside, there are two tables.  I'm craving their wings as I type this, too bad it's a Tuesday.  I will have to beat the rush after work to get here since they close at 6pm.
author: Christine R.

description: Uh Maze Ing! ! I've been coming to Hot Sauce and Panko for the past 10 years .  Every time I go it's always as  good as the first time .  This place is the real deal . It's impossible not to find a wing  to fall in love with . I prefer the  Korean, spicy  but not overpowering. My girlfriend is in love with the yaki(we split them to keep it cool). Waffles are on point ! Never overdone, perfectly sweet and thick. This is my go to spot when trying to impress friends new to the city!
author: Luis R.

description: Really tiny shop but you can't really miss it, it's on the corner of the street and has a noticeable sign.  It didn't seem to busy when we went but there isn't really any seating, basically enough for 6 people to sit.  Along the wall there's a big stock of different hot sauces to check out while you wait for your wings.  The prices are okay, a little more expensive than your average wing place but the taste was definitely there.  Wings were crunchy and flavorful.  It's a place I definitely plan on coming back to just to check out the other flavors and I'm located in East Bay so it's clear this place is worth it to trek all the way to nob hill.
author: Alexander C.

description:
Chicken wings is the perfect meal and they know how to cook wings.

The quality as not changed even at this new location.
author: Evan W.

description:
When I walked in the door I was certainly surprised that there were so many 5* reviews.  I wasn't sure what could justify it...

And then I bit into my first crunchy decadent boiling bursting Chris's honey wing and I knew we had found something special.  The Kochujang were also some of the best KFC I've had.  I only wish I'd ordered 12 other flavors.  I mean seriously.  How can this place have so many different unique flavor combinations?  

Service was fast and friendly which is no tall order in a tiny cramped place like that.  Price also very reasonable given how popular this place is.  Make sure to grab a bunch of napkins because the only way to eat this is with your hands and they are messy.

In any event this is a must stop when in San Fran for any wing lovers!  Will definitely be back to try again and again until all menu options are exhausted.
author: Tarek S.

description: Incredible wings. This place has a great fusion of eastern and western flavors and churns out some of the most delicious waffles around. It's nothing fancy and there's barely any place to eat, but that's not why you come here...  it's all about the food.
author: Justin E.

description: I don't know... I must admit I was disappointed. I ordered the Goliath sandwich, chase and Chris' after reading up on reviews. I can't say that I was blown away. I've had better. For what it was, I thought it was pretty expensive. I can't say much. And wish I could say more... I think if I were in the area, I'd give it another shot, but I wouldn't go out of my way.
author: jonelle y.

description: This place is like my chicken wing wet dream. I collect hot sauce and they have so many I had never heard of. Chicken waffle sandwich is so good. The Korean wings and the garlic Parmesan are my favs but you really can't go wrong. I'm originally from western New York and this is the only wing place in SF that does them RIGHT! Crispy on the outside, juicy on the inside and great flavors. 10 million stars
author: Nicole S.

description: I had Green's and Salt & Sichuan. Both were nice, but I liked Sichuan more. It's not a fancy place and it's a perfect to-go or quick-eat spot. It's best to come here when your plan is to hop around different places in the city on a weekend and need a quick stop to eat. Since I live in NOB area, it's a perfect to-go for me when I have the wings craving. Pricing is very good too.
author: Ash M.

description:
We came back for another round of wings and this time we decided to try some different flavors!

Last time, we ordered the Chris's and Garlic Parm (mmmm all that bacon!) which were two solid flavors. This time, we ordered Green (which they ran out of last time) and Korean. Personally, I preferred CHRIS'S much better and I can def say that's my fav so far!

My ranking of what we've tried so far: 

1) Chris's - A little on the sweeter side but sooooo good! It's a "honey salty crispy black pepper" wing and all the flavors just come together so well!
2) Garlic Bacon Parm - All those bacon bits?! Bursting with garlic and parmesan flavor and overloaded with bacon. Definitely a crowd-pleaser.
3) Korean - House Gochujang Hot Pepper. This wasn't as spicy as I initially thought it was going to be, but it was alright.
4) Green - Cilantro Jalapeno Ginger Sesame Oil Spice Mix. I had high expectations for this!! But was semi-disappointed. I thought there was going to be a bigger kick from the jalapeno or something, but all I could really taste was the ginger and sesame oil (kinda?). More of a mellow wing.
author: Wing L.

description: So delicious! I would highly recommend this place to anyone. They have a diverse menu of wing flavors and a wide selection of hot sauces you can buy! If you love really spicy wings I would suggest you try their ghost pepper wings. They are very spicy and very crispy. This place is small so it's mainly only for take out, but the service is quick and while you wait you can enjoy their comical decorations. If you're thinking about trying this place you won't regret it!
author: Kiana H.

description: Pretty small place, primarily takeout but there is a limited amount of table space. My chicken is juicy and tasty, and there are a bunch of flavors to try. Their menu has something for everyone.
author: Julien B.

description:
Spent my cheat day here, and didn't feel like I cheated! Chicken wings drizzled in the sauce of your choice (flavor right down to the bone!) with a waffle? Sounds like fourth meal food, but was a great lunch. Set yourself up for success- the wings are hearty and filling, so order as you go, starting off with six. And that waffle? Split it or be daring and order one on your own. This stand-up table restaurant knows that you need to stand up in order to push the flavors down, if you sat you'd be stuck! haha.

Come here for a unique lunch packed with flavors, at an affordable price, while watching the trolley of tourists go by every few minutes.
author: Regina D.

description:
#126/2016

Just don't ask for Buffalo wings (yeah, I think they're overrated and I'm from Buffalo.)

Expand your taste buds instead with honey and pepper, lime and fish sauce, garlic bacon Parmesan, bacon wrapped bourbon molasses (yeah, right?) and many other inventive combos. 

You can't just order one so throw restraint out the window. 

I love the playful riff and flavor profiles but have a quibble: Don't charge extra for sauces-  bleu cheese, wasabi, tartar, etc.

Yeah, if people want extra, ok but it seems stingy to tack on $0.25. 

Also, tempura fries could've been a lot crispier but that might've been lost in delivery. 

The humble wing is overdue for gourmand treatment (I'm fond of my chili lime wing with tamarind chutney) and Hot Sauce & Panko has smartly filled that gap. 

If they stayed open late on Saturday they'd make so much money serving the late-drinking crowd. 

(No one's tipsy when they close at 7pm or 5pm Sundays). 

But they do deliver so get that 'wang on!
author: Jennifer O.

description: Drove around for 10 minutes because parking blows in this area and when I showed up slightly after 530 they weren't taking any more orders! BS
author: Jay Y.

description: Like most people I loved this place!! Just a small venue with funny posters and AMAZING wings. I tried 5 different flavors with my boyfriend and loved them all! And it's a great price for the quality you get! Want to come back and try them all!!
author: Dylan H.

description: The chicken was so good!!! Loved the CHRIS one!!! Definitely would go back and try other types of chicken wings!! BUT I DEFINITELY WOULD RECOMMEND THE CHRIS FLAVOR CHICKEN WINGS! The decor in the store is hilarious and you can buy your own hot sauce!
author: Tiffany C.

description:
Sometimes I wish I had a pitless stomach so I could try all the wings at Hot Sauce and Panko.

I visited their new location about a month ago and I still think about their wings. For all you first timers, I recommend Chris's. It was exactly as I remembered- juicy, succulent wings with sweet and salty flavors. 

The Korean Wings were good and tasted exactly how I imagined: chicken wings with gojuchang sauce. Nothing surprising and gave a good kick.

The only wings that I was iffy about were the Sticky Pepper Garlic wings. I wasn't sure if they were burnt and the flavors didn't stand out to me like Chris's or the Korean wings did. Will definitely pass on this next time.

Tip: unless you like sweating while eating your wings, I suggest eating it outside or taking it to go.
author: Eva L.

description:
I used to be a health freak, but my friends in undergrad really liked OB Chicken in Berkeley and my friends at UCSF really like San Tung...thus chicken wings have been added to my (wannabe) foodie adventures. 

Hot Sauce & Panko has an eclectic variety of chicken wings, from ghost pepper to sriracha caramel. Prices are moderate at ~$7 for 6 wings, but it makes an unexpectedly sufficient meal. They don't allow split orders, so I strongly recommend coming in a group so you can try more of their interesting choices.

GREEN (cilantro jalapeno ginger sesame oil spice mix): Sounds like too many ingredients jumbled together, but very tasty. (Disclaimer: I don't have the cilantro-tastes-like-soap gene, so my recommendation should be taken with caution for that sub-population) It reminded me of the ginger steamed chicken Chinese dish, except a bajillion times the guilty-pleasure factor due to the fact that it's fried chicken wings.

MANGO HABANERO: Didn't expect mango and habanero and wings to go well together but it was great--very saucy and succulent with a layer of freshly fried crispy goodness. I tend to not be a fan of fried chicken because it's dry and can almost make me feel like I have a sore throat, but all the mango habanero sauce fixes this. (And FYI, this is not spicy despite the habanero in the name)

Although most chicken wing places are Korean, I think HS&P may be Chinese-owned because I heard them speaking Canto, and that would explain why the green wings reminded me so much of the Chinese chicken dish.

Ambiance is very mom-and-pop with limited hours and a hint of quaint cutesiness like how they give you a wooden alphabet block for your order number. They mostly take to-go orders because there's only one table inside; however, Yelp tells me you can take the food to nom on next door. Also, they do have plastic forks but it's somewhat hidden by the register. I hate eating with my hands (yes I'm high-maintenance like that), and struggled holding chicken wings with napkins that kept soaking through in sauce before I was able to find the forks. First world problems...
author: Edna C.

description:
I start off by mentioning that I love chicken wings.  Any time I can try a new wing place or just wings in general I most certainly take advantage of it.  Now with that out of the way, this place has the best wings I have ever had.  You're probably thinking that's a bold statement but after trying his place several times this place has become my all time favorite place for wings.

This place is a super hole in the wall place with tons of different sauces to try but being that I love spicy things I went with a 6 piece mango habanero.  It's no where near as spicy as the mango habanero from Buffalo Wild Wings or Wingstop, think more along the lines of Dominos.  It's has a nice kick, but really captures the sweetness from the mango.  I definitely recommend this if you want a less spicy flavorful sauce.  But besides the great sauces, I've tried a few, the wings are so tender that it blows my mind how wings can be so delicious.  I've honestly never had wings even remotely close to the consistency as the ones here.  

Along with wings they also have friend chicken and waffle sandwich.  Yup, it's just as delicious as it sounds.  For $7 you're getting your monies worth.  Inside of it comes with some coleslaw, Sriracha, a huge piece of fried chicken and some syrup on the side.  The fried chicken is nice battered, but doesn't crumble and make a mess when you bite into it.  

If you're a fan of wings they you seriously have to try this place.  Already looking forward to my next SF trip so that can come back here for wings.
author: Jesus H.

description: LITERALLY SO GLAD I FOUND THIS GEM IN THE CITY!! My friend raved about this place to me and surprisingly it was super close to my boyfriends house. Parking can be difficult at times but really depends on your luck. The restaurant is in the corner and cable cars passes by it so maybe take public transportation to get here is better! The place is pretty small I only see one table with two seats. There's a whole shelf of different spices, some have super funny names! Take a look while you're waiting for your wings. I ordered their two most popular flavor which is greens and Chris honey. Both were amazing!! Me and my boyfriend loved it. They just earned themselves regulars! This is better than wing stop guys trust me!! Can't wait to come back and try all the flavors BWUAHAHA
author: Tina C.

description:
Ordered through postmates for fuel while watching the Game and was pleasantly surprised.

Really cool flavors and very flavorful! They definitely don't skimp on the sauce either. We ordered the double hot buffalo wings and the old bay. I ended up liking the depth of flavor of the old bay a bit better. Would like to try the other flavors!

Also ordered fries and they were delicious, crispy, potato wedges--a bit paltry in the portion and no ketchup but tasty nonetheless.

 One star off because about half the wings were fatty. They should trim the fat off before frying or buy more lean (frozen) wings.
author: Semuteh F.

description: Delicious, the waffle and wings combo is great. Reasonably priced too. Also the batter isn't too thick and the wing not too fatty either like super cheap places.
author: Phillip T.

description: Best wings I've ever had! I visit the San Francisco area a couple times a month for work and always seem to find my way over here. The Chili Crunch wings are my favorite, but honestly, they have lots of other good flavors the won't let you down.
author: Alfonso Q.

description: A bit disappointed but I might give it a try again. I got a chicken sandwich and when I unwrapped it, the sauce was really messy and all over the sandwich ): also the chicken was just plain versus garlic like I ordered. It was tasty though.
author: Vinh T.

description:
WOW is really all I have to say. If you're looking for the best chicken wings around, stop reading Yelp and get over to Hot Sauce and Panko. I stumbled upon this place while walking around SF when I saw an Australian man scarfing down some wings, so I asked him about it and he told me, "I can't even explain it, just try them." So I did. The wings are a great fusion of Asian taste on chicken wings. I had the Mongolian BBQ and was blown out of the water. There's just the right about of sauce, the outside of the wings are crispy and the chicken is perfectly moist. They also do an interesting waffle and wings creation that I saw someone else eating. 

The only downside is that this place is small (only two tables) so it's not the best for inside eating. However I had no problem sitting outside on some steps and eating away. Seriously, go get yourself these wings.
author: Juliette S.

description:
When do I ever say no to chicken wings??  (Answer: NEVER!).  I saw a lot of ppl ordering take out- specifically via apps- and for good reason.  There's not much sitting room.  Actually, there's none.  Just two standing tables surrounded by a lot of silly decor and signs.  We got Thai mango chicken wings and the Goliath waffle sandwich.  Delish.  I can't wait to try the other flavors.  

WINNA WINNA, HOT SAUCE AND PANKO DINNAH
author: Lyn C.

description:
Updating this review after trying many different flavors:

KFC- always solid. Strong gochujang flavor. Perfectly crispy and saucy. Highly recommended!

Old Bay- started off as my second favorite  next to KFC but I think it's my favorite now! Something magical happens when the old bay seasoning dry rub comes together with the sriracha caramel sauce! Caution- this is one spicier and sweeter than the KFC.

Green: this is one of their most popular ones, but we thought it was alright. I like my wings to pack a punch in terms of flavor and this one was just on the milder side- lots of cilantro and good taste regardless. 

Ramen: if you're a fan of super crispy wings, you can try these. The ramen is almost pulverized to make the crust. The meat was juicy inside, but not as flavorful as the others.
author: Debika M.

description:
I had the Chris' Wings per yelp and the employee's recommendation and they were just okay. The wings were cooked thoroughly but were a bit dry, and the honey and salt and pepper flavors tasted pretty good together, but nothing blew my mind. They also charge $0.25 per sauce, which I know is a way to not waste sauce but still seemed pretty stingy. At over $1/wing, the price wasn't great either. 

Also, the fact that this place has no seating (only 2 small standing tables) makes it really unappealing. If they had a partnership or something with a bar nearby to make it easy to bring our food over to it and order drinks from them, it would have made our experience much better.

Overall, I'm pretty surprised by how high the ratings are for this place.
author: Mio W.

description: Sooooo DAMNED Delicious!! Got a group of folks from work to order a bunch of different flavors and although there wasn't a loser in the group the stand outs were the bacon wrapped one and the Serg situation!! My goodness so tasty! I am a true fan of Hot Sauce and Panko!! fr fr
author: Denine J.

description:
Not the cheapest ($7+ for 6 pieces of chicken) and sometimes the pieces can be really small. Probably will need at least 2 orders of chicken per person (if you're only ordering chicken). But most of the flavors are great, though they can be a bit spicier! 

Docked one star for the lack of place to even set things down for a second. The shop is tiny and won't let you use one of their two small tables to eat if you choose to get take-out. 

That said, I will probably be back since everyone loves chicken wings ¯\_(ツ)_/¯
author: Mingmei N.

description: First time eating there tonight and I loved it! And yes, you do want the waffle on the side! It's amazing and it's definitely not a frozen waffle like most places give you! This is gonna be my new FAVORITE Friday night spot before going out now haha!
author: Deondre J.

description: One of my favorite spots to visit in San Francisco. It is relatively close to the park and the chicken is phenomenal. They also feature some very funny anti-Trump memorabilia.
author: Will M.

description: Best wings in the city hands down! This place has everything on point! From the flavors, quality of the chicken, and the way they fry the chicken is amazing! Korean and Chris wings are my favorite flavors on the menu. If you haven't tried this place yet you got to head over there now!
author: Michael T.

description: Got the recommendation to come here from a lyft driver and they were the best wings I've ever had!! We got 4 different flavors and they were all amazing!  They outside was perfectly crispy and the meat just fell off the bone. Highly highly recommend!!
author: Renee R.

description:
I came to the new location (located on the corner of Jackson & Hyde in Nob Hill) this past weekend and am so happy about the new addition to the neighborhood.

Food: I got the Yaki (Teriyaki) Wings & my bf got the Beer Wings and we split an order of fries. Soooo delicious and I cannot wait to try their other flavors. 

Service: We came about 30 mins before closing & had to wait ~25 minutes to get our food, which was surprising since it wasn't that crowded. There were people who came & ordered after us and received their food first, but it wasn't too big of a deal since we weren't in a huge rush.

Ambiance: Definitely a grab-and-go place. There is no outside seating at the new location & only 2 tables inside (both of which are standing-only tables and would be really inconvenient to sit at if it was crowded).
author: Catherine S.

description:
Unassuming but delicious grab-and-go wings shop on the corner of Jackson & Hyde.

Tip: If you're ordering two types of wings, I'd recommend ordering something saucy for one pick and then something crispy & fried as the other as texture and flavor complements to each other. 

I got Clark's and Lime this time - both super delicious, saucy, and succulent, but with the two together, there was also too much flavor in the sauces poppin' off in my mouth (my bad on the ordering). Also, I found that I overall prefer Chris's over Clark's, the latter is almost too hot to taste the other flavors.

I think this is going to be one of those spots I come back to regularly. Love them wings.
author: Ashley S.

description:
Experience : I love trying new places, especially hole in the wall places. If you like chicken wings or waffles, you gotta try this place.

Food: So I normally don't meat. It limits the places I can go and sometime when there's nothing and I'm super starving, I have to go against my normal diet and do what I have to do. (don't judge me) this place was great! It's always a good sign when you a line out the door. We hopped off the cable car at Hyde and Jackson and picked up a quick bite to eat. The wings were juicy and perfectly fried. I liked how they had different sauces that you could pick from and they were all unique. It made me excited to try something new rather than the typical buffalo sauce, teriyaki sauce. 

Atmosphere/Setting: Very crowded and tight on space. We managed to get a table after another group left but it wasn't a sit down table. We stood the whole time and inhaled the wings. If you're looking for fancy, this isn't your place.

Service: You pick what you want, order it from the cashier and wait for the glorious wings to be ready and for your number to be called out.

Final thoughts: Would definitely come back
author: Winnie P.

description:
I've always wanted to try this place because my friend said that it was "the bomb". Finally tried it yesterday with my bae. So we ordered the Korean fried and Yaki, chicken fried waffle sandwich and the fries. Personally, I think that SANG TUNG wings were way better. The fries were just fries. And the fried chicken waffle sandwich was okay. Overall! Everything was okay but definitely a little pricy ! Nothing special.. Sorry not sorry. 

And P.S Zev. K for you lovely message. "You should take down your Panko review... It's going to get taken down anyways and you just look stupid promoting another business. #badkarma" just saying that I have the right to express my opinions without any of your concern. thank you!
author: Shirley G.

description:
I actually like the five wings I tried, Korean, salt and pepper, garlic Parmesan, mango habanero, honey salt
The waffle was so soft in the inside but so crispy on the outside
author: Susan P.

description:
This place has the best wings and the worst hours. Closing at 5pm on a Sunday? 7pm on a weekday? I consistently wish I could order this or pick this up more often. :(

Anyways, best wings in sf. The Chris 2x hot and the green wings are a must.
author: Michael G.

description: I think this place is overrated & overpriced. My friend and I split the ultra chicken sandwich which was just ok, chicken was tender but the waffle was too thick & lacked flavor. We also ordered 2 different flavors of wings that the cashier suggested bcz I wanted something spicy. The Korean was ok, nothing special. The green was pretty awful. Wont be coming back.
author: May G.

description: The most amazing wings I've ever had. Super fast service. There's only 2 tables if you want to eat there. I don't see that as a huge problem. It encourages people to hurry up and eat so others can eat. Highly recommend.
author: Joey H.

description: Wings with just the right amount of sauce and crisp with a variety of flavors. Great spot to pick-up and go.
author: Alex B.

description:
Be warned! This place has no seating, and only a standing table..but they do have a wall covered in various hot sauce bottles. I was able to find a Nando's peri peri sauce which was exciting (I haad to buy it). My friend and I ordered three wings but I completely forgot the third one so I'm guessing it wasn't that memorable :( 

Green: Cilantro Jalapeno flavored wings. Not very spicy at all, really tasty and tangy! They said it was one of the most ordered so definitely try these out. You'll be picking up the dropped jalapeño pieces and eating them once you finish all the wings

Panko Parmesan: Came with spicy mayo dipping sauce which was super yummy. These were crispier than the others and I think my favorite. The panko made the wings next-level.

The waffles smelled really good but we wanted to focus on the wings here! Maybe next time.
author: Hana S.

description: Chicken wings are my candy. This place hits the spot - the best wings I have tasted anywhere. I'm happy to see they re-opened in San Francisco and am looking forward to trying their new location.
author: Sunny M.

description:
Hot Sauce and Panko has one of the best chicken wings ever with lots of different flavors to choose from! They close Mondays/Tuesdays and open Wed - Saturday 12-6pm and Sunday from 12-5pm. You also get a free waffle on Thursdays if you are a spoten member which you can sign up at spoten.com! 

There isn't much seating there but you can go to the bar next door and eat there and enjoy a glass of beer! 

The top 5 best wings flavors are:
- Green: cilantro jalapeno ginger seame oil spice mix
- Korean: house gochujang hot pepper
- Yaki: teriyaki
- Chris's: honey salty crispy black pepper
- Wings & Waffle Special
author: Jenn L.

description: Good chicken with delicious sauce, if u live in SF, u should try it definitely! Yummy chicken!
author: Pasha M.

description: Some of the best wings I've had. Small place with barely any seating/standing room. Wish I had the chance to try one of the waffle sandwiches. Got Serg's gbp (spicy garlic bacon parmesan) and wish I had tried more flavors. Also, lots of Seinfeld stickers.
author: Bito M.

description:
After coming here a few times, I've come to realize that while the wings are good, you need to come for the ULTRA GOLIATH WAFFLE SANDWICH. This thing is fried chicken, cabbage, and sriracha, caramel (?), and sushi sauce layered in between two perfectly golden waffle halves. All for $7.49! I would easily argue that this beats out many of SF's fried chicken sandwiches. The flavors of this sandwich are spot-on- the perfect amount of sweet and savory with a hint of spiciness. The chicken is well fried and not too heavy in breading. And the waffle is thick and has the right amount of crispiness to hold up against all of the goodness inside.

Because this is at the end of the day still a wings place, I feel obligated to at least mention it.
Chris's- honey salty pepper
Exactly as it sounds, and pretty good. People pleaser choice.

Old Bay- sriracha caramel
Slightly sweet, but mostly spicy. Too spicy for what I would want.

Lime- caramelized fish sauce
My favorite. Nice tartness from the fish sauce.

An order of wings is 6 large wings for $6.89. You'll probably want to do two orders. The annoying thing is you can't mix and match flavors in an order, so make sure you bring some friends to swap wings with.

RESTAURANT
Really tiny spot with two small standing tables. Get your food here, get a drink at the convenience store across the street, and then take it to the Washington and Hyde Mini Park a block away to enjoy.
author: Alice T.

description:
So. Freakin. Good. 
Had the garlic Parmesan wings and waffle. The waffle was simply perfect, and the wings were unbelievable! They just melt in your mouth, very tender and plenty of flavor and spice. Living this close by is going to be dangerous....
author: Nick V.

description: Whatever they do to their chicken wings is straight-up of voodoo... Not really haha but it is so good! I haven't quite figured out what exactly it is that they did different, perhaps the Panko would make sense ... but I have to say it's probably the best chicken wings you're going to find in San Francisco!
author: Kristina Noel K.

description:
Been going here since it was in Richmond.  

Delish!  Very well seasoned, juicy and moist.  Have to order the wings with the waffle next time but I always forget.

Use to order it for events but since they moved out of Richmond.  It's not as convenient for us but I'm sure they have more traffic and business at their current location.  

But it's a pain to find parking here so I make sure to go w a friend and have them run in and do a pick up.
author: Gia C.

description: I would come back here all the time if I didn't live so far; this is actually the best wings place I've ever been to! The wings here are perfectly seasoned and crispy! However, I must mention this place is definitely inconvenient to get to if you don't have a car since its a residential area, but it's definitely worth the trip.  I will also mention that the shop is quite tiny so there is very limited space to eat, but we were lucky enough to get one of the two tables.  But I can honestly say the wings are worth all the downsides that I've mentioned.
author: Jacqueline T.

description:
Best. Fried. Chicken. Sandwich.

Extra casual place with little to no seating/tables - but worth it.
author: Marco P.

description:
Was a fan of this spot since the week they opened. Amazing wings with a seemingly endless variety of recipes. Had a few disappointing visits where the wings were mostly fatty greasy globs instead of meat, but wrote it off to the business experimenting with different wing vendors. Took my friend last weekend and had three different flavors. Sadly, each order was rife with globs of chicken fat where I was hoping to bite into meat. It was utterly disgusting, and unfortunately my last visit to Panko. 

It seems as though this business is a victim of their own success having sold out to cheap, low quality, fatty frozen wings to save a few $$ while trying to keep up with the high demand that constantly lines up at the door of their tiny shop. So bummed.
author: Buddy L.

description:
THIS PLACE IS THE BOMB!!!!! 

No shame, we ate them in the car and I think it added to the experience! ha! 

All the wings were fried perfectly...good texture on the outside with a moist inside.

Chris's = good seasoning, should def get
Siracha blend= absolute favorite. Spicy but oh-so-good!
Teriyaki = meh, not a fan of the "soy sauce-y" flavor

next favorite: THE WAFFLE!  Sweet and fluffy! A must with your chicken.

The place is small. No sit down tables; in fact i only remember two bar tables.  

I will be back!
author: Kris Marie D.

description:
Delicious wings, came by on a Thursday afternoon around 1 pm and there was no wait at all. Small establishment with two small tables inside and some small tables outside (standing only). Got the cilantro lime, Korean, and Chris's (honey-flavored) which were some of the top-selling flavors. All were delicious but the Chris was my favorite. Crispy, sweet, and juicy. It's a little pricey for $7 for a small order but it is a mom-and-pop store, so you're supporting local businesses.

Overall, would definitely come back and try the other flavors.
author: Wendy L.

description:
So glad I found this place.  Love KFC (Korean fried chicken) and haven't found a good one in the city. After hours of practicing getting on my surf board and ride the waves at Ocean Beach, I was spent and this place hit the spot. 
Got the waffle and wings special for about $10. With so many to choose, decided on the mango. It was a perfect blend of spicy and sweet. I tried the jalapeño cilantro, it was okay. Needs more depth to me. Taste just like its name, jalapeño & cilantro. I want to come back for the Chris, Red Rooster, and the Korean, next time.
author: Naty D.

description:
A tiny little hole in the wall place in a neighborhood on its own, surrounded by houses. From the reviews, I knew it would be small, but didn't expect it to be SO SMALL. Best to get your food to go unless you want to wait for a table to open up. There's only two little tables inside. You clean your own tables with the sanitation wipes they provide you, near the condiments. 

A very large and excellent selection of hot sauces!! I expected more from the chicken due to the 4.5 stars on yelp. The sauce was definitely superb, but the chicken wings they use was extremely fatty. And the waffle sandwich we got wasn't as flavorful.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
4-4.5, but knocking off a star because of their hours.

Why do they close so early???   7PM may have been fine for their previous quiet section of Clement street location, but around here, I really wish they'd stay open at least another hour so I could get some winner winner chicken dinner.  7PM is really early for a lot of us in the area - practically right in the middle of the dinner rush.  Yeah, we can call in and pick up right at 6:55 (or even worse, drop in at 6:55), but that doesn't feel very nice - nobody likes getting a bunch of work dumped on them at the end of the day, not to mention the chance of running out wings/etc for the day.  

Food-wise:
- Like everyone else has mentioned, the wings are really damn good:  juicy, tender, well flavored, great variety, with a nice crispy exterior.  I don't need to reiterate the other 700+ reviews.

- The fish & chips was meh - not bad, but nothing special.  Fish is logically panko breaded and fried, not battered like UK style fish and chips.  Lime + tartar sauce included.  Wedge fries were also meh.  Just like fish at a steakhouse is usually meh.

- The Goliath waffle sandwich firstly is really thick (phrasing), just under 2.5", so you need to squish it down a bit to fit in a non-pornstar mouth.  The chicken "kara-age" used in here is much closer to fried chicken tenders than traditional karaage's lighter coating and seasoning.  Not bad, just not what was expected.  As a whole though, this sandwich felt a bit dry and bland.  There is some sauce/slaw in there, but not enough to offset the amount of chicken+waffle.  Was I supposed to use syrup on it?  Nothing was included in my takeout box.    Maybe a creamier slaw might help.
author: T C.

description:
I'm debating if I should give 3 stars or 4 stars... 3.5 star it is. My first visit was probably last year... anyways it's been 1+ year (and I totally forgot what we got) and just came back from my second visit last Sunday.

Hot Sauce and Panko is a very small and homy snack store. We planned to sit down and eat there (as party of 2), however there were only 4 seats and they were occupied within 10 minutes after they opened. What can I say, maybe I would prefer eat at home and not to get looks from people waiting to order the wings... So we got to-go instead. The wait time was around 20 mins, longer than I expected. 

Chris': It was amazing. It was crunchy and very flavorful. I usually don't do this but I did lick my fingers. Just this once. *don't judge me*

Fish 'n' Chips: It was alright. The fish smell fishy (duh) after it cool down. Don't think I will get this again. 

Chicken and Waffle Sandwich: I love waffle and I love fried chicken, the portion was huge (or was it because we got a lot of food). It was good but Chris' nailed it even I love waffle so much.

Overall, it was tasty... I might come back again if the wait time is shorter and if I can find a parking near by. Originally we wanted to get the Ramen Fried Chicken because it was sold out last time we visited, however they took it down from the menu. The decoration in the store is definitely very fun and sarcastic (I mean, how do you put fun and sarcastic together amazed me). Lots of indie/non-huge-brand sauces for sauce lovers.
author: Leslie C.

description:
I came here for Superbowl sunday, and they had a special menu that didnt include the chilli lime flavor or the Chris's - which were two I was looking forward to!!
I put in an order at 1pm, and received my order at 2pm. Geebuz. The store itself is really small and there isnt a place to sit. They have a standing table or two for people to eat in, but not much room to stand in to wait either. They will instead give you a buzzer when your order is ready. 
I got the thai and sticky wings and they were both super crispy and juicy wings with good seasoning/sauce! But nothing that blew my mind, and the wait made it just barely worth. 

I would like to come back on a normal day and try their other flavors and re-review!
author: Grace P.

description:
Definitely a hole in the wall kind of restaurant!

Walked in and did not expect it to be small. There are 2 small tables inside that fit 2 people each and 2 standing tables outside. Everything is out in the open so the kitchen is right behind the register. Parking here is terrible.... But I guess you cant really expect much since it is in the Richmond, but just be prepared for that. Next time, I'm definitely just going to call in and order, and then quickly go in to pick up.

As for the wings, they were so delicious! I got to try Green, Korean, and Pad Thai and all 3 were so good!! My favorite would definitely be the Korean one, they say its comparable to San Tung Wings, but for me, San Tung still wins haha. They were crunchy on the outside and juicy on the inside. I'll definitely be back to try all the different flavors next time!
author: Carrie L.

description: Oh I love this place!  Welcome to the neighborhood!  They have every type of chicken wing to satiate any taste bud.  Go up, get your ord
author: Maile N.

description: This place is great! The wings are fantastic all of the flavors are so different and yummy. The double hot is so spicy so if you aren't someone who loves super spicy go for the regular hot! The mango jalapeno and is my favorite! It is sweet and spicy and so delicious! The space is really small so it is for sure somewhere for take out. The wait can be long depending on how many orders they have so I would recommend calling ahead!
author: Jazlyn H.

description:
My top picks (coming from someone that can't handle eating spicy food): Chris' Wings and the Bacon Garlic Parm. 

Their wings are so flavorful compared to other wing places and the Chris's wings are basically honey glazed wings. Once you get a taste, you can't stop and they they definitely don't skimp out on the bacon bits in the bacon garlic parm wings and they won't over fill it with parm and garlic either. It's a happy medium of all three favors. 

The wait isn't super long either and their store if filled with all sorts of hot sauce, that was the first thing I noticed. You can't go wrong with the Chris's Wings!
author: Eva O.

description: I took my family here this past weekend, and let's just the ah the 30 min it took to park. The wing and waffle made for it ! So glad i finally made it fire!!
author: Anthony M.

description:
As if they need another 5 star review, I still wanted to leave my two cents about my experience here. I've been meaning to try this place for a while and I finally had a opportunity to stop by one afternoon. Decided to try out four flavors:

Lime: 5/5. Fish saucey-limey goodness. Being from Thailand, the spicy/sour/tangy/umami taste really hits home for me. This was my absolute FAVORITE by far. I will come back just to have this again. It was pretty much a flavor party on my tongue. If you're into sour-tangy wings I'd highly recommend this.

Chris's: 4.5/5. This one was pretty simple. A honey, salt, & pepper mixture that had a great balance of sweet and salty. Also a must-try.

Fried garlic: 4/5. For all my garlic lovers, this is the one for you. Fried with a garlic-crisp exterior, these wings come with a special dipping sauce. I was unsure what kind of sauce it was but it tasted chipotle-y (?) Super noms with the sauce though.

Green: 3/5. This is a crispy fried wing with a blended cilantro/jalapeño/ginger mixture on top. Its not bad, but my least favorite in terms of flavor. You definitely need a bite of those greens to enhance the taste.

Overall, it's a cute and tiny spot that serves a variety of wings that are far superior to places like Wingstop or BWW. It's definitely worth a try!
author: Marny N.

description:
Hot Sauce and Panko... how do you get your wings so perfectly crispy on the outside, and amazingly tender on the inside? Seriously.

These wings don't look like much on the outside (I mean, wings rarely do), but they're seriously some of the best wings I've ever had. 

To avoid waiting - call in your order, then go pick it up. You can't sit there if you order to-go, but I typically just pick up my wings, and walk (ok SPRINT) home.

Make sure to try the ramen rings. Although the coating of my ramen wings weren't to ramen noodle-like, they were the perfect, dry exterior to counterbalance the juicy moist interior. 

Must try!!
author: Michelle L.

description:
My aunt and I made the journey to HS&P this Sunday afternoon and arrived around noon. There was no line and maybe one group was waiting for their grub when we got there. The place is tiny and there is barely space to walk in and maneuver your way to the register. I can only imagine how cramped it is when there is a line! I felt like I was going to knock over everything while wearing my backpack. Directly behind you, as you pay at the register, there is the wire shelf of hot sauces that so many others mention in their reviews. I didn't give it too much attention, I had no plans of drowning the flavors I ordered. The cashier was pleasant. 

After paying, I maneuvered my way to one of the two tables available to wait for my order. I noticed a sign on the table that you're not allowed to eat there if you got your food packaged to go. I was starving and thought it would be silly to enforce that with hardly any other patrons in the shop. My food was ready pretty quickly, it felt like five minutes but I wasn't really keeping track of time. At the moment, I was just a starving pregnant woman wanting her wings asap. I decided not to test the wrath of the supposed Wing Nazi and took my grub for a ride. 

We ordered the Korean fried chicken (an order for each of us), the lime wings, and the chili crunch wings. My aunt got a couple of sides of ranch for the road. Before leaving, I checked my bag and noticed no napkins were packed. We maneuvered our way back to the register to pick up some napkins because we were eating wings, duh! Overall, the in-store experience was fine but I can't say it would be the same if there were more than six other customers there. 

For my two orders of wings with no condiments, I paid about $15 & change.

Onto the wings! 

When I read the description of the lime wings, I was imagining a Pok Pok style chicken wing of super stickiness. These are not that but are still delicious. I love the tangy combination of the lime and fish sauce. It is definitely a saucy wing with less crunch but I think it is so yummy. 

The Korean fried chicken flavor was sooo good! It had the crunchy texture and so much flavor. I got full on my lime wings that I ended up saving my KFC wings for later. I focused on finishing my lime wings because I didn't think they'd be as good as leftovers. Well, the KFC wings still had a crunchy texture a few hours later.  

I sampled the chili crunch wings from my aunt. They had the same great texture as the KFC but they were covered in clumps of red chili flakes. The flakes alone tasted great! 

I mentioned my aunt got ranch dressing on the side. You really don't need it but I tried it with my KFC and chili crunch wings and it really makes it taste even bettttttter!!

Would I come back? OH YES! Would I come back during peak hours? Likely never. Dealing with crowds deters me, BIG time. I'll miss you HS&P, until next time I'm in SF.
author: Krisell C.

description:
MMMMMMM. BYOHS (bring your own hand sanitizer). 

Location: Small storefront with only two standing tables available. Order for here if you want to eat at the tables. If you order to go.. not sure where you'd be able to eat since there isn't really seating outside or public benches. Street parking can be difficult, so park a few blocks away! (We parked on Washington between Post - Van Ness and walked 7 minutes)

Service: Food comes out quickly and all the workers are friendly.

Food: 
-Green (4/5): Delicious, crispy wings topped with a cilantro/jalapeno/ginger mix. I think this would taste amazing with a few squirts of lime on top (perhaps I'll bring my own next time?!)
-Chris's (5/5): Subtley sweet with a huge crunch. One of my favorites. 
-Chili crunch (6/5): MY FAVE. Crunchy and smothered in chili flakes.. this was amazing. Slightly sweet. 
-Beer (3/5): My least favorite of the bunch. I don't really like my wings super smothered - and this is super smothered. The sauce is interesting but I wasn't a huge fan of the taste.
author: Shelley K.

description: I think this place has DELICIOUS drumsticks/wings. However, the pieces are way too small. If you do go, get the Chris's no matter what. I should have gotten 3 orders, but man, $6.89 for only 6 pieces.
author: Janan D.

description: This is the best place for wings, chicken sandwiches, and hot sauces in SF. There are so many different wing flavors and hot sauces, that you will definitely be able to find your favorites. The service is also fantastic, so the turnaround between order and eating is quick.
author: Disaster P.

description:
Chris's honey salty pepper wings is the most delicious flavor of wings that I have ever tasted. The sauce had an unexplainable kick to it, the skin was perfectly crispy, and there was plenty of meat on the wings. The green wings were a bit subtle and the Thai was a little too sauces but the chris...It's was just crispy, tangy perfection!

The only reason why I I dropped it to a 4 star is because the ultra Goliath was totally underwhelming. They used the same waffle maker as the ones we have back at school and there was barely any sauce. While there was plenty of chicken, the waffle was dry and the salad was sparse.

I'd come back just to try the Chris again!
author: David H.

description: Quick stop wings to go. Chicken on the sandwich was good, and the bread was OK - nothing special. The wings are why you go, and there's lots of options. The Pad Thai & Salt, Pepper Szechwan were our favorites. The tempura potato wedges were delicious while crispy on the outside & soft in the middle.
author: Alison G.

description:
One rainy afternoon, my friend and I wanted some chicken wings - we were making dinner, but we had both not really eaten all day. Since we were going to get groceries in the Inner Richmond and then head towards the Outer Sunset, it was perfect. 

No real parking on a Sunday afternoon, but that's okay. I went in and grabbed those chicken wings and he drove around until I was done.  We got 2 different types since there are ONLY small plates now instead of large ones. 

We got the Chris's honey salted pepper wings (MY FAVE) and the KFC. The Korean Fried Chicken wings were a bit too spicy for me to enjoy that much. They were spicy, with no real flavor to me. The other wings were my favorite. Sweet, salty and a little bit of spicy - just how I like my wings (and myself ;)). 

The area is small so don't expect to get any seating (if you do, you're lucky!). Super easy to order and take them to go.  

Protip: parking is difficult in at times. Definitely order the honey salted pepper wings. BEST.
author: Nina Y.

description:
Flavorful. Crispy skin. Juicy meat. What more can you ask for? 
I tried the Parmesan Panko, Chris' and Thai chicken wings with an extra waffle. I could not believe how crispy the crust was on the Parmesan Panko. It was crispy all around! Unlike some wings that get soggy on the side it was sitting on. Also, it paired perfectly with the ranch-Sriracha sauce. PP was my personal favorite and every time I go back I will order again. Chris' had a honey-salty flavor and it was my family's favorite flavor. I liked the Thai when I first bit into it but by my third wing, I was getting sick of the flavor and ended up not finishing that batch. 

I ordered everything to go and was surprised that they were still crispy by the time I got home! Wow!
author: Jennie Y.

description: I loved the Garlic Wings but they could have been served at a hotter temperature, I'm not sure they were freshly cooked. The hot sauce collection was just Ok. They had a lot of sauces /brands that you can find at other places. I was hoping for different.
author: Dario M.

description:
Stopped by here late afternoon hoping to get some amazing fried chicken wings. The shop was super tiny with only 2 tables and a couple standing table outside. When you walk in, you're greeted by an array of hot sauces. 

I ordered a couple spicy ones and they were pretty tasty. I docked one star because for it being too sweet and not really that spicy.

Overall, great place to grab a quick bite. Definitely recommend!
author: Arda S.

description: Best wing spot in town. Sad they moved to Hyde Street, used to be my jams in the Inner Richmond. Get the wings with Old Bay on them. Or any of them. The waffle sandwich Goliath thing is to die for as well.
author: Jonathan B.

description:
Hands down the best chicken wings I've had! Service was great! All the ladies were very nice. Sadly it's a very small place but everything else makes up for it. 

My boyfriend and I ordered 5 flavors and two waffles. The waffles are freshly made and taste so great. We ordered Chris's, Old Bay, Bacon and Molasses, Korean, and Thai wings each and every flavor was so good it's hard to pick a favorite. 

I had to tell all my friends about this place!!
author: Ayee M.

description: Ordered wings from them while visiting a friend. They had great sauce and the service was fast. The prices are really good and the quality went beyond expectation. Gave ranch and other sauces with the wings and an abundance of napkins. Would like to go into the actual restaurant next time!
author: Collin P.

description:
I saw my friend post photos from Hot Sauce and Panko, and I thought, "HOT WINGS?! I NEED TO GO THERE." So I did. It was cold and rainy, which was not an entirely pleasant experience because there is minimal seating. Literally like six seats total. My boyfriend and I ordered our hot wings to-go and took them home to eat. This place makes the ordering process quick and easy. Plus you can check out the impressive variety of hot sauces they have for sale on the shelves while you're waiting.

We ordered three types of wings:

* Green (Cilantro Jalapeño Ginger Sesame Oil Spice Mix) - Pretty good, though I was not impressed. Then again my expectations were high for a recommended Top Seller, and I'm not exactly in love with anything cilantro-flavored.
 
* Beer (Buffalo BBQ) - Cool twist on a regular buffalo wing. These were not too spicy or sweet.

* Chris's (Honey Salty Crispy Black Pepper) - These were unexpectedly my favorite wings because I usually like super spicy wings. Perfect combination of sweet and salty flavors. Would recommend.

All the wings are very meaty, which gives you a huge bang for your buck. Again, it's best if you can snag one of the seats inside because hot wings are best HOT, but otherwise take them home, break open some beers, and enjoy!
author: Stefanie C.

description:
I freaking love some good wings, and the wings were freaking good. We ordered Green (cilantro, jalepeno ginger sesame oil mix), Korean (house gochujang hot peppers), and Chris's (honey salty crispy black pepper). All three are considered their top sellers, and they were all delicious. I generally don't like too much pepper in my food, but I think Chris's was my favorite out of the three. Honestly, it's really hard to pick a favorite.The chicken was perfectly cooked throughout, not dry at all, and the outside was a good amount of crispy.

The place is very tiny. There are two tables-for-two inside and a table outside that can fit four people comfortably. We ended up taking our to-go and eating it in the car. The kitchen is essentially open so you can see what's going on back there. They have shelves stocked with a bunch of sauces that you can purchase. I've never seen so many sauces for wings in my life. The wait was fairly short with a few people in front of us. Finding parking is a tad bit difficult but no surprise there. 

Really sad that I can't find any wings like these in Texas. I can only dream of the day I return to Hot Sauce and Panko for more delicious wings.
author: Kathy N.

description:
The best Korean fried chicken place I managed to find in the city!

It's not a sit-down place (there are small tables where you can stand and eat), so keep that in mind. I'm giving four starts only because it closes so early (and that makes it really difficult to go there during weekdays). The wings are really good though - I got Korean, Chris's and something else that was basically traditional hot wing sauce, and all of them were pretty good. (Gotta say, my favorite was Korean...) Kim-Jong-Eun seems to be a very popular one too - when we went there, KJE wings were already sold out...

Anyway, I'll be definitely going back here frequently for my "fried chicken & beer" nights :)
author: Ella K.

description:
Are they the best wings I've ever had? No, but they're pretty solid. We had like 3 different flavors, and the waffles (yum).

They'd run out of fries, but somewhere in the back they had tots so we went for that.. and those are bomb. I mean, you think you can't mess up fried potato but people do screw it up all time. These tots were fried to perfection.

Annoying to have to wait sooooo long in this lil space but at least you don't have to hoof it to the Richmond for these anymore.
author: Vivian H.

description:
A couple of friends and I had stop by for some delicious chicken and waffles. We order, sit down , wait for our orders and their was one mistake  we got one order of wings hot rather then the "bacon wrapped bourbon molasses" I went on to explain the situation and the cashier decided to start arguing with me. I told perhaps it was a  miscommunication between the cashier and my friend . She took it back to the owner I'm guessing because 30 sec later the owner comes out and starts saying we are not replacing your order, no refunds, & to get out NOW
He is the guy in the peach shirt . If my review was just on the waffles and the "Chris's" flavor chicken wings it would be a solid 5 . But unfortunately this was my worst customer service experience.
author: Jennifer r.

description:
Love that their new location is so close to my house! Definitely worth the walk up and down those hills! Have to work up am appetite so I can get more wings! Definitely not a place to eat with a group but a place order and bring a group of friends to try out all their different flavors. They even have a whole wall dedicated to hot sauce. 
The wait is long but worth it. If you want to catch them before closing you better not try to call in because they won't pick up.  I was there 15 minutes before closing and they just ignored the phone calls cause they had a line and order for days! If you aren't willing to get you butt off your couch to order and wait you don't deserve to get an order of these delicious wings. I know time is money...but if you don't have wings to eat what's the point?
author: Fanny C.

description: Been here twice. Best wings in the bay. They get meat and sauces just right. I only wish they had more spicy options (or a spice meter?) so I could compare how hot their hots are.
author: Timmy K.

description: One of the best wing places I have ever been to. The store decor is hilariously amazing. Everything I have tried there is delicious.
author: Ryan H.

description:
Here's the breakdown:

Pros:
1) the WINGS O M G. I loved the honey salt and pepper wings the most. It was so flavorful and the inside was not dry at all. I also tried the green (cilantro/jalapeño/ginger) since it's one of their top wings, and it was good but not salty enough. I also tried the Thai chili wings, and it was packed with flavor and spice but too saucy for me. 
2) unique flavors and variety!

Cons:
1) the Goliath (crispy chicken wrapped in a waffle with coleslaw and Sriracha sushi sauce)--so dry and not at all flavorful. The waffle reminded me of cheap college waffles you get to make during breakfast. Not good. 
2) there's only two tiny tables in the area and you have to stand as you eat!

Overall, a great place to try! I'll warn you though that you'll probably have to eat in your car or on the sidewalk haha.
author: Ranice L.

description:
This is now my spot for chicken wings. This TINY joint run by little Chinese ladies has got this chicken thing down. The place has 4 seats inside and some standing room outside, so you might want to get it to-go, but I think the crampedness is all part of the experience. I'm all about hole in the walls (it's clean, just small).

My favorite wings from here are the parmesan panko, and Chris's. The Chris's is a bit variable on the spices but nevertheless fried to perfection and covered in sticky sweet and peppery goodness. The parmesan panko is breaded with... parmesan and panko. This gives a nice crisp and texture to the whole thing while packed with flavor. They also serve it with a sriracha mayo that goes gloriously with the panko. The drumsticks are somehow nice and fatty so none of the pieces you get are ever dry (not that they overcook it either).
So come check this place out, though the wings with bacon are sub par, that's probably more of a big neon sign for bacon lovers to come (not indicative of the quality), but this place is more than that. Also, the waffles are mediocre so stick to the chicken.
author: Bryant C.

description:
Great little whole in the wall place that does fried chicken of all sorts well. You can't go wrong with most of the flavors, they all have a unique and different sauce/taste. For about $6.49 per order of 8 you get either wings/drumsticks. The size varies but are decently sized with a few that are plumper than others. The one thing I like about here is that whichever wings you order they all have a different taste/sauce. As opposed to other wing places that have wings that look like they were dredged in the same sauce and you can't tell if they are different flavors. 

I got to try the Chris wings which reminded me of a honey glaze that was nicely battered. It had just the right amount of sauce on them and wasn't too messy.

The Lime wings were based of a lime fish sauce lime garlic roasted chiles. These were my favorite and I don't usually like fish sauce but I could not detect any fish sauce which was a bonus. These were also the messiest and resulted in a nice finger licking sauce due to the garlic roasted chiles.

Lastly, the garlic bacon parmesan wings which were just ok to me. I couldn't really taste the bacon but it still had a great crunch to them. After picking up a few of the pieces I saw the leftover oil drippings which was unpleasant. 

Overall, this is a great place if you love chicken wings sauced in different ways! There isn't much seating inside with just 2 small tables that fit 2 people and two larger tables situated right outide for people that want to stand and chow down. They have a nice assortment of hot sauces on the wall that you can look at while waiting for your order. Even with a line, it goes fairly quickly.  Street parking is tough but it's worth driving around the blocks a few times or more.
author: James H.

description: Okay let me start off by saying I am a wing connoisseur... this place goes above and beyond any expectations ...... they have over twenty different selections of wings and half are served with a Belgium waffle which I double as a biscuit the depth of flavor is unmatched and unrivaled I am not going to say any specific wing because the menu has a flavor for everyone ..... it's a little hard to find and they aren't open all the time but when they are you need to try this place!!!
author: Leland N.

description:
Step down San Tung, it's Panko and Hot Sauce's turn to step into the spotlight. This place really understands how to make a good fried chicken wing. Thus far, I've tried their KFC (5/5), the Chris's (4/5), the garlic parm (4/5), and the green sauce wings (4/5). My personal favorites are the KFC and the green sauce wings. The KFC is the perfect balance of sweet, savory, and tangy. The green sauce wings make the fried chicken wings almost seem healthy because they are so fresh and light tasting. Their wings are all fried to perfection though and you really can't go wrong, even with just their original wings. Do note that this place is very small and there is no real seating. Try to grab a couple bites of the wings when they are fresh and super crispy. Their waffles are just ok in my opinion, but it's hard to pass up the classic fried chicken and waffle combo. I'll definitely be back here to try the rest of their abundant flavors of wings.

Pros: 
- amazing fried chicken wings
- lots of flavors to chose from and all are pretty good
- if you're into hot sauce/sauces in general, they have so many here that you'll have a hard time just choosing one

Cons: 
- no real seating 
- ridiculously hard find parking in this area
author: Diana C.

description:
After eating some amazing Korean wings in NYC, I'm always on the lookout for some bonchon style wings every time I visit a new city. After doin some Yelp recon before the trip, Hot Sauce and Panko was definitely one of the places we were most looking forward to. Unfortunately of all the restaurants we wanted to check out while in SF, this was the most out of the way. It was a hell of a trek to get out here, basically the middle of a residential neighborhood with nothing else really around it. It was definitely the most expensive Uber ride of the trip, but I thought it was worth it. 

The place itself was pretty tiny. There was maybe one table inside and then a few countertops outside in front of the store. You order and then they give you a toy wooden block as your order ticket. Our wings came out in batches as they were done cooking, so they were always fresh out of the fryer. Each order pretty much came with at least 6 wings. 

Since it was already our 3rd lunch of the day (good ol vacation diet), we unfortunately only had enough appetite to try 3 flavors. We ordered Chris's wings, Korean, and Old Bay. Maybe it was just our imagination but I swear for each sauce they had a different cut of chicken wing that best highlighted each flavor. We might've read too much into it but it seemed like each wing was customized to have a different size, texture, and overall flavor profile.
