Came here today and boy was I excited to try the wings! I was amazed at how they were able to operate with such a small space. But they manage to do it and the wings were awesome! 

We ordered the "Ramen" wings, the "Korean" wings and a side of potato wedges. I really liked the "Ramen" wings because of the decent crunch! I also liked how it comes with a wedge of lime which beefs up the flavor of the wings. The "Korean" wings were really satisfying as well. I'm excited to go back to try the other popular flavored! The wedges were a nice addition but I'll probably get the waffles next time. 

The place is really small so be ready to order your wings to go. We ate our order in the car because the two 2-seat tables were taken up. There are also standing tables in front of the place but it was way too cold to be standing outside.
author: Sara W.

description:
Something about this American unpretentious atmosphere always charms me to the core. It's what makes America great. You have the fusion of hot wings and soul food waffles, added with a bunch of Americana decorations including a bunch of Seinfeld memorabilia, and finished off with an entire wall of quirky hot sauces for sale. There isn't much room to eat. I believe there's two standing tables. Perhaps about eight people can eat here at any given time. Most orders are for takeout.

I went with the Korean hot wings and waffle. They asked if I'd like butter with my waffle. I obliged and received a huge spat of butter (that I loved but quickly regretted). My wings and waffle are hot as heck fresh and tasty. Although I've had better wings and waffles, you can't beat the immediate self-indulgence of the fresh wings and waffles.

While eating you should definitely observe the mostly silent family operation at work. Each person is diligently working their station all in effort to churn out as much food as efficiently as possible. Business is rockin'.
author: Michael H.

description:
Wing heaven! Though the place itself is quite small (two tiny tables and a tall standing table for 2 indoors and 2 small tables outside) it makes up for it in flavor! The first thing you notice when you enter will have to be the hot sauce wall. They probably have every hot sauce in the U.S. on that wall, and I could probably spend hours going through them all. It was pretty fun to read all the random wacky names people came up with for their hot sauces!

As for the food, my friend and I split two orders - 1 order of the green wings (cilantro, jalapeno, ginger, sesame oil, house spice, etc.) and 1 order of the KFC/goju wings which was more like korean fried chicken topped with sesame seeds. Both orders were equally delicious in their own ways, but I think I favored the green wings a bit more since it packed a spicy punch! The goju/KFC wing was also great though, just on the sweeter end. Two small orders (~8wings/order) was more than enough for us, but they also have larger sizes (~12 wings/order) for $3 more. 

And I definitely appreciated the wet wipes and hand sanitizer on the side table!
author: Kim D.

description:
I stumbled across this restaurant when I was searching for a place that sells yummy Korean chicken wings. After reading the reviews, we decided to give this place a try. I think if I wasn't looking for this restaurant specifically, I would have walked pass it. The restaurant is pretty small. When I walked in, the first thing I noticed was their wall of hot sauce. So many different bottles, so many different brands. They also had interesting decor for their walls. 

After debating over what we wanted to try, we ended up ordering an order of the green wings, which is basically fried chicken wings with a cilantro, jalapeno, ginger and sesame oil mixture. It was very delicious. The chicken was crispy and the sauce was very flavorful, both refreshing and slightly spicy.

There is a little bit of a wait because they make the chicken after you order it. But it's so worth the wait, and so worth your money, because the chicken wings you get are that good. I definitely recommend the green wings. And I will return to try their other flavors. Maybe one day I will be brave enough to try their ghost pepper chicken wings. =)
author: Andrea G.

description: this place is good. so many different flavors!  i got - old bay, chili crunch and korean fried chicken.  they were all good - but chili crunch definitely stood out as my favorite.  i'd come back to try more flavors for sure.  only complaint is that the wings aren't as crunch as i'd like them to be (not breaded)!  place gets busy and PACKED (small space too)
author: Christina L.

description: Really great wings & quick friendly service. So many good flavors! Can't wait to come back
author: Ashley W.

description: Yummy wings, not a lot of standing room. If you're a hot sauce person, or a hot wing person, you should add this to you list. Don't forget to order water or some sort of drink!
author: Jenny K.

description:
This the best chicken wing I've ever tried.  I've tried Korean, Chinese or American chicken wing but this is far more supreme than all over the above.  It's cooked well but still crunch; not too sweet or salty but so tasty from perfect seasoning.   
Not only that but also I love Terrence'a high service spirit.   Terrence's caring for customers makes him create the great food for all.
Because of the perfect taste it can be so addictive.
Two thumbs up!!
author: Piano B.

description:
A lot of the names on the dozens of hot sauce bottles on the shelves here relate to bodily functions of which I have way too much familiarity, but they do provide endless amusement as you chomp on your wings. It's an odd duck of a store that still looks like the Chinese herb-and-massage parlor business it once housed. As a matter of fact, the first time I passed by here I was wondering why so many hipsters were hanging out at an Asian grocery store. It wasn't until I read about it later that this was a place to eat chicken wings.

When a friend of mine suggested meeting here last weekend for a catch-up, I said to myself why not. It's on a quiet, mostly residential stretch of Clement Street, and we met up right when it opened at noon. That gave us some time to study all the host sauce bottles and finally the menu of wings available. Since we were both neophytes, we decided to split two eight-wing baskets for $5.89 each, a pretty good deal if you ask me. The first was their signature KFC (Korean Fried Chicken) which was liberally coated with a red chili paste mixed with ginger and sprinkled with sesame seeds (see photo).

Although quite sloppy, it was quite succulent with the chicken skin quite thick and the meat surprisingly tender. I was wiping my fingers a lot since I was trying to alternate them with the Green W(a)ngs which were not coated but seasoned with cilantro, jalapeno, ginger, sesame oil, and their special spice mix (see photo). I definitely had a preference for the green this time since it wasn't quite as overwhelming, but I would kick either one out of bed. There were about a half-dozen sauces on the condiments stand, so we doused a few pools for dipping. I honestly preferred the wings naked as they were flavorful enough for me.

One funny thing happened when the owner inadvertently thought we were using the sauces off the shelves. He snapped at us and was immediately corrected by the girl waiting on us. He immediately rectified the situation by serving us both cups of free vanilla soft-serve ice cream (see photo). It was refreshing, but it came in the middle of our wings fest, so now we were alternating two different wings and ice cream before it melted. By the way, I don't know where the panko part comes in since I didn't see any panko-fried wings on the menu, but the reference does make for a catchy name.

FOOD - 4 stars...better than Wing Wings with a certain freshness to the chicken
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...funky with a sense of humor, crowds quickly with very limited seating
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...despite the false accusation, a nice crew
TOTAL - 4 stars...living on a wing and a prayer
author: Ed U.

description: Have had almost every flavor on the menu. Highly recommend. They do quick work and worth the wait if there is any. Local gem
author: Alex P.

description: Such a stellar place to get some comfort food fast! Although they have a ton of delicious flavors for their wings, I personally just like them without the sauce whenever I get the wing & waffle combo. The fries are amazing as well. Everything is the right amount of crispy. So so good.
author: Liz H.

description:
I have to say, I love the food from this place. BUT i'm going to revoke my 5 star rating because this is the most unprofessional business ever!

I've been an advocate for their business and i'm tired of seeing this guy talk crap about his customers and yelp reviewers on facebook. Facebook business pages aren't for venting, they're for promoting your brand. You are bad for business. 

I've sent you private messages, I've commented on your posts. And what was your solution? Remove my right to comment, rather than grow the hell up and stop using facebook as your place to air your own grievances with customers. WHAT OTHER SUCCESSFUL COMPANY DOES THIS?

You are ridiculous. I am going to do everything I can to convince people never ever to eat at your establishment.

I hope you close because you're a negative, ungrateful human being. 

Happy holidays!
author: Rikki T.

description:
I never thought a day would come that I would find chicken wings that even came close to San Tungs, but Hot Sauce and Panko is definitely giving them some competition!

I've ordered Chris's ( my favorite so far) , Korean, Sticky & the Garlic Bacon Parmesan..all of which I would order again. If youre unsure of what to order you can't go wrong with their topsellers, but I don't doubt that everything else is just as good. 

I live a few blocks away from the Richmond location, but they've recently moved and I will definitely be making a trek out to their new location to get my hands on these again because they are just that good!
author: Nicole L.

description:
My friends and I came here as our final food destination before we left SF. The restaurant is just a small little place with two tables inside, two tables outside, and it was pretty crowded. We just decided to eat standing up. They have a wall with shelves filled with bottles of hot sauce if you want to buy some.

My friends got the KFC (Korean Fried Chicken) wings and the Sriracha Caramel wings and they said that they were both really good, but the Sriracha Caramel may have been a little bit better.

I got the Chicken Waffle, which was fried boneless chicken, cabbage, mayo, and sriracha caramel, inside of a waffle, and folded up. If you're from SoCal, it's like Bruxie. In my opinion, the waffle was a little soft / soggy; I wish it was a bit crispier, but other than that, the waffle sandwich was pretty good. The mayo they put on top is not typical American mayo, it's the Japanese one, and with the sriracha caramel, it's a great combination.

I'm a fan and the next time I'm back I want to try their wings !
author: Alesia C.

description:
Chicken wings....can they ever go wrong?

I didnt get to try the chicken and waffles...so boo?

I got the red rooster? and lemon pepper? its been a while since i had it and i procrastinated on the review =P

Both wings were crispy but yet still juicy....which is quite hard to do.  The skin holds a lot of flavors and if you are health conscious...dont bother eating here...well if you're eating here....just enjoy life!!

I like the spicier wings, I like the kick...and it is spicy...i was too chicken (pun) to try the ghost pepper but i really wanna see how spicy it is!

The places offers various hot sauces but my favorite is the ghost pepper one...it got me tearing but its good
author: Laurie W.

description: I dont get the hype here, the wings are alright at best. The coating becomes soggy after the aggressive saucing. But gotta give it to the style in the store! Love the  no fawks given signs
author: Ryan H.

description: Tried to get them to substitute Chase's Sauce for the Sriracha-Caramel and they refused.  Their customer service and general attitude to their customers is atrocious and among the worse in the city.
author: Matthew S.

description:
Probably the most delicious chicken wings I have ever eaten in my life!

The seasoning is tasty but what's more impressive is the way they cook their wings. Every single wing is cooked equally. They are crispy on the outside and very juicy inside. My favourites are Chris's and Korean.

The line is pretty long but moves quickly. We visited at 11.30 (their opening time) and the line was already forming.
author: Peerawit K.

description:
Heaven sent for chicken wing lovers all over! If spice is your game, then come on over! Siracha is the main player with waffles as the wingman. 

Rooster Red and Sticky Garlic are the wings we ordered. Waffle sandwiches were pretty good too. They're big enough to share between two people. 

Be prepared to wait in line. This place is tiny with three small tables. You'll be elbow to elbow with people sitting down. You might be better off to order your chicken ahead of time and eat somewhere else. Very inexpensive, so order to your heart's content!
author: Sharon B.

description:
Wings were perfectly sized, perfectly fried and the ghost pepper sauce was wonderful. I like how the wings were proudly displayed to me before closing the to-go box. It really was a work of art. It took me an hour to eat the first 3 wings with no water, and then I had to box it up for later. Even a couple hours later, the wings still tasted great, and I found that a swig of coconut water before each one helped me down the other 3 much more quickly and without compromising the gestalt.

It was the overwhelming perfection of these that led me to 5 stars. But the total experience was not. The fries were just a distraction and not worth $2.75. I'd skip them next time. The place itself is small and kinda uncomfortable, but therein lies part of the charm. Being able to watch the open kitchen was great tho, and service was helpful. The amazing number of variations available on the menu definitely means future visits...
author: Henry Y.

description:
I have to say these are some of the best wings I tried.

The flavours are original. The chicken is cooked to perfection with super crispy skin, but the insider is still juicy. Would definitely recommend the Panko wings. One of my favourite.

Great food but the place is super small and not suitable for a big groups. Unless you don't mind standing outside and eating on the streets.
author: Jason M.

description: I stumbled across this place while dropping off a Lyft passenger. Quick Service and delicious food are the two components to win me over as a customer for life. I still can't get over how fresh and delicious my mango habanero Wings were. Piping hot , sweet, spicy, and all-around delicious. I mixed the maple syrup with a hint of Marion Berry syrup on my Waffle and had a flavor Bonanza in my mouth. I truly recommend this place to anyone and everyone that I know. And it's a great place 4 a date or brunch.
author: David D.

description:
I almost feel like a bad San Franciscan for giving HS&P 3 stars, but I gotta keeps it real, even if keepin' it real sometimes goes wrong.

Yes, there was a line, so they must be doing something right, but the wings and hot sauces we tried were mediocre at best. My pal raved about the Green wings, which are fried nude and tossed with a cilantro, jalepeno, and ginger mix. They were aright, could have been fried longer, and been spicier and saltier. 

The other flavor was new, Habenero, and no one was super down with those. They also lacked flavor. I found myself leaning on the Chomp & Swig-provided Sriracha to liven them up a bit. Another friend bought an array of hot sauces 

I will say that other wing options sound really delicious, like the Koren Fried and the Double Spicy Buffalo, the waffle sando looks great, and I can never say no to Ghost Pepper. I also will say that I plan on going back and ordering wings that I personally choose for myself, knowing that my preferences include scorchingly hot sauces and crispy chicken skin, and then updating my review.
author: Crystal C.

description:
Inner Richmond is a pretty testing distance to go for food. There was previously only restaurant that could get me to weather the trip out there, and that was San Tung. Hot Sauce and Panko has made that coveted list as one of those restaurants that are worthy of making the trek out to the other side of SF. Except soon, eastside San Franciscans rejoice, you won't have to! They're moving their beloved wings and waffles to Hyde and Washington very shortly.

Step in and there's two tiny tables alongside an comprehensive wall of all the hot sauces you can probably get in America. Feel like getting your colon cleaned? There's a hot sauce for that. Ever wondered what tequila hot sauce would do to your stomach and your liver? Now you can find out!

The menu selection is pretty straightforward; an assortment of piping hot wings smothered in various flavors, and waffle sandwiches. A supremely hangry friend of mine ordered the Ultra Goliath Waffle Sandwich and after witnessing first-hand how their chicken did a 180 on his mood (okay, and because I stole a few bites), I decided to get an order of Chili Crunch wings despite not being hungry. Couldn't finish them but I think if I was at fully-fledged hanger levels I could have eaten 10-15 of them, they were that good.

On top of everything, the owner is such a nice and personable guy. The only thing better than a delicious fried chicken joint is a delicious fried chicken joint with great character.

CAN'T WAIT TO SEE YOU GUYS IN NOB HILL!!!
author: Chrystal Z.

description:
I've been wanting to try the wings here for months, after hearing about it from friends and seeing it in articles about must-try chicken wings in the nation. For my first-ever visit, I tried the bulgogi and the red rooster wings, and I was satisfied with both. The bulgogi wings are crispy on the outside, glazed with a sweet sauce. The red rooster wings are coated with Sriracha sauce and come with a slice of lime and some creamy sauce that has a kick of spice to it. I'm glad we ordered a combination of sweet wings and spicy wings, and I'd recommend both of these. Can't wait to come back and try the rest of the unique flavors!

Tip: call and order ahead so that you don't have to wait 15-20 minutes outside. The shop is small, and there are only 2 small tables squished in the front of the store, so I'd recommend ordering to-go.
author: Celia K.

description:
Bad ass wings and bad ass attitudes. It makes me ask myself "what the heck?"

I order garlic Parmesan and siracha caramel. They are both great but garlic parmesan tastes more like bacon because it's smothered in lots of bacon bits. 

You can also order wings here and enjoy your wings next door with a drink. But make sure you to pick up after yourself. Hahaha!
author: W C.

description:
a little storefront decorated plentifully with sassy signs barking orders at you to NOT order to-go and eat in store (which i don't know how you would anyway, theres literally 3 seats smushed up against the counter). there is no public restroom. 
we ordered the green, the korean, and something else (i canNOT remember but it was so good); all three were from the top of the menu in the best sellers section. wait is really short because i think some of the chicken wings are already fried and they just toss in the sauce. regardless, the flavors are all there and the prices are decent for the cool combos they have. they even have chicken and waffles. 
i'm happy i tried this place; but parking was difficult and you would more than likely have to take the food home.
author: Jessica W.

description:
Good wings. I tried their honey black pepper wings (can't eat spicy) and it was delish. Though, I was surprised by the dark appearance of the wings when they came out but like I really enjoyed eating it. The flavors were there. I reckon people who can take heat would love the other flavors they have here! Water in mini mason jars :)

Next time will try their sandwich.
author: Sara T.

description: These "custom" wings were exactly what we needed on a cold, breezy afternoon in San Francisco on MDW 2016. The flavors apparently change weekly, so I'll definitely be re-visiting the next time I'm in SF! The place is very small (as are most in downtown SF), but there are benches outside for your wing-gorging pleasure. Pair this with an ice cold Coca-Cola, and MMMMMMMM... I don't need to say any more.
author: Ajay H.

description:
Had this place on my "must try" radar for some time now, and finally came here for a quick lunch with the GF the other week.

BOMB ASS CHICKEN & WAFFLES is all I have to say! I haven't had the pleasure to try out Roscoes yet, but I think it's hard to beat HSP and these wings are hands down WAY BETTER than chains like BBW or Hooters or Wing Stop, etc...
author: Marco M.

description: I have been there 3 times and I'm very happy with this place. I've tried three different kinds of their wings and  fries and  Panko they're closed on Monday and Tuesday and have short hours but it's worth it I'll go there again and again
author: Jay G.

description:
HANDS DOWN THE BEST CHICKEN WINGS IN SF. 

I usually write more in my reviews, but I honestly don't know what else to say - these guys DEFINITELY know what they are doing. I try not to go like every week but...seriously addictive. 

Check out their menu. I guarantee you will love ANY/ALL of the choices. 

I would feel sorry for anyone who can't eat spicy foods, so consider this a warning. "hot sauce" is part of their name, afterall. 

AMAZING. Richmond District's GEM!
author: Jackie C.

description:
Hot sauce and panko does not need Another rave review, but what the heck. 
I've been dying to check out this little spot in inner Richmond for the longest time, but between travel schedules and everything in between, I did not get a chance until almost a month ago.

I came here with my uber food fanatic friend and we couldn't decide what we wanted since everything on the menu looked amazing. 
So...we ordered 50 wings between the 2 of us. 
That's right, ladies and gentlemen, 50 wings for 2 ppl on a sunny Saturday afternoon.
I mean, that's why I go to pilates 3x a week, right?

The parm panko was our fave for a dry wing. 
Crunchy, addictive coating. 
The green wing was my fave for a slightly wet wing. 
But honestly, you just can't lose when you are here 

Lines are long but the wings are prepared Fresh and are piping hot, so it's definitely a great trade off. Loooove the creativity of these wings!
author: Jocelyn L.

description: I miss this place being so close, but it's worth the trek. Best wings in the city! Our favorites are the Chris's and the green. The waffle sandwiches are also really good.
author: Alex P.

description:
Small little location, parking on the street, 20 minute wait, but I believe it is worth it. I wanted to try the green wings but they were completely sold out -- bummer. Instead we got two other kind of wings and they were good! Although I liked one more than the other. I believe it was the honey glazed salt pepper something. That one is worth trying! 

I like this place because they have different flavor wings that are unheard of. Surprisingly, it works. It taste delicious. I recommend people to go out of their way to try it!
author: Stephy L.

description: Lots of flavors, but I think it's pretty pricey for about 6 small wings. Got the Chris' Wing hot. They were crispy and saucy. So texture and flavor is decent. Shop is pretty small and service is quick. Willing to go back to try other flavors but It's just not a very motivating trip to take.
author: Binh P.

description: Foreal, this place is Dope. Hands-down one of the best chicken and waffle places I've ever eaten in my life. I've never eaten out in the outer Richmond before I started dating my awesome boyfriend. He introduced me to hot sauce and Panko... The owner is a triple OG. I have no idea why crazy ass old women were complaining about not getting the free goddamn waffles? But thanks you ungrateful asshole! Now they're moving to some bullshit ass location like Hayes Valley or something. Gonna miss this place. Here's what my average order sounds like... Old bay, Kfc, sticky pepper garlic, mango habanero and I usually get the fish and chips. Can't forget about the waffle and butter. Yum :) wish they would consider moving to the mission somewhere. Anyways, this place is five stars you'll love it.
author: Sasha M.

description:
Huge fan.

They rotate their menu of unique wings and most flavors you can't find anywhere else in the, dare I say it, entire world.

They have all the regulars, but some of their most interesting (and trust me, it's 5 stars) are:

ramen wings (wow that texture of ramen batter on the outside is amazing)
nori (tasted like my Japan ramen in Tokyo)
bacon garlic parmesan (just yum, all 3 of the best in one)
spicy honey (wow)

I can go on forever, but everything is amazing. Order to share with a ton of friends and you won't regret.

They also have hundreds of unique hot sauces for sale, pick 2 or 3 up to test with your wing party.
author: Chuck N.

description:
That moment when the near wing spot in the city moves 5 blocks away from you 

One of my coworkers invited me to grab HS&P the other day, and I declined due to the anticipated trek.  I used to drive way out to the Richmond on Clement to get these wings every now and then, but that particular time didn't work.  Fast forward two days and an Internet search, the wing-gods messed around and moved to Hyde & Jackson  Great diversity of flavors, waffles and fries there to complement whichever side you pick.  Why are you still reading? Go get some wings
author: Christian S.

description:
Not quite a four but I'll give it to them.

Pretty crispy chicken wings.
Had the green, old bay, and Chris's 
The green (jalapeno cilantro ginger sesame oil) was underseasoned.
The Old Bay (with sriracha caramel) wasn't bad.  I didn't think it really tasted like sriracha though.
The Chris's (Honey salty crispy pepper)  was probably the best one.  It was sweet and salty, if you like that kind of combo.  
There are maybe two 2-tops inside and two cocktail table things set up outside.
Each small serving comes with 7 wings.

I realized I missed the ghost pepper wings. Next time!
author: Heejin L.

description:
I'm in love!

We read the reviews and had to try the wings.
I had the cilantro lime and my daughter hot wings with waffles and I have to say the reviews are right. they are great. We had ours to go and got there 5 minutes before they close, so we didn't had to wait in line. But the place is tiny with only 1 table so I can imagine it gets very crowded.

Definitely recommend.
author: Arlen S.

description:
Best. Wings. Ever.

Also, funniest and most entertaining decor ever (memes everywhere).

We ordered the Korean, Chase's, Red Rooster, Hot Garlic Parmesan, and a side of tempura fries (pls order this). All were absolutely amazing, but Korean is definitely the winner out of the bunch we ordered.

This place is wing and hot sauce heaven.

Affordable, fast, delicious, big portions, memes -- need I say more?
author: Kimberly P.

description: By far one of the best wing restaurants I've ever been. Add the fresh homemade waffles and make an Asian fusion chicken and waffle sandwich, you've got a different level.
author: Steve S.

description:
Growing up just down the block from this place, I knew I had to seize the moment and check out panko when I visited home. However, in the last 2 years, every time I can home, they were freaking closed! What the hell! Closed for winter break, closed for summer break, closed on all holidays... aaaaarg. This probably happened to me 4 or 5 times. Is it a sign that I'm never meant to get a taste of those panko wings?! Never! I refused to accept defeat!

So when I found out I was coming home yet again and that they would be shutting their doors soon, I looked up their schedule. A 1 day window before they close for winter break?! Yes! I just had lunch with friends but I headed straight to panko after. Just 2 1/2 hours before they closed, I stepped in and ordered myself the Korean fried chicken and the chris' flavored wings. Each order comes with 6 wings. You can't do half flavors so I happily went with 2 orders. I took one step out the store and didn't even wait. As I walked back home in the rain, I gobbled down each flavor. Holy crap... it's like crack! The Chris had a sweet home glaze while the Korean had a nice spicy kick. I wouldn't say I have a huge spice tolerance... I have been building it up though. However, it was the perfect amount of spice. And they were so fresh and crispy! I managed to restrain myself from eating them all before getting home. 

Tomorrow is another day and panko is closed until the new year. I can now say I will never live in regret, knowing that I was able to get a little taste of panko's wings. I hope to be back when they are open again, even if it takes another 2 years... I'll be back.
author: Jessica Y.

description:
Great spot in the neighborhood. Stopped by the other day to grab some wings. Here's what we got: 

- Panko parmesan wings: These were great, nice and crunchy with parmesan on top. But the BEST part was the sri-rancho dipping sauce that came with these wings. After the wings were done I wanted to put the sri-rancho dipping sauce on everything, it's just that good. 
- Honey pepper wings: If you want a sweet wing with an afterbite of black pepper, these are for you. They are also fresh and crispy but definitely sweet!

Will definitely come back and get more flavors. Sri-rancho dipping sauce on everything.
author: Alison G.

description: Wings a go go!! Tiny spot-2 small stand up tables to eat at...undoubtedly THE best wings in the western US! My hubby got the ghost pepper wings, when they handed him his to go order, they told him "be careful"...never heard that before!! Lol Try this slice of wing paradise, you won't be disappointed!!
author: Lisa F.

description: Well well well, at first glance I was excited. This place has got character, it's quite entertaining with witty little pictures and statements all on the walls which makes it exciting to enter.  The place is mainly to go with two tables to stand at, and eat again, I repeat stand at. It seems a bit overwhelming at first with all the wing flavors, but we wound up choosing the Sriracha Caramel wings and the Thai flavor. Six wings a portion so about a dollar a piece. Can't say I was blown away, or would be running back for these specific wings it was more Siracha and then crispy caramel. The unique sauces they toss them in which I was eager for, are not necessarily bursting with flavor. Could of captured the same flavor profile as any normal wing house selection.  However, if craving wings, and in the area and on the go this is will meet your needs.
author: Brittany C.

description: So before I had given Hot Sauce and Panko only 4 stars. I was wrong.  I complain often about how yelp should have a 10 star rating system so that there could be more detail in the reviews. Hot sauce and Panko is an 11. It is absolutely a 5 star. I like to reserve five stars for the best and they ARE THE BEST. The best wings in the city.  I will go back over and over again.
author: Sarah C.

description: Loved the chicken wings here... top quality meat! One star off for the lack of dipping sauce (buffalo wings without ranch?!?), crazy wait, and difficulty parking.
author: Nancy O.

description: Came here with my friends the other day craving food. After reading reviews, I chose to get the more popular wings.. And they didn't disappoint. There wasn't much space to sit and eat, but it won't stop me from coming back! Wings were DELICIOUS. We were basically moaning in delight with every bite we had . I had three orders of wings and are everything that was in front of me. LOVE THIS PLACE.
author: Fiona H.

description:
It's more of a 4.5 stars because of their ramen wings. I felt that their Chris's special was SUPER delicious and I was about to order another one before the boyfriend stopped me. They come in pieces of 6 which is awesome if you have more than 2 people so you can share and try different flavors. We also got the spicy korean wings and those were good as well. The ramen ones were only ok, which is for the minus .5 stars because I had high expectations. The chicken wings were different because they were super fatty and juicy. The health factor is probably a zero due to all the fat on the skin but if it's a once-in-a-while treat, I'd def. come back and indulge! I am happy that San Tung was unexpectedly closed so we could try this place.

Also, there's only two mini tables inside the restaurant so don't bring a big party here or just be prepared to take the wings home so you enjoy all the deliciousness!
author: Vanessa K.

description:
Review based on our first visit - 02.01.2013

Our family of five came in on a Friday afternoon. We downloaded the full menu online and put in a phone order with an ETA of 20 minutes for pick up. 

THE SHOP:
Quaint spot on Clement at the corner of 17th;
Mixed Residential/Commercial area with parking not too hard to come by (at least not at the time of our visit);
A dedicated wall lined with shelves offer a plethora of hot sauces from around the globe, sprinkled with cool toys and kitschy signs / stickers (including their infamous display-only urinal by the front door).

THE SERVICE:
Our order was practically ready upon arrival.
Love the welcoming atmosphere of this family-owned business.
The Mr. ran the back of the house with precision while the Mrs. ran the front of the house with smooth operation.

THE WINGS:
Great-sized, juicy, cripy wings.

We tried the following four sauces:
 1.] KFC (korean fried chicken) - garlic ginger soyu gojujang vinegar sesame oil blue agave coated and triple-fried:
I was craving the crunchy-sticky KyoChon-inspired KFC from SoCal and this version was not what my tastebuds had in mind. Nonetheless, they were delicious - the kick from the gojujang was awesome.

 2.] GREEN - cilantro jalapeno ginger sesame oil house spice mix:
This was my family's least favorite flavor but personally I found the golden outside and juicy bitefuls enjoyable.

 3.] BUFFALO - based loosely on the buffalo wing from Buffalo, NY (choice of: hot/ medium/ mild/ hot sweet) not coated:
It was average, if I was driving all the way to the Richmond for chicken, I'd go for the more exotic flavors, as you can get regular buffalo wing practically anywhere. However my plain Jane child aka picky eater loved the Mild Buffalo.

 4.] BULGOGI - korean marinated bbq sweet soyu sauce + coated and triple-fried:
This sweet savory mix was my FLAVORITE. The sauce was awesome, as was the crispy texture of the triple fried wings.

VERDICT:
3 stars for great service and flavors
a 4th star for the deliciously awesome homemade-to-order waffle. 

We can't wait to return & try the other varieties they offer (and of course to get another waffle).
author: Geminyna J.

description:
Really impressive! Some of the best wings I have ever had.

Garlic Bacon Parmesan  - B for Bacon.  Good, but I should have gotten the Bacon wrapped. 
Korean - A Really really good.  Nailed the flavors
Ramen - A+  Incredible!  Squirt with the lime and its one of the best wings ever
Chris's - A++ I know why it said this was a top seller.  Unique flavor and so well done.  I will be doubling up one these next time!
Double Hot - A I am not a super spicy guy, but my girlfriend LOVED them.  Great spicy flavor and perfect amount of it.  

I cannot wait to try more and to double down on the next order!!  So awesome!  And happy they deliver through Caviar.
author: Jesse K.

description:
I experienced my first visit and really enjoyed it!

LOVE:
The fast service (5 minutes for 3 orders of wings and and fries)
The different flavors (there were so many to chose from)
Chris' honey and pepper wings were my fav's! They were not too sweet with a small bit of heat (my tummy is far too sensitive for the heavy heat)

DOWNSIDE:
The size is very small so it's crowded around the ordering and pick up zone.
There are only two small standing tables on either sides of the entrance.
Wing sizes were on the small side.

I highly recommend this place to go! Great flavors... Fast service... Reasonable prices!!
author: Stephanie S.

description: Panko parm was so good! Second favorite was old bay sriracha. Will definitely come again.
author: Robyn F.

description:
I think it's safe to say I've found my wings holy grail, at least in the Bay Area now.

It's a complete hole-in-the-wall (but their walls are lined with fabulous hot sauces from near and far, for sale), and you're going to want to call in your order unless you want to wait a) awkwardly inside while blocking others or b) outside staring at the lucky few who managed to snag a table.

We ordered a smorgasbord of wings, but my favorites were:
+ SATAY WINGS w/PEANUT SAUCE & LIME.
+ CHILI CRUNCH.
+ LIME w/ CARAMELIZED FISH SAUCE, GARLIC, ROASTED CHILIES.

ULTRA GOLIATH WAFFLE SANDWICH.
God, I wouldn't say it melts in your mouth, but the waffle is such a delicious pillow for the karrage inside, and it's drizzled with a sriracha caramel. Perfect to split, and one of the best things I've had in ages.

Definitely calling ahead and coming back!
author: Claire S.

description:
My bbq and korean fried chicken wings cravings were absolutely fufilled! We stumbled across this hole-in-the-wall while on our way home and it really lives up to the ratings and reviews!
Being located around Clement with other great food stops, makes it part of a great food culture area. Seating is limited, but it's something that doesn't really bother or take away from the quality of the food. 

I love the fact they have a MASSIVE collection of hot sauces, some I've never even seen or heard of before, around the store. It's one of those unique "knick-knack" that gives off a nice and one-of-a-kind vibe to the shop. And I also find it very efficient of them to use heat lamps to keep orders warm, until customers pick them up.

We ordered the Green Wings, KFC [korean fried chicken] and Yaki wings [bulgogi], my favorite by far! 7 wings in a Small and 11 wings in a Large.
They're just crisped to perfection and drizzled with the right amount of sauce. They're not salty at all, and I think are one of the best asian fusion wings in the Bay Area. Super flavorful and seasoned just right! 

The wait may take up to 20 minutes or so, but are definitely worth the wait! 
This is a spot we're sure to keep visiting!
author: Milli M.

description: Amazing wings tucked in the corner of the nob hill. Can't go wrong with the Green or Chris's. Highly suggest to order with the waffle combo too!
author: Justin S.

description: Great lunch spot. Unfortunately, to fill up on just wings it costs $22 per person which can be a little hefty for lunch. Chris's sauce was great as were all the others we tried. Was quoted ten minutes and it took double, which is the only reason for the low mark.
author: Carly H.

description:
Hands down the best wings any where came here on Saturday night and I'm glad i did everything we had was perfect we tried 6 different kinda of wings all very delicious and unique in there on way also had the chicken sandwich to die for .

Hands down best place for wings in SF
author: Randy V.

description:
Wing heaven. So fresh, hot and crispy my fingers are burning and my mouths watering.

I came on a Thursday and it was not busy.  THURSDAYS are free waffle day with a purchase of small wings and a check in with the app Spot On.

Small orders of wings consist of 5-6 pieces and large orders 7-11. The wings are a very good size, not small and shrunken in like wing stop nor humungous like they have been injected with hormones. Wings are cooked just perfectly crispy, juicing at every bite.

The menu selection of wing flavors are so uniquely named and flavored, from green wings and ramen wings to sticky pepper garlic wings. My friend and I ordered the lime wings, sticky pepper garlic and ghost pepper  wings. We were very dissapointed with the sticky pepper garlic because we expected it to be sweet and spicy, instead they were very salty and not spicy at all with just some garlic powder on top that we saw but couldn't taste. I beleive the stickiness was oyster sauce, that's why it was so salty? The lime wings were bomb, it is made with fish sauce and I love those 2 combos. Finally, ghost pepper wings, Cheeses!!!!! They were spicy, but so flavorful! !!! I can't handle more than 2. Usually any type of spicy wings like habanero or ghost pepper items are just overwhelmingly spicy with no flavor, but these were flavorful.  I like this place because everything's crispy and even though the sauce is wet, it is still somewhat dry but still has enough sauce to it. I personally do not like wet sauce wings. To go with the wings I bought their ginger ale bottled drink, I had pomegranate and my friend had green tea. It was all natural and very delicious with bits of fruit pieces and ginger floating at the bottom. Definitly helped with the ghost pepper wings.  

The place is small, not good for big groups or families. Definitly not to dine in at least. There are 4 seats inside and 2 tables about side to stand at. Take it to go or stand around and eat it. Prices are reasonable, around 6 bucks you can get a small order of wings! And a couple bucks more for double the order! Will be going back to try more flavors on another weekday for no line!
author: Jessica W.

description:
These are the best wings that you can find in North America (or maybe the world).
They have a great variety of hot sauces too.

There's a lady I met from India.  (This is not a Limerick so remove any expectation of rhyme or rhythm for what's next.) She lives in the East Bay and when I told her where I Iive in SF  she asked if me if I had tried the place that sells chicken wings and hot sauce on Clement Street..  Yes, of course I had been there. 

She is a graduate of Cal Berkeley who majored in Chemistry. She said she tried one of the hot sauces that was so strong (in a good way) that it nearly knocked her off her feet.   I asked her if the sauce might have been derived from the Indian ghost pepper, which packs a punch from its extra high concentration of capsaicin. She said (insert Indian accent here): "No I surely would have been prepared for that.  This was something else altogether."    

"So what was the name of this sauce?  Did it have a label?"  I asked her.  

"It was Da Bomb," she replied.     On a recent visit to this wonderful place I found "Da Bomb" on the shelf and read the fine print on the label.  It is actually derived from Indian Ghost peppers. (Nobody reads anymore apparently, except you--the kind readers of this review.)

If you like chicken wings, you can't go wrong here--no matter how hot you need them to be.

If you like them not so hot--you will not be disappointed either.  

They are simply the best at what they do.
author: Philip R.

description:
Better than San Tung.

Whoa, I said it.

The chicken wings here are no joke, much meatier and juicier than those at San Tung, and also (triple) deep fried. Between the Korean Fried Chicken wings and the Bulgogi Fried Chicken, I would recommend bulgogi because of overall flavor. 

I also tried the waffle, cheap, plain but delicious (and comes with butter or whipped cream, and an assortment of complimentary sauces).

Tip: Skip on the fried chicken sandwich, it's very lightly battered, kind of dry, and sandwiched between some pretty mediocre panini bread. It doesn't look like what is pictured on Yelp (slaw, fried chicken, on french roll), I think they changed their recipe, so take a look at my photos!
author: Jess C.

description: My main man Terence continues the greatness at his new spot on Jackson. Do not wait, don't sleep on it if you want some!
author: Mark S. I.

description:
Wings aren't something I crave often but I find myself getting wings more than not because of my boyfriend. He is OBSESSED with this place and he's pretty particular about his wings. We love most of the wings that we've gotten, including the chili crunch (my favorite), mango habenero (bf's favorite), and bacon wrapped molasses. 

I wish they would expand for more seating. We try to get there early for lunch or dinner hours to get a spot to stand/sit and eat, otherwise we've had to do take-out before since it's really a take-out place. I haven't tried to buy any of the hot sauces they sell but want to check them out more next time I'm there!
author: Stephanie T.

description:
Ain't no thing but a chicken wing!  We love our chicken wings!  We were getting our drinks at Sharetea's grand opening on Geary and needed to think of a place to get lunch to go nearby.  So, we called Hot Sauce & Panko while leaving Sharetea.  Yes, Hot Sauce & Panko was the place that used to serve ramen wings, no I never wanted to try it, though a ramen burger is another story!  Anyways, he was in the mood for something spicy we chose to share a small order of Red Rooster Wings ($6.49) and the Ultra Golaith ($6.99) .  Our order was done in about 15 minutes.

Their storefront is small, with only like two tables tucked towards the front for eating at, so definitely a to go place.  If you love your hot sauce, they have so many different kinds for you to check out and buy.  When you buy a small you're told that you would get at least 8 pieces, we got 9.  The Red Rooster was a Sriracha lime cliantro sauce.  I couldn't quite put my finger on what the dipping sauce was though..perhaps some kind of light ranch with a hint of sriracha?  The wings were nicely fried and I liked how they weren't drenched in sauce.  It had some heat, but the really spicy thing was the waffle sandwich that was the Ultra Golaith.  Like it's name indicates, it was a huge construction of thick Belgian waffles sandwiching big chicken katsu pieces with a cabbage mix, kewpie mayo and sriarcha caramel sauce.  I loved the thick Belgian waffle which still had semi crispy edges and the hint of vanilla in the batter.  As I mentioned though this was really spicy.  The middle started to fall apart too due to all the sauce.  Other than that it was a pretty good and unique sandwich.  

Hot Sauce & Panko has many creative wings on their menu, such as the proscuitto wrapped one & pad thai ones.  While I still love me some SO wings, I can tell that they crank out wings that will satisfy anyone.  I think we'll back to try out another type when the craving for wings come back.  3.5 stars for now, rounded up.
author: Cat C.

description:
Chicken and Waffle Sandwich
- crispy JUICY fried chicken
- unique cornbready-ish waffles
- tasty savory slaw

definitely worth a try, however you should get it to-go due to lack of seating
author: Tina A.

description:
Best choice for wings ever! 
I am a Los Angeles native that was in town visiting family and I took the opportunity to yelp the area. As a father I asked everyone in my family to pick a food and we would yelp a place and go get it while taking in the sites. My oldest said he wanted wings and he was shocked to find out that someone created a bacon wrapped wing. He said we had to go so I called in a 5 piece order just in case and also he is on a diet for football so just a taste for him. Well that was my worst mistake not ordering my own and letting him makes this his only meal for lunch. So as we arrive there is street parking which is limited but we found one quick. We noticed people outside and how small a location is so I would not recommend dining there unless you want to eat standing up. But locations that don't have seating usually mean that they are going to be extremely delicious if it has a crowd outside. 
Location:  Don't be shy you will see a crowd in front of the counter and a dining area big enough for four people. You will have to make your way to the register that is on the left and then squeeze to your right to pick up your order.
Staff:  Very friendly and informative and even with a huge crowd they were engaging and courteous. 
THE WINGS: (Bacon Wrapped wings with a bourbon molasses sauce) 5 piece for $7.49 as of 08/20/2015.
These wings were scrumptious and simply perfection in a small to go box. My son's eyes nearly fell out after waiting to eat all morning and his first bite made them roll back and see the back of his skull. Of course mom and I each tried them to make sure they were safe for consumption and they were amazing. The sauce was sweet and tangy with a small bite at the end. The wings were big and juicy and they had a slight crunch from the bacon. I would not wait to take this home I would just sit on the curb and eat them in order to not lose the crunch of the bacon which adds to the texture. 
My verdict: this is a must try stop and get enough for seconds and don't plan on sharing.
author: Gary M.

description:
I guess it is finally time for me to add my review to this place. Having gone here for over two year now, I can safely say I have tried every flavor from their previous ramen wings (RIP) to their new carolina reaper wings (RIP mouth). This is easily the best wings place I have ever gone to not just in SF. Every flavor has been fantastic, but these have been my favorites

Ramen wings (dont ask for them. It is over)
Ghost pepper wings (a lil bit spicy for a minor kick)
Carolina reaper wings (really really spicy for only those with the stomach to handle them)
Chris's (a classic)
Bacon wrapped wings (only get 4 per order but they are pretty big and fantastic)
Panko (another classic. Super crispy and flavorful)

In fact, all their wings are amazing and I absolutely recommend this place regardless of the tough hours. 

P.s. I really really recommend trying the carolina reaper wings with your friends. You will find out which of them actually like real spicy foods (aka none of them really do)
author: Gilbert L.

description: They have over a dozen types of wings. I wish they had a sampler to we could have tried every single one. The prices are really reasonable too. $6.49 for a small 7-piece order. I had the sticky pepper garlic. I expected a kick since the place is called hot sauce, but it wasn't spicy at all. If that's what you're looking for, make sure you ask for it. The wings were really crispy, which I loved. They weren't breaded which gave it a real nice texture. I would definitely recommend trying this place. Seems everyone was getting the chili wings.
author: Christine L.

description:
Best WINGS EVER, you must try the Chris and the Old Bay! They have all kinds of hot sauces, just reading their names is entertaining. 

If you're in SF you must try these local wings.

:D
author: Maria G.

description: Solid and tasty wings, lightly fried and breaded. I enjoyed the habanero and mustard wings and Korean. Not super hot, just a nice balance of flavor and heat.  Nice hot sauce selection, but not really crazy amount. So that is the best part, I wouldn't call it a restaurant, there are two tables without chairs and a few cans of soda. No bathroom and difficult to walk in and order if there are people in there waiting. Definitely a place to order and pick up or delivery
author: Ed F.

description:
4.5 stars?!!! How? Have you ever been to any of the spots back east coast? San Tung wings are good these wings are subpar. They make you buy bottled water, have no celery or veggies as a side and the sauce are bare basic at best. Salt and pepper as a flavor? 

100% overhyped
author: Tom S.

description: Amazing. I got the Goliath waffle sando it was perfection. Waffle, friend tender juicy chicken, sushi sauce, and syrup. We also ordered wings, the Chris honey salt and Parmesan, I recommend either. The parm comes with a spicy ranch. Enjoy!
author: James H.

description:
Taking chicken wings to new and beautiful places, this hole in the wall has something for everyone. 


THE JOINT:

It looks like a rogue restaurant snuck into the middle of a convenience store and set up shop. 80% of the space is occupied by the kitchen setup, with a hasty barrier erected to keep the cooks separated from the hungry masses. It's all pretty weird and awesome. The front is then lined with hundreds of hot sauce bottles for sale. There's minimal seating here, so expect to get a to go order if you're coming during peak hours. 

THE WANGS:

Innovative and delicious combinations on sizeable portions. I always make the mistake of ordering two for my self when one would cut it. Green flavor, Lime and Garlic bacon parmesan have all been stand outs. Also their fries are perfect, crispy outside with pillowy soft insides.
author: Patrick T.

description:
well hot damn, if it weren't for the wafting smells of hot korean inspired fried chicken and thick sweet syrupy waffles or the line of people spilling out onto the narrow sidewalk waiting to be hit by a person snapchatting on a vespa, i'd have missed this place! it's on the steep corner of hyde and jackson. just follow your nose to near perfection served in a styrofoam box (what's up with the non-decomposable vessel!?) 
seating is HIGHLY limited as there are none. provided are two standing tables, so be prepared with casual conversation or your best thought provoking questions as you are going to get to know thy neighbors! on second thought, save it for your next get-together as you'll be too busy stuffing your face with soft YET crispy waffles and steaming pieces of chicken meats nothing will even matter. my party however, hand transported our bundle of joy to the park in front of the cathedral of st. mary and people watched. lunch + a show :)
if you can't decide on a wing flavor, spin in a circle, close your eyes and point. i've probably tried all of the available flavors and was utterly pleased with every single one. there's no miss in this hit. may we all be #chickengangster (s).
author: Shirley L.

description:
Just picked up some ghost pepper and old bay wings. The wings here have no competition. Hands down the best place in the city to get that wing fix. The menu always changes and the prices are fantastic for the effort put into the food. The staff is always friendly. Terrence is without a doubt THEE chicken gangster. 
Anyway.. My recommendations are the ghost pepper wings if you can handle the heat. Old bay are always a crowd favorite. The panko parm wings are awesome.. Haven't really found anything on the menu I don't like or wouldn't be willing to try. 5/5 in my book easy. 
And let's not overlook the wall of hot sauces they offer. Whether you like mild, medium, hot or insane..they have something on that wall for you. Can't say enough good things. 
Big thanks to Terrence for delivering godlike wings all the time.
author: Michael R.

description: This is probably the best chicken wings joint in San Francisco. Love all the flavors and all the hot sauces. Highly recommeded!
author: Sandy L.

description: Really freaking awesome wings. The place has a very friendly ambiance and great customer service. A little cramped but you go for the wings not an over decorated joint with crappy food.
author: Yahi M.

description:
My second fave place for wingsss (after San Tungs). Wayyy better than Wingstop!

They were out of Old Bay and Panko that day, so my group and I sampled the Green, KFC, Chris's, Sriracha Lime, and Thai Ketjap.

Green: the most "Asian," like salt and pepper wings. Topped with cilantro, jalapeno, and ginger tossed in sesame oil. 

KFC:  typical Korean Fried Chicken sauce. 

The last three were sweet and savory flavors, each different in their own way. 
Chris's: the crispiest of the 3 with the least sauce.

Sriracha Lime: more acidity to it (but not sour or overpowering).

Thai Ketjap: the sweetest with the most sauce. Covered in thai sweet chile sauce, topped with Thai Chiles. 

By the time we were finished eating, they were out of the Green, so get here early!

Hole in wall joints like these are my favorite.
Will definitely be back whenever I'm in the area and want a quick meal! They also change their menu up ever so often, so I'll come back to try their other flavors.  

Downsides: limited seating, hard to find parking, closes early
author: Samantha K.

description:
Best wings in town. 

It is a small mom and pop shop, so if you do not preorder you are going to need to be patient. 

While they have a couple of small tables all orders are officially to go, but the park is only a few blocks away and there is a bar next door where you can eat your wings with beer. 

Looking for white glove service? Go somewhere else and let us enjoy our wings.
author: Jeremy N.

description:
I could eat the "Chris's" wings all day every day. THE BEST! 

No frills, no seating, but the most amazing wings in SF. Seriously.
author: Amanda B.

description:
These are exceptionally good wings. I had the Garlic Bacon Parmesan, Chase's, and Korean and all three were great in their own way. 

They were cooked perfectly, with a slight crunch on the outside but very juicy on the inside. I also really appreciated how saucy they were - there was enough sauce to coat the wings, but they weren't dripping and messy.

My only complaint is they weren't as big as I had hoped. That's not to say that they were extremely small, but they would have been perfect if there was a bit more meat.
author: Matthew G.

description: Lots of great flavors, but just disappointed that the spicy flavors aren't that spicy. I love that they sell smaller sized portions at fair prices, so you can try a bunch of different flavors.
author: Tuan V.

description: I've been largely unimpressed with the wings I have had so far on the west coast, but these are some of the best I've ever had. The Garlic sauce and Korean sauce were fantastic.
author: Richie K.

description: A small hole in the wall off the beaten path, but well worth it. The waffles are fresh, fluffy, and delicious. I got the Chris' style wings (salty, honey, crispy) and they were great. Don't expect to find a place to sit, the entire place has 4 chairs. Limited hours. W-Sun 12-6.
author: Matt K.

description:
I haven't been logging into Yelp as much as I've liked in the past year, and one of the consequences in taking extended breaks from Yelp is not knowing what new restaurants are out there and in this case (literally) what is hot so let me start off this review by thanking my Yelp friends Luis C and Mike C for putting Hot Sauce and Panko on my radar.

When another Yelp friend Earl G called me out recently about my unmanly appetite I took exception.  I know he was kidding, but I wasn't about to back off of a challenge like that.  I just happen to love chicken wings anyway so giving the chicken wings at Hot Sauce and Panko a try was inevitable for me.  I visited the little restaurant on Clement Street just days prior to the Christmas holiday.  

I had a 50 mile race staring me down for the holiday weekend, and in training for this feat I found that no matter how much food I consumed my training runs just burned off everything I ate.  Perfect!  I called the restaurant in advance to make sure I could put in my order since I had read postings on their website of days when they had to close early because they sold out of wings.  On their online menu they state that one can order up to three sauces on their 1/2 pans of 25 wings so I decided to order two.

Two 1/2 pans that is!  Not knowing what to expect in terms of flavor I chose two flavors listed as "best seller" on their menu, and I put the trust in my fellow Yelpers that this place was legit and created delicious food.  

When I stepped inside the restaurant to pick up my order I saw the lady inside creating one massive sandwich for another customer.  "Oh heck!  Why not?!!", I thought to myself so I ordered up one of their signature "rrbblt" sandwiches in addition to the wings.  My pan of green wings (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/NwqdohySKrDnK0RsAde9UA?select=qe9W9hoocHvABwuu78dD4A) was ready to go warming under a heat lamp, but the gentleman of the kitchen was busy at work preparing the sauce for my second pan of bulgogi wings (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/NwqdohySKrDnK0RsAde9UA?select=6KTztgFMnncUI_7ndyOhkA).

The short wait gave me a chance to pay for my food and check out the shop's extensive selection of truly unique hot sauces as well as some of the fun and gimmicky décor that other reviewers had mentioned in their reviews.  Once all of my food was ready to go I took it home to devour.

The wings were still hot and even sweating a bit from the long ride home.  I grabbed a bottled water from my refrigerator, sat down and enjoyed.  There was a good mix of actual wing pieces and drummettes, and each were cooked up plump and juicy just like I had read on some of the other reviews.  The sauces were definitely tasty, and I love that the flavor of the sauce in most cases permeated into the meat itself.  Nothing peeves me out more than when a marinade flavors the outside of the bird but not the inside.  I'm glad that wasn't the case here.  I thought the bulgogi sauce was very good, but I loved the seasoning on the green wings.

I'll be honest though.  Those 50 wings filled me up pretty good, and I had to wait a couple of hours before I could dig into the massive "rrbblt" sandwich (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/NwqdohySKrDnK0RsAde9UA?select=jcUKkD7MFJltHdB5DVcjyA).  I wrapped it up in foil and heated it to the point where the bread became toasty and the meat and cheese warm.  Amazingly, the spicy slaw remained fairly cool and stayed very crisp.  The sandwich itself was very good.  I loved that the crisp bacon was separated from the roast beef for I thought this helped to differentiate the two flavors.  The spicy slaw while refreshing lacked the spice I was seeking though, and I never did find those fried onion rings that were supposed to be included within the sandwich.

Regardless, I'd give this place a solid 4.5 stars, and yes, I will definitely return to give other chicken wing flavors a try as well as their great looking waffles.
author: Wilhelm Y.

description:
I CLUCK FOR WINGZ!

Hell, I would even "attempt" to shuffle in 4" stilettos for wings. Yes, I would subject myself to all the laughing and pointing after slipping on my ass or face planting onto the floor....ALL in the name of wings. LOSER.

My obsession with chicken wings started 3 years ago when I first tried the Bon Bon Korean Fried Chicken Wings in NYC. Since then, I've been hooked on the cluck cluck fried crisp deliciousness lacquered with varying tongue tingling sauces.

Hot Sauce & Panko is one of the two non-chain shops in SF that specializes in gourmet chicken wings. Wing Wings in the Haight is the other place but they do not do this highly addictive snack justice. Link to my review: http://www.yelp.com/biz/wing-wings-san-francisco#hrid:OPQVyk16POSOiQ58lnaJmg 

What Hot Sauce & Panko lacks in size, they make up in flavor. The store is tiny with a small counter, a condiments table, a wall of hot sauces for sale and two small tables for sitting.

After running a bunch of errands, I came to Hot Sauce & Panko for a late lunch last Friday. I went for the 5-piece KFC (Korean Fried Chicken) Wings, one of their best sellers (Green is the other) and made it a combo with a Belgium Waffle for $5.99.

Both cooked to order, the KFC wings were some of the best I've had. The meaty, succulently juicy wings were fried to a tantalizing crispness before bathing in the luscious sauce of chili, garlic, sesame oil and agave. Since they're non-battered, the wings aren't as crisp as other wings but they were still crisp around the edges. The sauce was a winner, winner chicken dinner, infusing an addicting savory, garlicky, nutty and fiery kick with a subtle sweetness that  set fireworks off in my mouth. 

As the waffle was cooking, the light aroma of vanilla wafted into the air and intoxicated my senses. The hot waffle was crisp, soft and ever so fluffy. The whipped butter along with the maple syrup created for one HELLAVA waffle. 

By the way, they also have gift certificates available for Wing Lovers. Christmas may be over but I will happily accept these in any denomination all-year-round. :D 

CLUCK CLUCK WINGS FOR THE WIN!!!! *SHUFFLES*

OTHER NOTES:
*WING SAUCE FLAVORS: Naked (no sauce), Buffalo (mild, medium, hot and xxx hot), Pure Capsaicin, Honey Mustard, BBQ, Soy Dijon Blue Cheese, Brown Sugar & Ham Glazed, Proscuitto Wrapped, Green (cilantro, jalapeno and ginger), KFC (chili, garlic, sesame oil and agave), Gringo Bandito, Peruvian Aji Limo Rojo, Habanero, Bulgogi, Thai Peanut, and Miso. 
*Two new flavors will roll out tomorrow: Wings Katsu (panko crusted) and Filipino Adobo
*SANDWICHES ($5.99): Fried Chicken, Roast Beef BLT, Smoked Salmon and Spicy Chipotle Black Bean
*BELGIUM WAFFLES ($1.99-$2.49)
*SIDES: Fries, Onion Rings, Clam Strips, Potato Salad, Macaroni Salad, etc.
*Catering Available: 1/2 pan (25 wings-$19.99) and whole pan (50 wings-$39.99)
*Natural drinks like unfiltered Gingerale available (perfect for relieving sore throats)
*Moderately difficult street parking
*CC's accepted
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
This was one of the more disappointing experiences I've had after reading all the rave Yelp reviews. It was definitely off the beaten path and almost that I had to make a journey here to try it out. That being said, there isn't that much better in the area and if you really can't go your hands on San Tung wings ...  I suppose this is it.

My usual Sunday consists of getting wings, so I came here once and the wings just are more paltry than others. Sure they're tasty, but I really didn't get what all the hype was.

I suppose if you need a new hot sauce this is the place to go, their selection seemed fabolous. Otherwise just solid wings that aren't worth the trip.
author: Joseph L.

description:
For flavored wings this is the spot! Our wings were out in no time, piping hot:

Green wings: generous portion of cilantro, but could have used a bit more spice mix as it was more on the oily side. Still good though.
Lime wings: must try! There is a nice sweetness, but also a kick. Sauce is very good and even though there is a lot, it doesn't make the chicken soggy.
Panko Parm: evenly crusted and crunchy. Perfect for dipping into remoulade. These wings seemed to be a lot bigger and meatier that the other ones we ordered.

Inside is very small - there is only seating for four so most people take it to go or eat standing at the tables outside. They also have a huge selection of hot sauces for sale. Be sure to check their website to make sure they're open before you make a trip here.
author: Josh L.

description:
I wanted to come here because this place seemed like it'd be worth a try based on the reviews on yelp....

However, this place was a huge disappointment. I seriously didn't understand the hype of this place because the wings were cheap quality wings like the frozen wings you'd get from Safeway. I will NOT be coming back. =/
author: Leilani Y.

description:
Best fucking wings Ive ever had. And Ive had wings all over the world in different areas.
  I really love the Bacon Garlic Parmesan and the Buffalo. Prices are not too shabby either 

Also the Service is really friendly!

100/10 would eat everyday
author: Michael L.

description: hot damn im glad my girlfriend found this place!!! only two tables inside but dont let that stop you from going ham on the menu! theres a bench right across the street perfect for a little lunch date. we got 6 wings chris' special and my oh my these are some of the best wings ive had! sadly i didnt try their waffles :( wehhh, but i did have a hot chicken sandwich! Hands down best chicken sandwich in the bay and will definitely be back. cant wait to try the whole menu! i would suggest calling in to order because it gets pretty busy, i went on sunday around 530 and about 10-15 people came in during the time i was waiting for my food.
author: Elijah R.

description: Everything was spot-on. Highly recommend the sticky wings and the chicken and waffle sandwich is beyond legit. It was a little busy which is not surprising since it's the hot new thang in the hood, but there were plenty of people to chat with in line and blocks to play with. A word of advice--branch out from the "most popular" part of the menu. There are many other possibly better choices further down the menu. This is a place that lives up to what could be a poorly executed gimmick.
author: Nathan R.

description: Worst chicken wings in the city... When they're not sold out. Same with their horrible rude customer service! People don't waste your time and money...
author: Hugo V.

description:
Hot Sauce and Panko has been on my rader for a long time. they are mostly closed or no parking nearby when i go by. today, green zone open in front.

menu: wings, waffles sammies, fries
eats: panko wings(8/6.49) with katsu sauce
-surprisingly not wowed by panko since i'm very familiar with it
panko here nicely fried, just slightly dry. 
-wings meaty and tender but flavorless

crumbs:
-fries(2.49) looked interesting, better than shoestring, smaller than regular
-maybe the KFC would have been better.
-wings better than most places 
-lots of bottled hot sauces available here.
author: Victor G.

description:
Crack cocaine....that's all I can say.  This place must put it in their food because it's SOOOOOO awesome!!!  Friendly and efficient service.

Lime wings are divine!
Old Bay is also very good

Am not fan of the popular Korean (KFC) though
author: Lille L.

description: Bought a jar of ghost peppers, had two pieces with my green wings and now I'm at sharetea diluting my burning tummy with some milk tea ice cream
author: L T.

description:
I like this place a lot. They open doors strictly at noon but you can call your order in 30 minutes before. It's a bit price-y for a to-go food joint (they only have 2 small tables inside), but I guess they pride themselves in gourmet wings. Purchased  2-3 wing flavors in the large size and walked out dropping nearly $35 for lunch. 

I advise you call in and be better prepared by scanning their menu ahead of time: http://hotsauceandpanko.com/

Great wings. I love the concept and the variety of flavors they offer. Everything is deep fried in a batter layer first though, then seasoned. I think my favorite is "Honey Salty Cripsy" flavor aka "Chris'"

Would come back again. Tasty tasty!
author: Veronica S.

description:
Was out and about in SF exploring the Golden Gate Bridge. After riding past another wing place on the bus, and a crappy wing experience at Pizza Orgasmica (yuck), was craving some decent wings. Did a Yelp search, which never lets me down, and found Hot Sauce and Panko.

This place is a serious hole in the wall, as in, I almost walked right by it. You'd never know from looking at it that this place has got some serious wing skills. You walk in and there are many shelves full of hot sauces on the left and a small counter in front of you. The menu has some interesting options on there, but the litmus test for wings are the classic buffalo wings. Sadly, they were out of those, which threw me for a loop. They also have something called Beer Wings which have buffalo sauce in them with BBQ but they didn't sound spicy enough. Went with the Red Rooster wings instead and they were awesome! Here is the text I sent to my wife:

"I am in wing heaven"

Go check them out and you will be too.
author: Rob C.

description: The wide array of hot sauces for sale at this place is amazing! The wing sauces @ this place are mouth watering! I tried the green...old bay and the lime wings! As for the chicken itself...yikes! A lot of fat and ligaments on them. You can tell they are Costco buy in bulk type of chicken. If this place had the chicken quality of WingStop along w their wing flavors...RIP to the wing game! I wanna visit this place again but get the wing flavors on chicken strips!
author: Marcus M.

description: Closed on Monday, disappointing to get turned away after searching for parking. Time to update the hours. Turn off when the person in the restaurant with the open door is unapologetic for my effort to eat there.
author: Lhm M.

description:
My friends and I came in around 4pm on a Saturday, and the small "restaurant" was completely full at the time. There was only a short line so we were able to order quickly, but it took about 15-20 minutes before it was ready. We ordered:

(Large: At least 12 wings. Small: At least 8 wings)
-Ultra Goliath Waffle Sandwich (Chicken Karaage, Cabbage, Kewpie Mayo, Sriracha, Caramel, $6.99, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hot-sauce-and-panko-san-francisco?select=nnnjP0TZnXJhcKXINjx8qQ#nnnjP0TZnXJhcKXINjx8qQ): Just ok. The waffle to chicken ratio was off, so some bites would have no chicken and some bites too much chicken. I couldn't taste the caramel at all, and thought the Kewpie mayo overpowered a lot of the other flavors. However, the waffle itself was pretty good, so I would consider ordering a sweet version of that but wouldn't get the sandwich again.
-Goju (The Wing Formerly Known as KFC/NOT Bonchon!, Large, $9.49, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hot-sauce-and-panko-san-francisco?select=nnnjP0TZnXJhcKXINjx8qQ#_m0NbMeogKN1a89FU_4JBw): Just ok- I didn't like the flavor of this version of goju and felt I've had better versions at other Korean restaurants. I wouldn't get this flavor again.
-Kentucky-Yaki (Kentucky Bourbon/Sorghum Teriyaki, Large, $9.49, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hot-sauce-and-panko-san-francisco?select=nnnjP0TZnXJhcKXINjx8qQ#rQPafjVN1q9K-jJI6DLgXQ): Again just ok- the flavor was decent but not my favorite, and I wouldn't get this again.

I really wanted to try the Chris' Honey Salty Crispy Pepper Wings and the Green Wings, so will have to come back at some point to give those a try, although I probably wouldn't re-order anything I had this time around. I really liked that they had a large variety of hot sauces to choose from (including one of my favorites, Aardvark), although it can get difficult to browse if people are sitting down to eat at the tables. They only have a few tables to sit at, so to-go is recommended. They do have some open bottles of hot sauce for use at the restaurant, and you can also take some to-go in small plastic containers. Parking in this area can be tough, but street parking is available.
author: Amy D.

description:
I caught up with a friend over lunch at this place. I wanted wings!

For the people who complain about the owners. I really don't know what you're talking about because they're really nice. If you're wondering why the man in the back doesn't talk to you or look at you, it's because he's focusing his attention on your food as he is cooking it. And the lady at the front is super sweet too! 

Small place, but I saw that they made some changes. They added a bench and a table inside and some chairs/tables outside. Convenient change! 

Other changes: they added more things to the menu! Of course I was stoked to try them. We had three orders of Thai BBQ, Spicy Chili, and 10 Spice. My friend ordered a fish sandwich for himself. We bought sodas too. They have an interesting array of canned drinks though not as vast as the collection of novelty hot sauces they have against the wall. 

It took a while to get our wings, but there was a star next to some of the menu items warning me so. Again, small place! They only have two fryers! I wasn't complaining. I ate the complimentary waffle they gave us while we waited. 

About their waffles: Free waffle Thursdays! So fluffy. I topped mine off with chocolate sauce, caramel sauce, and Marion berry syrup. I tasted the bacon syrup out of curiosity. It tastes like smoke. Waffles are only free when you buy their regular (5 pieces) or 8 x 1.

Sandwich was given to us first. Meaty fish, small-ish sandwich. Tasty. 

Wings came in plates at a time. Thai BBQ came first (with vinegar sauce) and then 10 spice (with chili sauce). Thai BBQ has a nice flavor. Juicy. 10 spice was my favorite because they're crispy on the outside and tender on the inside. And not drowned in  sauce. You add the chili sauce on your own. DELICIOUS. Recommend. 

Spicy Chili came next. It's actually really spicy but it hits you slowly and you burn from the inside out. They were nice to me and gave me pickles and a cup of milk to ease my pain. 

So delicious. I like this place a lot. No bathroom to wash your hands in so bring hand sanitizer or eat everything with napkins/forks. 

Will come back.
author: Sofia R.

description:
Walked in to this place at 4pm on a Sunday to try the "best" wangs in the city. Your boy been cravin some chicken wangs all day.  After waiting ~20 minutes, the seemingly angry man simply stated "no more orders!:. He proceeded to place a nice big stop sign on the register. I get the fact that they are the "best"; but it reminds me of the Soup Nazi from Seinfeld. NO MORE WANGS FOR YOU!


Until these imbeciles read 'How to Start and Run a Buisness for Dummies' (its only $15.99 on Amazon, free shipping with Prime!), I will be taking my hard-earned money to San Tung to satisfy dem chicken wang cravings. 

Notes for Owner:
1) Serve customers during posted business hours. Bright idea: change your hours to reflect when you will be 'tired'.
2)  Hire more people or open up a new store; thereby, providing for the high demand of dem chicken wangs. Capitalism is quite right on this front. (Maybe they didn't teach this....you know where.)
3) Sooner or later, these customer service deficiencies will bite you in the (donkey). 
4) I'll be back. These better some damn good wangs. If so, this review shall be revised.
author: Michael L.

description: I am not a chicken wing lover, like at all, but this place is delicious. So good! Highly recommend.
author: nicole r.

description:
Hot Sauce and Panko is a very small non-chain restaurant located in the Outer Richmond.  It's in a residential part of the Outer Richmond so parking can be difficult. However, the fiancé found parking right away.  As all their wings are made to order, there were a few people ahead of us when we got there.  The store is tiny; it's made up of a counter, a condiments table,  a wall of hot sauces that customers can purchase, a small table inside, and two small tables outside.

The fiancé and I ordered a 1/2 pan of wings (hot buffalo wings, KFC wings, and prosciutto wrapped wings. All the wings are made to order, which is great!  The KFC wings were by far my favorite. The meat was very juicy and bathed in a chili paste, garlic, sesame oil, and agave sauced. The hot buffalo wings was one of the best buffalo wings I ever had. Hot Sauce & Panko make their own hot sauce. =)

I would definitely come back to try the other flavored wings.

Pros: great customer service, & great flavored wings
author: Candice H.

description:
