HSP is a small retail shop http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hot-sauce-and-panko-san-francisco?userid=8Ces6YdT6j7BYycnZLrSng#ZsN7aBWfropcMLHr4QuOGA with a huge assortment of mostly award winning hot sauces ($5.49-$15.99) from independent producers. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hot-sauce-and-panko-san-francisco?select=C6N-3iOZvY2423NGJvKoJQ#C6N-3iOZvY2423NGJvKoJQ And also a snack shop, http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hot-sauce-and-panko-san-francisco?select=r4qzH2FHPJnX7ooacHGpqA#r4qzH2FHPJnX7ooacHGpqA with items like chicken wings, waffles, sandwiches, sides, chili and bottled drinks. The menu might be short, but the food is well prepared. Bonus points because the owners are super friendly. So I give them 5 stars.

Before making any purchase, u can sample many of the hot sauces on the condiment table. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hot-sauce-and-panko-san-francisco?select=uJgp_EB0qcebxCMOCXdGCw#uJgp_EB0qcebxCMOCXdGCw And later use them to season your food order.

I got a chicken wings http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hot-sauce-and-panko-san-francisco?select=xX2FvveaBRJ5I0lwnUrmEA#xX2FvveaBRJ5I0lwnUrmEA and waffle combo ($5.99), plus a side of potato salad ($1.99). http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hot-sauce-and-panko-san-francisco?select=p9H2MZzdM6PLfIWRLLx08w#p9H2MZzdM6PLfIWRLLx08w The waffle was hot and very crispy, the wings were plump and tasty, both were as good as can be.

While waiting for my food order, I noticed the quirky humor http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hot-sauce-and-panko-san-francisco?select=ENcFskQBkRciPCULZrqTzg#ENcFskQBkRciPCULZrqTzg on the walls. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hot-sauce-and-panko-san-francisco?select=7TmiR5awEiAKczoNfiUfFQ#7TmiR5awEiAKczoNfiUfFQ Take some time to look around the store, and you'll find many nifty things. For example, the store's clever hot sauce category system: A Darth Maul plastic doll head sits above the ultra spicy hot sauces (enhanced w/capsaicin extract), while a Spiderman plastic doll head sits above the standard hot sauces.
author: Luis C.

description: Sure they have good wings but they treat their customers like crap. They make you pay for water, don't have a public restroom, have an ant problem, and are generally just rude. When I asked to close the front door since it was freezing outside the only answer I got was "Sorry...no sorry...sorry." Wtf? Scroll down to the next negative review to see the owner's combative tone with another customer. This is a classic case of a small business in SF owned by people with absolutely no business savvy or sense of customer service. I'll stick to San Tung for wings (their service is better...and that's the last thing they are known for)
author: Amanda B.

description:
Parm & garlic wangsss are to die for! 

The Green wings were also good, but maybe because we tried the parm&garlic first, we were hooked.

They also change their menu..by week or month, i'm not sure but if they have the parmesan garlic, make sure you get em!

The hot sauces they have here are also pretty cool & fun to look at!
author: Elise T.

description:
i'm updating my review because i still can't get my hands on those ramen wings. they are literally impossible to get. 

I came here on a sunday and they had a waiting list to put in an order! it was absolutely ridiculous. In fact, upon walking in, the girl at the counter said they weren't accepting any walk in orders. well their sign outside says "we accept walkens" with a picture of christopher walkens..how deceiving. 

i waited til the line died down and walked back inside. Since there was no one but me in the place, she kindly took my order. That's the trick, MAKE SURE NO ONE ELSE IS THERE. otherwise, i suggest phoning in. try as many times as you can until someone picks up.
author: Andy H.

description:
BACKGROUND: me and my friend were starving and we're going on San Fran adventures. I looked on yelp for local restaurants and the one next door to this one popped up. But we saw people outside eating waffles and chicken and opted for this place.
SERVICE: I didn't interact with the staff but my friend did. He said they were nice and the service was very fast.
FOOD: AMAZING!!!! The waffle was warm and fluffy, the chicken was to die for. Everything was cooked to perfection. We tried a few different sauces and enjoyed them all (lime, buffalo, chipotle). There isn't much to say besides try it. Everything was fresh and hot. 
AMBIENCE: THIS PLACE IS TINY!!! It can seat 4 people inside and has a couple standing tables outside. I would recommend ordering to go so you can eat comfortably. It can get pretty crowded inside since it is so small
ADVICE: order to go or anticipate eating standing up. Either way it is worth it!
author: Sable S.

description:
I tried the ghost pepper wings the first time around and they were delicious. Juicy, tender and actually SPICY. I dislike when restaurants advertise spicy food and its actually not spicy. These were actually really spicy. As a spicy food/ hot sauce fan, I was very satisfied :).

The staff is great too! They're so nice and full of energy. 

I highly recommend this spot and I can't wait to try the other wings!
author: Tom U.

description:
Food: decent wings. Tried the pam and bacon, Korean, and two other. It's not bad. But doesn't hit the spot. I think the flavors are almost there but just not quite. It didn't excite me and I keep wanting to like it more but ultimately didn't.  I really think the balance of flavors are missing. All the sauces need more refinement and r&d to be honest. 

Atmosphere: quick shop. Small. Don't try to group this. Take out would be awesome.
author: P L.

description:
Argh! Why didnt I come up with the idea of selling wings doused with creative flavors on it?!!? 

This shop is tiny - like literally capacity of 8 people!!  Do not come in with a group of 4 expecting to get seats. 

I'm feeling pretty lucky, because from reading other people's reviews, it seems me and Panko were meant to be: 1) got a seat and were able to sit down to enjoy our meal, 2) ramen wings were in stock, & 3) the people running it were friendly! 

The ramen wings were okay - creative yes, but I wouldnt order it again. The KFC wings were delicious! I will come back to try all other flavors. & the waffle burger! ;)
author: Kristie F.

description:
Best place for wings! 
I prefer this place over Wing Stop, Buffalo Wild Wings, and San Tung's wings!! 
Love the unique flavors and how they are constantly coming up with new ones. 
Service is good, my orders came out pretty quick. 
Just wish this place was bigger though.
Bring back the ramen wings please! Oh and also the banana matcha waffles! I'm so sad that I never got to try those :'(
author: Tina S.

description:
I've heard some great things about this place and finally got to try the wings this past week.  I love wings.  From the classic buffalo style wing to Korean fried chicken wings I could eat them several times a week.  Thus, I was pretty excited to try this place.  We ordered 3 different varieties of wings:  1.  Kentucky-Yaki, 2. Gogu-My favorite of the three.  Sweet, korean fried chicken style,  3.  Old Bay:  (kinda like a crab cake meets a chicken wing).  :-)

The price is quite reasonable ($6.49 for 8 wings) and the service was friendly.  The actual wings were a good size and had lots of meat on them.  This is definitely a carry out type of place.  So bring a friend to sit in the car while you run in an get your wings!!

I will definitely go back to Hot Sauce and Panko when I am craving wings.  :-)
author: Paul W.

description:
This will be my first and last time here.  It was 4:59pm and I was in line, the lady took an order from the person in front of me then she puts up a "closed sign" and says we're closed. I know you close at 5pm, but you might as well take the last customer otherwise, have an earlier close time such as 4:30pm so that you can leave promptly at 5pm. This was terrible customer service.
____________________________

Message to owner:

Hi Terrance,

Thanks for the reply. I walked up to the counter before 5pm and the closing sign was placed prior to 5pm. Look, instead of writing emotionally charged, inflammatory, personal attacks across all social media platforms, you should realize that I am a customer that was looking forward to trying your highly touted food. I was extremely excited and although it was very close to closing, I thought I had made it in time to order something for take-out. I'm sure I can't change your mind on this matter, but you're going to see this happen with other people. I'm sure it's stressful being a business owner, but you are overlooking a huge detail: people are getting mad about missing out on trying your wings. Ultimately, you are the one running your business and making the decisions, but others might take this fact and recognize it as an opportunity to grow. We are not enemies, nor should we be. 

Good luck!

Sincerely,
Amy T. (wings fan extraordinaire and an almost Hot Sauce and Panko Wings fan)
author: Amy T.

description:
After now a second trip, I finally want to write a review.

Skip the bacon wrapped wings as the chicken was undercooked. Not sure if this was a fluke or if it just turned out that way because of the bacon being wrapped over the wings? All our other wings have been cooked to prrfection, so I am curious as to why this was undercooked? Maybe I should try ordering them next time to see if it happens again. 

The Yaki are my favorite right now. Sticky but good. Make sure to grab napkins! Panko being the close second. The seasoning is great on the Panko! I even reheated left overs the next day and still crispy! 

My bf got the Wing and Waffle combo our last trip and I got the Open Sandwich. The waffles were different, but I sampled both and I feel that the waffle that comes with the W&W combo is waaaay better than the open sandwich. I wonder if its possible to get that one with my sandwich?  Why no butter on the sandwich? I had to steal butter off my bf's waffle to put on mine. The chicken strips with the sandwich are really good. The first and second time trying it I feel that syrup is better than gravy. But thats just me; I highly suggest trying it for yourself and make you own decision on that one! Unfortunately, I don't think the strips are available to order alone. I could see myself ordering strips with some ranch! Now I am getting hungry again. :)
author: Karla C.

description: I'm writing this review because I called in for pick-up and they guy on the phone was SO funny - they have the best customer service!
author: Gina H.

description:
SO GOOD. So so so good. Great for takeout to parties where you're sure to be a hit. There are basically two very tiny tables to sit at indoors and a round table to stand around. Luckily, when we went an hour before closing on a rainy Sunday, it was easy to get seating. Lots of people came in to pick up to go orders but not many planned to eat in.
Don't go there too set on certain flavors - by the time we arrived they had sold out of a few. Everyone in the group had their personal favorites, which I think speaks to how solid the recipes are. We did KFC, Lime, and Red Rooster - all great. This is one of the places where I'd try to hit everything on the menu at least once.
Service was really friendly, place in a part of town where you shouldn't have to worry about parking (just the time it takes to get there).
Highly recommend this place, will definitely be coming here again
author: Melissa T.

description:
Can't say enough about how good the wings are here. The selection and flavors are great and price is reasonable. The place is very small for capacity eating there. We got lucky on a Sunday afternoon and the one table out front opened up when we got there. Had the Chili, the bay, Chris', and the deep fried. All were awesome. When we ordered, I thought for sure I was going to box up and take left overs home......Nope!  Actually went back and ordered four more orders for the long ride home. It would be great to have a beer with the wings, but not enough to effect this review rating. 

By far, the best tasting wings I have enjoyed!!!   Cheers!
author: Jim P.

description:
Speciality chicken and waffle joint. Exceptional and original creations. I usually call in my order for pick up because parking here is ALWAYS a pain in the ass. If you're in the area it's worth a taste. 

Always get the ultra Goliath sandwich. It's a fried chicken sando with spicy slaw and sauce, between two crispy golden waffles. It's super good but can be on the spicy side. If you don't like spicy ask for it mild. Must consume immediately or else waffles are at risk of becoming soggy.

Awesome variety of wings. Always get Chris's sweet / salty wings. Soooo good! Best hangover food!
author: Rosalyn W.

description:
Today is sad day:( Found out this place moved.  I hope they open another location back up in the richmond.  We came here 2 to 3 weekends a month, that is definitely not going to happen as their new location is more of a trek.  Good for them, bad for us:(


Some of the best chicken wings I have ever tried. I come here weekly. Wings are small, but juicy and tender. Not too greasy. Their flavors are creative, and are executed really well. I love the korean and the parmesan panko. Oh, and don't forget to order waffles or tempura fries. It's also fun looking at their hot sauce wall. Be warned though, sometimes there is a long wait. Make sure to ask for a receipt because one time my ticket got lost. Slightly annoyed, but the food is just too good.
author: David D.

description: Delicious wings. We had the mango habanero, Korean, and Chris's. My favorite was Chris's but they were all deeeeelish.
author: Tiffany C.

description: so bomb.  Best = garlic bacon parm wings with a waffle + extra butter combo.  Smother those waffles in marionberry syrup and its like crack.
author: Dan J.

description: This place knows what it's doing with wings. So many choices and varieties of flavor. We picked four different kinds at random and got an order of the wedge fries as well. We tried the panko Parmesan, sweet chili Thai, Chris's, and Korean. Korean was probably my least favorite out of them all but that is relative because I would order all of them again. Next time we will order the spicier wings because the flavored we ordered just didn't have enough kick. We will be back!!
author: Erica V.

description: Local take-out or easy cable car hop-off. Love the wings.
author: Pamplemouse L.

description: Always order to go, if you're lucky you'll be able to get one of the 4 seats inside but on to the food, got the ultra Goliath waffle sandwhich and green wings. The sandwhich was alright... The chicken inside is pretty dry but the green wings were really good can't wait to go back and try the other flavors  wish they mixed flavors though
author: Krizia R.

description:
I ended up walking to Hot Sauce and Panko by chance on my last adventure through the city, and what a great discovery it was!

This super small shop seems to be all around amazing, in their service, attitude, and most importantly their food!

First probably the only two downsides I could find: Parking is going to be rough, the shop is tiny, and there is no lot for it, so you'll have to just drive around and find a spot on the street somewhere.  I was lucky and found one a few blocks away, and I totally didn't mind the walk after those delicious wings.  The second downside would be their seating.  There's basically only one table inside that seats maybe 4-5 people max, and then a few tables outside for 2-3 people each.  Amazingly, both these concerns are actually highlighted by the restaurant itself on their website, that's what I call great transparency and attitude!

As for the food experience itself, it was amazing.  I had the Panko Parm, which are lightly crusted fried chicken wings with crumbled parmesan cheese on top.  I came in when it was a little crowded, but the guy at the counter was extremely polite and apologized for the 10 minute wait for my food(which really seemed like nothing).  In fact, waiting for the food gave me an excuse to dig through their shelves of hot sauce.  They have everything from the most well known hot sauces to miscellaneous novelty ones.  It was really cool being able to look through them, and I'll definitely pick some up on my next visit.

Overall, it was an amazing hole-in-the-wall chicken wing place, and I'll definitely swing by the next time I'm in the area!
author: Andrew T.

description:
I've been a fan of this spot for years and have brought many friends here.  This all changed recently when the owner went berzerk on me, verbally abusing me and mocking me in front of his other patrons for trying to get a bag to take my leftovers home.

I spent $28 on food and tipped an additional $3 for wings, which I ate there.  There were a lot of leftovers so I asked for a bag to carry the multiple boxes of leftovers in, and was told I needed to pay $0.10.  As I had no cash, I pulled out my CC but was told that they wouldn't accept it because they would be fined if they didn't charge me.  I tried to tell the owner that one of the exceptions to the ordiance is if the bag is to pack up uneaten food (i.e. doggy-bag) and that he wouldn't have to risk being fined.  

This is when he started going crazy and screaming at me.  Another patron, wanting to avoid the drama offered me $0.10 to pay for the bag.  At which point the owner said 'charge that asshole $5.00 for the bag'.  

On my way out, he started yelling at his other customers telling them how stupid I was. 

Independent of  all other factors, this is now how you treat a customer.  Not accepting a CC for the $0.10 makes no sense as they use square and square charges a flat percentage - no transaction fee - so there was no reason for them not to accept my CC.  I physically had no cash and there were no ATMs nearby.  I physically couldn't carry the leftovers home (walking 3 miles) as a stack of boxes.  And if you look up the ordinance, it clearly states that a bag for leftover food is not subject to a $0.10 minimum fee (http://sfenvironment.org/article/prevent-waste/checkout-bag-ordinance).   

To be treated in such a horrible way is just not right.
author: reza n.

description:
Simply the best wings in the world. Period. F the haters! Go to the bathroom at home like an adult.

-Zkloon
author: Wolf Z.

description:
Pretty good wings. Happen to be in the area shopping at Toss and had a hankering for some wings. I yelled the area and found this gem.
They have many variety of wings. I chose the Old Bay wings because I use the seasoning at home on seafood but never on anything else
The wings were really good but needed a smudge of salt and could of used a minute less in the fryer. Besides that they were tasty and the fries were good too.they have a variety of hot sauces that line the wall for you to purchase as well. I'll be back if I'm in the area
author: Ayana K.

description:
First i want to give notice to all who may decide to order over the phone on the fly after reading this (which...is what i did...): when you ask for the "chicken sandwich", there appear to be two. The one i got (and it's NOT their fault-i probably said "yes" when the person asked if i wanted (i think it is) "the Behemoth"?...)  At any rate, i was shooting for the one in all the fried chicken sandwich photos i saw here on Yelp. Well...it's NOT. What i got is a open-faced fried chicken waffle sandwich with tomato slices and a creamy coleslaw with hot sauce topping. Not what i expected, but delicious nonetheless! A happy mistake, you might say. But i still want to try out the regular one, too...next time!

Which brings me to my review: YES! There WILL be a second time! 

Nice variety of wings. I got the ""KFC" (Korean Fried Chicken) and the "the Honey one..." (that's what i called it cuz i couldn't remember off the top of my head the name of it from when i had seen the menu the day prior*. I could only remember it was the honey one and it said something about salt... They were both DEEELISH! Perfectly fried wings and quite the amount of flavor. 

The sandwich was tasty; i wish i had picked it up sooner so i could speak more truly to the waffle; it was soft, a little sweetness to it and yummy. I can't speak to the crispiness since i was late picking it up. I liked the sauce on the coleslaw and it had just the right amount of hotsauce to balance it. A tasty treat!

I'm looking forward to trying the Bulgogi wings. And the OTHER fried chicken sandwich! Overall good foid and good experience!

ETA: So I figured out a couple of things since I liked it so much that I returned the next day for MORE wings!  
-The "waffle sandwich" I got is the 'chicken and waffles', I think it is called the GOLIATH (this, from memory...)
-The menu changes about weekly, so go to their website to see what the latest wing offerings are
-It's still good the second time around-and trying different things!
DO EET!!!
author: Leslie W.

description:
Holy Moly ,,G
Heard bout this place quite a while ago but couldnt make it 
Finally tried it and its out of the world 
Wanted to try em all but could not eat em all 
Am going to go again till i taste each and every one of their wing :)

Place small 2 tabls,, u cannot eat inside but u have 2 tables outside where we can stand and eat ,, or eat in ur car,, 

coming to the main thing
Ive tried 
Lime,, on the lighter side and its good
red rooster sriracha,, fishing awesome ,, dont missi t ,, on the spicier side
double hot buffalo ,,is awesome,, dont miss it
bacon wrapped double hot buffalo,, ,,my tongue is drooling here,, the best wing ive ever had ,, on d spicier side,, awesome 

Bottomline,, dont fishing miss the food if u like wings or duck or wat ever,, 
go have fun
author: C S.

description: Had chicken sando first time. Well made and tasty. 8/10 a bit dry needs house hot sauce w/it or something to make it moist. Tempura fries I've had twice now. 10/10 must get. Just crispy enough, light on grease and salt but well balanced. Whatever the batter is makes is sooo much more tasty than any other fries. I can only hope they're not frozen. I get the sense they're not though. Tonight March 30th. Had the ultra sando. AMAZING, waffle was cooked perfectly added a touch of sweet to salt and fat. House hot sauce added the extra magic to harmonize everything. Again the tempura fries were consistent and delicious. Also had an order of Korean gochujang wings. Super tasty too 9/10. Texturally, they were the best feeling wings I've ever had. Slight crunch, slight carmelization on the outside moist and juicy on the inside. Flavor was of honeyed, brown sugar, seasame, and umami complimented by the fatty chicken and bready coating. I give 9 of 10 because of personal bias. Although they were great in their own right, I craved a different flavor. Overall I recommend to anyone craving wings.
author: Daniel-san F.

description: Do you like Chicken Wing? Do you like Chili and Hot Sauce? This is the exact place you should come! I guaranteed you, no regret! This place is awesome with variety of hot and crispy chicken wings. Definitely a MUST visit place for some "wing wing" (my term of chicken wing :P) love it! I'm sooooo happy now after some wing wing from Hot Sauce & Panko.
author: Unyo N.

description:
My experience was more like 3.5 stars, but I'll round up. This place is super tiny, and there is hardly any room for a line plus people waiting for their food. My friend told me it's more like a takeout place, so I came prepared with my own plastic bag. Fortunately I had one because the workers do not ask if you need one. 

I tried the Korean fried chicken and Chris's wings. They were both pretty good, but I expected the Korean wings to be spicier. Chris's wings are supposed to be like the wings from San Tung, and they are! All of my wings were cooked really well, and they had just enough sauce on them. 

The portions are pretty big (about 9 for a small order), and it was reasonably priced. My wings came out pretty fast, too. On a side note, eat these fresh because they don't keep too well in the fridge. (The sauce on my leftover Chris's wings literally dripped off.)
author: Rachel H.

description:
Pretty good wing spot with interesting flavors. Their website is classic San Francisco uber-hip self-styled food mecca.

Some highlights:

"we are not a restaurant"

"parking is a problem"

and of course

"we will halt making food at any time regardless of the times posted"

Just like Grammaw's house.
author: Alex L.

description:
Hands down best wings spot I've been to. It's a small hole-in-the-wall joint that has odd hours. There is not much seating there, but they have an unwritten agreement with the bar next door where you can sit at the bar and eat Hot Sauce and Panko food as long as you buy drinks from the bar. Ordering and picking up food there can be a bit chaotic since the joint is so small. 

Hot Sauce and Panko closes Mondays and Tuesdays and are only open between like 12pm and 6pm other days. I believe they get their wings from Costco - the wings are plump and juicy. My favorite ones are Panko Parm, Thai Chili Crunch and Double Hot (similar to hot buffalo wings you get elsewhere but better). The Ramen ones were a bit plain. The waffles are also simple but good. 

If you like hot sauces, they have a gallery wall of hundreds of hot sauces on your left.

Hope you like it!
author: Jesse N.

description:
!!! The reincarnation of The Little Piglet--my all time favorite sandwich place that shuttered in 2009 when the landlord drastically raised rent.

When I walked in here on a whim and saw the Little Piglet guy, I flipped out. I felt like I'd come home. I could not stop grinning. I honestly almost cried. I essentially had lunch with him every day for the whole year I worked at the Hall of Justice.

And this place has already won my heart too.

I had old bay and sriracha caramel chicken, bulgogi chicken, and Korean fried chicken, plus a waffle. Drank passionfruit ginger ale. 

All were excellent. Chicken was juicy, crispy, good bite. Flavors were strong without being overbearing. 

Favorite was the old bay and sriracha caramel. As an ex Bay Stater with family in Maryland, I have a soft spot for old bay. Excellent combo of spiciness, savory, and sweetness.

Service is great, staff is friendly (of course). Treat them well-they are family! I will be back as often as I can--i just moved to the neighborhood!
author: Adam D.

description:
I've been dying to try this place! Once, I came here on a weekend about 20 minutes before closing. They had a big fat "STOP" sign on their cashier. Like their website says " We will halt making food at any time regardless of the times posted" Sad face times infinity.

Came back another day, and I FINALLY had the chance to try the wings!  I love the creative flavors. Where else can you find original flavored wings in San Francisco?! 

Coming back for:
- Lime Wings
- Korean Wings

Ill pass on the:
- Sticky Pepper garlic 

Call ahead and order so you can just pick up and leave! They do have some outdoor seating but its very limited (about two tables).
author: Fanny H.

description:
So lets start with the good stuff.

The wings are good sized wings, not the puny ones you get at Buffalo Wild Wings. Also unlike Buffalo Wild Wings, this place is cheap for the amount of wings you get. There are a wide variety of flavors, from spicy siracha to korean-style. I got my wings pretty quick, and if you like your hot sauces there are shelves full of different types and flavors you can purchase.

Now let me explain to you why I had to pull back from the 5 stars.

First, service is absent. I wish I had known this before tipping, because I ended up wiping down the table myself. 

Second, lets be real guys. These wings are straight from Costco. If you are too lazy to go to Costco and buy the back of hot wings and make them yourselves for so much cheaper, this is your place then. 

Third, be ready to get to go. This is not a place you want to eat inside (they have tables outside for standing). If you do decide to sit, you are either wedged right next to the door (where a crazy kid and walk in and punch you in the face without you even knowing), or you ware wedged right next to the shelf with hot sauces for sale. If somebody wants to buy a hot sauce, they are reaching over your table. If there is an earthquake, you will die from falling glass hot sauce bottles.

Which brings me to my last point: how did this place pass the safety inspection? You can literally see the chaotic work station behind the cashier counter. If this place doesn't close before someone getting salmonella, it is going to close because of a failed SFFD inspection. Claustrophobic people: Beware!
author: Justin L.

description:
I went on a wing hunt and found this place, sooooo good. They have several flavors, my favorite was probably the green wings that came covered with a jalapeno cilantro topping. They have an entire wall of hot sauces that you can purchase, along with a whole table for you to use if you're eating there. 

If you're craving wings, this place hits the spot.
author: Angela K.

description: Best wings I've ever had hands down... I've tried a lot of them but the only two I order now are the Chris's way (the best) and the Old Bay wings.  Nothing else is worth ordering over these two.
author: Jay H.

description:
They're just a-ok. I had high hopes for this place seeing all the great reviews via Yelp but for a football party..they were disappointing.

For a cilantro hater, the green wings with the cilantro sauce or whatever was tolerable. 
Bulgogi was forgettable, barely any flavor and that was what I was looking forward to the most.

Honestly, I had these back during football season (it still hurts, I know let's not talk about it Niners) and I forgot all about it. That's how just a-ok these are.

I wouldn't make this a destination spot and I definitely wouldn't make these a party item. If you're in the hood and you have a hankering for wings, it's aiiiiite.
author: Susy C.

description: Seriously epic! If you love wings, you HAVE to come here. I came with my husband and friend, and everything we got was amazing. I recommend the wings and waffles together. Just note there is almost no seating so most people take the food to go. Wow!
author: Mary K.

description:
So...as a WANGS lover, I approve of this place (: this is one of those small petite places with good food!

--Fried Ramen Wings w/ Pour on Sauce ($6.99, comes with 6 wings): basically wings covered with crunchy ramen and fried to perfection.The outside is extremely crunchy while the inside stayed nice and juicy. They have fish sauce for dipping which was a MUST. Ugh it was so good. The only thing that prevented me from giving this 5 stars was that it might be a little TOO crunchy if you don't use the sauce. Kinda on the hard level.

--Ultra Goliath Waffle Sandwich ($6.99): that first bite was orgasmic. This sandwich is so bomb! It has two big pieces of chicken karaage and the "kewpie mayo sriracha caramel sauce" was perfect. You can add whatever sauce you want that they have but  had it without them and it was still awesome. I definitely recommend this!

WANGS WANGS WANGS
author: Jackie T.

description: this place is popular, but chicken is undercooked in the middle. the waffle sandwich doesn't taste as good as it looks either. but the staff is very nice. for the price you're paying, the chicken should be GREAT -- not just good.
author: Brian W.

description:
This place is amazing, but sadly way too far out to go to often.

I do not recommend getting the sandwich because the waffle SUCKS. The waffle taste like flour- no butter, no salt, no pepper, no seasoning at all. You are just eating a crap load of flour. 

As a Korean, I have had many korean fried chicken so take my advice when I tell you to get the KFC,

I liked the old bay spice chicken wings but it wasnt something I liked at first, it sort of grew on me.

I also tried the lime chili one? that was okay.

Overall, the chicken wings were crispy and crunchy and not soggy at all. I cant wait to try the ghost pepper one day but for now these will do. So remember do not get the sandwich! and go next door for a nice cold beer.
author: Grace C.

description:
Wings! Wings! Wings! If you like wings, you must give this place a try. 

I came in on Wednesday at 1pm. No line, sweet!! I ordered Kentucky-Yaki, Chris's, and Sticky Pepper Garlic. I asked for Togo and Wings were ready within 5 minutes.  
The lady explained to me which wing is which, very nice service.

I ate them 10 minutes later and they are still very tasty! Chris's is my favorite so far. I'll need to try them all soon!
author: JC C.

description: I finally got to try this place by going on a weekday.  It was easier to find parking and less people.  It's a small place so I had to cram in my stroller in there.  I think I got the green wings and the one with sriracha.  I also got the waffle.  Waffle was okay.  The wings were good.  It was juicy and flavorful.  It wasn't salty unlike chain restaurants that sell wings.  I'm not sure how the pricing was.  It's definitely a place to get your food to go since seating is limited.
author: Claire J.

description:
These wings are bomb.com. I also appreciate the fact that they are honest in their dealings and try to give you your moneys worth of wings depending on the price of chicken. Red rooster was my favorite. 

Only downside - its far (sunset) and there isn't much space so sit.
author: Amir A.

description:
This place is awesome. 10/10

Wings are on point. Service is friendly. And the atmosphere (especially the quirky signage) is very fun. Did I mention the WINGS. I know good wings, and these are damn good wings!

I took the wings next-door to Chomp N' Swig because they have damn good beer. This combinations can turn around the darkest of days. Take advantage of these Outer Richmond gems!
author: Brendan F.

description: This place used to be great, now it sucks.  Currently on their website (1-15-2016), the menu says small order is 8 pieces, large order is 12 pieces.  Pricing 6.49 and 9.49 respectively.  I called to place an order for pick up and was told they now only sell one size, 6 pieces, for 6.49.  Seriously?
author: Roman S.

description:
After the hype surrounding the ramen wings, I decided to try this place out.

I ordered a round of those wings along with some other wings and their waffle sandwich.  The latter two weren't too bad, but I was a bit disappointed with the ramen wings.  I know that we got an order of 6, but I couldn't get past 2-3 since it felt bloated compared to the rest of the food I ordered.  Even the waffle sandwich was tolerable compared to the ramen wings.  Luckily I had someone to finish the wings, but I just thought it was hype, overall.
author: Ren L.

description:
I've got say, probably the best wings in the city. Good riddance Buffalo Wild Wings, WingStop & sadly OBW. 

My husband and kids have been there twice this wk and everything we've order have yet to disappoint. we all have our fave. 

My husband dreams of the OldBay & Korean Fried.

Son #1 is in love with the Chris'

Son # 2 & 3 love the BaconGarlicParm

I will devour the Satay. 

Chicken is always perfectly cooked and so moist on the inside, even having it as a to-go order it was delish. 

Their fluffy waffles is the cherry topping to the meal. 

Staff is friendly, direct and to the point, but not in a rude manner. 

Definite loyals.
author: Sarah N.

description: Good chicken wings but to us it is a big turn off that if you to-go your food but end up eating on site, they don't provide a trash can for you to toss trash. Others might not care but we think that is just cheap.
author: Paiyu G.

description: Solid place for your wing fix. They have unique flavors so try them all!
author: Derrick W.

description:
Gotta try this place if you like wings!!! 

Perfectly crispy! Absolutely delicious. And I will definitely be back again. 

The Rundown:
- Awesome wings
- Limited seating (4 inside/4 outside)
- Great for takeout 
- Huge hot sauce selection 
- Family owned

The flavors are original and the owner really seems to enjoy creating new flavors. He experiments with different dipping sauces. He had me try a Sriracha Caramel sauce, and it was awesome. 

The bf doesn't really do well with spicy, so we tried their non-spicy wings: Chris's Honey Salty Crispy Pepper, Green (cilantro, jalapeño, ginger, sesame oil  house spice mix), & Katsu with Tonkatsu sauce. I'd highly recommend the Honey Salty Crispy Pepper wings!! They're perfectly sweet, salty, and crispy. Oh yea, they also have waffles & and assortment of condiments to top your waffles with!

I have a feeling that I'll become a regular at Hot Sauce and Panko
author: Dana M.

description: They play heavy metal music for you to headbang while eating your chicken wings and have hundreds of different bottled hot sauce for sale. Exquisite.
author: Briget P.

description: In the area an thought we would check this place out because of the review. It looked really small but the food was amazing even with wings were awesome months latter my friend kept asking what was the name of the place we went again?
author: Kurt R.

description: Overpriced and no flavor. Spent $30 on wings and none of them were above average. At over a dollar for only half a wing I expect better. There's a reason why they sell all that over priced hot sauce. Maybe you could cut costs if you didn't have 5 people doing two peoples job. There's way better wings in the hood that will blow your mind for about $0.50 a piece and they don't even need sauce.
author: Jeff F.

description:
Ultra Goliath was AMAZINGLY DELICIOUS!!!!! I had this during lunch with my coworkers and boy was I excited to eat this.

The Ultra Goliath is like a huge chicken sandwich but except of using bread they used waffles instead. It's pretty much a thick waffle with lots of chicken strips and shredded cabbages that's topped with this mayo looking sauce and a lot of Sriracha hot sauce. It was so flavorful! Everything tasted so good together. The waffle added a nice hint of sweetness, while the chicken added a awesome CRUNCH! I especially liked the cabbages they used because it was refreshing and it really balanced out all the crazy flavors of the waffle sandwich. 

My coworker had the KFC (korean fried chicken), Bulgogi wings, Lime wings, and the Green wings. All of them said that lime wings were the best. I didn't get to try of course because I was working on my delicious monster (ultra goliath).

I would go here again! 

Note: Service is not awesome but the food is too good to not come back
author: Nguyet T.

description: So many variety and the wings are meaty and juicy. It is on the pricier end $6.99 for half a dozen and you cannot mix and match the flavors. The place is small so have to come at odd times to have seating. Many get to go which I did but the wings are definitely better when eaten fresh and right away. They also have waffles that come w their wings but I didn't get to try it. But quite a clever concept and would want to try all the different flavors. It's a pretty cool chicken wing place.
author: Wendy L.

description: To be honest I'm not really a fan of wings but WOW! This place is fantastic! Delicious! Perfection! The wings are what all wings aspire to be, not greasy, crispy, flavorful and it comes with waffles! That makes this small, clean, neighborhood store front a perfect place to stop on the way home from work for a delightful dinner.
author: Anna P.

description: best wings i EVER had! visited SF and ended up eating here 3 times in 5 days. Gochujang wings are AMAZING!
author: Jen G.

description:
Despite our excitement for this place, somehow it's taken us 9 months to swing back around. This time we had the lime chicken wings which were absolutely amazing, a perfect taste of southeast asia-  with strong flavors of fish sauce and lime juice.

A bit more disappointing was the godzilla waffle sandwich which was a boneless breaded piece of fried chicken inside a waffle. The sandwich was a huge confusing mess, both in presentation, eventual sogginess of the waffle, and also in flavor. The chicken itself as a bit dry (which we've never gotten in the wings) and all of it tasted more like a fast food mess of a sandwich than the sharp bold flavors we generally have come to associated with Hot Sauce and Panko.
author: Amy D.

description: Barely any space to eat. Two standing tables only. May make sense for to go orders, but do order. The wings here are amazing. Plenty of flavors and service is really quick! Highly recommended!
author: Gaurav K.

description:
Love the fluffy waffles & the yummy wings.  right next to a beer pub too!

The only reason they received 4 stars rather than 5 is because the physical space is small and could use some ergonomic re-designing.  They could definitely create a more comfortable vibe by putting actual seats out on the patio.  But the food & the price can't be beat.
author: Rick A.

description:
I have to give 4 star because:
I like it. I like it very much.
Last night I got the most terrible KFC at Joo Mark on Geary Blvd & Funston. So, I need to get something Real KFC, K as Korean today, so badly. So we came here.

I was here about 2 years ago, gave 3 star review, did not impressed that much, because  I had better Fried Chicken Sandwich at Bakesale Betty's, Oakland.

Today, I did not see Fried Chicken Sandwich in the menu, instead, I saw Waffle Sandwich! so we had to order it, also, one of best seller at HSP, "Korean Fried Wings", large. 

Waffle Sandwich was good, crunchy juicy, tender hot fried chicken was nice.
And the Korean Fried Wings was awesome!
I must say, it was really good, mouth watering spicy chicken wings.
I was loving it.
I have heard that they are going to be open every day, in near future.
Great Chicken Wings!
Go, HSP, Hot Sauce and Panko, Go!
author: Nobu K.

description: I now go out of my way to make it to this place when I'm in town. And I mean multiple times! Love their wings, don't ever change!
author: J R.

description: Best wings in the bay! T-Dawg the man behind the wings is true artist always reinventing the chicken wing. Love it #chickenGangster!! For all you haters out there you gotta take a step back and respect the hustle! Show up early. Remember it's closed Monday and Tuesday and never forget Free Waffle Thursday!!!!
author: Pauly H.

description: I am visiting from out of town and this hot spot is close to where I was staying.  After reading the reviews I had to see this place for myself and I am so glad I did. The wings are amazing!  Super crispy, lots of flavor and very satisfying. The location is small and there are 2 tables for dine in orders only.  We went close to opening to ensure we had a spot to eat and we were happy all around. This is now another must go to spot when I come for a visit.
author: Jessica W.

description:
Gluttony is one of the seven deadly sins - one of which I am sadly quite guilty of.  I blame establishments like Hot Sauce and Panko for continuing to enable my over-indulgence.

There are just too many wings and too little time (or stomach volume).  

My favorites:
Waffle Sandwich - Chicken Ultra Goliath
UGH! SO many good flavors, textures and food love overload!!  This delectable beast is loaded with their chicken kara-age, cabbage, fried onion, mayo and the most amazing srirach sauce. LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE!

Bulgogi Wangs - once again, the flavors and textures sent me over.  These wings are coated with delicious batter, then given a dose of sauce.  I was expecting bulgogi, Korean-style...but this was something different. Delicious.

Green Wangs - bright, acidic, tangy....delicious!

KFC - Korean Fried Chicken - another coated wing...tasty sauce with a sprinkle of sesame seeds.  Finger-lickin' goooood.

The wings are plump and juicy, like me! Gluttony is such a sin...but I hear all the interesting people are in hell anyway....
author: Christy L.

description: Dope fried chicken sandwich, wings are on the pricey side but overall this place is great
author: Bryan S.

description:
I'm gonna go ahead and leave five stars. I've never even been here but I promise it'll be my first stop when I get to San Fran. I own a chicken wing restaurant in St. Louis called St. Louis Wing Company. I've been looking at this place online for a while and see nothing but great things. I'm a fan already. Thumbs up!
side note: lets talk... bobby@stlwingco.com
author: Bobby T.

description: The wings at Hot Sauce and Panko are unreal. I consider myself a connoisseur of chicken wings and these are the best chicken wings on the west coast. I hsve tried for 9 years to find a good wing place and nowhere in SF bcompares to HS+P. They have a seemingly endless offering of different sauces too, some ambitious some traditional. The waffle is also delicious. Bummed U-Lee is gone but this is a great replacement.
author: Robert R.

description:
I went here months ago with the man candy and didn't really feel like it was all that different than other wing places but he has been talking about giving it another chance since the reviews have been getting better. So today we went and I was pleasantly surprised by how much improvement they have made. 

Today we came in and looked at the menu. Apparently they added sandwiches more importantly WAFFLE sandwiches. We ordered the Ultra Goliath waffle sandwich which had 2 pieces of boneless chicken kara-age, cabbage, mayo, sriracha and caramel and Chris' honey salty crispy pepper. 

The Ultra Goliath waffle was a great combination of sweet and savory. The chicken kara-age was crispy while the waffle added the perfect amount of sweetness, it wasn't crispy enough to make the right substitution for bread. If it was in the waffle maker for another minute it would have been perfect. 

Chris' honey salty crispy pepper was a bit different from how the name sounds. You can taste the honey, a little of the salt, definitely crispy and a mellow taste of pepper. It was such a great sauce that covered all of the wings. (I have been to places that add the sauce last and you have to evenly distribute them yourself) 

A couple other things to note, they don't have a bathroom for you to use and it is a smaller place with about 2 tables and 4 chairs inside and out so you may need to eat in your car. Also they have a great selection of hot sauce. (I know this should be obvious but I almost went into a salon that was named after a candybar.) I am scared of all things spicy so good luck with that. Anywho for about $14 I was happy with the decision we made by coming back. Now it makes me wonder what other places I should try again.
author: Jayne A.

description:
I wanted to post an updated review, because I constantly think back about this meal being the food highlight of a trip last year to San Francisco, from New Zealand. I still follow the store on Facebook, reminding me I need to get back as soon as I can to try their selection of mind-blowing creations.

We tried four different types of wings, and a waffle sandwich - cannot fault anything. The clerk at the counter was also very knowledgeable and happy to answer all my curious questions about the vast array of hot sauces the store stocks.

We took our wings to Baker Beach (best view of the Golden Gate Bridge), as the store doesn't have seating - and who needs seating when you're so close to some of the worlds most prized sights, Golden Gate Park included!

Keep up the great work, and see you soon Panko!
author: Jared K.

description:
The Ultra Goliath chicken and waffle sandwich is absolutely amazing! The sandwich is HUGE. I was full after eating half, but forced myself to eat the other half because it was too good to quit. The Sriracha gives the sandwich the perfect kick without being too spicy, and I added some maple syrup to add some sweet to the savory.

The place is tiny (only two small tables at the front), so I don't recommend trying to eat there.

Will definitely be back to try some wings!
author: Jordan N.

description:
Wings here are definitely above average and would come back to try the different flavors. The most important though is that you've got to try the different hot sauces. They made the wings so much better!

Ramen Wings - 3/5. Although this is the main reason I came, but I was a bit disappointed. It's exactly what you'd expect (although they have a fish sauce that you pour over), but for some reason I was expecting something magical. Must have been all the hype. However, would be fine with ordering this again.

Lime - 4/5. Very intriguing flavor profile! Would definitely get again.

Chris's - 3/5. Typically the sweet & savory crossover ends poorly for me, but it worked! Would order again.

Bulgogi - 2/5. Although as a whole the execution was well done, it just didn't suit my tastes. If you enjoy a teriyaki wing, I'd suggest this - otherwise, might want to be more adventurous.
author: Gabriel C.

description: Nothing extraordinary about this place, there is no taste or flavors to the wings. I order chipotle and green and it seems to me that they are regular fried wings with sauce just sprinkle on top.
author: Melanie N.

description:
chicken wings 5/5

Came here several times and it never disappoints. They don't always have the same flavours so the next time you go, your fav wings might not be there anymore. I would recommend bacon wrapped anything. The wings have different textures too, so its not all the same wings with different sauce. Some have thick batter, some are dry fried, some are drenched in juicy sauce. One order has 6-8 wings and costs around $8.

This place only has about 6 seats inside surrounding a pock marked table and about 10 standing/sitting space outside with tables. So take your food to the park or to go. 

Just a tip, bring your own waters, all drinks are about $2.50. They are "helping" the california drought by no longer offering free water for customers -_-
author: Cecile S.

description:
Tried this place out a couple of nights ago with a friend who is a HUGE fan. I must say I am as well! I got the Sriracha Wings, or were they called "Rooster Wings"? Whatever, the case, they were great and came with a nice spicy mayo sauce on the side. 

Shared a waffle for dessert and I was in heaven. Fluffy, buttery, and comes with a huge variety of toppings on the side such as caramel, strawberry sauce, chocolate, white chocolate, etc. 

Limited seating inside but they have some outdoor seating if it's not too cold. It wasn't the best wings I've ever had in my life, but I definitely enjoyed them and will be coming back because I love wings. So glad to find this place!
author: Cara O.

description: Best hot wings I have EVER had. The flavors are amazing!! I also tried the chicken waffle sandwich which did not disappoint. Don't forget to get a hot sauce too! They have a huge wall of the spiciest hot sauces I've ever tasted. Small place that's always packed, but totally worth it.
author: Sara D.

description: Good tasting wings for relatively inexpensive prices.  I would have liked the wings a little crispier.  Also, I wish they had a couple more tables for people who just wanted to eat there wings there.  This is a takeout place definitely.
author: Brian S.

description: It's a perfect spot for a quick lunch or savory bites  before heading to the next bars.
author: Ichi Y.

description:
The chicken wings are AMAZING!

I tried the green wings (cilantro jalapeno ginger sesame oil house spice mix) since I wasn't sure what to get as they had 13 different wing options today. I'm definitely coming back to try the other wings though I am certainly interested in trying the ghost pepper wings.

They also offer waffle sandwiches. Who can deny the combination that is chicken and waffles?!

They have an interesting sense of humor in the window especially with a picture of Christopher Walken.
author: Jeffrey Q.

description: Great wings. Largest retail Hot Sauces for sale I've ever seen. Very friendly staff and generally happy place. All people working were laughing and joking. Overall a great experience.
author: David M.

description: Best wings I've ever had, hands down! Lime is super flavorful if you're craving something with an Asian flair... Chase's is a great go to. Mango habanero is a whimsical choice. I recommend trying one of each style every time you're in... They're all great!
author: Rashmi J.

description: My first time coming here, I ordered the korean wings and they were amazing. Some of the best wings I've ever had. The ranch I ordered on the side wasnt necessary at all. I cant wait to come back and try the other flavors.
author: Nick L.

description: I've had two experiences at Hot Sauce and Panko (although at their old location, so take that with a grain of salt, I suppose) - some of the wings were incredible, some were just ok. I suppose it depends on when and what you order. My suggestion would be to go for the Korean or Chris's wings because they're a little more known for that and maybe stay away from more traditional wings, like buffalo. They do have a crazy hot sauce selection available to purchase, so definitely check that out too!
author: Megan V.

description:
do not make the same mistake I did. I got only one takeout order of wings and one goliath sandwich. I am stoopid. 

after my first bite of the parm panko wings (so crunchy. so crispy. yet so juicy), which is, btw not spicy at all unless you dredge it in the accompanying chipotle mayo, I almost climbed back into my car and drove back across the bridge to get me some more. but then my 1st order would get cold! what a dilemma! then, after my first bite of the goliath sando (such pillowy waffles, soft and sweet wrapped around spicy-sauced chicken), I just lay down on my floor and wept.
author: Sasha R.

description: My favorite restaurant in SF. The Goliath sandwich is the core survival food for the apocalypse, hangover, or a perfect high class meal
author: Parker S.

description: A gem in the city! Our family is in the city for five days but we ordered take out from here twice.  Try to order early as they tend to run out the popular flavors.  Our favorite is Green and Big Bay.
author: Jenny L.

description:
"You're going to bring wings, right?"

This is what follows every time I'm invited to a pot luck now.
I used to cook fancy foods for dinner parties - braised short ribs, 5-cheese gratin potatoes, grilled polenta. You get my drift.
Ever since HS&P moved into my neighborhood, my culinary experiments have been relegated to the back burner, in favor of delicious Korean Fried Chicken and spicy Green jalapeno wings.

The menu changes frequently and for me, that's a good thing. These guys are creative, quirky, and their inspiration shines through.
Despite some negative folks (haters gonna hate), this place is almost always busy, and during football season, has been known to sell out of wings, so get there early or place a phone order in advance.
Be patient (quality takes time), be prepared (parking is nonexistent), and be kind (to the staff), and you'll be rewarded with some tasty spicy creations!

[And, yes, I'm going to keep bringing wings.]
author: Kevin C.

description: These wings give San Tung a run for their money. Chris's wings are the perfect combination of sweet and sassy. The beer wings are solid as well. Can't go wrong with lime, either. But seriously, just order Chris's wings, you will not be disappointed!
author: Jim G.

description:
Friendly and fast service.  They definitely know their stuff when it comes to hot sauce.  I came at 2 on a Friday and got to sit inside.  One wall has shelves of hot sauce for sale.
I ordered the Kentucky-yaki flavor and of course had to try the Ghost Pepper.  I also ordered a waffle.
The Kentucky-yaki was sweet and sticky.  When first brought out, the wings were still crispy.  Good teriyaki flavor and no spice at all if you don't like spicy wings.
The waffle was everything I expected from a waffle.  Light, crisp, and able to hold a ton if syrup.
The Ghost Pepper wings were definitely the star.  The wings come dry with the house made ghost pepper sauce on the side.  The dry rub is pretty spicy by itself.  Maybe a 6 or 7 out of 10.  The ghost pepper sauce is made with lime.  I literally drank it straight from the cup.  It hit my stomach pretty hard that way but it was worth it.  The spice was 9/10 and is a bit of a creeper.
I look forward to going back and trying more flavors!
author: Audrey D.

description: I went to this place when they were over on Clement hella good wings. Hella hella good wings!! Tried to go back 2 more times at their new location but there's no parking there a all be prepared to walk 4 blocks to get there up hills or down Hills. Which kind of takes away from The Allure of the place it used to be a small little cutty Wing Spot easy access in a quieter part of the city now well I can't really tell because I can't even get there but if they still make wings like they used to they definitely get 5 stars lol!
author: Keno M.

description: I'm so glad we made the trip. This place has the best hot sauce and wings. Light crisp texture on the chicken and flavors are bursting in spices! Go. There's chomp and swig next door w good beer and sides too! You can order wings and tell them you're eating next door and they will deliver if they aren't so busy. I'm hooked. You will be too.
author: Marlene T.

description:
If I had to choose what my last meal on earth would be, it would definitely be tacos aside from fried chicken wings as my next choice.  But in this case, wings it will be!  If you live in San Francisco you have to know what Hot Sauce and Panko is!  Hot Sauce and Panko is a small, hole in the wall Korean friend chicken spot that serves one of the best tasting fried chicken in the city!  I discovered Hot Sauce and Panko through a first date I had with my current boyfriend at the moment.  He took me here because it was one of his favorite wing spots to eat at.  Now that we go often and visit Hot Sauce and Panko, we always get our favorite flavors.  I would recommend anyone trying the Goju Wings, Chris' Honey Salty Crispy Wings, the Sriracha wings, and the Garlic Parmesan and Bacon wings also.  All the flavors I would say are worth trying because they are all so different compared to other Korean restaurants like Toyose, Wing Stop, or basic Buffalo Wild Wings.  (I even feel bad for comparing Hot Sauce and Panko to Wingstop of BWW lol.) 

At Hot Sauce and Panko right when you walk in, you will notice it's a very small shop that is mainly based as a to-go restaurant.  Their purpose is not to have people sit, eat and enjoy, but their main purpose is just to sell amazing wings!  They also have a wall of hot sauces that you can pick from.  it's a really interesting shop, very unique also.  Like who would have thought to make a quick to-go Korean fried chicken spot that had a wide variety of hot sauces that you can't get in the grocery stores!? Such a brilliant idea! =) 

Also, watch out on Superbowl Day, they will not sell wings unless you call ahead about a day to place an order, or choose to buy their 30 wing combo pack with only certain flavors to choose from; just a heads up!
author: Rachel V.

description: When are these guys gonna be deemed a historic landmark? Best wings in SF? NorCal? CA? Yup, I think so!
author: Joshua F.

description:
PARKING
Neighborhood street

HOURS
Wednesday-Saturday: 12- 6:30pm
Sunday: 12-5:30pm

I use to live across the street from this place and now, I'm so sad that I don't.  I would usually call in to order, pick it up, and eat at home. There's barely any room to dine in. Unless you don't mind people staring at you munching on your wings, the space is really tight. 

I've only ordered the KFC, Korean fried chicken because it's just too delicious not to get. It's $6.49 for a small and another $4.59 for a huge wafffle. 

On Thursdays, they give free waffles for purchases of small or large wings. (Find out looking on their website)

Oh, and if you LOVE hot sauce like I do, there is a good variety of hot sauces you can purchase here. They even have some on the side for you to try with your wings.
author: Christina T.

description:
They have a hot sauce wall! I wasn't brave enough to try the ghost pepper sauce. It's not really a sit down restaurant. I called ahead to take out and they actually called me when my order was ready. Good service!

I was disappointed they were out of their popular Green wings. I ended up with bulgogi, kfc, 10 spice, and panko. They know how to maintain moistness and especially crispy skin for the dry rubs. Really good! I'm undecided about these asian inspired flavors though. Should have added on some sweet potato fries or a waffle for something sweet.

These are hulk sized chicken wings. Keep that in mind when pre-ordering. I'm accustomed to those dainty wings at Wingstop so i estimated i would need to order 2 pans for 4 people.... Ended up with an extra tray of wings! Each pan comes with 24 wings. You can choose up to 3 flavors per pan.
author: Samantha L.

description:
I live in the neighborhood, or...the chicken coop as I call it.  Yea, and when I'm in the coop I get. my. pecking on!  Like a real Chicken Little! Chicken Wangs are big thangs. And if the sky was falling THIS is where I BEE.  Humble like a bumble bee. Hot. Sauce. &. Panko! If you dont know now you know Mondays.

Only thang is they closed too much.  When a Travis monster needs his wangs he can't always be waiting til noon.  Wang Thang from my Dangalang. Sweet nectar.
author: Travis W.

description: I have lived in this neighborhood for 23 years and was mortified to see a beloved family-run restaurant, U Lee, vacate the premises for this overrated and woefully mediocre joint. I've spent a goodly amount of time in Buffalo, home of the original chicken wings, and believe me, this place can't hold a candle (or wing) to the real deal. Not only that, but the one time I went there the counter person was rude and tried to stiff me on the blue cheese dressing (!)--quite the depressing contrast to being greeted by the chef at U Lee, who beamed the second I walked in. This place is yet another example of how the city's best is being replaced by trendy, insipid wannabes catering to millennials who think they're on to the latest coolest thing.
author: T. C.

description:
It's a shame that the owners are not available to keep the store open during weekdays the past few weeks. My condolences to the family.

When I moved to San Francisco, I never thought I would experience the same quality of  inexpensive good eats like I did in LA. The food in LA is cheap and delicious.. and you just can't find that in a city where trendy comes with a hefty price tag, and the startup salaries skew the cost of living / cost of food exponentially compared to other cities. But let's forget about that for a second.

One fine day, an Uber driver told me about a hole in the wall joint where wings comes in all sorts of crazy flavors, and I said, pfffft.. how is that possible? They are probably greasier and pricier than the wings at a lowbrow chicken wing chain *cough cough wingstop/hooters*. I regrettably went weeks without giving it a shot. 

A few more people told me about it and I wondered how a hole-in-the-wall could have so much buzz about it. I couldn't resist it any longer and finally caved in. One bite of the green and KFC wings, and I've been hooked ever since. 

Recently, I tried the parm wings and old bay with sriracha caramel flavored, and they were all delicious, crispy, tender, and full of flavor. I'm determined to try them all.
author: Fiona Y.

description: OMG omg this place is sooooo dope!! I've only been living in the Bay Area for 8 months and I must say coming from good ol South Georgia. Hot sauce and Panka totally made me love the west coast a lot more!! I got there famous waffle and 6 piece combo!!...and a extra 6 of sweet chili! They totally blew my tastebuds away!!!
author: Calvin R.

description: I discovered this place back when it was out in the richmond & since moving back downtown I couldn't be more stoked that it's moved. Only thing more exciting is these ramen wings. I'm dead.
author: J A.

description:
Korean Fried and a waffle on the side. DONE.

The chicken wings are SO moist and delicious, and the sauce is so finger-licking perfect. Two people can easily split a large order, but if you're hungry, one large for one person plus a waffle will do the trick.

Definitely be ready to wrestle for one of four seats inside the actual restaurant if you plan to stay there. Otherwise be comfortable eating on the curb outside or standing up next to the two tables out front.
author: Bianca P.

description: Tell me these aren't the Best Wings in SF?  OK, haven't tried them all, however they are terrific!  And the price is right.  Friendly staff & owner.  Spoke to him some time ago when they were in the Richmond but could hardly ever get there.  Parking problems aside, can't beat Jackson & Hyde for local access.  Lines in the late afternoon & early evening so I try & go mid-afternoon.  Green, Chris's, Sticky are a few of my faves however it's fun to try 'em all & pick your own!  If you're in Portland try the wings at Pok Pok. 5 Stars too, but hey, this is SF not Portland!  Not a flack for this place but Get in Here!
author: Joshua C.

description:
My Standard Hot Sauce & Panko Order that I suggest you duplicate:

**Large - Old Bay Wings - sriracha caramel, need I say more?  Basically crack
**Small - Chris' Wings - pepper, salt, honey, yum
**Ultra Goliath Sandwich - chicken, waffle, oh that sriracha caramel sauce again

Call your order in ahead of time - walk over, pick up, walk back home - don't feel as much as a fat A** :)
author: Jana S.

description:
This place is amazing! The wings are a work of art. I like the standards korean fried and sticky pepper garlic. I've been here so many times, I'm actually starting to get tired of wings...LOL

Seeing those who have given negative reviews of Hot Sauce and Panko is really disappointing. Come on...this is a small mom & pop business that makes chicken wings that you would be hard press to find anywhere else. The food is high quality and made in small batches. Every single wing is made with absolute passion. I guess some yelpers just gotta hate :-(
author: Stephanie L.

description:
An order of chicken and waffles from Hot Sauce and Panko has fast become a Sunday tradition. 

I've actually taken it upon myself to try every type of chicken wing they serve, stymied only by the fact that they continuously add new, delicious flavors.

Overall impression:

Waffles: literally, the best I've ever had.
Wings: can't beat them. Mango Habanero is my current favorite.
Lines: suck. Almost always out the door.
Ghost Pepper Wings: if you order/eat them, be sure to wash your hands before using the restroom.
author: Steven B.

description:
Well, I finally got into this place on my sixth attempt.  I must have hit a lull in the middle of the day, because it only took me 15 minutes to find a parking space, and there were only three people in front of me in line.

I ordered four different types of wings and took them home for dinner.  I was expecting that they wouldn't be as good after the drive, but in spite of the minor wilting of the crispiness that they originally must have had, I enjoyed all four flavors.  

I think the two things that stood out most were the plump-and-juiciness of the wings (not typical of deep-fried wings), and the fact that even though I ordered everything from honey-sweet to what I assumed was blazing hot, everything was edible, not only to me (a chili head), but to my partner as well (who thinks mayonnaise is too spicy).  Of course, I used some recently-purchased hot sauce on mine to give them a bigger kick, but even without the added Schoville units, they were really good.  I would take them over Original Buffalo Wings, Wing Stop, or Buffalo Wild Wings any day.

The place is dinky, but some of the best places are.  It appears to be family-run.  The cook had all the focus of a Cordon Bleu chef, and clearly took pride in what he was doing.  The counter person lacked a bubbly personality, but she was nice enough and very efficient, but was probably tired after a long day.

All in all, it was a good experience, and worth the total of six attempts it took to finally get in the place and try it out.  I was ready to upgrade my review to five stars--that is until I read the owner's response to my first review.  He seemed miffed and defensive, and if there was any doubt that he lacked customer service skills, the last line in his response cleared that up:  " ...please don't bother updating your review as I will not serve you."

Really?  

First of all, business owners don't get to tell customers what they may or may not write about them on Yelp.

Secondly, the owner may be riding high right now because his place was featured in the Chronicle, resulting in a sudden surge in business.  Maybe that has gone to his head, and he thinks that the popularity of this place will keep riding that wave indefinitely.  

But, as they say, "what goes up, must come down."  Eventually he will not be on the point of the hipster spear.  And when that happens, he's going to have to rely on the quality of his product--and the good will of those customers who don't just move on to the next popular fad, but with whom he has built lasting relationships.

And telling customers that he will not serve them is not the way to build relationships.
author: Nickolas M.

description:
As a native we try not to support these hipster business because they have no respect for the city they're destroying. Yet I was gonna try this place today so I read up on it. I still wanted to give it a shot after seeing that review below, until I read the reply. At first I thought he everyone has a bad experience maybe you got unlucky or you both are misunderstanding each other's fault, but I have never seen an "owner" go out the way to defend themselves. Yea I get it don't be a pushover but if you were confident in your own service quality, you wouldn't have to react to someone being incredibly unjust. I mean I've seen most replies go something like "hey sorry this and that lets try and fix this even if you're wrong or I'm wrong". Hell even if you are wrong, there is no professionalism in bashing the customer the way this establishment attack certain 1 star reviews on Yelp.
Even after all these signs, I decided to try. Rudely "greeted", felt rushed even after explaining its my first time, and was practically ignored until I left. To those who love food I hope theirs is better than their service, I'll never find out. And to the natives, these are the money sucking resource destroying establishments we avoid. Please do not support.
author: Jun S.

description: I always regret coming here after getting their food. Super delicious but super heavy. Friendly staff and reasonably priced.
author: Dani N.

description: I got here around 2pm on a Friday... No wait which was awesome. I ordered the two of the top sellers (Chris's and Korean). The wings were a little on the small side but they made up for it by giving me an extra piece or two. The skin wasn't as crispy as I liked but the meat was moist. The KFC was alright. I had better KFC from other places. The Chris was by far the better one in my opinion. It was a sweet and salty sauce. Would I come back here? Definitely since I wanted to try the other flavors since they sounded really good but I didn't have the stomach to eat like 30 wings
author: Jimmy P.

description:
Don't get the spicy wings - they are joke "ha ha, look at you screaming and coughing and crying" spicy. Not enjoyable.

But otherwise fine.
author: Alex R.

description: Chris's style wings were what dreams are made of. Or at least what my dreams will be made of for the next month. I'm drooling right now just thinking about it. Get it. Eat it. Love it.
author: Alix M.

description:
This is a legit hole-in-the-wall with 1, 2 small tables inside (sitting) & two bar tables outside.  Location is easy and convenient to get to, especially for those of us living in the Sunset, Parkside, and Richmond districts; you will, though easily miss it if you drive too quickly.  Parking is challenging, but still a little easier than in the Haight, as Hot Sauce and Panko is located in a residential neighborhood.   And since it's a hole-in-the-wall, I highly recommend calling your order in ahead of time; I did this and I picked and paid for my wings easily, and still nice and hot.  I ordered 2 small orders of wings: "Chris's wings" & "Kentucky-yaki"; loved the sweet, tangy flavor of the Kentucky-yaki; Chris's wings tasted similar but had a tiny peppery kick, which may not be tasted if you're a fan of extra spicy flavors.  Both types of wings were crispy on the outside and tender on the inside.
I don't care how long it takes to find parking,  I'll definitely frequent the shop and will be sure to try the KFC (Korean Fried Chicken) and their waffle sando as those received popular reviews.
author: Jessica S.

description:
One word: Delicious!!! 
This retail store of hot sauces is only one block from my home and I always wanted to try their wings and waffle.
I am glad I did!! They open at noon so I called 10 minutes before to place in a phone order for pickup.
I ordered waffle combo with chili crunch wings and waffle combo with beer battle wings. Order ready for pick up in 15 mins! It was busy but not too busy because they just opened and that was perfect timing because if I came later I am sure it would be lines. I saw lines all the way to the other block! That's how busy they get! So come early or order for pick up 10 mins before they open if you don't want to wait too long.
The waffle is just perfect and the chili crunch wings (8 pieces) just delicious! Crunchy tops with red chili flakes and spicy but not too spicy!!
I'll be back and order the same thing. Unfortunately the beer (I can't remember the full name) wings are not my favorite.
I think I just consumed 1200 calories in one sitting but I don't care!! It's sooo delicious I don't I care about the calories anymore lol
author: Ty N.

description: Heavenly combinations but the biggest let down is how cheap the wings are - all gristle and fat - such a shame as the marinades are so well thought out and made - would Noor come again? Sadly not
author: Noor A.

description:
So good...... Why?

1. Mom and Pop nicely run family business.
2. Unique novelty hot sauces and overall one of a kind place. Hidden gem
3. fingerlickin good ass chicken wings. My fav is the green but im on a mission to try them all literally all.  Most recent was Bourban-Yaki (yum)
4. Walk from my house makes me feel good when people line up from all over.

***Keep it up guys!!! You rock!****
author: Darina N.

description: There wings and waffles are delicious ! The place is really small so plan on eating it outside or taking it to go ! The food travels well we took ours to go and ate it after about 20 min it was still warm and delicious ! Try the Korean wings they were the best ! And their waffles are a must !
author: Laura M.

description: Very delicious chicken wings. I want to give 5 stars for the wings but the service kindda slow and the shop extreamely small!!!! But because of the delicious wings I gave 5 stars lol
author: Orange S.

description: These are the best wings in the city, bar-none. And since they've recently moved to Hyde street it's a short uber from the financial district, and the perfect getaway for your lunch break! They have the perfect lunch deal, too - 6 wings and a huge waffle for $10.99. I recommend the ramen wings, they're unique and incredibly tastey.
author: Clay P.

description:
When I lived in SF, this was my GO TO spot in the Richmond - we'd eat here at LEAST once a week. I love Terrance and the whole HS&P family for their delicious food and their hard work. They were even kind enough to name wings after my boyfriend, and later, some wings after me! 

Forget all these ENTITLED "YELP ELITE" CRY BABIES and their poor reviews about HS&P (and any business, really). Many of you must know that the yelp elite are a huge joke, don't inflate their egos as they're over compensating for an exciting life that they strongly lack. if you like listening to babies cry, then its your loss and you're missing out on great foods around SF. If they had any idea, what kind of work goes into owning, operating and maintaining a popular small business than they wouldn't be such unbearable cock gobblers and they would be decent human beings who can respect others time/space/work. 

KEEP DOING WHAT YOU DO, TERRANCE! Much love from your loyal customers in the pacific north west... the wings DO NOT COMPARE up here... not by a long shot! 

TIPS:
don't be a dick - don't open new hot sauces without permission
don't be a dick - don't steal their products, lick open products, take excessive amounts of free products *napkins/wetnaps/syrup*
don't be a dick - and show up 5 minutes before closing and EXPECT a smile or a warm greet, YOU AINT GETTING YOUR WINGS BITCH
don't be a dick - and cry about your "negative" experience on yelp because you're just a nasty, negative person. i would be fuckin embarrassed to go out dining with you. 

DO be kind, patient and gracious. Bus your own tables. Clean up after yourself. And THANK AND TIP these kind folks for their time and talent.
author: K B.

description: This place has amazing wings, had the Kentucky yakis and they were delicious. Also tried the waffle sandwich, really filling and great fried chicken. Wish the waffle was toasted but other than that pretty good. Location is extremely small so make sure to get take out.
author: Josue V.

description:
Super guilty pleasure food. We (non)-justified getting lunch here after a not-so-strenuous hike from Marshall's Beach and Land's End.

We ordered 2 small orders of wings (16 wings total) and 1 waffle - more than enough food for the 2 of us. We ordered the Sriracha Caramel and Old Bay. Essentially the former are wet and the latter are dry wings. I liked both but I think the Old Bay did it for me. Loved the light breadedness (such a fattie)  and tender meat inside. The Sriracha Caramel was spicy and (a little too) sweet.
The waffle was soft and hot and fresh. I wanted to inhale the sweetness.

They have an amazing collection of hot sauces from around the world. Red sauces, green sauces, Louisiana hot sauce, Mexican sauce, even a completely clear "frost" sauce where the label warns that there is "nothing frosty about it".

I wish they had more seating, a public bathroom, and more hours of operation. I drank a lot of water with the meal and it would have been nice to have a bathroom to use. Also try not to go towards the end of their open hours - we went at 5:00 pm on Sunday the first time and they had run out of food. Sad face.

Munch on that wing and take a bite of waffle in between - the perfect way to enjoy serious comfort food.
author: Brandy A.

description:
The first time we came here I got the Ultra Goliath Waffle Sandwich while my SO played it safe and got wings. The sandwich was amazing and while I had some regrets over the potential calories, that was quickly overridden by the fact it was incredibly tasty and delicious. My SO had the Sizzling Rice wings which were also tasty (but my sandwich dominated my palate so...
