Most recently my SO went back and ordered 4 different types of wings: Green, Chris's, Mango Habanero, and Buffalo Wings. They were all so delicious. 

We still have yet to try the hot sauces (we will... eventually) but I have to say that everything we've had so far as been delicious and the service has been great.
author: Shauna S.

description: The wings were good and meaty. A little too spicy but still delicious after dipped in their creamy ranch. The thing I didn't like was that the place is very small and there's only one table to sit and eat. I was with a large group so we couldn't fit. Also, even though my friend ordered food from there but had to eat outside, they wouldn't accept the trash from their own restaurant. He had to walk around the whole block just to find a trash can. A little ridiculous. 4 stars for the food but 2 stars for everything else.
author: Samantha H.

description:
Who can resist chicken & waffles?

This is a cute lil joint but for some reason the smell of the waffles and the asian garlic seasoning in the restaurant made me nauseous. Nonetheless, I liked browsing through the museum of hot sauces. We got a few good laughs, some of my favorites including "ass reaper" and "colon cleanser." I don't think I'd be able to put down a hot sauce lending itself to emptying the bowels of its consumers, but to each his own. 

I also loved the fact that there were several hot sauces to try in the condiments section ranging from an exotic ketchup to ghost chili hot sauce. They also have bacon syrup which is a must try if you get a waffle, wings with bacon syrup actually don't sound half bad either. 

Anyways, got the green wings and found them salty and a bit too crispy for my taste. Lots of wing meat but very crispy casing. Also the "green" is more like a seasoning rather than a sauce so this is a dry wing. The flavors were unique, full of spice and reminiscent of green indian chutney. Small mom and pop shop, two people behind the counter making the wings to order so expect to wait at least 10-15 minutes. No public restrooms but an endless supply of free water from a trusty brita filter.
author: Kelly Z.

description:
There's no more hot sauce at home.. wait, WTF!?

                           THIS. 
                              IS. 
                               A. 
                          STATE. 
                             OF. 
                    EMERGENCY.

(but lets rewind a little bit) 

After finishing up my evening workout at 24 Hour Fitness, I was contemplating what I should eat for dinner and it just occurred to me that I didn't have any Sriracha left at home.. (the hot sauce you see everywhere that serves pho). 

wait.. what!? How could I let this happen!? Arghh!

Never fear, Hot Sauce and Panko is here! (and open til 8PM)

Hot Sauce and Panko is truly a neighborhood gem! It's a very small family operated grocery store that (only) sells an impressive array of various hot sauces from all around the world, and also specializes in cookin' up all things spicy; in this case, bomb-ass chicken wings! 

Green Wings  + KFC (Korean Fried Chicken) - http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=NjO83KcGv4bGX8_FexVCag&userid=5jUlCtMCI9Z7poi1vHq6cQ
5 wings for $4.99 or 10 for $9.99 (it's the same thing but you get the point). I opted for the Top 2 best sellers; Green Wings (a concoction of green peppers, chilies and spices) and the KFC wings (kimchi flavored with various chili spices as well). The green wings were extra crispy and set off a good heat in my mouth but I would have to say I loved the KFC more. For one, the KFC wings are noticeably huge-er and the savory sweet sauce that coated the succulent plump wings was amazing! 

Keep in mind that there are also dozens of available hot sauces to try out at the counter for your pleasure! Sweet, I mean.. Spicy!

On a side note, the lady that took my order was very silent and never smiled at all.. however, when I received my wings from the gentlemen in the back, who is the master-chef of these delicious winged concoctions and remained hustling to knock out numerous orders in a timely manner, he gave me the biggest sincere smile that simply showed how much he loved what he does. I couldn't help but to smile back. 

Oh, and yes, I didn't forget to grab my bottle of Sriracha too, and at $5 for the large bottle, what a bargain!
author: Albert L.

description: I wonder if the nearby convenience stores are used to people bursting in asking for milk and napkins with tear all over their faces.
author: Changbai L.

description: So glad this company is in the neighborhood!  We got the teriyaki, ramen, and green wings--all really good.  Inside is small and limited seating, but easy to get in and get out.  Will be coming back for more :)
author: Tim C.

description: One of my new favorite restaurants in San Francisco. Panko has a large variety of delicious and interesting flavors to choose from. I particularly love spicy food. If you've ever had nashville-style hot chicken, the ghost pepper wings here are the closest you are going to get in the city. Panko is a cute little spot on the corner with friendly service and even better food. Highly recommend.
author: Jake L.

description:
I was pretty disappointed with this place.

Ordered:

Green Wings: 3/5 These were alright. The wings were a tad small. They definitely aren't worth "dying for". These wings were pretty ordinary to me, the flavor wasn't anything spectacular and the selection of wings they offered that day weren't very special.

Sticky Pepper Wings: 0/5 These were TERRIBLE. My god, I took one bite and spit it right out. Don't order these. They were drenched in salt and tasted completely burnt. Was this even chicken?

Service: 0/5 I ordered two orders of wings and it took at least 25 minutes for me to receive my order. The place wasn't busy at all, only other customers seated with their food. There was neither a place to sit and wait nor a place to stand in the restaurant so I just went next door to Chomp N' Swig and ordered fries so I could sit comfortable and wait for my food. The lady who finally gave me my order shoved the two boxes in my hands that were wide open and left. The boxes they serve the chicken in CANNOT be closed. I ordered these wings to go by the way. The boxes are WAY too small to hold a SMALL order of wings. They also didn't give me a bag, napkins, or any utensils (if you need them) so go figure. I tried asking for a bag and napkins but the lady completely ignored me, I tried getting her attention but after a few minutes I gave up and just left.
author: Courtni W.

description:
The place is TINY, slow, and overhyped. We came here on a Saturday at around 1PM and ended up having to wait almost an hour for our food. We originally came here for ramen wings, but found out that they weren't selling them anymore. So instead, we ordered two sets of wings: KFC and lime.

The wings themselves weren't crispy and were pretty soggy from all the sauce. The KFC flavor wasn't too bad, but we've had better (Bon Chon). But, the lime flavor was pretty dry and flavorless.

This place is best for take-out and make sure you phone ahead to order. Overall, we wouldn't come back. The price and wings aren't worth the wait.
author: NoonNarin N.

description:
So I see I caused some damage where they are eliminating the ramen wings completely. Sorry to everyone who are affected by it. What did I do for the business to decide not to have ramen wings anymore? I'm just reviewing in my opinion. Don't put the blame on me where you couldn't supply such a famous demand and just decided to take it off your menu. Now my reply to the blogger from their website. Where is your professionalism in telling me to go to hell? Clearly you DO NOT know how to run a business especially with that attitude expecting people to still come to your place. I'm not telling you how to run a business, I was stating my opinion. Customer experience is a big factor and you just made it worst. Everyone, you still choose to come here?
________
This place is so popular, but I want to know why they only have ONE guy and ONE mixing bowl for all the chicken wing flavors??? Inefficient. 

They became more popular because of their ramen chicken wings so I decided to come here on a Sunday at 1pm. They open at 12pm and when I went to order the ramen wings...they were sold out! In an hour?!! They probably didn't have any even if we came at 12pm because apparently, they said someone phoned in yesterday to pick up for today. Should that be a sign for you to stock up on your ingredients? For a business to run efficiently and profitably, there's definitely some work to do on improving.

Since we already made a trip here, we shall order.

Green - I liked this flavor the best.
Bulgogi - sweet and tangy flavor
Red Rooster - sweet and tangy also?
Waffles - soft and warm. It was pretty good.

The order took 35 minutes to make but luckily there is Chomp n Swig right next door where we can hang out at.

Overall, it's an OK place. Wings round out to be $1 each and not every wing is meaty. Im happy with just going to Buffalo Wild Wings honestly. I have to give them props for their wall of hot sauce though. Need a bottle? Just come here, but you might take awhile to choose just one.
author: Nancy N.

description:
Very cool place. Good selection of hot sauce, wings and things. Place is tiny so go at an odd hour or order To Go.  

Tried several of the wings and waffles, and they all passed the flavor exam. I typically prefer standard buffalo wings but I can appreciate a wing that's outside the box, in the  taste department.
author: Masato W.

description:
So happy they open in my neighborhood.

Love the greens and chili crunch.

Going to go there everyday.
author: Mary Anne C.

description:
Still extra crispy. 
Phoned in my order, said it'd be ready in 10 mins. I took my time getting there. Eventually got there 40 mins later, 10 min walk home to eat it and it was still crispy n warm.  Most wings if you let it sit in sauce for awhile, it gets soggy. But this was still nice and crispy! Yum. 
I was debating on which flavor to get and browsed the other photos to help me decide. Unfortunately, the ramen wings are not available and not on their regular menu. I thought maybe, just maybe it was on a "secret" menu that I didn't know about. Nope, none, na-da. Oh well, stuck to the usual order of Korean Fried aka KFC and satisfied!
author: Christi S.

description:
I'm not usually a big wings guy but this place is fantastic. If it were open later, I would probably come here every night. It's super convenient, affordable, and delicious. The only time I may recommend not going here is on a date... unless you're a very skilled wings eater. It's awesome food, but your date will probably not be impressed by your ability to gnaw and suck every last piece of meat off a chicken bone.

You can't go wrong with any of the wings here but if you're going for the best value you gotta get that waffle sandwich. I don't know of anywhere you can that much good food for $7. It's almost two full meals, or one very hungry John sized meal. Hot Sauce and Panko is definitely a staple of this part of the Richmond and always a great spot for lunch on the weekends.
author: John D.

description:
Today was my first day at Hot Sauce and Panko, and I came to this place already with the knowledge that the wings were frozen then cooked.  

I got there about 15 minutes before they closed, and the line was out the door.  The sign said the kitchen wasn't taking anymore orders, but they still took mine!  Good first impression! 

Upon ordering, I was excited to try the famous "Chris'" wings, but to my dismay, they sold out.  My boyfriend and I ended up ordering a large "Sticky Pepper Garlic" and "Green".  In my opinion, the sticky pepper garlic was a bit salty, almost like it was immersed in soy sauce and not enough garlic.  On the other hand, green was my FAVORITE.  I am such a big fan of jalapeno; however, it wasn't as spicy as I thought it would be...not even spicy at all...but I was still really happy with it! 

I'll definitely be back to try the other flavors.  

But...

A word to the wise...

Parking can be a challenge.
author: H. C.

description:
Would I come here again? No. Go to Chomp and Swig instead - way better customer service, tons of beer to choose from, TVs to watch and cheaper, better food. And if you must... they'll let you bring in wings from next door. 

Overall GRADES:
Food: B-
Portions: C-
Service/Wait-times: F

DETAILS
Wings (green chile, red rooster, bulgogi) -   B
  - moderately tasty, nothing really special. (HINT: San Tung chicken wings are much tastier) 

Waffles -  B
  - pretty good but very standard. Mundane at best - same as the waffles I make at home or at any other brunch place in SF. Regular syrup. $5 per waffle.

Fries -  D
  - I gave them a generous grade here. Cheap but not very good - same fries that come from a school cafeteria. Go next door for garlic fries (much much better).



Portions were beyond TINY. PETITE. XS. BORDERLINE UNBELIEVABLY MINUSCULE. At almost $1/wing, at least have regular sized wings. Waffle was standard size. I have never seen a more stingy amount of fries - it barely filled 2/3 of the container that it was given in.... I really think they made one order of fries and split it into two containers. (Hint: go next door for the fries). Thanks for the portion control but if you're going to give me a kids meal, please don't charge me the full price. On the bright-side, the profit margin must be pretty high.


Waffle - 30min wait. Wings ~45min wait. Luckily, the bar next door let us sit there, order food and beer and later bring in the wings (FYI, grapefruit beer was really good).


Bottom line: It felt like the owner was overall a stingy old man. Rent a small place to save on rent (1 stove?), give small portions of wings and fries, make people wait for +45mins. Run out of ramen wings less than 1hour of opening. Did I mention that they stopped taking any walk-in orders 2hrs into the workday? (on a weekend)

This place might stand a chance if they hire a valid manager with at least a speckling of customer service and business competency. In it's current state, the organization runs worse than congress during the government shutdown.
author: Brian L.

description: Never again.  After seeing how the manager/owner treated his staff the day I walked in to order, I'll never spend another dollar there.  Swearing, throwing things, and acting like a hissy little brat, his behavior was shocking.  Oh, and the wings are grossly overrated.  Greasy and soggy.  Maybe one or two flavors are good, but unimaginative for the most part.
author: william c.

description: Quaint little shop, what it lacks in table accommodation it's makes up for in BIG flavor. Green wings were meh, if you eat them, after you probably won't be hungry. That's about all I have to say about that. Its sustenance, nothing more. Hot wings are buttery and tender, yet uninspired to say the least.
author: Jesse C.

description:
I went when it first opened. Nice Asian family owned business. The restaurant is very small with no seating. The kitchen is visible from behind the counter. They also have a nice selection of unique hot sauces with sample cups to try them! Pretty awesome!

 My friends and I ordered the KFC (Korean fried chicken) and buffalo wings mild. If you like spicy then this is the place for you! The wings have that spicy where it would burn your mouth but you could still taste the flavors. My friends ordered the 100? Wing plate and they gave them more! 

They are also super high tech with the iPad credit card machine. Very hip and yummy chicken Wing joint! Definitely recommend!
author: Daniel S.

description: These wings are a gift to us all. I champion the Thai, Korean, Green, Chris and Satay. We got three types of wings and then realized that we needed two more before we were ready to leave.  My only complaint is that my belly wasn't big enough to also conquer the waffle with chicken smothered in gravy.
author: Jeremy G.

description: I decided to drop by one day after I got done with some errands because I remembered reading such good reviews. There was a line but thank god it wasn't long that day. The place was pretty small, about 2 tables inside if I recalled but there was a table for you to stand outside and eat. They had a shelf full of hot sauces for sale and a lot of funny signs. One of the signs said something about clean up after yourself because your mom doesn't work here and another said they charge a $50 fee for being rude or grumpy haha. So for the wings, I decided to go with the Korean wings and ramen wings that everyone raved about. The Korean wings weren't really spicy and it was just okay. The ramen wings were awesome though, they were really flavorful. They have a rule about 1 order of ramen wings per person unfortunately. If you love wings, give this place a try!
author: Sherman L.

description:
Amazing food and sauce collection. We had tried da bomb sauce last year and had never been able to find it. Lucky for us their selection is huge and we were able to pick up a bottle. 

We tried the green, korean, parmeasen, ramen and chipotle. All of them were so tasty, but we could have ate the green all day long.

The ladies that work there are nice and fast at making your orders. They do not have cups of water and their drink selection is slim. Your choices were coke, diet coke, sprite or bottled water. 

Warning: if you are riding the cable cars, get off at the Jackson and Hyde stop. It is right on the corner across the street. Be prepared to walk down to the piers from there. Some up hill and down hill is expected. Took about 30 minutes. The cable cars will not have room for you to get back on, but trust us, it was worth it!
author: Racheal B.

description:
Come here for quality wings with a good variety. I'm always surprised that there are not more people here whenever I come. Along with the wings, they have all sorts of hot sauces that you can buy to use on anything you'd like. 

Going back to the wings. Among my favorites are the Korean Fried and the Thai Peanut but you can't go wrong with any of the flavors on the menu. They're all delicious! I'm used to 25 cent wings, but even though these are more expensive, I'd choose these over 25 cent wings any day. These are to die for. 

They also have waffles and combos with their chicken (their own version of chicken & waffles) that I have yet to try but I've seen people eating them and they look delicious.

My only complaint is that there is very limited seating because the place is very small. There are only about 4 seats inside and standing room outside for about 5-7 people.

Definitely check this place out!
author: Kevin H.

description: The wings are AMAZINGLY moist and flavorful! I tried two and they were delicious. Will return.
author: Valerie F.

description:
I have high expectation of this place as my picky friend highly recommends it.  She and her coworkers drove all the way from SF downtown to have lunch there.  My first attempt failed as it closed at 6pm.  This time, I got there around 3pm and there is no line.  We even got the one and only table inside the store.  I ordered three small - green, KFC, and sticky pepper.  I also ordered a waffle as it looks good. 

Verdict - all three are just so-so.  The green is just warm which is a huge turn-off to me.  The KFC and sticky pepper are pretty standard too.  They are all too greasy and wet.  It is not "dried" enough and not exactly flavorful.   The best is the waffle - probably because it is fresh off the waffle maker.  

All in all, it is worth a try.  But, I would not go back again.
author: Y Y.

description:
Reminding me of a small fast food place named Frosty's in Chinatown (a staple to those who grew up in Chinatown in '60's and '70's), this shop is known for their chicken wings.  It's on a sleepy stretch of Clement so it's easy to drive right by without noticing it.  While in the neighborhood and not being in the mood on a weekday afternoon, I ordered two sandwiches to go.  
For lunch, I ate half of the fried chicken sandwich (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/NwqdohySKrDnK0RsAde9UA?select=DO2WxtrewHBcdj9jTedS_Q).  The portions are generous, but I'm not particularly a fan of crusty bread.
A few days later, I reheated the rrbblt (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/NwqdohySKrDnK0RsAde9UA?select=QnmonvSDnIQk4yzQCl9nJQ) in the toaster oven.  This reminded me of a BBQ beef sandwich, though the roast beef is thinly rare slices, garnished with a slice of cheese, bacon, and a health dollop of BBQ sauce.  Again, not a fan of the bread.
Both sandwiches are $5.99, very reasonable considering the size.  
While paying, I noticed three diners happily picking through their order of wings.  Will come back to try their signature dish next time, but, replacing the bread, this easily could become a five-star place for me.  Love these owner-run businesses.
author: Mike C.

description: Best wings I've had in SF. They have lots of flavours to choose from. The place is quite small and there's not a lot of room to sit. There's also always a line up, so I usually call ahead and place an order for take out.
author: Suraj C.

description: Juicy wings, sweet wings, and spicy wings. Crispy potatoes and good concept. Big no no.... lack of restroom. I realize its a san francisco (aka big city) thing... but not providing a bathroom for customer might make people wonder if you even have a restroom for employees.... im sure they do have a restroom, im just saying. A rule that i try to live by when dining out: nice clean bathrooms, generally means nice clean food. To be 100% fair, id say their wings were about 3.5 stars.
author: Emilio G.

description: One of the best and interesting wings places I've been to. They have quite limited hours, a huge selection of hot sauces, and some fun toys. Wings come in a large variety of flavors, the "green" might be our favorite, but all the types we've had are awesome. Very limited seating, should take stuff to go. There's usually a bit of a wait. Really love this place, and very very sad to hear that they're closing =( Get here before they close! [Correction! They're not closing, but actually just moving, to 1468 Hyde St. Yay!]
author: Dave Y.

description:
Wow 4 1/2 stars! My itty-bitty 3 star review shouldn't hurt that average at all, right?

The cashier lady never smiled. Not once. But I did appreciate that the one guy busily making all the food in this tiny open kitchen took the time out to smile and say hi, and he was working very hard. 

I love the shelves of outrageously titled hot sauces. Need some of "The Hottest Fuckin' Sauce?" It's effin here! Need some Torani Bacon flavored syrup? They got it!

Onto the food, they were out of the Green Wings, but the KFC (Korean Fried Chicken) wings were delicious. I lucked out and got the last crisp and airy waffle. I also got what I mainly came for, the Fried Chicken Sandwich http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/NwqdohySKrDnK0RsAde9UA?select=Cer1Q6ossjh7t_0nUVWafQ. This sandwich comes with fried chicken, spicy coleslaw, bacon and cheddar. With all these components, you think yummy, but it was lacking flavor. The coleslaw not spicy, the bacon was soggy from being microwaved, the chicken and coating were bland, and I also think that was microwaved =/ The cheese wasn't even melted. Thankfully, there's a table full of hot sauce to pick from. But I feel very little would have been needed for everything else going on with it. 

So yes, delicious KFC wings... friendly guy cooking the food. Why the 3-stars for A-OK? We noticed whoever ate the wings had a little stomach ache later that night. Maybe it was an off day, it was a Sunday football day. I'm sure this pair cooked up tons of chicken wings. Would I go back? If my stomach is up for it!
author: S Y.

description:
This review may be considered blasphemy by some, but that's OK cuz I'm not big on religion anyway. I came here believing in the hype, with the hopes of anointing this place as the chicken wing mecca that others have proclaimed it to be.

This place is very unassuming, sitting on a very quiet block on Clement, looking more like a random novelty shop since the walls are covered with plethora of different kinds of hot sauces together with a bunch of Star Wars figurines, and there is minimal seating. That's kind of a good thing, cuz I could imagine how horrific the wait for wings would be if this place was actually trendy. The lady at the register was very nice and she delivered all of the food to our table even thought we sat right next to the counter. The wings are actually fairly small, which means an average guy can polish off at least 2 small orders on his own. You serve your own water (nice) using small jars as glasses (not so nice, went back for 5 refills). To the food items:

Thai chicken waffle sandwich: Fried chicken is well prepared, with refreshing raw cucumber and pickled(?) jalapenos that gave the impression of the pickled daikon/carrots found on banh mi sandwiches; in fact, they could use some raw carrots or bean sprouts to give this sandwich more crunch. The waffle itself is a little on the flimsier side as it is thick and airy, it would be much better if you ate the mess on top of the waffle as a knife-and-fork job. They are surprisingly skimpy on the peanut sauce as compared to the picture on the website, but thankfully they provide extra sauce free of charge.

Panko 2.0: Their namesake. This order comes out smoldering hot, beware the juices that are released with the first bite. It's essentially delicious chicken katsu with chicken bones to hold so you don't need a knife and fork. Innovative and excellent.

Chris': My friend's favorite. It provides a nice crispy texture, a little peppery kick, and well-balanced flavor. It's essentially a much less saucy and floured version of peppery orange chicken.

Green: A very "Asian herby" mix of flavors, unfortunately the cilantro is a little overpowering. If you like your chicken wings to be "refreshing", then I guess this is as close as you'll get without throwing them in the juicer with some beets and kale. An intriguing flavor that I am going to have to be in the mood for to truly crave...I'm just not sure if I will ever be in the mood for this flavor again.

KFC: Bonchon, you most certainly are not. For those who have experienced Korean fried chicken in NYC or elsewhere, this is does not even come close. First, there is no double-fried crispy goodness that is the hallmark of true Korean fried chicken. Second, the flavoring is predominantly sweet and almost reminiscent of ketchup, offering none of the tanginess or heat that serves as the follow-up punch in the typically delicious KFC 1-2 combo. In fact, a closer flavor profile could probably be achieved by mixing the flavor from Chris' with jalapeno purée. Considering this was the first order that came to our table, we went from unbridled excitement to instantly crestfallen.

I would give this place a 3.5 if possible, in part because they serve a variety of ginger beers (I had the ginger jasmine tea, quite good) and because the absolute lack of fiber somehow did not result in GI distress later that night. I'm still looking to try a bunch of their other chicken wing flavors, and I'd much rather get a waffle on the side, but my expectations will be significantly tempered when I return.
author: Gene C.

description:
I think I need to give this place another chance and I certainly will.

My experience today however was jus "eh" I went Sunday at around 4pm (there was no parking so we decided to get our order to go)

Turns out on Sunday they do not offer full size sandwiches... only "sliders." When I asked why, the guy mumbled something incoherent like "it is too difficult to keep up with sandwich demand on weekends." --- So maybe I'm an idiot , but isn't it MORE work to make MORE (qty) small sandwiches than fewer big sandwiches???

I tried to order Onion rings - they were out.  And apparently I got the 2nd to last slider bun as I hear the cook guy tell the cashier guy "only one more slider left"

We got 2 chicken sliders, Sweet potato fries, and 1 bulgogi beef slider (which, when I asked what it was - the flavor was explained as a "korean beef", which didn't really help -- but I was game to try it)

The "sliders" are actually decent size - certainly not  regular slider size - probably double slider size.

The bulgogi was our favorite, a wet teriyaki flavor with a real sesame oil scent.  The chicken sliders were "eh" not very hot and not very crunchy - which is really the whole game of a chicken sandwich.

HERE's WHERE I WENT WRONG - seems like the WINGS are really what to order here.  So I will go back, try them, and update this review if my findings are significantly different.

Until then my money will go to the AMAZING "Chomp & Swig" sandwiches at the place next door.
author: Amy W.

description:
Chicken wings and hot sauce galore!! I have found the heaven for chicken wings, and it's called Hot Sauce and Panko. Their wings are soooo good! I'm talking about fat, juicy and flavorful wings, not the small and dry wings that we hate to get.

Panko is truly a hidden gem in the Richmond district. Beware, the store can be easily missed! This plain and tiny shop is concealed by the buildings surrounding it so I had a bit of a challenge finding it. 

The orders:
-"KFC" wings
-Green wings w/ side of potato salad
-Habanero wings
-Waffle
-Fried chicken sandwich

My favorites are the waffle, "KFC" wings and the green wings. They have a huge variety of hot sauces to pair with your food and they have a few variety of syrup. Be sure to try their bacon syrup, it's quite an experience for your taste buds. 

Lucky for me, they're walking distance from my house.
author: Jenny K.

description: The parmesan flavor are great. 5/5 flavor. Also have had the chicken waffle sandwich 3/5.
author: Logan T.

description:
Stopped in for lunch and wow!  It's a tiny hole in the wall that if you had no idea it was there would likely miss it completely.  I had the Ultra Goliath waffle sandwich with chicken karagge, cabbage, kewpie mayo, and sriracha.  Unbelievably delicious!

From what I've read the place is usually super busy with a line out the door, but we got lucky in that there were only a few people inside, and a couple outside.  The timing was perfect as the moment we got our food the two folks at one of the two tables were just leaving, so we got to sit and enjoy our food.

This place also has a selection of hot sauces that is simply off the chain - Blair's, Dave's, Defcon, Hazmat - a huge variety of flavors and levels of heat.  Next time you need some sauce, that's a great place to shop.
author: Kevin K.

description:
We visited SF last week and our friends took us here for lunch.

The line was quick on a Saturday afternoon and my fiance and I shared 3 flavors with 7 wings each. Perfectly cooked!

Panko Parm - my fiance's fav. The crusting was light and gave a great texture!
Kentucky Yaki - we both killed this very quickly. It must have been the sauce on the wing. It was just delicious.
Korean Fried - my fav. It was tangy, not too spicy, and I definitely see the korean fusion in it!

These flavors were booming, and the sauces were just as flavorful. Line wasnt too bad, and they gave us endless supplies of ranch sauce too.

Its def a small place, but luckily we found a table to stand around :) We had to drive around a bit, but the timing was perfect and we landed a spot right in front of the joint! We very much enjoyed this! Well come back if we visit SF again!
author: Alyssa Y.

description:
I probably say this any time I find a really good chicken wing place, but BEST CHICKEN WINGS EVER.

This place provides a variety of flavors you won't find in a typical place, such as Thai sweet chili and Korean pepper paste. You can find some standard barbecue flavors too but the other flavors are more fun. They're relatively cheap too compared to what you find in other places. Great deal considering the quality.

This place is basically a takeout place, though you could eat here if you really want to since they have a bit of space on the sidewalk. You can try bringing it over to Chomp N' Swig next door if there's an open table. They can even bring your food over to you next door when it's ready since they have some sort of partnership.

Warning - sometimes during major sporting events like a 49ers playoff game, this place will be open but only for phone orders. I've gone here before and they were basically only open for pickup.
author: Allen C.

description:
They don't have ramen wings anymore. False Advertising led me here. 

I gave it a chance, but the wings were wayyyyyyyy too salty. This coming from a guy that consumes copious amounts of sodium. 

I'd give this place another chance though. The wings were juicy and really crispy. They were just a little heavy handed on the seasoning. But seriously, no ramen wings? WHY?!
author: Richard T.

description: Checked out this place.  Its a small little place.  Basically seating for 4.  Ordered my name sake....The Chris Special.  Its a sweet sauce on freshly deep fried chicken.. Its a nice mix of the sweet and meaty.  Really fresh chicken wings.  It's so sweet, you might need some green tea aster eating this.  Overall nice fresh wings with that tenderness thrown in.  I wish it had more seating indoors tho.  This is not your buffalo wild wings or hooters.   If your down in the Richmond, check out this place, SON
author: Chris P.

description:
These wings are HUGE!!

My bf and I ordered 5 pieces of KFC (Korean Fried Chicken) and 5 pieces of Garlic Parmesan wings. The KFC wings were subtly sweet and I don't know... a bit tangy? The menu says it has blue agave in it, which I have no idea what that tastes like, but it was good. The coating was thick and crispy. It was quite a new experience for my tastebuds; still, I liked the garlic parmesan wings a bit more than the KFC wings. They were delicious, but rather buttery. It left my lips drenched in a slippery mess. (That's what she said.) They were generous with the parmesan cheese - the wings were covered in it! For a cheese lover like me, that ain't a problem at all.

I would come back again. Parking can be a pain in the ass though. And be prepared to wait at least 15-20 minutes for your order. Yes, even on a slow day. But hey, it's worth it. The wings won't disappoint.
author: Annie S.

description:
"Hot Sauce and Panko." When I first heard this name I thought it was a super hero duo. A crime fighting pair ridding a city of evildoers. And, yes, that's exactly what they are. A city of the evil of a lack of great wings. A paucity of sauced poultry, if you must. And Hot Sauce and Panko are warding off that evil to deliver the best wings in the city. 

Yes, like everyone else seems to have experienced, I thought I could arrive on a 49er playoff gameday around 5pm to pick up some wings. I should've paid attention to all of their updates on their site & the reviews here as I went home without wings. I really don't think that situation warrants all the negativity here. It's pretty clear they run a tight operation and when they run out, they run out. I think in a lot of cities this is true, whether it's a soup nazi or Una pizza in Soma or Swan oyster, or Capo's pizza in North beach. I mean, haven't you gone to a bar where the beer was so delicious that they've ran out? It's a good problem to have. 

So last week I stopped by at 430 on a Thursday. No line. Plenty of wings. There's nothing worse than overfried dry wing, even if it's sauced well. These might have been the softest wing I've ever had. From what I could tell the fryers were small, and they're paying close attention to fry time. I had an order of the KFC, and I asked what the closest would be to the traditional buffalo, and it was a nice twist of cilantro and lime with a sriacha dry rub. And thanks to their incredible selection of hot sauces, they had a Defcon competition sauce, which I'm not sure how blasphemous it is but I tossed the dry rub wings in that. 

The service was attentive, fun, kind and quick. Being freshly fried & tossed wings makes an enormous difference. Being the small batch spot for wings is a lot different than your traditional giant sports bar wings. Wings are better at home anyway. To me this place is worth the trek west, worth the wait, worth the hustle of calling ahead or planning in advance. In a city that's dubious for being derelict in its wing duty, Hot Sauce and Panko saves the day.
author: Jon A.

description: HSaP has some of the best chicken wings in SF. The basics are amazing (Double Hot and Double Hot Bacon Wrapped!) but even their stranger wings hit the spot. My absolutely favorites are chili crunch, green, and Double Hot Bacon Wrapped.
author: Anush V.

description:
I missed this place on my previous tour of San Francisco, and as luck would have it, I was back this past weekend and they happened to be open. I had to get a little creative with the parking since the kitchen was about to close, so my suggestion would be to plan ahead if you are one of us idiots that actually drive around SF.

The place was barely big enough for the 5 people behind the counter to work. There were a couple of (occupied) tables inside and honestly they don't look all that comfortable so I would recommend getting the wings to go if you can. The cashiers were quite friendly and are quite helpful especially with the massive selection of hot sauces on the shelf, most of which contains names that reference doing things to my rear end that I often hear from playing against 10-year old kids on Halo.

With the wings, if you are the picky type, I suggest calling ahead to see if they have what you want available since they run out of stuff from time to time. I ended up getting the Korean Fried and the Old Bay Sricha, both of which had to sit agonizingly in my passenger seat for 20 minutes before I can navigate my way back to Noe Valley.

The Korean Fried was good, though I would imagine it would have been far better had I eaten it when it was fresh and hot from the kitchen as with my experiences with other Korean-style fried chicken wings. The sauce is on the thicker side and tended to stay on the surface of the wing, so there is quite a deep and sharp taste to them as when they are hot.

On the other hand, the Old Bay Sricha wings were great after they have had a little time to cool down, as the sauce got deeper into the wings. Normally I just prefer good old fashioned hot sauce instead of Sricha since I am not a hipster/foodie/terrible person looking for an ethnic hot sauce experience, but in this case it worked beautifully with the Old Bay seasoning and I am still not sure why. It's just a weird combo of flavors that works together.

All in all, I was just glad my car was still there.
author: Ian L.

description:
First time in this little offbeat joint after walking by it for years.  Went with the family on a  Saturday stroll with this place as our lunch objective.  Coming upon it, we saw a group of people outside and breathed a sigh, "F*#&@! (ugh!), another line to a hidden gem in SF" I said to my wife.  However, we took a deep breath and decided to head in and reconnoiter the scene.   Turned out it was mostly folks waiting for their placed orders and not a line just to place an order.  

So  in we went.  Place is small, just a couple of tiny tables and a stand up counter, but it did not deter us our group 2 adults and 2 small boys, we queued up and placed our order.  The counter person was friendly and welcoming.  Additional staff were quick and cheerful to offer recommendations from their varied and tasty looking chicken wing options.  We ended up with 3 choices of wings, and one of their ham, mac'n'cheese waffle sandwiches.  Lucky for us, we were able to grab one of the small tables and squeezed ourselves in.  It seemed most folks ordered to take out or were picking up phoned in orders.  Just as we began to make fun of the various patrons including the marina wanna be couple next to us, the almost hipster 20 somethings, local ABC kids, grandmas, a grumpy but oddly friendly lesbian, and even ourselves, our first order was up.  

Our entire order came in quick succession and we got down.  Down on tasty chicken wing town.  Yes, effin' tasty, savory, hot, well prepared, juicy, sweet, tangy, spicy, meaty little chicken wings of goodness.  The ham, mac'n'cheese waffle sandwich which got the predatory stares from everyone in line also proved to be worthy of such attention.  Our two boys managed to focus their ferret-like energies on the food as well.

Damn good chicken wings....DAMN GOOD.

We're adding this joint to our local food road map.  

We brought a few extra wings home.  




I am going to eat them right after I hit "save"....
author: Patrick M.

description: The best wings I have ever had. Green, Chili Crunch, and Thai Sweet Chili are my favorite. Green is covered in fresh cilantro and chili crunch is covered in chunks of chili and both are perfectly flavored. I do not care for the BBQ wings.
author: H K.

description: I've eaten my way through half the menu by now and am yet to be disappointed. Korean, green and chipotle are my top 3.. That and the tempura fries. The friendly staff is a bonus.
author: Alan D.

description: LOVE this chicken joint. The only thing I hate is the seating and being able to eat and dine when I am in Richmond Area of San Francisco. You literally have to order your wings and be out! I mean I see the reasoning and overheads of having such a deliciously teasing place in a small venue, however, they would be more profitable if they had a fast-food set up with a bit more seating. I hate having to wait and find a place to eat the wings while they are smoking hot/crispy.
author: Eve A.

description: Yes, these wings are that good. Perfect, crispy exterior, fantastic sauces, all you could want. If they had a place to sit and beer, they would achieve perfection.
author: Timothy S.

description:
I failed to see what the hype was all about. The wings were good but they were not amazing. 

The green wings were pretty good and had a nice garlic taste to them. 

However, the sticker pepper wings were subpar at best. It was extremely salty and almost tasted burnt.
author: Ray W.

description:
This is the best shit around, period. If you don't know or had a bad experience, seriously that's all on you and must have some shit to do with your bad karma or maybe being an asshole. Yeah that might be it.

Nicest, most unique and creative staff and owner. They will be the sweetest, funniest people to you if you are a respectful and understanding human yourself. 

Ever changing flavors of mouthwatering chicken goodness where the chicken is always juicy and I'm pretty damn sure anyone saying the chicken is "small" needs to go back to Buffalo Wild Wings for their GMO big ass mutant chicken slathered in nasty sauce...to each his own.

A wall of every kind of hot sauce under the sun, all pretty dang affordable.

Two words....Goliath. Sandwich.

Another two for you.....Waffle. Heaven.

And for the grand finish another two words, this place will seriously turn you into a....Chicken. Gangster.
author: Anna G.

description:
Fannnntastic. 

Their wings are actually juicy. 
There's a ton of hot sauces to try.
The waffle is is crispy and soft. 

Everything is good. 

Not seating tho.. that sucks. 
One table inside.. and like... two outside. 

No restrooms for customers.. 
So, wash your hands before coming here. 
Or, you can just wet some napkins up and do it that way. 
Up to you.
author: Garland W.

description: This place SUCKS!  The first time we tried to go, they were closed for some reason...on a Wednesday. So the second time, we decided to call ahead to make sure they were open and confirm their closing time. The person who answered said they closed at 7pm so we go over there at 6:25 and they had stopped taking orders!! WTH?! What I don't understand is why the person didn't mention on the phone that they stop taking orders WAY before their closing time. That's a really crappy customer experience and we won't try to patronize this business again.
author: Michelle B.

description:
Football and Chicken Wings make for a delicious duo

when it's game day, you root for your favorite team, you call in your order after the first quarter and then pick it up at half time. BUT when it's the SUPERBOWL you better call at least a week ahead if you want to make sure you get them when you want them.

Hot Sauce and Panko's KFC (kimchi fried chicken) caught my eye! instead of the usual places we went here for our SUPERBOWL needs. a special occasion calls for special wings. and they did not disappoint! 

they are serious about their wings. come game day, they had so many pre-orders that they couldn't take any walk-ins. this modest house of wings has a mosaic of hot sauces on their shelves and a variety of one of kind flavors on their menu.

looking back i wish we got more than the half pan of one of their best sellers the KFC (kimchi fried chicken) wings. a lover of kimchi and wings, i was happy^2 (yes that's happy squared). i almost jumped for joy!

until next time,

cheers!
author: Jerico P.

description:
I like the wings but I am pissed at the staff here.  Your operating hours say closed at 6:30, but if I show up at 6:20 I can't put an order in?  

The girl at the counter put up a STOP sign in my face and said, "We're backed up on orders, can't take anymore.  Sorry."  How is that MY problem?  It's not my fault you're too slow on fulfilling your orders.  And you don't have to have a bitchy attitude about it either.  And who closes right when dinner time is starting?  Sounds like a terrible business model.

My advice if you want wings is to call in, and call in early.  So they don't throw up a stupid STOP sign in your face.
author: David N.

description: Amazing wings, possibly the best I have ever ate! Great, unique combo flavors and fast service. Korean fried, chili crunch, and sriracha caramel. Sick!!! Yum!
author: VeeMaria L.

description:
Wasn't too big of a fans of the wings. The flavors were great, but for something deep fried, why weren't any of the wings crispy? I did, however, LOVE the waffle! It was very crispy and light. More fried chicken and waffle joints need waffles like theirs.

JONASAPPROVED!
author: Jonas T.

description: I went to 2 other restaurants but the wait was too long so I started driving and found this random ass little chicken wing joint... and I'm sofa king glad that I did. Heeella good! I recommend this place to everyone and their mamas and their grandmas and grandma's mamas. It's fucking good!
author: Kevin J.

description:
I think I could live on Chris honey salty wings. I ate two and then hoarded the rest for later. They are mine and I am not sharing them. 

The green was good but not spicy at all. The panko breaded ones were seriously cheesy and thick- they came with the most amazing dipping sauce. 

Consider me a total fan. 

Get them and then have them run over to the bar next door. It has AMAZING beers on tap.
author: B S.

description: When we travel the country and taste wings from restaurants big and small we measure them against HSAP.  "Hmm..these are bigger, but the tastes isn't as good as HSAP."  "Interesting flavors, but not as much heat as HSAP."  It's a good product to compare the rest.  My advice, go order three different flavors and then walk up the street and get a nice cold brew at Chomp and Swig.  If you like unique flavors as well as the old standards you really need to try out HSAP.  Plus, you can pick up some bone burning bottled sauces to go.  Woooot.
author: Kevin-John B.

description: Wings. Wings. Wings.  I came here after getting rejected by the 4 hour lines at Ramen Street in J-Town.  Starving at almost 3 in the afternoon, we ordered the Chris, Green, Sticky Pepper Garlic and a Waffle.  These wings were great.  The Chris wings were less sweet than the candy wings at San Tung.  The Green wings had cilantro but were the most bland of the three. The Sticky Pepper Garlic wings were very peppery, not much garlic.  The trifecta of the wings along with the perfect fluffy waffle made a great meal.  Next time, however, I will have to brave it out and try the spicy wings.
author: Brian C.

description: This place is a really cute hole in the wall fried chicken place. My friends' have got my hooked. I got Chris's and Kentucky-yaki and they were not disappointing. There's a lot of choices to pick from and I am planning on trying every single one! There wasn't a line when I got there so there wasn't that big of a line. It is a small place so there's not a lot of seating around. So if you're planning to eat lunch, get it to go.
author: Sarah A.

description:
Grab a pint from Chomp and Swig to enjoy with your wings. 

Yes, they are delicious. Yes, they are cooked to order.

Parking is horrible.  Any day, any time you'll be circling for 20 minutes.
author: J. M.

description: A hole in the wall chicken wing spot that u don't want to miss if passing thru the Rchmond district. Half order 6 wings is $6.88 and 11 wings $9.98. Many choices we got salt and pepper and Asian inspired ones. This family owned business is super friendly also have ginger flavored Sofia's as and added plus!
author: Nancie M.

description: Juicy and huge wings. Beware of the hot sauce. Soooo spicy. Interesting/fun decor. Lots of wing sauces and if you buy any, make sure to check the expiration date. All in all, I plan to come again and try different flavors
author: Jennifer U.

description:
There are no frills here; in fact there are a slew of homemade signs doling out rules such as not to dine if you order takeout, clean up after yourself, and that they won't accept back the takeout containers they provide.

But what may feel like a barrage of rules are just the efforts of a well-managed family business to keep operations smooth and cost-efficient while delivering the best chicken wings and chicken+waffle sandwiches I have ever had. The prices are incredibly reasonable too (for SF).

I can't wait to go back.
author: Casimir P.

description: This place is the S***!!! (lol) There's certain foods you will come across in life where you think "Wow, I could eat this everyday." HS&P is one of those spots. The only reason I'd ever tell anyone not to eat here, is because I want all the wings to myself. Even if u aren't in the mood for these award winning Hot Sauce and Panko Wings (if such a feeling exists), just grab a Goliath Sandwich. Because who doesn't love a huge chicken and waffle sandwich dipped in syrup in hot sauce??
author: Ferrarah D.

description:
I've never cared for the saying "making love" but if I could make love to a food, it would be the Chris' Honey Crispy with pepper wings. 
They might as well have just given me free wings because as I sat out front of the hole in the wall business in the outdoor seating area (4 to five people at most) I was basically assaulting customers to eat there. I was their personal advertisement with sweet heavenly sauce on my lips and empty bones in my hands.
Never would I say, "Hey guys lets get wings as a meal!" Not even on the super bowl. But since going here, I want my whole diet to consist of these chicken wings. 
Can't stress hole in the wall enough though. Not a lot of seating but perfect to pick up and go. 
GO THERE NOW!
author: Lindsay B.

description: Ordered the Korean Wings and the Bacon Garlic Parm Wings and they did not disappoint. Don't expect to find a seat inside during busy hours, but there is some standing room at tables outside. Otherwise, they're easy to order and easy to pick up. I'll definitely be back again!
author: Christopher S.

description: I'd been here twice and on both visits the wings were amazing!!! The exterior is crispy with not a lot of batter and the sauces are extremely flavorful. If you are in San Francisco, Hot sauce and Panko is a must!!!
author: Jessie S.

description: We had Korean-fried and Chris' (salty, pepper) and waffles. Not bad. Friendly staff. I can't give 3.5 stars, so I'm giving 3. A second trip may lead to a future upward revision.
author: Gogo A.

description:
OMG - I'm not certain if these were chicken wings or angel wings because they were heavenly! Had a bite of the ghost pepper wings and Chris's Honey Salty Crispy Pepper wings.  Always good to have others ordering something different.  :o)  Then I concentrated on the Ultra Goliath.  Do a little fasting if you are going to get this delight as it takes up a lot of stomach real estate.  It was soooo good and well worth the detour from the east bay. The waffle is awesome and a great edible wrapper for the perfectly prepared chicken.  I can't get the taste out of my mind.  The sauce was perfect too.  The only challenge was getting a hold of this thing.  I decided to just deal with the mess and grabbed hold and didn't let go.  Fortunately they have wet wipes to clean up with.

The owners are lovely, hospitable hosts and if you like crazy nut head items from the web, check out their blog.  Where do they find this stuff?

This is a must check out.  Check their online menu to see what they have as they change it up often.  Also, seating is quite limited.  We happened to stop by later in the day on Sunday and were able to hang out inside while we enjoyed the food.

Also, if you are on the lookout for hot sauces, they have the biggest selection I've ever seen.  Ever!
author: Jeff L.

description: I tried many times again and I liked it more than the first visit.    Although It's so not pleasant to see all the obnoxious comments in the store every time I visit.  I guess the owner had many incidents that brought him to that level?     But he needs to realize that  there are many more nice customer than unpleasant customer since the business is going really well.   It's just not nice to see hostile owners attitude towards his loyal and nice clients when they visit the store.
author: Sam A.

description:
I have been walking past this place literally for months as I live a few blocks away.  The outside is so unassuming but I should have known better...never judge a book by its cover, so true when it comes to fabulous places to eat in our fair city.

I got three types of wings to start:  goju, kentucky-yaki & old bay.  I love spicy, but the chidlers can't handle it and the kentucky yaki were right up their alley.  The old bay were amazing, as I had heard...spicy, sweet with just the right amount of sauce.  The goju were a take on traditional kfc with a little pepper kick that really made them and a slight crunch, despite the bit of sauce (just the right bit!)

And, because I just HAD to, I ordered the ham macaroni and cheese WAFFLE FREAKING SANDWICH!  I mean, come on!  It was awesome...the mac and cheese itself was perfect and the waffle had just the perfect amount of sweetness.  Definitely recommend this one.

Next time I will try their kaarage chicken waffle sandwich and possibly (probably) one of the sweet ones too.

Super friendly service, didn't take too long (though if you are in a hurry I'd recommend calling in ahead) and if their teeny tiny "dining room" is full, I heard you can go next door to chomp n' swig (another review in the writing!) and eat your wings with a beer.

The only sad thing, they are only open until 6:30.
author: tanuki c.

description:
6 days out of the week I crave Hot Sauce and Panko. My sister told me about this place and I've been hooked ever since. 

The flavors are all amazing.  You can tell the owner loves creating new recipes and has a genuine passion for what he does. He makes flavors you can't find anywhere else and is dedicated to making them all mouthwatering delicious. I think my favorite is Chris's honey salty crispy pepper, but it's really too hard to pick one.
author: Vicky J.

description:
These wings are the bomb diggity!

It's a really small chicken wings joint. They have a full wall dedicated to about a hundred different hot sauces. And you can even see the staff making your food in front of you. 

Come in early! The earlier the better. It gets busy super fast. The service is very on point though. The staff works very hard providing the best customer service they possibly can. 

Now to get to the best part.....the wings! Old Bay is probably my new love. What's not to love about it?! It's a mix of siracha hot sauce and caramel! YUM! I've also tried the Green, Korean Fried, Sticky Pepper Garlic and Chris's Wings. ALL AMAZING!
author: Lisa H.

description:
Had wanted to go to this place for a couple of years now and was recently finally able to check this place out.  The last time I tried to stop by in July, during their normal business hours, I got greeted by an unexpected sign saying that they're sorry but they're closed that day, which sucked a bit, since it took about 40min to get here after work;-(  So this time around, I wasn't taking any chances so I called to confirm that they were open and since they were and now that I'd gotten a person on the line, I went ahead and placed my order for pick-up.  I ordered the Red Rooster and Chris' Honey Salty Crispy Pepper Wings.  

When I got there, my order was in the midst of being made and after a few minutes wait, they were ready to go.  There were about 5 customers eating/waiting when I got there around 6pm on a Friday.  It is a tiny place, so unless you come at the right time and the 2 tables inside are not being used, you'll definitely have to take your order to go.  I caught a glimpse of their few hundreds of bottles of hot sauces which was awesome, but couldn't really get a better look at them, since I was short on time and there were people right in front of the that area during my brief visit, so next time I'll have to make time to check that all out.

The employees working there seemed nice and attentive and the lady that gave me my order told me what each order was, which was well appreciated, instead of other places where they don't even bother telling you what they're giving you and they just stuff your order in a bag and give it to you.

Both of the orders of wings I tried for the first time were great choices as they were delicious:-)  Highly recommended and definitely, right next to San Tung's wings, these are the best wings I've ever had in SF.  The Red Rooster came with a side of sauce and a lime wedge and that definitely made the wings taste even better and the tastes all harmonized and went very well together, in my opinion.  They did a great job with Chris' Honey Salty Crispy Pepper wings too, the combo of ingredients in this one was excellent and I loved how it had a crisp to it on the outside, yet was still juicy and moist in the inside. They have a bunch of different varieties of wings and I'd love to try the Ghost Pepper and Green next time around.  Even though unless you happen to live around this place, it may be inconvenient to get to, I'd come back here whenever I can as their wings are definitely worth the trip!
author: Kahanalei M.

description:
I'm not sure why I ever rated this place 4 stars. That was foolish of me. I can honestly say I'm straight up addicted to this place. Nothing even comes close to their selection of wings. Most places, you'll find the same thing: garlic, buffalo, thai, etc. Here, every wing they have is a flavor you have never had before. And it gets better: they switch them up all the time! One time they had a flavor with chopped mangos on it. I can't make this stuff up.

... HOLY BALLSACKS!! I just checked out their menu as I'm typing this. New flavor: Prosciutto Wrapped Wing with Bacon Jam. Whaaaaaaaaaat?!?!?! This is what I'm talking about. HS&P never disappoints. I seriously cannot wait to try this wing!!! AHHHH!!

Oh, so back to the review. Yeah, best wings in SF hands down. Actually, best wings anywhere. This place runs laps around Kezar's Pub. BW3, Quaker Steak & Lube, any Korean wing restaurant ... nope. Not a chance. If you have not been here yet, get prepared to elevate your wing game. I just wish they were open longer!!
author: Tony P.

description: I tried the KFC wings and they were great. The texture was super crispy and the flavor was spot-on. The hard part was picking a hot sauce to try because there was just overwhelmingly so many! The BF prefers San Tung's but I really liked the ones here, especially because there are so many different ones to choose from. It would be cool if they let you split an order or have a sampler (although I can see how that would be hard to do when everything's made to order in the small kitchen).
author: Allison S.

description:
had such a good experience here ! 
we ordered 
sticky pepper wings - garlic & really flavorful but a little on the salty side
rooster - basically Sriracha and like wings ; really good but don't let the description fool you , it's not that spicy probably like a mild - medium 
kfc wings ; this was my personal favorite , the marinade goes perfectly with this one & the sesame seeds on top compliment it and ties it together 
green wings : lime - cilantro wings ; this was another favorite & basically tastes like the description 

service was on point. they checked up on us a couple times and the wings came out fairly fast , was very surprised on the speed 

overall , this place is really the definition of a hole in the wall & honestly, I'm thankful it's not that popular because the space is pretty small & it would get crowded very easily. the only complaint is that they ran out of ramen wings which is something we really wanted to try & the space is really small , which is really cramped with a limit on tables. I really hope they expand their business so it won't be as crowded in there but everything else is very good ! will definitely be coming back!
author: Emily Q.

description: Very small cozy place. Straight to the point. Literally waffles and wings. Small menu. Will definitely come back!
author: Ibelig V.

description:
Wings and hot sauce!

This place is bomb! Its tiny but the wings are soooooo good and the hot sauce selection is downright amazing. The owners are so friendly. He came out the back and let us try practically every sauce in the joint and I even purchased one to go.

We had the KFC wings and the Crispy honey pepper ones. I cant wait to go back and try the rest.

There is 2 little tables inside and 1 outside so maybe not the best for a leisurelly dine in situation but it was en fuego!
author: Michael B.

description:
I had to try this place since it's all about chicken wings. And I LOVE chicken wings!! Mhmm. 

I came her and placed an order, since there is no menu online. I had to wait... 20 min? This place was busy with lots of to-go orders and I was amazed with the amount of people that came in specifically for hot sauce. haha I didn't know there was a niche for this. Awesome though. This place is a super tiny hole in the wall, there's nothing really near it so it's not like you can just walk to other stores. 

Owners seemed pretty friendly and were chatting with the customers and some regulars. I love seeing that. 

I took 2 orders of wings home for me and my hubby to eat at his parent's house. So we ate it pretty much right away. And it was a slight disappointment. The chicken seemed VERY fatty. That kinda turned off me and my husband right away. I'm tempted to give them another try because maybe it was a bad batch of chicken wings or something. Stay tuned.

UPDATED EDIT #2: 
Since you're putting this review on your business's website/blog and have closed the comments there, I wanted to make a revision of what I said. And since you stated on there, "FOLKS, I'M GETTING SICK AND TIRED OF REVIEWERS WRITING BELATED REVIEWS OF THEIR EXPERIENCE IN 2011 AND PUBLISHING IT IN 2013." Just for the record, we came in November 2012, less than SIX months ago. 

UPDATED EDIT: 
Owner is critically fighting back, so here is my rebuttal... 

So I forgot to mention that I came here about a year ago(?) something like that and the website did NOT look like that at all. It was a BLOG at the time and did not have the button "MENU" before. I remember coming into the restaurant and asking for a paper menu and the kid cashier said they don't have any printed ones but gave me a strip of paper that listed the website. That was all. 

Secondly, I did NOT complain about the wait. Did I say the wait sucked?? I just said I had to wait 20 min, nothing bad about it. So why is the owner being this defensive about my comment for the wait. Yelp reviews are more useful if they're more detailed. 

Oh and the wings were fatty whenever I went. My husband didn't care for it because of the strip of fat under the skin. Brining doesn't give a layer of fat, it just helps moisten the meat. Can you confirm 100% that every piece of chicken that you cook and send out is perfection? No, which is why I said I would give it another chance. And it's not like I gave a 1-star review?! Settle down.

Oh and by the way, there's no need to be bratty about it. Telling me how to click on the menu button, really?? If the owner is this condescending, I don't want to go here anymore and am tempted to lower my review to a 1-star but I'm not childish like he is and don't want to stoop to his level. Funny thing is that my original review I wrote saying the owner seemed pretty friendly, you just ruined it with your rude clarifications.
author: Grace L.

description:
the fried chicken here taste like the fried chicken from the hot counter at safeway (hope the owner doesn't find this and call me stupid on Yelp for comparing their business) overall the only feeling I get from the food and this business is PURE PETTINESS. 
1)2 tables and no outdoor seating
2) no trash for takeout (5 signs made it very clear and killed the mood it made me feel like my money was no good and that this business feels like it's too good to accept my trash) 
3) chicken was bland and expensive 
4) they will watch how much napkins you take and give you the meanest stare ever and it will make you feel like a peasant even though you just spent good money on poor service and poor chicken
5)NO TRASH CAN I repeat NO TRASH CAN if you buy food here you will have to take your trash with you (they have 5 more signs asking you not to litter even though they don't provide a trash can) 
6) so many rules being printed up and posted around the business it killed my appetite and the want to spend any money here. They even had a no photography sign how petty is that. 
7) the chicken was bland , yet you post all these rules and signs and act like your hot wings cure cancer 
8) why do you have 8 people doing 2 peoples job? 
9) please don't come to Jackson and Hyde with this poorly ran business and terrible chicken. The yuppies here will ruin your business if they felt any type of way I felt by your service today 
10)TREAT YOUR CUSTOMERS BETTER MAKE THEM FEEL WELCOMED SO THEY WANT TO SPEND MONEY. YOUR BUSINESS IS SO CONCERNED ABOUT CUTTING COST ITS DRIVING CUSTOMERS AWAY READ YELP REVIEWS EVERYONE THINKS YOUR BUSINESS IS PETTY. 
This place is just pathetic in all aspects.
It will have you feeling like asking for your money back after you ate your food
author: yoo s.

description:
Great chicken wings!
We had their panko parm chicken wings, korean fried, and red rooster (sriracha lime cilantro).  Their were all good but my favorite was the korean fried chicken wings.
author: Dante D.

description:
OMG! Best wings ever! Better than San Tung and Wingstop cause of all the flavors available. I ordered Chris's which is like a honey and pepper sauce on the wings. MAN IT WAS GOOD! It was kinda sweet and crunchy and it has bigger wings than Wingstop. 

Will definitely make this a regular place to go to.
author: Nick C.

description: Fave!!! The Green and Lime Parmesan! 8 pieces for 6.99.  You can add on fries or a waffle.  This is a take out place. Inside seating for 4 people.  They also sell a variety of hot sauces, even ones made in Hawaii!  I want to go there again!
author: Lorene P.

description:
Megumi's garlic parmesan is to die for. If it's on their menu for the week, then you must definitely try it! The green wings are also delicious and a little spicy because of the jalepenos. I want to come back and try more flavors! I think it's cool that they always change and add different flavors to their menu. 

Their bottled hot sauce wall is also interesting to look at.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Ordered the KFC sandwich, fries, and honey pepper wings. The sandwich was deep fried twice, from a culinary perspective that is completely unnecessary. There was no texture to the chicken because it was over fried, and so were the onions. The sauce did not complement the sandwich at all.

The fries were your average frozen fries that you buy in bulk at restaurant depot... Nothing special there.

However the wings were absolutely delicious! Some of the best wings I've ever had. I would return solely because the wings are off the hook. The freshness is there, the quality of sauces, and the taste were above my expectations.
author: Serge C.

description: First time here. Ordered 3 different flavors. Chris's - sweet and very yummy, Korean - mildly spicy and tasty. Mango habanero - suppose to very spicy (not enough for my son). Going for the ghost pepper next time.
author: Lily L.

description:
UGH. This place is so good. I have a bit of a chicken wing obsession, and these are definitely some of the best I have ever had. I bookmarked this place years ago after seeing it on some sort of tv special(travel? food network? who knows!). 

We showed up at about 2 pm on a Wednesday. I can't imagine coming here when they are actually busy. The place is located in a fairly residential area and is TINY. There are only like 2-3 tables inside, and 2 tables outside. I imagine they do a lot of to-go orders. In addition to Hot wings, they sell sides like waffles and fries. They also sell pretty much every hot sauce imaginable. 

We went with 2 different kinds of wings. The Korean Friend Chicken wings and the Old Bay with Caramel Sriacha wings. Both were fantastic! The breaded wings were nice and crispy, and the sauce on both was AMAZING. Neither were too spicy, but had just enough spice to add really good flavor. They seem to rotate our flavors weekly, so make sure and check the website. Although, I doubt you could be disappointed with any of the wing choices. Skip the fries though. I would want to try the house-made waffle. 

This place is extremely efficient. They use an ipad ordering system, which is actually really quick and easy. I have seen lots of problems with these types of systems. Our food didn't take more than 10 minutes, but given the fact that there are only 3 people working(one taking orders, the other 2 doing the cooking), I imagine there can be a wait if they are busy. But it's definitely worth it!
author: Kristin C.

description: Wow!  What a well kept secret.  The wings were great!  The menu changes daily so you never know what great surprises they will have for you!
author: Kenneth G.

description:
Oh. My. God. How did I not know that this existed until now? I'm hesitant to write this review, mostly because I don't want ANYONE ELSE to come here so I can have it all to myself. 

These are literally the most delicious wings I've ever had. LIterally. The place is a total hole in the wall in the Richmond. You walk in and immediately start to salivate from the delicious smell of waffles and fried wings. Come with a group and try them all. 

There is only one small table for about 5 and a standing table for 2-3. They have one table outside, but its often cold in the Richmond, so beware. I would recommend ordering a bunch to go, but you don't want to miss out on the immediate gratification of a hot crispy wing.
author: Lauren D.

description:
WINGS ARE AMAZINGGGGGGGGGG!
I love this place and always rave about it to my friends.  
A couple of years ago, they were a victim of their own success and on the super bowl they were an hour behind.  They figured it out and these football playoffs they have been on it! If you haven't tried these wings, you have to!
author: Nick S.

description:
Finally finally!  Tried the combo with KFC and waffle, $6.50.  Big YUM.  I got the waffle first and waffled it into my mouth.  No need to wait for the wings.  Too hungry.  It's crunchier when it's hot.  They put a wallop of whipped salted butter(?).  Normally, I wouldn't eat it, but it really taste too good to pass up.  They have your standard syrup, strawberry syrup, and blueberry syrup (unless you want to put the various hot sauce on it).  Most of the opened hot sauce bottles were empty, boo hoo.  One hot sauce had scotch as an ingredient.  The KFC wings (5) were crispy, mildly sweet, and too mild to be hot.  They were very meaty for wings any way. Now, I have to go back at least 10 more times to try other wings and other sandwiches.  

I don't understand why all the reviews commented on the cashier.  Just to continue this obsession, the cashier was nice and she did smiled.  It did take a while before I got my order.  It seemed like they had to fry it fresh.  Which is a good thing.  Allow at least 15 minutes, because there were a couple of people ahead of me. 

The table and chair configuration is really cramped.  May I suggest small round tall tables with high chairs. Strangely, they have this naked picture of David Hasselhoff next to the menu on the window.  That is not appetizing.  Strange sense of humor.  Why a miniature urinal near the door?
author: Helen L.

description:
Look past the haphazard hours and the horrible parking and you'll get a chance to eat some really yummy wings. Korean fried wings, double fried wings, parmesan and garlic, they're all good. I can't say which is best because it all depends on my mood. None of them have left me wanting more.

So take a book and tie up your dog to the sidewalk table and it's hard to beat this lunch.

Plus the selection of hot sauces for sale has got to be the best around.
author: Rick H.

description: Where else you can get their diverse variety of wings? Nowhere! Love the Korean and the Chili wings. Waiting to try the new Indonesian style. As for the location, I live 10 minutes walking from them and have no issue with the space, as you have to take it as it comes. The only downside is that for the moment they are only opening Thursday through Sundays, so make sure to check their Facebook page for the latest news.
author: Frank B.

description: Ive had the pleasure of eating here and I have to say the bacon wrapped Buffalo wings were delicious the customer service was good considering the small place was packed ...the smell of delicious waffles hits you when you walk in to the place.... Though I never tried them  I do plan on returning here to try the waffles on my next visit to San Francisco . ....
author: Peter S.

description:
This is a Hot Sauce store that serves wings on the side.....What....On the side. 
However, the wings are the star of the show. You walk in and instantly see the racks of hot sauces from all over the nation, if not the world, but that sight will be taken over by the smells that come from the small kitchen right in the back. 
What makes this place especially unique is their range of sauces. I don't know what they do to the wings to make them perfectly crispy, none like I've ever had anywhere else. I can really explain the texture, but it is perfect. Back to the sauces..most have like a korean/asian twist or flare and all the others just sound amazing enough you'd want one of each. I personal favorite is the Korean sauces, it is basically a Gochujang or spicy BBQ almost, but not overly spicy like some habanero sauce would. You can really taste it. I've had about 5 other sauces and each with its own flavor/spice/pop/deliciousness. Never was I disappoint with anything, each bite takes me into Wing Bliss. I wont stop til I've tried all the other sauces. THESE WINGS REALLY ARE TO DIE FOR. I've recently hit this spot up over the weekend, probably my fifth visit ever, and the number of wings i get always increases. I really hate to leave town without making a stop. If that hasn't caught your attention, they also have a Chicken and Waffle Sandwich that is also just as amazing as the wings. I noticed they added a few more items on the menu like Fish and Chips. On my list of Must-Trys.
Until I'm back in SF in the Richmond District, I'll be dreaming of these wings.
author: Jonny L.

description:
You looking for a place that has wings on wings? Head on over to Hot Sauce and Panko! With over 10 types of wings to choose from, you're bound to satisfy your chicken wing craving AND THEN SOME. And if you're in the mood for some novelty hot sauces, there's a whole wall of them for you to browse and buy.

Went here on a Friday night around 6:30pm with friends, and the place was still bumpin' even though it was going to close at 7. The shop closes fairly early everyday (between 5:30-7pm depending on the day), so make sure you plan ahead! 

We ordered four different types of wings, and they all had very distinct flavors, each of them very enjoyable. The wings aren't huge, so no harm in ordering a few flavors! Here's what we got:

* Lime (4 stars): The sauce for these wings was made from fish sauce, lime, and garlic roasted chilies. These wings were super flavorful and had a nice sweet, sour, and spicy tang. These were my favorite wings of the night!

* Green (4 stars): These wings were coated with a cilantro-ginger sauce. I hate ginger, but the combination of cilantro, ginger, and jalapeno really balanced each other out to create a unique savory flavor. My second favorite wings!

* Panko (3 stars): Though this flavor is mentioned in the name of the restaurant, I thought this was the least unique. Don't get me wrong, it wasn't bad. But it basically tasted like your average chicken/pork katsu but in chicken wing/drum stick form with bones! If you're craving something that's panko crusted, just get some regular boneless katsu chicken or pork instead so you don't have to deal with them bones.

* Ghost Pepper (3 stars): Whoooo-weee.. talk about SPICY. I usually brag that I can eat really spicy food (I really can!), but damn, this shizzz was spicy. At first bite, it tastes like you're eating a dry, cajun-spiced chicken wing. But as you take more and more bites, the peppery spices start kicking in and burning your tongue and mouth. Unless you don't mind sweating and being in a slight bit of pain while you're eating this, I'd stay away. I took 3 bites, and I was done. Not bad tasting, just spicy.

We also got an order of fries, which was pretty standard. Good for dipping in the leftover sauces.

Definitely worth a try if you're around the area! FYI, it's not really a sit-down establishment, so best if you just grab and go. There is a small table in the place if you get lucky and grab it, which seats about 4 people.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
This is my first time going to Hot Sauce and Panko. I came here with a friend around 5 PM. 

Ambiance: 
It is a very small restaurant, which has around  2 tables inside and 2 tables outside having a total of 8 seats. The restaurants decor comprises of a wall of different hot sauces which can be purchased. The seating area is also the waiting area; it is small and can be easily crowded. It is kind of dirty, but what would you expect from a small place serving sticky foods like wings. The kitchen/ cooking area is open, so you can pretty much see everything that is going on. 

Service:
