When we got there, there were seats available, but don't expect there to be seats since a couple minutes later, the room was filled and people were standing and eating. We sat ourselves right next to the wall of hot sauces. The lady who took our order was nice, but I could barely hear when she called my order, and I had to stand there for a while before I could get her attention to ask if that was my order. 

Food: 
I ordered the "Chris's Honey Salted Crispy Pepper". It was out of this world. The wings were nice and crispy, sticky, moist on the inside, and super flavorful.  I had a total of 10 wings. I would definitely recommend this flavor. My friend got the "KFC: Korean Fried Chicken". I am not a big of gochujang sauce, but it was okay in my opinion. If you like the sauce, I'm sure it would be tasty too. The wings were saucy, and topped with sesame seeds. My friend got 8 wings, although her pieces were bigger than mine. 

The small order of wings cost $6.49 with tax it totaled to $7.06. It is definitely a place to try, whether it is for their delicious wings or to grab a bottle of hot sauce. I will no doubt be bringing my boyfriend to this place to try it since we both love wings.
author: Vivian Y.

description: Good wings but they are always late with our order and they aren't worth the money and hassle.
author: Timothy L.

description:
I always recommend all of my friends to visit this joint when they visit San Francisco and they're never disappointed when they leave. Their Goliath Chicken Waffle Sandwich is to die for. Try it, its the best sandwich ever.

For those who complain about the wait time or that they ran out of wings before you arrived, here's a tip: order ahead.

I've called 1 1/2 hours before they close and place my order to go. I've never had a problem when I come and pick it up. My order is hot and ready and I'm not waiting in line with all the scragglers who think this is a fast food joint. The early bird gets the worm and in this case, WINGS!

Keep up the good work Terrance! I'm excited to see what delicious wing combinations you'll bring us this year!
author: Kristen V.

description:
This place is so awesome it should have had a cult following already! The owners are always there and the quality of food is superb! We also always get a few beers from Chomp next door - perfect way to spend your afternoon.
My favorites:
Lime
Bulgogi
Trinadad
author: Nazz W.

description:
First time at eating lunch from Hot Sauce and Panko was amazing. 

This spot is not really a "hole in the wall" but you definitely can miss this place easily if you've never been here before. This is a very discreet spot for them and you really have to look closely. oh yeah ... PARKING is horrendous!

Ordered:
1. KFC (korean fried chicken) - super tender and perfectly cooked chicken wings! the flavor is perfect and the kick is gonna slap you on the face when you take the first bite

2. Ultra Goliath chicken and waffle sandwich - this thing is a mess. it's the best mess of a sandwich you'll ever have though! it aint as spicy as the KFC but damn that would be a good combo. The sandwich is beast consumed while sitting and with a fork and knife in my opinion

i gotta come back soon and try all the other flavors. SUPERBOWL PARTY order in mind already! watch out!
author: Kenny L.

description:
loooooooved this place! 

Parking was semi easy to find (didn't have to pay either)
Place is small..got here around three and was able to find seating outside on this perfect SF day just before a small crowd of people came.

Boyfriend and I decided to try a small of each of the Lime, Green and Chris's waaaaaaangs...which was perfect for us...got a total of about 27 (dont EXPECT to get this many if you decide to order similar, menu says small comes with AT LEAST 6 wings which we got lucky and had a more than 6 for each flavor) mini drumsticks and wings which we killed.

They were all really good! My favorite being in the order of... 1. Chris's 2. Lime followed by Green. 
Boyfriends favorites in order... 1. Green 2. Lime and then Chris's... which says this place is pretty consistently good. I'd be down to try all of them (minus ghost pepper due to weak stomach) eventually but would probably insist on ordering Chris's every time. 

I love the honey chicken at 99 and was anxious to see how this would compare...and surprisingly I enjoyed the flavor of these wings more than over at 99! They were almost perfect..a little crispy but juicy due to the honey but not overpowered with sweetness (which can happen at 99) because of the other spices. Only thing is at 99 the drumsticks are bigger and are GENROUSLY dipped in batter giving it a more perfectly crunchy texture that I love... however the flavor on hot sauce's rendition was superior in my opinion.

Despite my initial intention to... I did not order any waffles, will have to next time because they have a perfect little waffle condiment station to the right that included both maple and chocolate syrup (and I think I saw whipped cream as well?) :3

The only 'drawback' for us was that we personally prefer big drumsticks over the little wings..which really isn't a drawback haha. And although flavors were on point we still preferred the texture over at 99... but still CALLING ALL CHICKEN LOVERS you need to try this joint out if you haven't ;D
author: Melissa C.

description:
If you own a mouth and you don't love Hot Sauce and Panko, you are a ridiculous person. Wings are plump and juicy. No sissy half broken pieces or unidentifiable chicken chunks. Wangs I have wanged: KFC, Buffalo (medium), Green, Lime, Hiromi's Katsu. Can't pick a favorite. Can't wait to try more.

I'm no expert, but I do have a "Wings" spending category on my Mint.com financial profile. 

The first time I tried these guys I dove right in and got 3 huge trays to bring to a party, and boy oh boy I've never seen so many fancy people get down and dirty with sexy drums and flats. Huge hit. 

Place is small. Get takeout. Order ahead and order EARLY because popular things ARE POPULAR OK?

Also, Like them on Facebook so you can read hilarious wing-relevant content and see pictures of new flavors that will make you want to eat your laptop or iThing.
author: Patty J.

description:
Without a doubt, the best chicken wings in the city.  Better than San Tung, or any other place you can think of (though do check out scisso, it gets close).  These are korean style wings mainly, but they have about a dozen different varieties, so you can pick your fancy. The hot chili crunch is my favorite, the traditional KFC is really good, too.  I'm still working  my way through their menu and enjoying the process.  

I think it's run by a father and daughter team who are super cute.  Their small scale and large pickup business for gamedays and such can lead to some periodic slow downs in getting your order, so if it is gameday, and you are headed out to the Richmond solely for the wings (they are worth the trip), you may want to call ahead to make sure they aren't too busy filling party orders.  

Like people mentioned, there are only two tables there, so you can always head to Mountain Lake park a few blocks away to the north (the southernmost edge of the presidio) to eat your wings at the benches by the pond/lake there.  Apparently, this is where Spanish explorers spent their first night in the city, before ditching the fog and finding warmer climes in the Mission.  

Or you can eat in the car like an animal, whichever.
author: Jim M.

description: All I can say is, FUCKIN BOMB ASS WINGS !!! Don't hesitate to get Chris's... That stuff has some kind of crack in it ...
author: Kevin C.

description:
Love this place! I split a large order of the KFC wings and a small order of the lime wings with the boyf and the amount was perfect!

I love love loved the lime wings and it's probably because I'm pretty much addicted to patis (aka fish sauce). It kinda made my fingers smell a lil fishy after but I'm NOT complaining. I luv my fish sauce. The KFC wings were also very good and reminded me of bibimbap. Super tasty! 

We ordered to go since we figured we probably wouldn't find a seat but we ended up squishing next to a couple inside the shop. There's maybe 10 seats total inside and outside!

I'll def be coming back!
author: Kathryn Y.

description:
A friend of mine has been raving about Hot Sauce and Panko as the spot he goes to weekly when he is in the city.  
 
Finally, I was able to join him on his escapade out in the inner Richmond area. For a Saturday afternoon, we were able to find parking shortly. Hot Sauce and Panko is a hole-in-the-wall with meager seating. One high chair table, a four seater near the window, and a four seater for outdoor seating. Its more of a order to-go type of restaurant.  
 
The store itself have shelves lined with different types of sauce with funny cartoon animations and names like "Ass on Fire" and such. Reminds me of the sauces they sell at Alien Jerky in Baker, CA on the way to Las Vegas. Nonetheless, I enjoyed the theme of the store and was excited to devour some wings.  
 
We ordered: 
 
KFC (Korean Fried Chicken): The wings were covered in a red sauce like buffalo wings, but tasted like sweet and sour sauce.  
  
Lime: This is actually my favorite of the three that we tried. Taste like the sweet fish sauce mix that you receive at Vietnamese restaurants to dip your spring rolls/egg rolls, or to sprinkle over such dishes like bun thit nuong (vermicelli) dishes. That sweet fish sauce is made with lime and chili, and sugar. Bold flavors for wings.  

Katsu with tonkatsu sauce: They literally breaded the little wings which I thought was mind boggling and ingenious. Surprisingly, the wings were still crispy and perfect.  
 
Overall, the wings were not heavy after devouring x amount. Although, it would be nice if the wings were a bit bigger. They were baby wings. 
  
In comparison to some chains like wing stop and buffalo wild wings, I like the idea of Hot Sauce and Panko spinning different new flavors and concoctions for wings that are out of the norm that may be more of the adventurous side - its different.
author: Becky Q.

description: Step aside Wingstop - this place is LEGIT!! Ordered (via Caviar) the Chris's wings and Green wings, along with bleu cheese dressing, and a side of Tempura Wedge Fries. Didn't realize the Chris's was honey and salt & pepper, (I misread it as being only salt + pepper) but they were great anyway. The Green wings were perfectly crispy on the outside (topped with a garlic/cilantro chutney, major YUM), and deliciously juicy on the inside. The Tempura Wedge Fries were pretty tasty also. Will definitely be ordering again!
author: Anna D.

description:
I really want to give this place 3.5 stars but only option was either 3 or 4 and this place doesn't deserve a 4.

The wings tasted fresh but the flavoring wasn't as good as I was expecting from the hype about this place. The wings/drums didn't taste like it was marinaded long enough for the sauce to soak in.

I'll go ahead and give this place another try with different flavors and update my review in the near future.
author: Ken T.

description:
Put those wings in my belly!!!
Love the green onion , honey mustard and KFC flavor. Their sweet potato fries were waffle cut which was  super delish!! They make the wings fresh as you order so be prepared to wait about 10 mins if it's not busy but maybe longer than that during dinner time. This place really has not a lot of tables to sit at , maybe 3 or so and no bathroom either, so we went next door to Chomp n swig to get 3 dollar Coronas and some drinks. It was perfect!!! Like matchade in heaven. Wings and beer , what more can you ask for??
I will definitely come back and try their waffle and other chicken wing flavor
author: Claudine V.

description: Very tasty wings for sure, and a lot of flavors. Just a bit on the pricey side for what you get.
author: John Stone S.

description:
DAMN I love these guys. They are no nonsense- come in, try some incredibly epic/kick-your-butt hot sauce, and buy some of the best and most interesting wings you've ever had.

I love the humour, I love the Star Wars stuff everywhere, and I especially like the attitude: you want good wings? Then calm down and wait for them. They have a beautifully well done product and the wings deserve your time and respect :) Plus, it's very easy and efficient to phone in an order for pick-up too.

The waffle is great, and I've tried the green wings, the bulgogi wings and the KFC wings. The KFC one I think has been my favourite, it really is quite stellar. I love their unique take on wings, and the staff is so funny, has a very cute setup there, and they just do their thing- make kick ass wings. Highly recommended.
author: Mike J.

description:
I came here for the ramen wings, but they seemed to have replaced it with some other type of wings

My favorites had to be green (herb taste), chris's (dried honey flavor), and fried rice cake wings (sweet and sour, good in small amounts)

The sticky pepper was overly salty and bulgogi was mediocre
author: Dorris W.

description:
Only been open for 2.5 months! Oh boy the wings are DELICIOUS!

Thought this place was only a hot sauce store but no! Hidden gem of nothing but goodness!

KOREAN SAUCE WAS AMAZING!! Must get!
author: Rachel J.

description:
I really wanted to love this place with the lack of a great wings places in the city.
The  Korean Fried Chicken was interesting but I would not get it again.
The Cilantro wings had a nice cilantro/garlic flavor.
My problem is that the wings themselves are a little fatty, and there was not enough of a crunchy crust that I was expecting from the Panko.

Hot waffles were excellent - soft, warm, and buttery.
3.5 star experience, but loses a half-star additional for being over-rated.
No real seating to speak of.  And no bathroom (where are you supposed to wash your hands after devouring 15 wings).
author: bao t.

description:
Very tasty wings. Not in the same league as Points East Pub in Milwaukee, WI - but enjoyable. 

Hipster girl at the front was pissy, costumer service doesn't seem like a top priority, but I didn't go there to make friends, I went there to eat wings, and I was pleased. 

Tip: if you like to drink beer with your wings (who doesn't?) get a table outside and grab a beer from Chomp N' Swig next door.
author: Donny C.

description:
A cool little spot to try out some delicious chicken wings, waffles, and a variety of hot sauces.

The KFE chicken wings is amazing - I highly recommend it. Service is nice and quick!

I really enjoy some good waffles and the ones here definitely hit the spot - soft, fluffy, and tasty =]
author: Cuazzy N.

description:
PROS:

- Awesome mom & pop shop with a friendly family that you just want to donate all of your money to solely because they're such a friendly family

- Incredible wall of hundreds of different brands of hot sauce. The owners also allowed us to try any of the hot sauces we wanted. Ghost Pepper one was deadly.

----------------

CONS:

- Not really good for take-out. After we brought the order of 70 wings home, most of them were soggy and lukewarm. Popped most of them back in the oven, which resurrected most of them, but not the BBQ or Parmesan, which just ended up looking dried out and nasty.

----------------

WINGS:  (Best to Worst)

- Herb-Crusted Panko = My FAVORITE one of the bunch
- Ten-Spice = Excellent. Packed with flavor.
- Hiromi's Katsu = Loved the panko crunch, very tender & moist inside
- Fiery Hot Wings = Packs a spicy punch, loved these
- KFC Wings = Nice and spicy.
- Bulgogi = Interesting flavor but I didn't really taste the bulgogi marinade
- Red Rooster Wings = This was okay
- Green Wings = Meh. Didn't think the flavor really worked with this one.
- Garlic Parmesan = Way too much parmesan, kind of overpowered.
- Ryan's BBQ Wings = I didn't like this one at all, fries were soggy, sauce was too sweet
author: Roy C.

description:
Not sure what I love more about this place, the quirky humor, the wall of hot sauces, or the fact that they do wings and waffles exactly the way I like 'em. They've ruined my taste for all other wings, boohoohoo. 

We tried the Green Wings, KFC, and Red Rooster; all were fantastic but my personal favorite was the Red Rooster for its zippy lime flavor. You can't go wrong with any of those. They reheat nicely too.

Waffles are by no means small, but save yourself some heartbreak and get an extra one, you'll want it. Crisp and fluffy, sweet, perfect. 

The fries were the most disappointing part of the meal. They're thick-cut and soft and why would you do that when you could just get another waffle? Or six?
author: Angela N.

description:
Kept hearing about this place for ages. Finally made a point to hit them up. 


I Got the Chris' wings (honey, salty, crispy pepper) they are REALLY good and the Ultra Goliath (chicken karage, cabbage, kewpie mayo, sriracha caramel) which isn't bad. 

My only beef was that there were few options that didn't seem spicy or had Sriracha as an ingredient (I am NOT a fan of Sriracha, it has NO flavor, only heat)

The Ultra Goliath sandwich was pretty good, though a little bland I thought. 
The waffle was light but had density/mass, it had no sugar in the batter so there was no sweetness to over power the fillings (hat tip to you guys for that). 

Definitely coming back here to try more

Menu changes weekly

The place is REALLY small inside. There's 4 seats and a stand up table that will make it even more cramped inside. 

Parking is a nightmare, better off just double parking and keeping an eye on your car/waiting outside for your order.
author: Leo V.

description: Best wings that I ever had, great flavors and selections.  It is prepared to order, not really a sit down place but who cares, I got them to go and enjoyed them in my car.  They tasted fantastic.  I had the garlic bacon parmesan and the mango habanero and they are super flavorful and spicy - not burning your mouth spicy but with a good kick.  I can't wait to come back to try their chicken and waffle.
author: Ed Q.

description:
So, so delicious. Some of the wings were the itsy, bitsy wings, but they make up for it by adding more to your order so you don't feel cheated.

We ordered:

Green -- Delicious. Would order this again in a heartbeat. 
Chris'-- Hands down, flat out amazing. Next time we order this, we're ordering double.
Goju (FKA, KFC) -- This is ok, but would not likely order again. 
Kentucky-yaki -- Awesome. Would totally order order this again. 
Old bay -- These were ok. The wings were "bigger" but they were almost 33% fat. The wings on the top were delicious, but underneath they were a little soggy and not so appetizing. Would maybe order again.

BTW, this is not really an eat-in place. It's a pretty small shop with 2-3 sit down tables inside (we're talking small, circular tables) and a larger 4 person table outside. 

They have an intense variety of hot sauces for sale. I would have bought some, but it's awkward to browse if people are sitting down since the tables are right in front of the shelves.
author: Colleen M.

description:
Went here for the first time. Got the KFC. Really enjoyed it.

The wings are super crispy, yet not dried out. The flavors are bold, with a bit of a kick. Looking forward to trying all the different kinds.
author: Tim M.

description:
Crispy, juicy, flavorful and spicy! Always fun going with friends and ordering a bunch of different things. Really enjoyed the "green", "fiery hot", and "garlic Parmesan". 

Fast and friendly (we were the only ones there!); they even offered us taste tests of the "fiery hot" sauce--mucho appreciated.

Would love to try their fried chicken and waffle next time! :) Too bad they aren't in the East Bay.
author: Chris V.

description: Love their menu, "Food like we give a damn"---presumably they do, it's yum. Second visit on Sunday afternoon, short line and wait. Ordered the Parm Panko wings and another round of Chris's. Parm Panko exceptional flavor, crisp on the outside, tender meat with a bit of Srirancho dip. Cooked just right. Enjoy the pepper and honey glaze of Chris's. Proudly displaying their 100% rating for a recent Health Inspection in the window. They should, it's visibly one of the cleanest restaurant kitchens around. Moving up to a four star this visit.
author: Nancy D.

description:
This place is amazing. If you like wings, you HAVE to go here. Went this past Saturday and wanted to go back the very next day. The quality of their wings are above par. Not fatty, plump, falls off the bone, juicy... Mouth is watering just thinking about it. For 2, we ordered 3 small orders (plenty, as they are about 7-8 pieces a piece): 1. KFC (korean friend chicken), great sauce, topped with seasame seeds to give a great crunch 2. Red Rooster - my favorite!!! srichica and a great lime kick 3. green - cilantro, jalpeno... amaze balls!

This is my first yelp review. I'm selfish because I usually use Yelp to look up places, but haven't reviewed myself. Hot Sauce and Panko changed that for me. They are so good I want everyone to know! Can't wait to go back

Small inside, so call in your order. Can take 15-20 and there's not much around that area. They do have a crazy hot sauce selection as well!
author: Katie B.

description:
today we went back after getting news from facebook that they have new sauces for the wings!  We tried the '"greens" sauce and the "miso" sauce wings.  The greens sauce is like salt and pepper mix with the chinese Hainan chicken sauce (dry version).  Super tasty!  not spicy at all (to me).  The miso however is wet sauce with diced peppers.  Sweet but spciy!!   I am a wimp so I did not eat the wings with the pepper afterwards so it was ok.. lol

of coz we also have waffles there.  Eat it while hot it was sooooo good.  We also had the soba noodles which was good too!

They now have put chairs and a table on the outside so no need to bring the food home!!  I love their new bottle drinks ginger ale that has real ginger pieces inside.  We tried the original and pomegranate...  bubbly love it!
author: Jo L.

description: I came here yesterday after visiting the De Young since I was in the area and I was very happy that I did! I'm surprised that a place like this, as popular as it is, did not have a line at all when my girlfriend and I showed up around 1pm. Between the two of us, we ordered one of the waffle/wings combo, and then two other orders of wings. I think the total was about $30? Anyways, the wings here are fantastic. My favorite between chipotle, Chris' honey salty crispy pepper, and bacon parmesan was the bacon, which unfortunately isn't a permanent item on their menu, just like their well known ramen wings. Hot Sauce and Panko is rated #4 in SF for wings on Foursquare at the time of this review, and I'm not surprised at all. The wings here are so packed full of flavor. If you're especially sensitive to salt, you may want to order a small order as the wings here can get pretty salty after 6 wings. Bring your own water, as they do not have free water here, only bottled for $1.
author: Austin W.

description: We came for the wings.....noticed someone eating the waffle sandwich and added it to our order. The sensation brings the meat to levels that are rarely reached. One bite into the sandwich and we were totally quite. If you are in SF and don't try this you're nuts. Totally at must do
author: Ray J.

description: This place is legit. It's a chicken wing circus act in there. Super hard working Asian family putting out an amazing offering of wings. Totally stumbled upon this place while getting brewing supplies at SF Brewcraft next door. Had the Kentucky Yaki wings, incredible. And I'm not much of a eating meat clear off the bone kinda guy. But those lil' bones were clean when I got done. They definitely have a hard stop when orders are done. Eat outside at the stand up communal tables. Who cares about no parking, try the corner green zone spot. Great offering of handi-wipes and hand sanitizer too! I'll be going back.
author: casey c.

description:
Extensive menu, great quality food, and excellent buffalo wings.. If you love wings then this is the place for you. If you love spicy wings then welcome to heaven my friend! 

Large selection of all kinds of hot sauces as well.. I recommend calling in your order before hands to avoid the long wait. You can tell how busy they can get by their hours of operation but trust me.. It's worth it.
author: Kevin L.

description:
Best wing's i've ever tried. 

True mom and pops shop. 

Panko 2.0 with Peanut sauce, KFC and anything else you want to try! It's all honestly really good. 

The goliath will fill you up but the sauce they use is soooo good. It's not a sandwich.. its a damn beast and takes a beast to finish it and wings.
author: Brian Y.

description:
Made it there on Sunday afternoon-loved the wings! We got three flavors: Chris', Red Rooster, and Go-Go (KFC). All very good an my personal favorite is the red rooster. Can't wait to try out more flavors next time!!!

Service is pretty efficient and quick. Seating is limited in the store but nothing stops you from enjoying these delicious wings! I believe I can fly now I got these wings!
author: HopHop P.

description: I had the KOREAN FRIED HOUSE GOCHUJANG KOREAN HOT PEPPER PASTE and the best wings I have ever had was the OLD BAY WITH SRIRACHA CARAMEL I asked young man in line. He was right they were 5 stars good. If you are going to the Cliff house area you have to try with some beer on the beach for so.
author: Larry F.

description: Definitely better Wings than wing stop. Definitely order ahead of time if u don't have time to wait.  Tried the Bourbon yaki, Green, and panko 2.0 Wings. My favorite was the Bourbon yaki followed by the panko. The wings were hot and juicy, the crunch on the panko Wings was perfect and not burned.  Can't wait to come back next week for the ramen wings. Terrence the owner was very friendly. Great service and great Wings.
author: Chan T.

description: God, it's like crack, someone please check me into rehab. I can't stop coming here. Do yourselves a favor and don't 'try it'. The first time you have it, you'll be a hooked junkie like me. I gained five pounds already this month. Waffles and wings ya'll!
author: Jeff H.

description: I think i read too many reviews and expected alot more. The wings were good but i wasn't blown away. I was actually craving wing stop lemon pepper wings after i ate here. I would come back to give it a second try though!
author: Dave C.

description:
Last year, around the time of Superbowl 2012, I wrote this as a draft review: "I have an unfortunate prediction: by the next Superbowl, Hot Sauce and Panko will be out of business."  I wrote this because Hot Sauce and Panko was so impossibly good at making wings and so impossibly bad at customer service that I was convinced that there was no way that they would survive.  (My own personal story went along the lines of waiting for hours, multiple times, for wings that I had pre-ordered.)

I've never been so happy I was wrong.  Hot Sauce and Panko has kept up their incredible wings but managed to really get the customer service under their belt.  We ordered their wings this year for both the playoff game and Superbowl 2013, and they were ready with our orders even before our assigned slot came up.  It was an incredible change, and it makes me very optimistic for the future of this shop.

But you don't really care about my personal experiences; you care about the wings.  The wings are... man.  They're the best I've ever had.  I don't know what they're doing here, but they have some sort of magic that you have to try out, especially the bulgogi wings.  Their normal buffalo wings are no slouch either.  Go here, get the wings, and enjoy.  They're fantastic.
author: Nils J.

description: Great place, got the wings for my super bowl party.  I ordered Korean, BBQ and Buffalo.   Emailed the order in and they said to pick them up at 135pm.   Went out to pick them up and they had them ready right away.   I was in and out super fast.  The operation is clean, smooth and most of all the wings were great!
author: Jeffery S.

description:
Yummmy chicken wings, especially since they are korean fried chicken! 

Definitely a mom and pop's joint and I am in love with their amazing and tasty GREEN WINGS!! Nothing spells the chili lime and cilantro like how they make it here with a bit of heat. 
Always take them to go or you can try your luck and eat them there.
author: Mika D.

description: my husband got me the waffle and teriyaki chicken  now this was brought home so i'll give it a break because nothing is good when it is almost cold the waffle was alright it was not soft not the best the teriyaki chicken was ok. sause was not bad but really sweet over chicken that had been fried for a little while . the price was about $11-$12 my husband said they gave 7 wings because they were small or it would have been 6 wings . not the best I think but maybe if it were hot . I don't know might give it one more try in the future. it is really small there , mainly a to go place.
author: Nellie J.

description:
Have you ever watched that movie called, Weird Science? If you haven't, I suggest to watch it! The guy behind the counter who make these delicious chicken wings are absolutely UH-MAY-ZING! I don't know how he does it, but whatever kind of science, magic, or whatnot...one word: phenomenal!!

My SO was telling me this who-ha deal about this cool chicken wings place in SF and read it somewhere on Yelp that we HAD to go check it out for ourselves. Thanks to him, this is by far, my favorite spot to cure my fried chicken cravings!

Small spot and minimal places to sit down, we looked over their one page menu figuring out what to order. I suggested we start off the first two, so our next visits we can work our way down the listed items. So far, we've tried the following:

green (cilantro, jalapeno, ginger, sesame oil and house spice mix): I love the hint of jalapeno and cilantro mixed into their house spice mix. Mild in flavor so it's not spicy as you may think because of the jalapeno. This is my favorite!!

kfc (Korean fried chicken: garlic, ginger, soy sauce, gojujang, vinegar, sesame oil, blue agave, coated, triple fried): I love the garlic and sweetness flavor of the chicken with the right crispiness after my first bite! Not bad for all the fixin' flavors mixed together.

bulgogi (Korean marinated BBQ sweet soyu sauce, coated, triple fried) I'm not quite a fan of this one in particular. It didn't come out as I pictured it in my head. I may have to try it again to give it another go. Seemed a bit similar to KFC but completely drenched with the sauce so I couldn't get the crisp texture when eating the chicken all the way through.

ten-spice (used 10 spice instead of 5, garlic, ginger, coated, triple fried resulting in a "pomme souffle effect") Another favorite of mine! I sure love my chicken wings spicy! This wasn't fiery and flaming-hot-in-my-mouth kind of chicken so I'm still working my way down the REAL hot sauce chicken wings. However, I enjoyed the little hint of spiciness and garlic resulting in a "fro souffle effect." 

skinny fries: nothing but average fries. You can't really call it anything special.

Belgian waffle (whipped cream): we had the choice of whipped cream or butter. Of course, we went with the sweet tooth craving opting for whipped cream. I tried a small bite of the waffle without drizzling nutella hazelnut chocolate, boy-oh-boy....soft, chewy, and deliciously sweet and tasty with a little bit of crunch from the outer part of the waffle! Goes great hand-in-hand with the chicken wings! FYI: Free waffle on Thursdays!!

All mentioned above, this is only the beginning. I'm still working on the rest of the menu. I'm coming back for more! The owner and cook is super sweet and funny! I love their SpotOn app they use too. Check-in and earn a small pan-size of chicken wings after a couple of trips here! You can't help but look at the galore of hot sauces shelved around you! I spotted numerous amount of hot sauces including sweet and garlicky sauces. The wait time may be 10-20 minutes but that doesn't stop me from coming back. Well priced for the amount of chicken wings you get. They're not your typical small wings you get at BWW or Hooters. This is WAY better than those chain spots!

I'm a fan!!
author: Fraulein C.

description: CrossFit workout just crushed me. Driving home, ravenous. Need tasty protein. Enter Hot Sauce and Panko, a relatively new wing spot and hot sauce shop in the hood just 3 blocks away. 10+ types of wings, went for the Korean Fried. 15 minute wait? All good, dropped into Swig next door for a craft beer. Picked up my wings (9, they say at least 8 for small order), finished half the wings (4) on the walk back to the car, finished the other half (5) driving three blocks home using me knee to steer. Don't tell my CHP brother. Needless to say it was delicious. Crispy, tender, juicy, sweet, spicy. This place is going to be very, very dangerous for me. And now my keyboard is covered with gochujang (Korean Hot Paste). Everything is awesome.
author: Al L.

description:
I happened to walk by this place randomly, but most folks would not find it were it not for the help of their fellow Yelpers.

Rows and rows and ROWS of hot sauce line the walls, some that might be familiar to you, many that will not.  All kinds of peppers are represented in these bottles, from ghost peppers to scotch bonnet to habenero.  There is even a little tasting bar so you can try before you buy.

But that's not all, because what vehicle to best deliver hot sauce to your system than wings?  They make all kinds of wings to eat there (sitting outside) or to go, and on Thursdays you can even get free waffles with your choice of wings!

It's a unique place with a good sense of humor and a must-try for hot sauce lovers.
author: Liz S.

description:
How awesome is it to have a place like this in the City?  I recently found out about this place through Yelp and boy did it not disappoint.  Their waffle and 5 wing combo for $5.99 is one of the best cheap eats deals out there.  It was so good I decided to order a pan (50 wings) for the NFC Championship game against the Giants (boo!).  My friends were impressed.  

I still like the bulgogi wings the best.  If you like southern comfort food, this is the spot.  Support a local joint like Hot Sauce and Panko that produces great food at a great price.
author: Sunny W.

description:
This is the best wings place. The food is amazing, with many flavors of wings to try. In addition to the great wings, they also have waffle sandwiches and a massive collection of hot sauces. I have always been treated well here. 

A couple things to note, the dining area is small and they do not serve alcohol. 

You can ask next door and CHOMP to bring your wings over there. They lets us do that so we could enjoy a beer with the wings.

This is my first Yelp review and I finally made an account just to give this place props.
author: Matt H.

description:
Ok i hate people that always give 5 stars but i feel it's appropriate for this joint, word up. Had the Green wangs for the first time and dug em the most, i even tricked my girlfriend into eating them and she claims she doesnt like cilantro but of course she didnt notice and totally liked them. the Bulgogi were aight but im not the biggest fan of sweet so ask somebody else I suppose. 

The real shit is also the straight up fried 1/4 chicken so i really think you should get that if you're a first timer. only thing is i really dug the multi colored potatoes over fries, in case anyone's reading this maybe you can brang them sh*ts back.

Good call on moving to the smaller wings btw, im all for it. Woulda liked to check the Persians but didnt make it in time. Used to have some really dope sauces for the fried chix but didnt see em this time, my vote goes to all of them but the sweetest. I think there was one that reminded me of a hot greenish Thai sauce but not totally sure. 

In any case keep it up yall and excellent call on the 7:30 close time on fri/sat. Now all we need is to get the bike messenger delivery boys on this and next = world domination.
author: billy m.

description:
3.5
Pretty small place with no bathrooms. They have quite some unique flavors although nothing super amazing.

Regular 5.89 7-8 wings
Large 8.89 11-12 wings

Green 
tasted kinda like the chinese ginger and green onion sauce that goes with chicken with some minced jalopanos. The wings are noticeably smaller than buffalo wild wings and about the same size as wing stop. 3.5/5

Chris Honey Salty Crispy Pepper
the breading for these wings was more fluffy and sweet and overwhelmed any salty or pepper flavor. 3.5/5

Free Whaffle on Thursdays with purchase and free hot sauce on the shelves. Overall, I would still go to buffalo wild wings over this place but If I am in the neighborhood and craving wings, shanghai house, san tung, and hot sauce and panko are my places of choice.
author: Robert Y.

description: Definitely a fan, even though I got cold leftover wings.  Will definitely want to try them fresh.
author: Edgar C.

description:
This place does one thing... wings. It resembles an eatery in asia, as if someone carved out their garage/downstairs of their house into food-service location.

Wings were definitely great. They have  different selections and flavors, so pick out the sauces to your hearts desire!

The hype here met my expectations. Would definitely come out here again. Worth getting off the beaten path to come visit and try!

Hope that helps, have a great day Yelp!
author: Andrew Y.

description:
Simply put, the best wings on the planet. The standard by which all other wings should be judged.
Yes, you have to wait for them. Yes, it would be wonderful if they had a bigger shop and could put more wings out faster. I suspect that will come in time ..,, or maybe not. But long waits will not dissuade those who seek wing perfection.
author: Michael B.

description: The journey continues - the latest foray was bulgogi - it's often recommended by the staff - and let me tell you - faithful reader - they know what they're talking about - bulgogi is an interesting (savory, umami, with a bit of sweet) flavor and it pairs unbelievably well with the hot sauce - the combination results in something greater than the sum of its parts - it's probably my 2nd favorite now after the green.
author: Oleg H.

description: First time I came to this place, I didn't know what to expect. But I ordered the KFC sandwich and the Green Wings and they're the BOMB. I do prefer this more than Wingstop and Buffalo Wild Wings. They have so much flavor in their wings and it's just so delicious! I did order a small Green but they gave me a little extra! This place got me extremely bloated.. DEFINITELY TRY THIS PLACE OUT!
author: Angela L.

description:
The best wings I ever had... 

Our favs:
- Belgium Waffles (eat it with the Green Wings)
- Korean Fried Chicken
- Green Wings
- Garlic Parmesean
- Ten Spice

They have specials every week, with very unique takes on wings. Follow em' on Twitter to find out what they're doing every week. 

They make things fresh to order so it takes some time. But your patience will be rewarded. It's best to call in your order ahead of time. 

There is very little seating, maybe a few tables total. Parking is limited. Might have to drive blocks to look for a spot to park. 

They've got a wall of hot sauce, too. It's fun to look through all the bottles and their unique names.
author: Fathen Z.

description:
Must get: Chris's, Green and Go Ju. 

Fresh white meat. Every wing was crunchy and succulent. 

Don't even want to over-word this one, it's pure crackzilla city in there.
author: Max K.

description: Oh wow. The hype is real. This place is definitely amazing . They have a good variety of flavors. The portions are not big. I think you get like six wings... For a little over $6 ... Lol and its more of a snack depending on how much you eat. On Thursdays you can get a free waffle with their check in. The waffle is good! Looks plain but dam, it mell in your mouth! Dint expect to sit because theres like literally  4 seats. There are also tables outside  where you can stand and eat. Unfortunately they open at inconvenient hours so good luck!
author: Kristina L.

description:
Came here with Spideymike for a long delayed lunch.

Green Wings: everyone recommended it... and I see why! This was very similar to a sauce Janette's cousin makes in the sense that there's cilantro and lime with a good amount of heat that's more for flavor (its not hot at all, but the slight burn really opens up your taste buds). Perfectly fried, all the pieces were very juicy

10 Spice: surprisingly the more spices you add, the milder it tastes... not quite as overwhelming as 5 spice can be (its as if the star anise gets subdued by the other spices). this actually worked great. Again, perfectly fried and just salty enough to get the juices flowing... very good.

Waffle - very good... i typically don't like big squared waffles, but this was perfect for a few reasons... 1) it was not sweet at all, so all of the sweetness comes from the syrup if you add. 2) since it isnt sweet, you can add the wing meat and make a sandwich with it, which is really good, and since it isn't salty at all, you aren't really impacting the flavor of the chicken, and are instead creating an envelope of awesome. 3) with the butter and syrup, this is super good...  and I would rate this waffle at the same level as Little Skillet's

A little pricey for wings but given the amount of flavors and specialization, and real estate for storage, it evens out... not to mention they're so good, that I'm glad this place is out of the way... because I'd probably be fat and broke.
author: Marc T.

description:
IM ADDICTED AND NEED TO COME BACK ASAP!
the wings were amazing, if i remember correctly they also had waffles too. this is a secret spot for super bomb chicken and waffle combination! its a must try!
author: Armand W.

description: Crazy good variety,  great flavor and great cool Atmosphere,  barely room for 4 to eat comfy.  Take to go.. Or street food vibe.. Well worth it.. Will be back!
author: Elijah R.

description:
Taste - 5 star
Bulgogi wings: this is my personal favorite. Some may find it a bit too sweet. For me it's perfect since I like my savory food a bit sweet.  The Bulgogi sauce added tons of flavor to the wings without making them soggy.  The coating kept the wings crispy outside and tender and moist inside.
Green wings: I've had it twice. Somewhat unique flavor. I like it but wouldn't crave for it.

Service - 3 star (according to Yelp's rating definition)
Not long after the shop opened, I had a not-so-pleasant experience.  I went in one day within an hour before they closed and was told they had run out of wings.  While I could blame myself for not having checked in advance, the response I got was less than desired - just that "we have no wing left"; not a single word of sorry or offering a tip how to make sure I get my wings next time.

My recent experience with the staff was definitely better but nothing special.  For a small neighborhood shop, I would expect the staff to be a bit more friendly.  They were indeed nice to some regulars as far as I've seen but I haven't experienced that myself.

Tips: a) if you go near the closing time, do check first just so you don't leave empty handed; b) wings are made fresh, meaning the wait can be long.
author: Elaine H.

description:
This place is just freakin awesome. You walk in, they have hot sauces everywhere (with these hella sassy and creative names), and just plain old funny stuff posted on the walls. 

The big drawback is the size of the place. Extremely tiny, less than a 10 by 10 size area that fits about 5 or 6 people inside. 

Aside from that, you can't really go wrong on the menu. All the hot wings are just soooo gooood and delicious. The katsu ones are ok though, but I think they made an improvement on the menu for thatsince the last time I went. Order the sandwiches or chicken and waffles, too. Nothing is bad and everything has a unique taste. My personal favorites are Chris's honey crispy pepper wings. OMG :00. 

Other than that, I don't get any cravings for this place, but it's really decent and quality comfort foods.
author: Gino G.

description:
Quite possibly the best wings I've ever had, definitely the best in San Francisco. A very unique atmosphere, I love the odd assortment of toys and pictures hanging everywhere and the huge assortment of hot sauces gives me something to read while I wait for my wings.

Yes, it takes a decent amount of time occasionally for the food to come up.  It's usually a single person making the food and they put all their attention into it, I've had mass produced wings before ala Wing Stop or Wild Wings and they're always drowning in mediocre sauce, here everything is expertly made and I'll gladly wait for it. People have also mentioned that you can buy a beer at Chomp & Swig while you wait which is a great idea, they're also wonderful.

All in all if you're not in some hyper rush or trying to cater your party then I'd 100% recommend this place. I live right around the corner from them and I've never been disappointed.
author: Jacob T.

description:
If you're looking for delicious chicken wings, just hot sauce or the spiciest chicken wings, this is the shop for you. They have a huge variety of hot sauce ranging from mild to insanely hot. They have a little table to the right where you can sample quite a few of their hot sauces. A little taste before you buy type of thing.

This shop sells chicken wings, sandwiches, and waffles. The chickens wings are extremely great. Their XXX hot wings live up to its name. The wings have a delayed reaction... so you'll be like this isn't hot... then wham... a boxer's right hook. Insanely spicy. This makes Wing Stop's atomic wings look like grade school stuff.

For people who aren't fans of spicy stuff, they have quite a bit of non spicy flavors that are great. I recommend the Thai peanut. That sauce is very tasty.

There isn't really a place to eat in this store. It's pretty small.. sort of your hole in the wall type of store. There are like 3 seats inside and 2 seats outside to eat though. This place accepts credit cards and cash. It seems that they have a computer for customers to use.
author: Steven B.

description: I needed a large order for a work event and have a budget of 300.00+, I got there around 11:10AM and didn't realize they weren't open until 11:30AM. I thought OK I can ask to make the order since they were obviously taking phone orders, I could ask to have it delivered or picked up later. Well I was ignored at the front door for a good 10 minutes and when I fianlly got someone's attention I told them I had a big order and do they deliver? the person handed me a caviar card and told me to go through them and walked away as if I was wasting her time. She was much more interested in an engrossing conversation everyone seemed to be having in the back. I told her she was losing a large sale but she didn't seem to mind at all. These people obviously hate their clientele and know nothing on running a business that serves the public. I took my business somewhere else where the food and service was excellent!
author: Sf T.

description: OMG the wings are legit! dont know what took me so long to try them but they are amazing!!!! be ready to wait in line and sit on the street to enjoy them because this place is a tiny hole in the wall. but totally worth it! I seriously crave their wings all the time! Also the waffles are legit as well!
author: Nia R.

description: My local chicken dealer keeps slangin' that good ish! I'm not addicted though, I can stop whenever I want.  Lol.
author: Michael G.

description:
Fantaaastic asian inspired wings. Hands down the best gourmet chicken wings joint in San Francisco. 
Their flavors are unique, and very satisfying. 

The Green Wings:
Not my favorite, but still very very good. It has a traditional Mexican kick to it! Chile lime complimented with cilantro. The lime was slightly too heavy for me.

KFC Wings: 
*Favorite.* They are covered in a sweet thick glaze and sprinkled with sesame seeds. Perfectly sweet and salty. It's hard to get these two flavors to work so well together! I would definitely go back to get more.

The Buffalo Wings: 
You can never go wrong with chicken wings. I got them "hot" and they were insanely spicy, but worked well with the tart sauce. I'll turn the heat down a notch next time. Still very good compared to the other buffalo wings I've tried in SF.

The service is amazing, the staff is friendly and the ambiance is friendly and inviting. 
The place is definitely worth trying out!
author: Veronica L.

description: Why you gotta leave the hood?  Why not just move down Clement or something?
author: Floyd B.

description: Best wings in SF. Not much competition around as they are the only ones who create delicious blends of flavors with fresh ingredients and not the standard buffalo sauce version you can find in most bars.  Have tried about 7 different flavors in two visits and all have had their own special uniqueness. Each wing is meaty and cooked to perfection. Odd hours but that makes it even more special when you are lucky enough to get in. Love this place!
author: Ayrn H.

description:
Great little joint with one sit down table, a bar table for 2-3 to stand and eat, and a couple of tables outside but keep in mind it's the Richmond and chilly most days. The chicken and waffle sandwich was awesome and only $6.95 and made to order  Boneless chicken, likely breast, fried up perfectly with a cabbage slaw and a very tasty sriracha sauce. Included a tomato but not sure if this was necessary or added to the sandwich. You can fold up the waffle and eat like a sandwich but I opted to eat the slaw, fried chicken, and waffle separately so I could dip my waffle in syrup to enjoy the sweet and savory independently.  This isn't your traditional chicken and waffle but a great play on the classic in a paper bowl at a very affordable price. 

Will be back!!!!
author: Tony N.

description:
get the crispy honey pepper wings!  Just as good as san tung without the ridiculous wait.  

the restaurant (if you can even call it that) is tiny, with only 8 spots to sit.  Takeout might be a better option here.
author: Cindy C.

description:
I love this place! Yeah, it's small so getting a table is a challenge at time but they have some amazing wings and waffles and a funky decor to keep you entertained while you wait. 

My favourites are the Red Rooster wings and the Green wings! Yum
author: Leanne S.

description: I love love their ghost pepper chicken. The hotter the better for me an they met my expectations. If you also like ghost pepper chicken, get there early, they sell out quickly and they do close early, Another great thing, after getting your order of chicken go to the bar next door and have a drink, they will let you eat there..
author: D. S.

description:
I tried a regular order of KFC and a regular Chris' Honey Salty Crispy Pepper (CHSCP?). One saucy variety, one sauce-less variety. Phew--all 14 wings, gone!

The house sauce on the KFC wings was tangy, spicy, Korean-y and perfect with rice. Size-wise, the chicken wings were "normal" compared to the "monstrously mutant" wings you'd find elsewhere (7 of Wing Lee/San Tung's wings =  10-11 wings from here). I didn't seem to mind this so much, since I've always wondered how full of hormones those unnaturally giant but oh-so-tasty wings could be filled with. Crisp-factor was perfect. Not over-fried, not under-fried. Juicy in the center.

CHSCP wings were good, but they didn't knock my socks off. The sweetness from the honey was a little too faint. Seasoned well..yes, but they may have been even better with a bit of roasted chili powder or some other dry-spicy-kick-in-your-pants (jalapeno peppers?).

Overall, I can never say no to good chicken wings, and this place definitely has some good ones! I hope to come back soon to try the other varieties, which seem to change on a regular basis. Maybe I'll bring the French BF here...then again, this wonderful hole in the wall explodes with so many hot sauces (to try/buy) it might send him running! Yay for Hot Sauce and Panko--my new favorite place that has a perfect health score, friendly service, and quality wings!
author: Liz L.

description: Another neighborhood gem opens in Russian Hill!!!  Hyde Street is set now!  Was thrilled to hear that Panko which I loved when they were out on Clement moved to my hood.  This place is sooo good.  Delicious wings and waffles - great to pick up when having friends over, watching the game, or just a tough day when you hate life and definitely don't want to cook lol.  Great sweet little set up and hope they do great here in the hood.
author: Kat C.

description: I never had such a bad service. I wanted some wings on a saturday afternoon 4:50 pm. I read a lot of good things on yelp and wanted to give it a try. When i came to the place they literraly through me out. They told me it is closed (at 4:50) and they will not serve me. I have to leave the store. The weird thing was, that there were other people in the store who got their food. I was very angry and yeah... i told all my friend no to go to this place any time. Bad luck. In my entire life no restaurant has treated me like this.
author: Marco T.

description:
WOOOWWW!!!!

Holy chicken wings Batman!!  These guys are SERIOUS!!  These aren't just wings, they're science!

Not just your standard Buffalo wings flavor, they offer lots of Asian inspired flavored wings.  Some are listed as triple-fried; some are listed as coated and others aren't.  The chicken is HUGE, JUICY, and DELICIOUS!!!

In case you can't tell from all the exclamation marks and all caps, I REALLY like this place.

First visit:  Korean Fried Chicken Wings = AMAZING!!  Slight tanginess, slight sweetness, slight spice, all in perfect harmony.

Second visit:  Buffalo Wings - hot = AMAZING!.  I find that most times you ask for "hot" and they're actually quite "medium".  Not an issue here!  These "hot" wings are actually quite "on fire"!  They were really spicy, but also really tasty.  

If I had any negatives, and I really hate to refer to it as a "negative", it would be the fries.  The fries are fine, not spectacular, and it would be nice if they took as much pride in their fries as they do the wings, you know, home sliced potatoes, sea salt, maybe some herbs.

Otherwise, HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!  Best hot wings in San Francisco!
author: Joshua B.

description: I want to go a ahead and state that these are the best Wings I have ever tasted. Thank you, Hot Sauce & Panko
author: Sophia P.

description:
I've had my share of chicken and waffles in the city and I must say, this place has the best combination ever..if you can get over your head that it's just chicken wings and not the rest of the chicken pieces. 

THE WAFFLE: The best waffle I have ever had. Normally, most chicken and waffle places skimp on this aspect, making the waffle really soggy and bland but THIS waffle. man. It's crispy, warm, fresh and although I have yet to try the whipped cream, the butter makes it so nice on top of that syrup.
'DAT. WAFFLE. mmmmm. 

BUFFALO wing After trying different types of wings, getting the buffalo chicken is pretty much my staple whenever I need to get a H.S.A.P fix. It's not your typical crispy buffalo wing but there's something in that sauce that gives it a nice kick and a pickled taste, which if it weren't for the hot-ness, I would instantly devour them quickly like the cookie monster eating cookies. Really. 

KFC wings: A mildly spicy wing with some sweetness because of the agave. It definitely reminds me of the sauce used in many korean dishes and it's finger licking good.

BULGOGI Wings: Very crispy wing with a side of the bulgogi sauce that you can use to dip or completely drench the wing in. The one thing I really like about this wing is that it's very well made. Often times, chicken wings are either too crispy to the point that the meat is really dry or that the fryer was not hot enough so the skin is just mushy, oily and just. gross. (This is why I'm so picky with eating chicken skin.) This place has the PERFECT balance. 

HABANERO wings: unfortunately, it seems like this wing has been discontinued but asides from the buffalo, it was actually my favorite because it had a really good balance of tangyness and spice. Perhaps one day they'll have it back up. * hint hint* :)

GREEN wings:  A dry spice rubbed wing with cilantro, ginger and jalapeno. It's really good and the jalapeno gives the wings a mild flavor, which is good for those who don't really like wings that are too spicy. 


Ahhh the best part about this place is that it's right in my neighborhood.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
I give them 3.5 stars for the food and 2 stars for the service. 
It was Wed night my friend and I were excited to finally try these wings so we decided to go in and order to go. We had a party of 4 that was joining us for dinner that night so 25 wings was what we needed. We go in we see one other person in there, good this will be a fast order, NOT!! So we see a sign NO walk in 1/2 pan orders (25 wings) WTF!!! Umm it was our first time there, HOW WOULD WE KNOW?? So I asked the lady well should I walk outside and call in to place the order? She was SO RUDE and said well then you will be waiting an hour and a half before we give you your order. WTF!! SHE IS RUDE AND A LIAR!!! I have NEVER been to a place where they did not want to sell us food! So my friend and I try to figure out how to feed 4 people enough without being denied! Here we go...
Waffle and 5 wing combo (Bugolgi wings)
Order of 15 wings (Buffalo sauce, and Korean sauce)...
15 minutes later after putting our order in I'm thinking there is NO way 15wings is enough for 4 people!! I get up to order 10 more curry wings and she hands me my bag of already done food. (Keep in mind 15 wings in 15 minutes!).
Then she gives me attitude for ordering 10 curry wings and says to me it will take 40minutes! I said that's fine, I knew she was lying! I timed it, took 15minutes! 
THAT was the WORST customer service ever, she could of saved us all some time and took my half a pan order of 25 wings that I ended up getting anyways! She just wasted containers which is MONEY for the company and wasted My time ordering 2 times and pissed off a potential client who would of came back multiple times if she wasn't RUDE! By the way the guy who was the cook was VERY NICE, he made me feel a little better with his positive attitude, got some of the sour taste out of my mouth. If you are the owner dude, you need to get rid of this lady or train her to be NICE. 

So now on to the food- Bugolgi and Korean was our favorite Buffalo was ok and Curry was over battered and tasted blah. Waffle was tasty and syrups were good too, just wish I ate it before it got a bit soggy. IF I were to go back Bugolgi is what I would get the most of. Chicken was perfectly cooked and juicy in the middle.

(I just read the note from the owner to me and I FEEL Threatened and disrespected just because I am a yelper and stated the facts about my experience there. Yelp is where I found out about your business in the first place, I saw the high ratings and the photos that made your food look good. I don't typically read a restaurant's blog before going in so I had NO CLUE about any threats that were placed against the owners, which is very sad and unfortunate, sorry for that. But you can't blame all yelpers or all of your clients for others mistakes. Maybe think of a solution to why customers are unhappy and try to fix it. Hire another staff member if it's becoming too overwhelming, but it's not cool taking it out on your clients who are not threatening you and just there for some good food. And to top it off post these comments on my wall threatening people they might end up buried in your backyard, I don't think I feel comfortable walking into your business again even if I think those bugolgi wings are good. Sorry for your misfortune and good luck! )
author: Karen T.

description:
Very unique flavors here. I tried the bulgogi and KFC wings. Bulgogi was good, but a little too sweet for my liking. The KFC had a nice spicy kick to it. But when I saw "korean fried chicken," I was imagining something like San Tung's dry fried chicken wings. So I disappointed myself when it was nothing like it. The sweet potato fries were pretty good. They're more waffle shaped then fries shaped though. Some pieces had a little too much salt on it too. But overall, it was a nice meal.

Came back the next day to try their fried chicken sandwich but they said they weren't making it that day (why put it on the menu if it's not a daily thing?). So I had their bulgogi slider instead and was a disappointment. Nothing special about it. Tried their Green chicken wings too, and that was unique. But I'm not a fan of curry much so I would skip it next time. 

Overall, I would stick to the wings here (but I still want to try their fried chicken sandwich!).

Not much room to dine in here. So I suggest ordering a head of time for pickup.
author: Linh T.

description:
Be careful of the Ghost Pepper Wings they have changed the way they prepare it. There are three variety of the Ghost Pepper wings. 

If you are looking for older way just order regular ghost pepper wings, i have been having these quite regularly and they are something which can be handled.

The other types are quite hot.
author: Y U.

description: These wings are bomb. So much love into each variety. I had the Sticky, garlic panko parmesian, and bacon wrapped. Favorites were the sticky and the panko. Will be coming back.
author: Ryan S.

description:
Interesting new addition to the outer richmond neighborhood. Hot Sauce and Panko can easily be missed when you drive down the street every time you enter the strip of restaurants on clement. I think a wild, medium sized tree blocks this location from being seen by the rest of the world. har har har. But im kinda glad that it is because then i dont have to wait. this lil gem of a store has some of the best, and also cheapest waffles available in the city. When you walk in, you can instantly smell those sweet sweet waffles being made on the insta-grill; they are constantly made on an infinite basis. Supply and Demand. It'll take about 5 minutes a waffle, but be patient, you will not be disappointed. Panko momma and Panko poppa have gotchu covered.

5 star waffles, whip cream over butter 5 out of 7 times a week. ~4bucks each

4 star green chicken, interesting flavors and I appreciate how its not soggy even tho take out. ~7bucks

3 star fries, reminds me of mcdonald fries but they wilted quite quickly. 
~4bucks

Hot Sauce and Panko also has an app that lets you build up check-in stamp cards via app. I think if you check in 10 times u get some free chicken wangs, and a hot sauce off the wall of fire if you check in 25 times. I think u can just come in everyday and buy somethin small til u make it to the rewards, but only if u are a fan (u would have to spend basically 250 bucks worth of waffles for a ~10$ bottle of hot sauce; even banks have better interest rates than that!) But if u are a diehard fan of these mouth-watering waffles, and these not-as-good-as-san-tung-but-still-good-enough-for-the-sake-of-convenience then u've found your new home at Panko shop.

-wifive
author: simon k.

description:
boooo, I'm sorry hot sauce and panko, I have to give you a negative review because you were my only lunch stop on my full free day of gallivanting in the Bay. 

First , I didn't hear about you through yelp, i heard about you through this website called thrillist. When I showed the picture of the ramen wings to my friends they were super excited to try you out. 

But to no avail we got there and it seemed like your whole staff gave us the stank eye...which made us super hesitant to even eat there. No ramen wings, I must admit I didn't drive 5 and 1/2 hours just for your restaurant..but I could've easily went to the surrounding spots to get some better grub. 

Your cashier was cool and I could tell she was trying to hide the anxiety of me inquiring about your wings , the only sunshine i experienced at your establishment was the dirty blonde that gave us our food. 

Your wings are okay. I wouldn't make it a priority to come back..but please next time work on your customer service from the get go and oh yea give the old asian guy with a glasses a chill pill.
author: Mike P.

description: Yummy! Better than bww! I got the green and panko parm wings and a free waffle for checking into spoton (only on Thursdays). Everything made to order so my food was deliciously hot when it was given to me. I  deducted a star for the lack of seating! I came here luckily at an odd time of the day (around 3pm) so I was able to get a seat but the table right next to me was so close I could hear their conversation. I didn't have my own bubble to consume my meal. Also I noticed that behind the kitchen is a door that I could see piles of trash and junk. Gasp! The places looks dirty enough maybe they should at least close that door so no one can see it! And a tip for the store, wipe down all those hot sauces once in a awhile it's starting to look like a display of dusts not hot sauce! Too many immediate turn offs in the place but I guess the food makes up for it!
author: Marie N.

description:
I have made it my life's work to eat fried chicken in every joint in San Francisco.   I ate here on a whim.  Did not know it existed but I went for Pho to my fav place and it had closed on me.  I was heading back to the other pho place and drove past HotSauce and Panko.  I was intrigued.  

Small place, four seat inside, four outside.  If they were smart they would purchase the parking space in front of their store, set up an awning, an outdoor heater and more tables.

I ordered the KFC wings (Korean Chicken Wings) and some sweet potato fries.  It was only me so I just got one.   I was surprised at the price.  I thought they were very expensive.  I'm not sure if they were going for premium price or just trying to make their money back, still... I'm a sucker for wings.

It did take a while.  I know that it takes time to cook food good.  I didn't mind in the least.  
The owner, working the fryer, was intent on his work but when I cracked a joke he had an easy laugh.  I was able to make him laugh a few other times too, though he did not say to much.  The young man working the register was sweet and attentive.  The shop interesting with all those bottles of hotsauce.

I sat down at a table, right next to a couple of guys in tats (and clothes) getting their banquet order of wings.  The tables were just close enough to feel a bit uncomfortable but I just put that out of my mind (not because of the tats, but just cause I felt like I was joining their party)

The wings were amazing!!!  Large, succulent, crispy and juicy inside. That sauce was spicy and sweet. I thought it might be a bit too spicy, but after a few bites the sweet won out over the spicy.  It was wonderful. Best wings I have in a very long time.  They keep this up and they are going to have to move to a larger place.

The two guys next to me were getting ready to leave and offered me a taste of their wing choices.  So I got to taste the green wings and the buffalo too.  The green wings were amazing.  I am going to order them next time. Buffalo, their way, was too hot for me.

The sweet potato fries were just, OK.  They were a bit soggy and were probably frozen.  They might look into double frying their potato product because I've seen a few dis'es about the fried potatoes on here.

Over all:  I can't wait to go back.  This could become my fav binge place.  Keep it up guys.  We love what you do!.
author: Stephanie G.

description:
Check out the decor. Look at the font on the menu. This place has a peculiar sense of humor I guess.

Then you will be awestruck by the selection of hot sauces that line the walls. 

They say their menu changes every week and we had the following:
Ultra goliath chicken waffle sandwich- liked this the most. Unbelievable sweet and spicy sauce on fried boneless chicken. Enough for two to share. 
Green chicken- I liked this more than the garlic parmesan because the jalapeno and cilantro was a refreshing change after the waffle sandwich.
Garlic Parmesan chicken- only if you can handle garlic and cheese.  

Although they offer several hot sauces for the chicken, I recommend that you forgo them because they cover the unique flavors.

Also, the bottled pomegranate drink is great.
author: Alfred L.

description: Omg this place!!!  cant go wrong with the KFC and the Green . I want more!! The girl at the register was so nice and the place had an all around good vibe. To bad i live 5 hours away. Delivery?!?!
author: Tyler B.

description:
This place is AWESOME :] The first time I went here I came back for Free Waffle Thursday(or Wednesday I think) (It's Belgium and fluffy, topped with a slice of butter)! The place is a little small but it's has a comfortable and homey feel to it. 

I love the owner! I'm not sure what his name was, but he loves recommending his favorite sauces, as well as which ones pair well with which flavor of chicken you order. I even asked him what his personal favorite was one day and he personally put his favorite hot sauce on my table and let me have a taste! They have a huge selection of sauces, but if you love heat and are up for the challenge try a teaspoon of the Ghost Pepper on your wings, I swear it'll make you sweat!

This place is a great place to go if you really want a quiet but friendly atmosphere. There's free coffee and water (no Starbucks, but hell its free). Also they have condiments for waffles such as caramel sauce and... BACON flavored syrup :] 

The wings are a little pricey, I think you average around $1 per wing but you definitely get what you pay for. I've tried all of their wings so far and my favorites are the Green wings and the Bulgogi. 
1. The Green wings have a great mix of cilantro and jalapeno flavor with just the right amount of saltiness. They're crispy, tender and moist! They're great for people who want dry wings, rather than having something lathered in sauce. 
2. The Bulgogi wings are saucy, but they still have a slight crisp to them, which gives it a great texture! The sauce is delicious (it's a mix of Korean hot sauce, sesame seed oil and magic) :] This is really good for people who want some Asian Persuasion on their wings!
3. The other flavors are worth a try (only if you're up for the challenge and have the budget) (another favorite of mine was the Thai-Peanut sauce wings)

In general this is a really great place! The wings are delicious, the atmosphere is great for casual dates and hang outs! The owner is amazing company! The sauces are exotic and amazing! 

So take a ride on the wild side! Try some delicious wings and enjoy browsing the gallery of hot sauces while you wait, such as Gringo-Bandito, Ass Reaper, Colon Cleanser, and Smack My Ass and Call Me Sally (I think that's what it's called?)
author: Jade C.

description:
I only came here because a friend wrote a bad review on FB saying how bad the service was and to avoid this place, etc.. Of course bad publicity is good publicity. I went on Yelp and saw they had 4 stars and thought I'd try it. The service wasn't bad at all. We waited a while for the chicken but I expected it because I read this on Yelp. The waffle was really good. I like how they have maple syrup, strawberry, and blueberry for you to choose from. The waffle was perfectly crispy and delicious. The chicken was really good as well. I had the KFC (which tasted like the korean chili sauce but with a sweetness) and the green onion one. Both very good. They have flavors that you don't typically find. I will definitely come back.

Service: The cashier was talking to everyone and helping every that walked in. Not related to food necessary, but just chatting it up. I thought she was nice. Maybe my friend experienced a different person but I thought this pace is a great addition to the neighborhood.
author: Karen L.

description:
Super small and super yummy. My bf and I got to this little hole in the wall only a few minutes after opening and it was already standing room only. We both are always on hunt for the most flavorful and affordable (cheap) digs we can find, and I was not disappointed. 

We ordered the KFC (korean fried chicken) and the ultra goliath. The wings had great flavor & texture, nicely crispy and perfectly glazed in the sauce. I'm not super familiar with Korean food, so have nothing to compare the gochujang sauce to, but thought it was a nice combination of rich flavor without feeling too heavy or overdone. I could have handled a bit more spice in the wings, but luckily a wide variety of yummy hot sauces were available for dipping. 

The Ultra Goliath was my bf's choice...not sure I would have chosen it myself, but I was pleasantly surprised. The waffle was REALLY good (i want to go back to get one by itself), as was the chicken on top, but I didn't feel that the other toppings (cabbage/mayo/sriracha/tomato) went together very well. just didn't seem to meld together & was difficult to eat. my boyfriend was disappointed with the dish, but i just picked through to get bites of the chicken & waffle and added my own sauce & thought it tasted pretty good. 

overall, 4 stars. great flavors all around, and the wings, waffle & chicken were all well cooked. pretty safe bet, too, bc if you don't like something about your order there are enough sauces on hand to fix whatever you feel is lacking! i definitely want to make it back and try some of the other wings they've got on the menu....nom nom nom
author: Kaden F.

description: The wings are amazing - have a little crisp on the outside with a perfect amount of sauce on top. And the waffle...fluffy and soft. I put white chocolate syrup and butter to top it off.
author: Renata G.

description: Finally got around to trying this place. It's such a small shop but with the diverse display of sauce bottle displays on the wall, it's hard to miss. We ordered the $5.99 combo, which included 5 wings and a belgian waffle or a choice of side. We went with the waffle. They were out of green wings so we ordered the next choice on our list, which were the KFC (Korean Fried Chicken) Wings. The owners were really friendly and politely asked us to wait for our order. The wait took a little longer than expected, around 15-20min but the food definitely made up for it. The wings were so juicy and tender, and the sauce gave just the right amount of kick. The waffle was huge, and was delicious with some syrup. This is such a great place, sure it's tiny, but it has so much to offer. Next time I'm coming with an empty stomach, and will try the green wings, bulgogi wings and the honey mustard wings.
author: Helen Y.

description:
Fried chicken?  Assortment of chicken wings?  Waffles??  And larger assortment of hot sauces?  Phenomenal!

I think what we have here is a collaboration of what everyone had wanted but never gave it enough thought to come up with what this place has got going.  

I had heard of all the good words on this nearby neighborhood Fried Chicken sammy, but never made the effort to venture to it.  It was my lost of course.  I was here with Johanna L. who pretty much nailed down the gist of what we had, and I'll second it.  

And although I haven't tried their sandwich, I don't think I need to because I've had the chicken wings (one of my favorite foods) and a waffle on the side.  For each 5 pieces, you get to choose a flavor, so I ordered a 15pc and that allowed me to go with the new Green Wings, and 2 of the favorites, Bulgogi and KFC.  All delicious.  The waffle was also nicely fluffy and had a good batter.  Drenched in butter and one of their available berry sauces....amazingness. The green wings had a good amount of cilantro and ginger taste..which was interesting.  

You might consider other places with their 25/50 cent wing special, but honestly, do you get these types of flavors and love put into them, not to mention, the array of possible sauces to drench them in?  No.  I think not.  PLUS, these wings are ginormous.  Yes, ginormous.....not your dinky shriveled up mutant looking thing, but actual plump, juicy, yet crispy on the outside WINGS.  

And to be set up cozily next to a brewcraft store and the newly opened Chomp n Swig which serves sammys and beer.........mmmmm,  beer n chicken....a dynamic duo or trio...and bite of sammy.  WINNER.....or shall I say....WINGER!
author: Vincent K.

description: 5 stars all the way. Just tried 2 small orders and was able to sit down inside the restaurant to scarf them down (seats roughly 4 only). I went with straight hot barbecue and Kentucky-Yaki. Both were 10/10. Place was really cool too. I should mention they had a great selection of hot sauces, including Texas Pete, which I haven't been able to find elsewhere. I've hit up Wing-Wings, San Tung and the other great places and these are without question #1 for me.
author: Alexander M.

description:
After inhaling a sando at Chomp N' Swig next door, our group had a glorious idea of ordering wings from Hot Sauce and Panko. Glorious it was. We ordered 3 different types of wings and while all varied in flavor, they all were extremely tender and seasoned to perfection. Breakdown below:

Bulgogi wings - Korean bulgogi flavored wings sprinkled with green onions. I died a little eating them.

Korean fried wings - What's the difference between Bulgogi and Korean style wings, you may ask? The red paste. And garlic. 

Green wings - Seasoned with cilantro, garlic, probably some sesame oil, and other misc. spices. Not my favorite of the bunch, but still good.

Have you seen the machine they use to make wings? Apparently it was transported from Canada (ey). Well, more wings' places should think about investing in one of those babies if they want to have such delectable treats. And if you love wings, get the bulgogi ones. Sidenote, we waited about 30 minutes for 15 wings which isn't bad as we were sitting next door hanging out. If you don't have much time to wait around, I'd suggest calling ahead and picking them up when they're ready.
author: Johanna L.

description:
I haven't had good wings like this since I lived in upstate NY. The KFC is fantastic. The Korean twist to the wings makes me very happy. 
If you're craving something heavy, get the Waffle sandwich with karaage inside...
I'm super into the hot sauce collection on the wall, and the friendly staff.
author: Rose M.

description: THOSE PARMESAN WINGS THOUGH.. Best I've ever had. Ever. The extra-spicy buffalo was also tasty. My only complaint is that some of our wings were slightly undercooked and looked a little pink on the inside :( It bummed me out because I couldn't stomach to eat them anymore after that even though they were amazing. Hopefully next time we don't encounter this problem.
author: Jessica F.

description: Beat wings in the city. Wing wings is a close tie but hot sauce and panko know what's up. The menu changes it up so that's nice. Small shop not a a lot of room to maneuver but its worth it. Get the Korean wings or the lime and BBQ you won't be mad.
