author: Samir A.

description: This is the only place I will go to in the city for chicken wings. All of the wings are made to order so expect a wait if walking in. There isn't much sitting space so I usually call ahead and take mine to go. My go to is the chili crunch and panko parm, you just can't go wrong. Also, THE WAFFLES MAN. If you can, get both the wings and the waffle and you will not regret it. The juxtaposition of a waffle melting in your mouth as the syrup composes a symphony of awesomeness with the amazingness that is any of the specialty wings that panko offers can make any person die happy.
author: Martin K.

description:
Came here on the recommendation of a client that lived around the corner and they suggested me to try the ultra something sandwich. It was a fried chicken and waffle sandwich with cabbage, kewpie mayo and sriracha (basically spicy mayo). It was a good size but not too big that I ate too much. And wow it was good. Not a huge chicken and waffles type of person but this place had me pleasantly surprised. Real clean inside. Most recent inspection was rated 100. Small place, little bit of a wait. No restrooms. Not much space to sit and eat there but I was told that later when the bar next door opens they let you use there tables as well. 

And if your looking for some hard to find or different and new hot sauce I'd come check this place out too. Looks like they had  maybe 30-50 different kinds up on the wall to buy. Would definitely come back to this place when I'm in the area.
author: Steven S.

description:
This review is strictly for the green wings, which is the only thing I've had here.

Fried chicken wings, dressed in cilantro, jalapeño, ginger, sesame oil, etc...super plump and juicy wings...great crisp...very flavorful...absolutely AMAZING!
author: Tanya P.

description:
I had really high expectations for this place, but found it to be very mediocre.

I had the Hot Buffalo Wings and they very soggy for something that is supposed to be deep fried and crispy.  I watched them make the wings and it looked like they were pulling pre-prepared wings out of the freezer, which may account for the sogginess.

I also had the friend chicken sandwich .... what a disaster this thing is.  First of all, they MICROWAVE the chicken, so they obviously use pre-made chicken tenders that I'm sure also come out of the freezer.  The bacon was soggy and obviously cooked in the microwave several hours before.  The bread was stale and bland.  The coleslaw had no dressing and no flavor. All in all, it's a really dry and flavorless sandwich.

Finally, it took over 30 minutes to get my order with only 3 people in front of me!  I do feel for the guy that was doing all of the cooking, because he was busting his ass back there.  However, the cook and the guy working the register both looked very inexperienced and over whelmed.  Looking at their cramped kitchen and their meager equipment, its understandable that they can only get out a handful of orders per hour.  My advice would be to lose the hot plate, the microwave and the heating lamps, and invest in a big ass deep fryer.

If i was in the neighborhood and had time to kill I would consider giving the wings another try, but it's definitely not worth the trek to the Outer Richmond.
author: Brandon H.

description:
Very plump, juicy wings.  Somewhat greasy, but that's part of the definition of fried chicken wings - they are grease fried in grease.  

I had the green wings, which were great, and surprisingly light and springy in flavor.  My companions got the red chili, which they were so pleased with that they bought seconds to take home.
author: Di Yin L.

description: Wings are verrrryyyyy good. I got an order of the ghost pepper wings and an order of the bacon panko parm. The ghost pepper wings are dry and the rub is spicy! So yummy. The bacon panko parm had a saucy garlic Parmesan tasting flavor with bits of bacon on the wings. This was delicious! The only downside though is that there are only enough seats for like four people inside! And two tables outside with no chairs! The place is sooooo tiny. I can't wait to come back and try all the other flavors!!
author: Guen S.

description:
Good wings plus a variety of different kinds. Tried the ten-spice and green and thought they were good. Juicy pieces of chicken, tasted fresh, and the wings were quite large compared to many other wing places to eat.
Service was nice and friendly.
Seating is very limited so either do take-out or go at a time when there are less people. We went for a late lunch so it was practically empty.

Did not look this place up beforehand and was surprised by the wall of hot sauces. As you wait for your food, it's quite nice to look at all the different kinds of scary looking hot sauces they have for sale.

Would definitely recommend this place to others and look forward to eating there again one day.
author: B M.

description:
food: thai sweet chili and panko parm. the thai sweet chili is similar to how most asian places serve their wings. very basic naked wings, but fried and coated very well. it can get spicy for those who arent spicy friendly. the panko parm has a thick crust to it that i love. it comes with sauce and a lime. the panko really adds a big crunch. ***4/5

service: it takes awhile for an order to come out. it wasnt a long line either, so imagine if there was, it would take forever. you order and pick up your order. there is water in a dispenser you can help yourself. ***3/5

atmosphere: indoors feel like youre in an oven. i dont know how the workers are able to endure the conditions. the fryer is going and you can feel the heat going around the place. there are 2 seats inside, but i opted to stay outside instead. ***3/5

value: most of their styles are unique and are delicious, at least the ones that i had. if they can keep it around happy hour pricing, i would be back all the time. ***3/5
author: Andy Z.

description: This place is really good. It's fairly inexpensive and filling. My favorite are chipotle and Parmesan bacon. I highly recommend those 2. This place gets crowded fast so come early. I wish they had more seating, but I love this place. I will be back!
author: Shaneel A.

description:
Hot Sauce and Panko is in my personal esteemed opinion, the best chicken wings in the city. In a nutshell their wings are pleasantly plump, tender, crispy when needed, and always delicious.

Their website, and social media outreach is superb with their quirky sense of humor, and their consistent unrolling of a new special weekly.

I have yet to try the famous and tantalizing-sounding Ultra Goliath Chicken Waffle Sandwich, because every time I go in I just go for the waffles and chicken wings. But will update this review, once I try their waffle chicken sandwich.

The classic Belgian waffles deserve an easy 5 out of 5 stars. They are the perfect companion to any order of chicken wings. Their fries are delicious as well.

Of the wings I have tried here is a basic scorecard:

Green: 4 out of 5 stars, as the name gives away - not very spicy in comparison to its neighbors on the menu.

KFC: 5 out of 5 stars. Unique and bomb.

Chris's Honey Sal+y Crispy Pepper: 5 out of 5 stars: The honey glaze makes for a cripsy and exquisite outside coating to the perfectly spiced wing.

Red Rooster: 5 out of 5 stars. Again with a crispy, but flaming hot coating.

The folks that own and run this place are very polite and let you know that they appreciate their business. The free waffle Thursday is also very popular, and worth the trek out to the Richmond for a order of wings and a waffle any day. It was not uncommon during the NFL season for the wings to be completely ordered out, and for them to close early. This just goes to show that they are doing things right, and that the diverse palate of San Francisco finds it to be a "Must-Try".
author: Caleb M.

description:
Really excellent fried chicken. When I went here with my roommate, I ordered the Green Fried Chicken and she ordered the Korean Fried Chicken. Both were tasty, but I think hers was overall more flavorful. 

There isn't much available seating, so I wouldn't go here with a group. Also knocking down a star because of the odd hours. I don't understand why they would close so early -- you would think they'd want to be open in the evening since that's when a lot of people are likely to be craving fried chicken.
author: Jenny B.

description:
My friend was raving about this place and claimed she ate it almost every week! So I decided to get it to go. I called and they said 45 mins, no problem as I was still working and in downtown. my friend warned me that they take awhile and that i need to tell them to have it ready when I get there. so i did.

when we got there, my order wasn't even ready! They didn't even start making it yet. UGH lame. luckily we only waited 15-20 mins, but still. and apparently they just microwave the sauce to mix the chicken in.

we got the 1/2 pan, with brown sugar which was pretty good, saucy sweet crunchy still. the kfc the korean one which was a little bit spicy, good also. and the thai peanut sauce one, least favorite of everyone. tasted too much coconut and curry flavors, and soggy. bleh. no good.

no parking btw.

i would rather stick to san tung, their wings never disappoint imo. and closer too.
author: Christine M.

description: Best wings ever!!! Great prices, too.  I love the green and avocado crema.  Get a beer from next door while you're there!
author: Suzanna F.

description:
OMG, I don't even like wings--but now I do. Had the bulgogi and the green wings. Great flavorings, succulent, chubby, crispy.And plucked from  good-tasting chickens--who were obviously well-fed.

Started with one of their delicious waffles--why not? With butter and a tasty berry syrup on the counter. 

Also tried their insanely rich potato salad flavored possibly with blue cheese. And some onion rings--very good, but finally a little too greasy for me.

Drank a great bottled ginger ale and sat at one 2 little tables outside, enjoying the sun and Richmond breeze. 

I love this place. It's a hole-in-the-wall, but they do have a couple of tables inside and out. Will definitely be back. Owners are helpful, pleasant, funny.
author: Barbara N.

description:
For the record,  

Chupy C is a fool.  The wings are brined. The owner, in fact, explains this very well in his response, which I thought was unusually measured and polite. I would have expected something more akin to Bill Belichick sneering disdainfully at a reporter who asks a stupid question in the postgame; when  you don't know your @$$ from a hole in the ground, it's hard for an expert to speak to you without sounding condescending. Kudos to HS&P for keeping it classy.  

As the reigning hot wing eating champion at Sneaky's BBQ, I can honestly say that HS&P has the best wings in San Francisco (Sneaky's a very close second) and among the best I have ever had, even in Buffalo,  Chicago,  and other midwest wing-loving locales. Anyone claiming otherwise is simply erroneous.
author: Evan M.

description: Great wings and so many sauces selections. It's a small restaurant but worth it. There is plenty of parking.
author: Marcos C.

description:
These are hands down the best chicken wings I've ever had.

If you're a first time visitor, I'd get the first item on the menu (green something) and also an order of the "10 spices" wings. Add a waffle if you're feeling like brunch!

The store itself has a nice family-owned vibe. They also have an impressive collection of hot sauces. In fact, you can sample some of them while you wait.
author: Jose F.

description:
A small mom and pop serving fantastic wings in the Outer Richmond. 

Seeing great reviews on yelp and craving wings like no other, I decided to rush after work to make it to HS&P. I was set on ordering a  1/2 pan (25 wings, 3 sauce), but the smell of lingering waffles enticed me to order that as well, I mean why not right? Wings and Waffles are made to order so expect no quick meal, but perfection takes time and that is what they give you.  

Belgium Waffle came out crispy and was soft in the middle as whipped butter paved the way for delicious syrup to make an amazing waffle. 

Green Wings is a nice dry rub coated on lightly that has a great taste with very little kick.

Korean Fried Chicken is a nicely coated in that familiar red chili paste bringing a nice heat to each bite.

Soy Dijon Blue Cheese was an order because I was curious and I love blue cheese, and I was happy the owner asked me if I like blue cheese, because he was going to commit to adding more to my order. Only order it if you like blue cheese.

My heart melted seeing an elderly Asian couple sipping hot tea, eating a Belgium waffle apiece, and sharing a 5 piece wing order supporting the local small business.  Yes they were that cute. 

Parking may be difficult, so be conscious of being force to walk.

I will back to try more flavors when the craving kicks in =).
author: Casey L.

description: Excuse my language but SO EFFIN GOOD. what the hell? It's so good that I would give it 6 stars if I could. When I went, I was pretty pissed off bc they were sold out of wings. They were closed for a week for the holidays so on their last day, they stocked up on less wings. Having traveled so far to get here, I was pretty pissed that this wasn't announced on yelp for people to know. Despite that, I ordered their Goliath and their chicken&waffles. Omg the Goliath made my week it was so good. It was a perfectly flavored and panckoed fried chicken, coleslaw, and some sinfully good sauce between two thick warm waffles. I could eat these alll day every day. Everyone must try the Goliath. Their chicken&waffles were good too but not super like the Goliath. Words of caution. 1) order ahead 2) bring a jacket bc u most likely will get the outside two tables and not the two that r on the inside 3) order early so they don't run out on u. Lastly, this place is run by a mom and pop that works rly hard by the looks of it so be nice to them :) they bring incredible food to this world.
author: Carrie T.

description:
This is what San Francisco has been missing for ages. This is by far the best chicken wing joint in the bay area. It's a hole in the wall so it doesn't guarantee seating when u get there. If it is busy be prepared to wait. But boy it is sure is worth the wait.

The green wing are the best, followed by bugolgi and tonkatsu. They really do have some unique chicken wing flavors all juicy and super crispy. Not to mention they also have an array of hot sauces for you to try and buy.
author: David W.

description:
Best wings in San Francisco (maybe even the world) and hilarious management of social media. They're a no bullshit organization. when you've got a good product manners aren't needed.

The wait is brutally long when they're busy, but that's just a testament to how popular they've become.
author: Benjamin M.

description:
I absolutely love this place! Thy regularly change items on the menu (I like to think of it as evolving their different chicken flavor experiments), so i'm always pleasantly surprised when I come back. I would say that my favorite flavor is the bulgogi chicken. 
One ip though, expect to wait for your food. There are up to 3 workers at a time, sometimes only 2 workers. It's okay though,  the chicken is certainly worth the wait.
author: Randell J.

description:
I love 50 cent wings at buffalo wild wings and wingstop. I probably just get a kick out of eating with my hands, but case in point : messy wings doesn't always make good wings. 
This place, however, was very messy and very delicious. A hole in the wall amongst many others in San Francisco, this place was a find that had many people coming in and out and thankfully, there is no line. 
With very little seating(four chairs?) inside, you pretty much go in purely to buy hot sauces that are lined up on a bookshelf to your left, and to order your wings. There are tall tables outside to eat your wings, but you have to stand. Not really an issue I think. 
Ordered the KFC(Korean fried chicken) wings, panko parm wings, and a waffle. All were very delicious, my least favorite was the Korean fried chicken wings, not because it was too spicy or anything, but it tasted like wings dripped in srichacha, and I've never been a fan of srichacha. The panko parm wings were very good, but maybe too much panko for my taste. The waffle was amazing and perfect to a T. 
Will be back again the next time I'm in the area!
author: Zoe H.

description: I love this place. We went here on a whim, now I compare all other wings to this place. I love the red rooster and the chili wings. Both are delicious.
author: Kristi C.

description: Racist business establishment, the picture above your register is highly offensive. You need to remove it. The wings were subpar and weren't bbq but a hot buffalo wing. I didn't want that.
author: Eyliss L.

description:
My little brother gave me a gift certificate to this place when I moved into the Richmond Neighborhood. 

Long story short : we are addicts now.

Go read the menu, it changes frequently with new ones popping up. ALL the flavors are good, and all of them interesting. You will not get to eat wings like this anywhere.

My favorites - Family usually gets at least 3 flavors every time we go.
1) Lime Wings - Zesty, Savory, a bit spicy. These are by far my favorites.
2) Bulgogi - for those who don't prefer spicy at all, these are the best non spicy wings I have ever had. Sweet and salty, delicious.
3) Chris' Honey Salty Pepper Crunch - Oh My Lord. So simple . So Good.
4) Ghost Pepper - For my chili pepper binge days. So good.

Side Note and ringing endorsement for Chomp N' Swig RIGHT next door. YOU CAN GET A DELICIOUS PINT OF CRAFT BEER RIGHT FROM THE TAP, AND CHILL OUTSIDE WHILE YOU EAT YOUR CHICKEN WINGS !!!!! What more could I want ? Maybe a foot massage at the same time ? Gotta kick out the neighbor on the other side....There are plenty of foot massage places on Clement, we have to make this happen.


One more thing:

- DO NOT CALL IN YOUR ORDER 10 MINS BEFORE THEY CLOSE THEY WILL NOT ANSWER YOUR CALL 
- DO NOT WALK UP TO THE STORE 15 MINS BEFORE THEY CLOSE. 

This is a small local shop and if business is a little slow late in the day, sometimes I have seen their "STOP sign" posted at the door before their official closing time. Yes, they will stop taking orders before closing time.

Just plan ahead guys. If you get pissed about this one thing, then please go to KFC, their hours are very predictable. Its obvious you do not care about the food anyway.
author: Nick M.

description: Chicken Wings and Waffles, what more can i say?  Do not get the ghost wings unless you are way tougher then me.
author: Mike Y.

description:
I really enjoy having Hot Sauce and Panko as my nearest eatery. The food is wonderful. I've tried their chicken sandwiches, slaw (very unique and tasty), and wings, of course. I really think their wings are out of this world. I never have been a huge fan of buffalo wings because they usually consist of as much skin and bone as they do of meat. At HS&P, that is never the case! The wings are always very meaty and tender. If you order the panko (or bulgogi - sorry, I forgot which - check the menu), you receive a special sauce that the owner makes. It's not too spicy and it's very tasty. Add Sriracha or any of their other hot sauces to it if you want some more heat. I love how they consistently experiment with new kinds of wings and foods, always adding and subtracting their experiments to the menu while keeping the standards. It definitely makes it more interesting than your standard fare. 

The only reason that they did not get a five star review is that they sometimes run out of food, which can make customers disappointed. Many a day I will be jonesing for some HS&P and see that it's closed when I go outside my house to check if it's open. My advice to them: find a way to stock up to meet the demand. Your business will boom if you do. Good luck on the Superbowl.
author: Robert H.

description:
Went to Hot Sauce and Panko for the first time, had the fiery hot fried wings, DIED, WENT TO HEAVEN, then back to order more.  Glorious!!

We also had kfc wings and sweet potato fries.  All yummy.  We ordered more, super spicy buffalo wings.  The owner, Terence, is a super nice and funny person.  He gave us 1 XXX buffalo wing (can't wait to try that), and a free waffle, which was super super yummy.

Love this place! If you are a fan of super spicy tasty wings, this place is the PLACE in SF.  Service is great, and man.... for a spicy lover like me, walking into this place is like a kid walking into a candy store, racks full of spicy sauces on display!!
author: Meiko S.

description: Loved the chicken/waffle sandwich! It was quite messy but that's expected with the combo. Also, seating is LIMITED!
author: Maria G.

description:
WINGS! WINGS! WINGS! If you are a wing lover like me, this is your place. 

Excellent concept, well executed, and amazing wings.

I remember one of my first experiences was few years ago for a Super Bowl party, I ordered couple of wing trays ...they were better than the commercials!!!

I've been trying the wings and that's it. 

One of the things I like bout this spot, they always have website updated...this shows they really care about the business. 

For the reviewers that complained about lack of space. Flash news for you! We live in SAN FRANCISCO! 

If you want to order wings for playoffs or Super Bowl, you must order ahead!
author: J. C.

description:
Angela's Panko Cod Fish Sandwich was brilliant.
Vi sono maestri di panko!
author: Bruno L.

description: I came here with hungry friends and was not disappointed. We tried the chicken and waffles and Korean fried chicken.  Both were good and inexpensive. The chicken and waffles was my fave. Great breading and tastes amaze with lime and peanuty sauce and syrup it comes with. I'm definitely coming back.
author: Jessica L.

description:
A wing place AND a hot sauce place in the Richmond? Sweet Zombie Jesus THANK YOU. 

The selection of hot sauces is amazing, and they even have abunch you can taste. Similarly the wings are fanTASTIC. They're always experimenting and coming up with new flavors, and of the 6 or so varieties I have tried, all have been delicious. 

Warning though, this place is DANGEROUS. I'm always like "I'll get a half pan, it'll be a couple of meals!" Then I start eating, and next thing you know I've eaten close to 30 wings and am in a food coma. 

Writing this review has made me hungry, I think I'm going to have to stop by for lunch.
author: Owen H.

description:
LOVE this place!

We've been here twice and both times, the wings & waffles were amazing.   

- Green Wings are super addicting.  It's so flavorful and I was tempted to get a second order.  Definitely our favorite.  

- Garlic Parmesan Wings....this was our second favorite.  Looks like they changed the recipe a couple of days after our visit, so I can't vouch for the new version yet.   The one we had was loaded with parmesan and garlic.

- 10 Spice wings were above average, but not our favorite.  I love how crispy it is...possibly because it was double fried.  It reminded me of fried chicken from some Chinese restaurants.  

We got free waffles because we had the Spot On app and we came on a Free Waffle Day (check their website...it's usually on a Thursday).  The waffles were huge and I love the different syrups that are available...especially the Bacon Syrup.  Yum!

There's a 15 minute wait for wings...even if no one is there.  So just be patient and hang out.  There are a bunch of magazines for you to read while you wait.  They are super friendly....definitely a mom & pop type of place.  Get there early because as other reviewers stated, they might close early.  It's like a food truck in a brick and mortar location.  Looking forward to my next visit!
author: Ring K.

description:
Dopest wings. Period. Double period. Full stop. Just read the menu, call in your order ahead of time, and in 20 minutes you have some of the best wings this side of Golden Gate Park. 

Also, the hot sauce wall is my father's personal Nirvana. The comic book memorabilia adds the touch of personality that keeps you coming back. 

The owners are super nice and helpful (especially when it comes to packing wings for a bike ride home). Thanks!
author: Sean C.

description:
Jane Lui (the singer/songwriter), if you are out there dear musical friend... you moved from SF before your time was due... BECAUSE!!!! BEEEE-CAUUUUSSEEE!!!

Dame fine wings sista!  This is THE Bay Area spot for chicken wings.  I know, it's a total crack house when you review the sign and step inside, but fo-shizzle, they make it all fresh, good size pieces of chicken, and tasty like it wants you badly!  Hell, the waffles even do the job... light and fluffy!

Hardly a spot to sit inside, but hey, screw it... just lay about the place and enjoy!
author: Dan M.

description:
So, this place is the chicken wing bomb, hands down. If you are looking for great wings on a weekly rotating menu of deliciousness, along with a giant wall of some REAL hot sauce, this is it in San Francisco. The one, the awesomeness that is Hot Sauce and Panko.

My girlfriend and I head over about two to three times a month on weekends and grab an order of the Green (so yummy) and two more orders of wings that we haven't yet tried. All of which are amazing! If we are extra hungry, we always add on a scrumptious waffle!

The staff is always cheerful and fun, and I love that the place is decorated in pop-culture brick-a-brack, political silliness and Internet memes. It's nerdy hip and charming.

Their selection of hot sauce for purchase is wide and in varying degrees of heat. Some of which will burn off most people's tongues, so watch out!

The only complaint I have is that this place deserves a bigger space. It's just way too good to be tucked away in such a small plot in a sleepy neighborhood. I want it in my apartment, that would be ideal.
author: Jessika H.

description:
Ordered some chicken wangs [Green wings, bulgogi]  and a waffle for pick up last night.

Chicken wings were good. Good sized portions when compared to places like wings stop. The taste between the two were distinct and different. Not hot. Mildly spicy. I will definetly try some other flavors/food from here. 

The venue is really tiny. Only about two tables inside, so ordering for pick-up is a must plus theres hardly any parking spots on this block. One side of the wall is filled with numerous types of hot sauce-I guess thats why the name of the business starts with Hot Sauce?  

I didn't really care about the waffle because by the time we got back [we drove and we live on 22nd ave and anza] the waffle was cold and they didnt have a container for the maple syrup. I just filled up a little solo cup because i didnt want the waffle all soggy.

Nice new option for eating dangerous, addictive, greasy food.lol
author: Jeff C.

description: Saw the reviews seemed good enough to try. Loved it the meat melts off and is filling. But they need more sauce imo
author: Andy Z.

description:
Sometimes I like to ruin my physique with a heavy dose of CHICKEN AND WAFFLES! My friends and I (4 of us total) decided to go all out, balls out so we could sample the menu. We ordered:

KFC wings- by far the tastiest; they were perfectly seasoned with Korean spicy sweet sauce.

Citrus Tea wings- a tad bland compared to the others, but piling Sriracha on top made them tasty.

Brown Sugar Ham wings- smokey, caramel-y and unique but my friend said they were almost too sweet

Green wings- dry-fried and tasted like Indian seasoning. These were my second fav

Waffles- HUGE, buttery and delicious.  

Fries, onion rings, sweet potato fries- not memorable but helped to clog our arteries

Fried Chicken Sandwich- divine and reminded me of Oakland's legendary Bakesale Betty sammy but BETTER.  Yes, you read that right.  It is BETTER due to the amazing addition of bacon and cheddar and not to mention it is only $5.99.  

Do you know how much that whole meal cost? $40.64. So crazy for that amount of food. Also, this place has a ton of crazy hot sauces.  You can pour some on your meal if you're eating there. (Note: very limited seating)  There are over 30 sauces for sale too.  Totes going back to buy the Colon Cleanse Hot Sauce. HEHE!
author: Sherry C.

description:
On fire.

Line out the door. Father/son (or so it seemed) taking and finishing orders as fast as possible. Hot sauce lining the walls.

People seem to return again and again for the wings. And the sauces. Together. 

Can speak for the version with BBQ sauce. It's awesome.

Just as good was an oversized waffle for three and change. Because wings need waffles. And waffles need wings. Don't judge.

Missed the panko. Consider it a reason to return. Along with the rest of you.
author: Jason B.

description:
5 stars for being something different and unique in the Richmond district.  It's not another run-of-the-mill coffee shop, deli sandwich shop, or dim sum joint, so kudos to that.  

I live right around the corner and always told myself i would check it out, and today I woke up not only hungover, but with a bad hankering for some wings, so i decided to take a stroll to Hot Sauce and Panko.

I know they have lots of crazy flavors but for my first trip i wanted to just try their most popular items to get a taste of what they're really like.  I was also in no mood to do any heavy thinking.  So i ordered the Buffalo wings - hot, and the KFC; their two most popular items.  Let me start by saying the wings here are more baked, it lacked that deep fried crunch that i was yearning for, so i'm assuming they are baked at least. However, the flavors were definitely there, you can tell they really take the time to perfect the sauces that they coat the wings with. 

The prices were fair, i spent $10 on about 12 wings, two different flavors. I also slid my card through an Ipad and then signed with my finger which was amazing to say the least.  I also don't think the wings here are cooked to order, i wouldn't mind waiting a few extra minutes for really hot wings that were just made. The wings could be a bit more savory, and maybe an option to have them deep fried? Sometimes I crave a nice fried crunchy greasy wing.  But anyways, 5 stars nonetheless, Hot Sauce and Panko is a great fresh concept, and a nice addition to the neighborhood.  If i'm not back here to try some of their crazier creations, i'll definitely be back to buy some of the dozens of hot sauces they sell in store.
author: Randy N.

description: Nothing to write home about. It was good.. Not the best or the greatest of wings. Ordered the Buffalo and Green wings. Maybe I'll give it another try by ordering other wings on their menu.
author: Rachelle L.

description: I like the lime and old bay wings. Crunchy, spicy, and just the right amount of lime to make things interesting. We had to wait a long time for our food because we were noobs and didn't know that the line would be super long. I suggest call in to order for pick up. It's also very tiny (two small tables inside and two small tables outside) so don't expect to get a place to sit. They have a wide variety of hot sauces to try so try them all!
author: LeTran B.

description: First off, I'm probably the only black guy on earth that hates chicken wings. That being said, I could eat here everyday for dinner! That's how great hot sauce and Pankos wings are. In addition they have every hot sauce you could ever want. Personally, I only need sriracha. To me the best wings are the Chris crispy honey spicy salty whatever its called.. Be sure to get a waffle on the side.
author: Jerry S.

description:
I love the food here, and it's surprisingly cheap too. I'm actually not a huge fan of wings (in general, I mean) so I usually get the waffle sandwiches, but I love them. The Ultra-Goliath waffle sandwich is a pretty solid bet.

I have no idea why people say the staff aren't friendly, I've always found them to be really nice. They're not the fastest, but given the size of the place and how crowded it usually is that's sort of to be expected. If you're in a hurry it's probably not the place for you, but the food is well worth the wait if you're not.
author: Doug T.

description: Super delicious! i got Chris' Honey Salty Crispy Pepper wings and they were fantastic, so much so that my boyfriend wished he ordered the same (he got the Kentucky-Yaki). We also got waffles and they were so so good! Service was very friendly!
author: Nancy W.

description: I was new in town and was craving some chicken wings.  Found these guys on Yelp.   Definetly satisfied and the Korean style wings were awesome.   I got there a little late and it was closing in abiut 30 minutes so I wasn't able to taste the waffle.   But I do plan on heading back soon.   Only problem is parking.
author: Reggie S.

description: I've been here since the opening and tried almost every flavor they've put out and they're still the best place for wings in the bay. They always inform people on early closings and changes on their website. Still very friendly and helpful. I love you Pankos
author: Christopher H.

description: This place is FANTASTIC! I have been going here since it opened about two years ago, and not once have I been disappointed. Really simple concept, I always get their chicken wings and waffles, the waffle is soft and warm and goes perfectly with their wings (I usually get their KFC wings but now I think they're called something else). The family that owns it is SO nice. The place is really small but cute and has a full wall of hot sauces any spicy food lover would adore. They also always have a good selection of hot sauces to sample yourself on your wings. 5 Stars.
author: Gabriela A.

description: Came back, didn't have to wait, it was open too(I have terrible luck it's usually closed). Wings were amazing, really amazing, and I tortured myself by trying out the ghost pepper. It hurt so good...so good.
author: Wells Y.

description: Try it out- good stuff. Although, they need to be more attentive with the way they cook their wings. 2 of the wings I had were not properly cooked and a bit raw. Otherwise its yummy and eat while its hot. I waited and it wasnt as good.
author: DeesQue N.

description: Mind blown! honey wings, sriracha wings, cilantro and lime wings, panko chicken and waffles!!!! all exceptionally exceptional.
author: Amanda D.

description:
Oh, forgive me, Terrence, Most High of Hot Sauce Pankoria, for I have committed a multitude of sins.  I ask for your Grace and Mercy to forgive me of the following, listed in no particular random disorder below:

1. For my presence on Yelp, "The Most Loathed of Sites" and then to add insult to injury, not being as useful, funny, or cool as Ed U. or any of the other Yelp Elite for that matter.
2. For not being a reviewer from Food and Wine, SF Weekly, or any other reputable media. Because of this, my opinion apparently means nothing.
3. For not being a food supplier.  As it is, I can offer you no deals on freakin' huge or average sized wings, hot sauce, panko crumbs, or anything else of value to the citizens of Hot Sauce Pankoria.
4.  For misspelling, the word, WANGS.  I am such an illiterate moron.
5. For forgetting to BMOMS (Bring My Own Maple Syrup).
6.  For forgetting that you no longer make catering pan-sized wings (I mean wangs) for single people who want to eat the whole thing before they get home.  No matter how well I have mastered the "sad, puppy face look."
7.  For not consulting the Good book (The New HSP version of the electronic bible aka Hot Sauce and Panko's Facebook Page) each and every time prior to a Hot Sauce and Panko visit. (Again, my stupidity knows no bounds).
8.  For having sluggish and impaired taste buds that can not adjust as quickly or as often as you update the HSP menu.
9.  For having a limited food vocabulary and general ignorance of all things gourmet.  I sincerely regret that I still cannot distinguish between a pistou and a pistachio.  I hope that's not the one thing that will condemn me to Hot Sauce Pankoria hell.    
10. For having nothing even remotely witty to add as my number #10 sin.  Next time, I will consult Letterman. 

Perhaps one day, I will have atoned for my sins, and become worthy to continue in my HSP Jedi training (or at the very least be worthy enough to have earned a free waffle on Thursday or any other day you have deemed acceptable).  Until then, a girl can only dream of one day having a chicken wang, named after her....
author: Danielle O.

description: The best place to get some chicken wings of all different tastes. I like the green wings myself, with the wasabi and cilantro crust. Always a smart decision to accompany it with a perfectly brown waffle with some syrup. Try to trick a friend into taking some atomic chili sauce on a wing an you'll be in for a nice comedy show as well.
author: Evan R.

description: Life changing wings. I'm not someone who eats wings on the regular but these are worth the indulgence. They don't even need dipping sauce. We ordered caramel siracha, lime siracha, kentucky bourbon and honey salty crispy. Smalls were huge and we couldn't finish it all amongst 3 guys and 1 girl. The wait was long but I'm not complaining.
author: Madeline S.

description:
Go go go -- creative, friendly, small business adventure in the avenues. Great concept and so sincere it hurts. Delicious wings. We got KFC ) of course) and hot Buffaloes. My daughter went three times last week and loved it. 

This is SF at its finest.
author: jim b.

description: Wings that sing harmoniously to my tastebuds. Got the cilantro, jalapeño and other greens. Highly recommended.
author: Joe N.

description: The place was highly recommended on Yelp for chicken wings. The business is small place with delicious wings in the Richmond district. They also sell a variety of hot sauces on the side. I tried the korean fried chicken and it was super tasty. The chicken wings were not that big tho. I'd probably come back again to try more flavors.
author: Jason L.

description:
Tried the brown sugar ham glaze. Which is good. I was overly anxious and dove right in. Wrong thing to do with this. Better to wait and let the sugars to "candy". This the perfect variation to pair with some of the hotter sauces they have for you to try.
The hot sauces I sampled, hit hard, but dissipated rather quickly. I prefer the heat to linger a bit more.

Also this place has no bathroom.
author: Geordie E.

description:
Mmmm, mmmm, mmmm.

Their waffle is divine. I had it with whipped cream, chocolate sauce and strawberry sauce. I got a 5 piece order of the bulgogi wings and one order of the garlic parmesan. They were supa fresh and supa hot when they came out. DELICIOUSNESS.

Great service. The guy who cooks the wings in the back made sure we were good while the hubby and I were working on our wings. Def need to come back! Well worht it!

We went in the middle of the day, middle of the week so there was only one person there before us at first so we didn't experience a long wait or anythang.
author: Lauren L.

description: amazing is all I can say.  my husband brought home 4 different wings last night, and they were all very good.  My favorite, however, was the siracha caramel.  It was so delicious.  I really can't wait to go back... A+++++
author: Shannon S.

description:
The Yelp affect is in effect here.  Thats when a fine little joint that does quality food and fun vibe goes viral, resulting in a collapse in operations.
The wait was about 25 minutes for a sandwich with about 6 people in line.  

Its because the 2 guys look completely overwhelmed, inexperienced, and unprepared.  This is the type of place Gordon Ramsey should go to, cause it has so much potential, with their crafty menu and good ingredients, like fries and onion ring order.  

Like Ikes in the Castro, make a phone order, you'll save time waiting and parking.  And, I'd hold the sauce on the po boy, its a hot mess, literally.
author: J S.

description: I miss this place so much. I left San Francisco for college and I can't find a single good chicken wing anywhere in Arizona. In fact, most of the food in Arizona pales in comparison to the food in SF. These wings are the best. Ever. I crave them constantly. It's driving me insane. San Francisco has so much great food. But these guys have better wings than anyone.
author: Nic A.

description:
I love this place. When it first opened, I always think about their waffles and crave it constantly. My whole family is hooked on it. Every time we're in the area, and it's A LOT, one of us always get a waffle! Luckily it's cheap ($2~) My dad said that if you think about their food often, that means they are doing good haha I love that they have a variety of syrup for you to choose from. Bacon syrup, need I say more? 

Recently I decided to venture off into their wings. Half my family is vegetarian (but I'm not) so I didnt think much about their wings before. Then one day I wanted something savory too because a waffle just wasnt enough to hold my appetite and noticed they have the wings + waffle combo for about $6ish? (I forgot how much but it is relatively that cheap/around that ballpark!) I cant decide on what flavor I wanted so I went with the regular. Even with the regular, I was super content! Yummy!

However, I noticed they have unusual flavors. Flavors you dont normally get at your average wing place! 

But most importantly, aside from the good food, the couple who owns the shop is super nice. I'm a talkative person (as evident here), so I like to strike up conversations. It's nice to meet people who are friendly and dont mind conversing with you. That in itself would have me more willing to go out of my way to be their customer!
 
One thing is that this place is relatively small. So you may have to do take out. But maybe it if does well, they would move to a bigger place!
author: Eliza C.

description: Don't believe any of the nonsense from those who don't appreciate this place's quirks.  These are the best wings on the planet, the staff are wonderful and yes, they occasionally run out.  HSAP is one of my ultimate guilty pleasures, and it should be one of yours too.  Don't hesitate, get in there and get ya some!!
author: Andy R.

description:
My wife read a review of this place yesterday and it sounded so good i had to run over there to check it out. So, while my 3yr old was napping, i scooped up my 7mth old son, left the wife at home and jumped in the car and drove on down the street to this new wing spot. 

Im glad i didnt wait... what a treat! we tried 3 different wings. first off the wings were good. lots of meat on each piece which you dont always get at other wing spots. plus the chicken was moist and full of flavor on their own. my wife loved the Sweet Soyu-Lime wings. light flavor and a wing that would be a good mix with a salad. i also got the Greens wings that has cilanto, jalapeno, ginger and spices which i thought was fantastic! the winner for both of us though was the Double Dip wings. DAMN! the chicken is thrown in a mix of lime, fish sauce, blue agave, and red pepper flakes and the dipping sauce (wow!) was a mix of orange, garlic, ginger, and chile that was other worldly! though we lost out on the majority of our sauce due to my son wanting some so bad he knocked it over. however our couch and rug smells awesome right now!

i also got a 50/50 (fries and onion rings) that were also tasty. fries could have been cooked a little longer but were salted up perfectly so ill still 5star it.

PLUS, they have about 20 different sauces sitting out on the table that you can cup up and bring home. along with a wall of bottled sauces you can buy this is a one stop for everything HOT related.

lastly, with my hands full (baby and bottle), the owner(?) grabbed my bag of wings and helped me out the door to my car. now THATS service. 

another run for some of those delicious wings is a definite! looking forward to trying more flavors and trying the waffles next... oh yeah... did i mention that they ALSO have waffles? much eating to do... gotta go!
author: Justin T.

description:
Awesome selection of hilarious and delicious hot sauces. It's a small space so place your order and go grab a beer at Chomp n Swig- if you ask nicely (and they're not slammed) they'll deliver your wings direct to the bar.

Now for the meat---my favorite wings in all of SF, possibly the country. Juicy chicken with unique, delicious flavors. I'm a stickler for quality meat and this place has it. Chris's is the BEST- sweet honey with a bit of black pepper, the perfect complement to their spicier choices. Korean fried wings are amazing, as are the Green and the Old Bay. Panko Parm is also great but not my fav- doesn't travel as well. Friends have also said the waffle sandwiches are incredible. 

You can tell these guys care about the wings they make, and they are damn good at it.
author: Patricia J.

description:
Been wanting to try this location for soo long, so when I got here, i got two orders: green and their new caramel with vinegar.
Regular orders are 8-10 piece for 6.49$. There's not much space to eat inside, 1 table with few seats and outdoor table with seats. They also sell a huge variety of hot sauce, from cayenne to ghost pepper.
The wait is like 10-15 min for the orders, smelled really good. When i started to chow down, the wings were regular size, not big. My green wings came out looking appealing but the chicken itself is too soft inside, doesn't taste like real chicken as it was a bit squishy for some off reason. Also i only got 7 wings, 1-3 less, which is odd but i already left so couldn't tell them. My caramel vinegar came out with exactly 8 wings, nicely fried but flavors aren't too strong. I'd actually prefer caramel vinegar over the greens, very surprising! I'm a 'wingstop' type of guy i guess, maybe I'd give them another shot at the KFC, but so far not impressed.
author: Hao B.

description: By far the best wing place I've ever encountered. Wings, waffles, & fries.. That's it. I highly recommend it to anyone who loves spicy foods with a passion. Owner dude is super cool. Only problem is wings are the most expensive I've ever had, and you should call in because he is super busy and can't keep up on weekends etc.
author: Ben S.

description: My husband and I tried like 4 different flavors of wings here including, Bulgolgi, Green and KFC and we both were a bit underwhelmed by how it just didn't compare to Bon Chon or some of the other Korean wing places we ate at, including San Tung. I have to admit that I did appreciate that the wings were made only upon request so they were very fresh but just lacking what we were looking for in terms of flavor. Although, I still recommend giving this place a try and I will definitely stop by next time to try one of their subs.
author: Petra S.

description:
My very good friend introduced me to Hot Sauce and Panko.  I sure love chicken wangs so when he told me about this place, I was ecstatic!  A couple of days later, we ordered a bunch of wings and downed them back at his house. Here's what we ordered.

Sauces:
Green - cilantro goodness.  I find it very weird that this was my fave out of all of them as I absolutely hate cilantro.  Good job HS&P!  You are slowly converting me.
Bulgogi- sweet and tangy
Brown sugar- just as it sounds, it's sweet and sticky.  Although this was my friends least favorite, these came in at #2 for me.
Miso - miso soup in chicken wing form!  These were just OK for us.
KFC - typical korean fried chicken that you get from the korean market/restaurant and oh so yummy!

I think they've slightly upped their prices since I first checked this place out.  5 wings for just under $6 or 8 wings for under $9.  Still worth it.  Get together with some friends and buy a bunch of assorted wings enough to feed an army so you can try em all! 

This place is a hole in the wall and doesn't really have seating so be prepared to bring your wings back to the house or be ready to get messy sitting in your car (if you're able to find parking).  I called in the order on my way home from work.  We didn't get there until 30 minutes later and thought our wings would be cold, hard, and nasty BUT to my surprise, they were still crispy and wonderful when we finally got to eat them.  They coat your wings when you get there and doing so is totally worth it.  Hot Sauce and Panko, you have won over the heart of a chicken wing lover.
author: Cheryl Q.

description: They're really good!  I had the KFC and Bugogi and loved them but the downside was that I didn't realize they were batter fried and then dipped in a sauce - I just prefer them without the batter, so... They would have 4 stars if I liked this style.
author: Virginia T.

description: All I have to say is that the wings were delicious.  They were hot and oily ( little too much oil which is why this is 4 stars but the taste was 5) They have a lot to choose from which will keep me coming back.
author: Rachel F.

description:
My friend volunteers close to here so we decided to stop by this place on her lunch break. We walk into the literal hole-in-the-wall and place our order of KFC and PANKO wings. Also a side of sweet potato fries and an authentic ginger ale!

We braved the gusty wind and sat outside, wanting to avoid the cramped indoor seating. The wings came about 10-15 minutes later and they looked delish! The KFC (Korean friend Chicken) came with some kind of sweet/tangy sriracha sauce. Not too spicy, just enough flavor. The PANKO wings with the "soy sauce" was pretty good too. I like how they fry their wings, not super deep fried, but lightly fried and not too oily either.

The sweet potato fries were good as well, just right by not being too sweet nor too salty. I don't usually like super gingery ale but it went down pretty easily. All in all, a good meal, and even a little bit of leftovers for some lucky family member to try!
author: Wilson T.

description:
Hot Sauce in Panko was my elusive unicorn on Clement Street for a while.  As a night student, I have class from 6:30 into the night, so I was unable to make it to their place in time frequently.  Fortunately, I had time during a lunch hour to make the trek, and I could not be happier that I did.

First- it should be made clear that this is NOT a restaurant.  Hot Sauce and Panko has a total of 6 places to sit, 4 of which are outside.  Worry not, but be aware of this- this is a take out joint TO ITS CORE.  

As seekers of the wing enter, they should first note that this place is quirky.  When I say quirky, I mean that there is a fake urinal behind the door with a republican elephant as the pisspad... y'know... as art.  To the left is a wall of hot sauces for sale. There is a serious arsenal of tongue-fire lining the shelves.  The kitchen is fully visible from the cashier, and it is exactly what you'd expect.  There is a fry station, a sandwich and wing-prep station, a waffle press, and a fridge.  

I ordered the wing-combo, which included 6 wings and a waffle.  Seeing as some places sell Belgian Waffles alone for 7 bucks, I was happy to say that my combo was $5.99.  A very reasonable meal price. 

I ordered the Korean Fried Chicken style wings, and they were amazing.  The batter was light and not too oily, and the meat was juicy.  HS&P knows what it means to fry chicken.   I'm not a heatseeker per say- I can handle some fire, but I also prefer to not be curled up in a ball crying after I eat.  There are also a humongous amount of hot sauces to adorn your meal with as well.  

There are a few things I wish that HS&P did.  
1- I wish they were closer to me.
2- I wish HS&P were open later.
3- I wish they delivered.

As all 3 wishes are all personal and selfish, beyond these issues- I think Hot Sauce and Panko are more like Hot Sauce and Perfect.

Seriously- try the KFC wings...
author: Richard Y.

description:
Green wings SO GOOD - 5/5
kfc - meh 2/5 ,  my roommate LOVED it though
10 spice - 3/5 
tonkatsu type of wing - 3/5 worth trying but wont get again
fried chicken sandwich - 3/5 i only liked the vegetable part
waffles - very normal

I would go there again just to get the green wings. its so good!
author: Cindy L.

description:
Absolutely amazing. I am a HUGE wing fan and these are the best in hte bay area. I always get extra blue cheese when I order wings anywhere but this is the first place where I dont need blue cheese to enjoy my wings. I have been here several times and the wings are incredible, and the menu seems to revolve with new creations every week/month. 

You must try the KFC, Chris honey salt and pepper, bulogi, and the Katsu. 

This place literally has re-invented the chicken wing with a gourmet style, complexly unique to itself.
author: The S.

description:
I've never been a big fan of hot wings. Ever. But, because I'm a wanna be foodie, I haven't been to very many places. My BF is from SF and, lucky me, I've been able to eat at some AMAZING places. Downside- I've got 25 lbs to show for that, too...
But I digress. Back to hot wings. 
This place is awesome. It seats 4 and has standing room for 3-4. I'd never seen a restaurant that had 2 tables. Yes, 2. 
We order the Goliath and the Thai peanut sandwiches that are served on waffles. I ate my whole sandwich before the BF finished half. So good. 
Now, I digress again. Back to HOT WINGS! 
Every flavor of hot wings that I've tried was delicious. Simply amazing. It just hit me today that the reason I really didn't care for hot wings is because the only time I had tried them was at a brother's house and they were from Costco! Who WOULD like hot wings if that was your only experience with them? 
Don't judge me to harshly. I'm from a town called Bakersfield and foodie they make not.
author: Becky O.

description:
Awesome place! Great selection of wings to choose from. I had the original (spicy!!), green onion and the KFC. Wings were good quality, meaty and moist, not the dry stuff you get at other places. 

If you are a fan of hot sauce- they have a whole wall with over 50 different types of hot sauces and majority of them for sample with your wings!!! 

Definitely try out the ginger-ale there. 

Unique place the is worth a visit and a try. Who doesn't love wings?!
author: Nam L.

description:
I tried this place somewhat on accident - I saw the sign for the sandwich shop next door but it was closed, so I walked over to HS&P and checked out their menu.  I needed to eat while driving, so I chose the fried chicken sandwich with a side of fries.  The owners/employees were super friendly and while it did take a little while to make my food, I know they were making it all fresh and it hadn't just been sitting there all day.  The sandwich was pretty good - aside from the chicken, it also featured bacon, cheese, and spicy slaw.  Mmm!

The thing that most impressed me was the price - my huge sandwich and huge small fries was $6.  Yep, $6 fed both my 22yo brother and me for lunch - the meal was too much for my hunger level so he helped me out.  I don't see that being sustainable in the long run - I mean, that's a lot of food for $6 - but maybe it was a lunch special or something like that.

Overall I would go back if I was in the neighborhood.  It's a great place for hot sauce too - not my thing, I'm a wimp, but there are TONS of bottles for perusal and taste-testing.
author: Meredith K.

description: Best wings I've ever had. I recommend the red rooster and the KFC. They also have a wall of hot sauce to oogle at while you wait.
author: Amanda A.

description:
The ultra goliath sandwich is like a journey into the center of food heaven. You start with that crisp waffly exterior that turns into a soft eggy layer. Followed by the moist crunchy goodness of the slaw beneath, slathered with their signature salty sweet spicy sauce. Then you get into the core of crusty breaded chicken goodness. And repeat. 

The flavor and texture combinations for all their offerings are total genius.

It's enough to make me forgive their somewhat erratic business. Sometimes they're open, sometimes they're not, and they seem to change their hours at whim. If you're coming from far away, definitely call first to ensure they're open.
author: Aiko S.

description:
The food is very good. From KFC to fish sandwich to the wings = all goodness. 

They have a nice selection of sauces to choose from for your food.

But the restaurant (which is family run) could really use an expert to come in and help them out ...  or they could get a bigger place, but then they'd have to hire staff.

There are no bathrooms ... all that hot food and you drink too much water (too bad for you) ... and they seem just a bit too proud of the fact that there are no bathrooms with all the signs about it.    

Inside only seats 4 - the food is not really conducive for take out if you want to try the sauces, and when did you ever go to a restaurant serving hot wings with no TV ?  But I guess it doesn't matter if there's nowhere to sit.

I'm glad we tried it finally, but I'm in no hurry to go back.
author: A D.

description: We tried the waffles and 4 different types of wings. This is the BEST place to eat wings. Easy hands down. Juicy delicious sauces. Perfect size wings. Cooked perfectly. Waffle was light and crispy. They house a wall of hot sauces. No joke. Everything you can imagine. Love love love this spot. No other wing will ever be the same. Long live the chicken gangsta.
author: M G.

description: We had the old bay wings- nice amount of spicy and sweet- & crispy!! I know I'll be back again
author: Cary S.

description:
I'd been planning to come here for some time, as I'd heard the KFC wings were perfection. I fucking LOVE Korean-style fried chicken, and I'd had some fantastic ones in the South Bay, so needless to say, having something near my apartment was a revelation.

It was a bit cold to sit outside, and the inside seating was taken, so I figured I'd bring them home on the 38. Easy, right?!

The ordering part was a snap: I got a single order (5 wings) of the KFC. The smells coming from this place was amazing; I was standing near the doorway, and at least twice, groups of people walking by were pointing into the place and saying "OMG that's the chicken wing place! That smells so GOOD!" ...and they were right.

So I got my wings, and the guy thanked me for waiting. It's no problem waiting when I know I'm going to be receiving quality product. I began my walk towards the bus stop, back up 17th Avenue.

The bus was arriving in 4 minutes, which was perfect. I arrived at the stop, the bus pulls up, and there's a woman trying to get off the front because she was obviously a senior. This bitch cuts her off and gets on before she can get down the stairs; I want to slap people like that in the back of the head. It's just fucking rude.

The bus starts on its way. The smell of these wings is driving me NUTS, but I can't chow down on them on the bus because they're messy. Hella messy, even. As the bus rolled down Geary, I was worried that the wings were becoming exponentially less crispy as I waited. I was terrified. Scared. "Oh noes, I will not be able to judge these wings properly when I arrive home and stuff them down my gullet!"

FINALLY, I arrive at the 28th Ave stop, run to my apartment, and take off my hoodie and wash my hands. I'm salivating and my hands are shaking...I cannot take my eyes off the container of wings.

I dig into the first one, which was a wing (as opposed to a drummette)...PHENOMENAL. Holy shit, they were still just that perfect amount of crispy. The Korean paste mix on the outside is absolutely perfect: not too thick, just spicy enough, and just absolutely delicious. I had 5, and had eaten before this whole adventure, but I wanted TWENTY MORE.

Seriously, if you have the means and the (one?) friend to share with, go ahead and call in an order of the 1/2 pan of KFC wings. They're that amazing.

I will be back for KFC wings + waffle combination...more than likely with another side of 5 wings of a different flavor. I wanna try the curry ones!!
author: Cody K.

description:
Small mom & pop shop selling lots of hot sauce and really good wings.
I will say that because it's kind of a 'hole-in-the-wall' place, the ambiance is missing a bit... and it's small. It felt like we were eating wings in a hot sauce shop, but that doesn't mean they weren't good.
My friend got 5 KFC (Korean fried chicken) and 5 Fiery Hot (?) plus a waffle. I got 5 Bulgogi and a waffle.
Because they're made to order, the wait was a bit long, but that gave us time to look at the different hot sauces and sample a few too. But it was nice knowing that our wings weren't pre-fried and sitting under a heat lamp. 
My Bulgogi wings were pretty awesome. Saucy, but still crispy with a bit of savory/sweet. I didn't try the KFC, but the fiery hot were pretty spicy. 
My only complaints would be that my friend's wings (but not mine, oddly) had a slight freezer burn taste since the wings ARE frozen. But it wasn't enough to detract from the crispy wings. Secondly, there's not much area to sit. We sat on the window sill with mismatched tables. There were also tables outside, but it was a typical gloomy and cold SF day. So I definitely want to return to try their other wings, but I personally wouldn't plan an all-out meal here. 
But fried chicken wings + waffles... always a good thing.
I also heard Thursday is free waffle day?!
author: Jen T.

description:
I discovered Hot Sauce & Panko through visiting SF Brewcraft for homebrew supplies which is two doors down the block.  The block has only been strengthened by the existence of HS&P because, in my opinion, hot sauce and homebrew go hand-in-hand.  (Lots of passionate people excited about creating something legendary for the tastebuds)

I'm looking forward to going back to try the sandwiches and waffles.  So far, I have tried the following wing flavors: XXXHOT (BEWARE wow super hotness), KFC (their #1 seller, Korean Fried Chicken...nomnomnom), green (cilantro, garlic, etc), habanero (delectable habanero citrus vinagrette), brown sugar ham glaze...lots of others that are escaping my memory right now but they're always changing it up which is awesome.  Suffice to say, this place inspires me.  I want to go there just to drink real ginger soda to cool my tastebuds and hang out at the hot sauce bar...a cheap date for a Saturday afternoon.

The owner is always willing to give suggestions regarding his favorite hot sauces.  And he definitely has good taste which is reflected in the options in the menu.  Together the owner and his wife make me feel welcome every time. 

Overall, given all the positives, the only negatives are that seating is cramped and there are no bathrooms.  And the joke non-functioning mini-urinal on the wall when you walk in doesn't really help when nature calls.

The neighborhood is out of the way but parking is usually manageable...I find that I am starting to crave this place when I am nowhere near the neighborhood...for good reason.

KWB
author: Kate B.

description: Amazing, and I'm not really a chicken wing fan. Had KFC (Korean) and Chris's, both excellent, Chris's definitely sweet with a pepper kick.
author: Gabrielle C.

description:
Only just heard of this place via Yelp.  Went on an odd midafternoon time so no wait at all.  I like the individual attention that they give to each order of wings but I can see how the wait could be long during busy periods.

The first thing you see when you enter the small shop are the hundreds of hot sauce bottles for sale on a wall, including some seriously potent stuff.

The green wings with cilantro, ginger and jalapeno was pretty good as was the Korean fried chicken with its gojuchang-type sauce.  Personally, I prefer the flash-fried dried Korean chicken wings (e.g. at SO) rather than the wet, sauce-soaked version here but not bad at all here.

Quite out of the way so probably not a regular thing for me.

Pretty much take out only.
author: F. P.

description: Hubby and I stopped by for a quick secret snack before going to Hong Kong Lounge for a family dinner. We only had time to have one small order of the jalapeño cilantro chicken wings.  They were really good and I wish we had time to try the other flavors too. We will definitely stop by for another snack before the dreaded Hong Kong Lounge food again.
author: Mona K.

description: These wings are as good as it gets. Truly amazing. I just wish they were open later into the night.
author: Nicole L.

description: I only tried 2 kinds of wings but they were both good: lime and KFC. The wait was a little long for 2 orders of wings, but it's understandable with the size of this place and the lines. I can't wait to go back and try other flavors and the also the sandwich.
author: Theresa D.

description: Best to take it to go since seating is very limited. The wings are fantastic with so many different flavors. It's very saucy. Can't wait to try the others. There's a garage not to far away for parking if you're willing to pay a few extra dollars
author: Kent N.

description:
The Belgian waffles here are so pillowy soft and, when covered in whipped butter, even more delightful. I also love their unusual selection of sauces for sale. I've been there twice just to buy gifts for friends (because, really, who doesn't know someone in your life who *loves* hot sauce?).

The green wings are my very favorite and the only ones I've tasted that aren't too hot for my liking. I'm a wimp. The place is tiny so the wait is long for food (most of the time) and the prices are on the steep side for what you get.

But all in all a great neighborhood addition and a nice place to find a great gift for a hot sauce fan.
author: Christina K.

description: What can I say this place makes some damn good wings!! I like all the hot sauces they have there,  the people that work there  really nice and friendly.
author: Pat C.

description: Stopped at this tiny little place after seeing a line out the door, and I'm glad I did! I love hot sauce so this place was heaven. Staff were super friendly and the place just gives off really good vibes. Get the Ghost Pepper wings if you like heat!!
author: K C.

description:
When I was naive I used to be enamored with the wings from San Tung.  To be sure they are an incredibly tasty representation of dry-fried chinese wings.  I would eat boxes of them.

Then Hot Sauce and Panko appeared, just blocks from my home.  They have the tastiest damn wings around.  Their wing flavors are simply incredible and unique.  I am trying to taste all their flavors to decide which is my favorite.

Also the waffles?  Delish.  I bought my first hot sauce bottle today and it turns out they now serve Po Boy sandwiches.

Go here.  Support them.  They rule.
author: Pouria Y.

description: I was afraid I'd be disappointed with yet another wing place but this place is solid.  Wings came out piping hot and crunchy with bursting flavors.  The greens weren't my favorite but Chris' was.  Can't wait to revisit.
author: S U.

description:
Gotta Try These Great Tastin' Chicken Wings!

Located in the Central Richmond District, this place is really a great find!  That is if you don't miss it, literally!  The entrance of this establishment is very inconspicuous, not resembling an eatery but perhaps a personal residence or small business office.  However, the food is DELISH!

Their menu features a large variety of wings, sides, waffles, and sandwiches.  A single order of wings consists of 5 pcs for about $6, but a better deal would be the 8X1 (8 pcs with one sauce for about $9).  The wings are good sized and are meaty, tender, and moist.

I tried 3 different types of wings with a waffle:

*  KFC (Korean Fried Chicken) Wings - A mildly spicy wing (not fried with a batter) covered with a sauce of chili paste, garlic, sesame oil, and agave.  They had a unique flavor with the little kick from the spiciness.

*  Green Wings - A very tasty wing dry fried and covered with a sauce of cilantro, ginger, jalapeno, sesame oil, and a dry spice blend.  Great tastin'!  The jalapeno is not overpowering but provides a flavorful mild blend.  YUM!

*  Bulgogi Wings - OMG!  My favorite!  A dry fried wing drenched in a bulgogi sauce with the perfect blend of sweetness and tanginess.  One bite and I was in heaven!

*  Belgian Waffle -  For about $3.50, this is one of the best tastin' waffles I've ever had.  Not one of the small miniature-sized waffles, but a large 7-8" round Belgian.  The consistency is light and fluffy, and it's cooked to a perfect golden brown color with edges that have just the right amount of crispiness and crunch.  Topped with a delicious scoop of whipped butter and a choice of maple, blueberry, or strawberry syrup and you have one AMAZING waffle! 

The place is very clean and the main decor is a wall displayed with about 100 different types of hot sauces for purchase.  You also have an extensive choice of hot sauces to try with your wings.  Being rather space limited, with only about 2-3 small tables, this is more ideal for take out.  If you do decide to eat there, be sure to empty your bladder before arrival since there is no bathroom. 

I had one great, satisfying meal and it was a bargain!  I will definitely be back to try the Fried Panko Wings.  Mmm Mmm Finger Lickin' Good!
author: Karen L.

description:
to whom this may concern:

why do i have to wait for the best things in life?! this world is so cruel! we ordered the KFC and green wings.. i must say the KFC was my favorite.. the panko and meat ratio was perfect.. how do they keep the meat so juicy?! thank you for blessing me with this heavenly delight.

-amen
author: Jen C.

description: AMAZING WINGS, they really know what they are doing. The Boogogi Wings are unbelievable. I really cant say enough good things about this place if you are looking for wings this is the place to go.
author: Jeremy R.

description: There are wings...and then there are THESE wings!  Stumbled upon it about a month ago and, though it was the only place still open around the area at the time, it was phenomenal.  We had an assortment of three (KFC, Garlic Parm and Bulgogi), and all were tongue teasers.  The on-the-side hot sauce is a variety of what's on the "for sale" shelf, from the interesting to the blazing ghost chili.  The waffle was expertly prepared, but the little drinking cups and urns made for frequent trips back inside a small space for water.  Leftovers were tasty, but lacked the crispiness of freshly served, as they often double or triple fry the wings based on the variety.
author: Shags S.

description:
Stumbled upon this place and decided to give it a shot I tried their KFC and the spicy wings along with an order of fries. 

At first I was amazed everything tasted very good later on that night however I got sick. This was really the only thing I had eaten that afternoon, Maybe I was on the verge of getting sick already I dont want to totally blame them. I will give it a try once more in the future and see how its goes.
author: Michael W.

description: The guy behind the counter who make these delicious chicken wings are absolutely UH-MAY-ZING! I don't know how he does it, but whatever kind of science, magic, or whatnot...one word: phenomenal!!
author: Donald W.

description:
The wings are good, better than Wing Stop but I can't say the KFC wings are better than the ones from San Tung.  San Tung wings have a nice flavor with tons of gooey, sticky sauce with it.  We tried 3 orders (8 pieces for almost $9 is 1 order) or 24 pieces:
1. Green wings - had an almost chili lime flavor but the cilantro gives it a nicer taste and it was spicer than I expected but not too hot.  
2. KFC - was reddish colored and sprinkled with a lot of sesame seed.  It was good but the least favorite of the 3 we tried.
3. Bulgobi - This is the one that most reminds me of the kind served at San Tung.  Probably my favorite of the 3. 
Watched a couple of take-out orders go by and the waffle is huge (under $4), about 6 inches wide and made fresh. They have these 2 cast iron looking waffle makers where the batter is poured into them and they flip it over to cook once the 2 sections are closed upon each other.  
They have several more flavors and we plan to be back to try the others, and a waffle!
author: Ry T.

description: My mouth is still watering from having the  old bay and chris's wings yesterday. These are by far the best wings I've ever had.
author: Amin S.

description: Excellent Korean Fried Chicken (KFC) and Hot Buffalo Wings.  You have to try this place if you haven't yet.
author: Zoran L.

description:
I have wanted to find a good wing place in the city for so long now. None of my friends are wing fiends like I am, so I only now found this place, courtesy of Yelp. Thank the heavens. 

The Green Wings were amazing. Even if everything else was bad, we'd still come back just for these. The regular hot wings were okay, but I was already spoiled by the green ones. The sauce was a little thin for my taste, too. We also tried the prosciutto wrapped wings, which were also very good, but more about novelty than taste. 

I also had one of the Belgium waffles in a moment of weakness. It was fluffy and warm and delicious and it tasted like the used a hint of marshmallow cream in the batter. 

I can't wait until my next "cheat meal" and go back here.
author: Kristin N.

description:
I came here after spotting this on my way home from the gym. Small tiny storefront with a catchy name that made me go "hmmm...? what the heck is this place?". Of course, I yelped it and saw good reviews and WINGS? done and done! I'm thinking this is more of a 3.5 star review than 4 though. 

Tried this place out last night for some takeout wings. Got the "triple" size (15-18 wings) for $14.99. Got the three "best seller" sauces: buffalo wings, KFC (korean fried chicken), and the green sauce (a dry rub). 

I'm not normally a fan of dry rubs on wings, but this was pretty tastiest and the wings were fried nicely giving a nice crunch. The KFC sauce that everyone raves out is pretty good, tang with a hint of sweetness. I'm not a fan of sweet with my spice, but this was pretty tasty. The wings, however, were not "fried". Still yummy but I do like the crunch. The buffalo sauce was pretty good, it leaves a nice burn... but it wasn't spicy enough for me. I took it easy JUST IN CASE their xxhot was TOO spicy. 

I'm going to come back again to try their habernero sauce, the xxhot sauce, and their miso wings. And everyone raves about their waffles so I'll give that a try too. Update later!

The lady at the cashier wasn't too friendly at first, but I chatted her up and she opened up a lot more. The guy cooking the wings was friendly and was telling me about the sauces. I ordered on the spot and didn't wait too long. I was the only one there though so that probably played a factor. 

They also have the frequent buyer cards near the cashier register. Cleverly hidden on the back of their business card... I only knew about it because I saw "freebie" on one of the spots and asked. For my $14.99 order, I got three stamps. I don't think it'll take very long for me to get my "freebie". 

Oh and last tidbit, credit card swipe/signing/emailed reciept via iPad. SMART!!! (and pretty damn cool).
author: Jeannie L.

description:
After I realized that San Tung wings weren't really that great, for years I was left with little choices as far as good chicken wings.  Low and behold Hot Sauce and Panko!

Luckily when I went there was no line so I had no problems getting my order fresh and prompt!

The KFC and the Green Wings with the Waffles are definitely the way to go!

I'm really glad this place opened!  *chicken wing dance
author: Anthony L.

description: Green wings are delish. If they were veggies, I would eat them all day. The flavoring is just this great combination that explodes in your mouth. The korean fried chicken was good but the green wings were the star. Their wings are less crispier compared to other places but the flavors there so that makes it just as good.
author: Eve C.

description:
I used to come here every week and the wings were generally pretty good but for the last couple months or so they have fallen off. They started using larger chicken wings and they just don't taste as good any more.  The wings lack the flavor they used to have. 
The staff are friendly except for the owner who seems to be irate most of the time and would not even acknowledge that I was there.  In the past he would talk to me and I would ask him to bring back a wing that I enjoyed, but he basically said it's not happening. It's apparent he does not really care what the customer wants. And if you criticize his shop in any way he would always have a very defensive and visceral response (just look at some of the negative reviews on here). They would actually post negative yelp reviews on their blog and go on rants about any customer that dared to criticize their service! 
Long story short I no longer come here for wings and would not be surprised if this review goes on their blog.
author: Piers Y.

description:
New favorite restaurant in SF!

I've never been a regular at any restaurant before.  I've always been the type to keep on checking out new places while only occasionally coming back to a few places.  This is all going to change due to this place.  I am going to eat everything on this menu in the next 30 days.  Why when I have so many more restaurants in my neighborhood I haven't been to yet?

Obviously the food: So far I've ordered the Bulgogi wings and the Korean Fried Wings.  The Bulgogi wings had a good sweetness to them that sort of reminded me of street food in Bangkok.  The Korean wings were pretty delicious although I would have appreciated some extra spiciness.  I also tried one of my roommates Brown Sugar and Ham Glazed wings.  Also, very tasty although I would never order them over the KFC wings.  Plus when I arrived to get my order while my wings were ready they didn't cook the waffle until I arrived so it would be fresh.  I really appreciated it and made sure to drive fast and take chances on the ride home so it would still remain as fresh as possible.

The Prices:  I could eat here every meal without breaking the bank.  Definitely a plus.

So far we have some pretty delicious food at a great price.  A solid four stars.  But they take things here to the next level to get to that fifth star.

The Hot Sauces: It's not just that they have a huge selection of hot sauces here.  It's that it is a selection of hot sauce built by someone who loves their hot sauce.  If you are looking for a hot sauce especially for a specific purpose talk to the owner (the guy cooking up all of your food) and he will rain down on you with some hot sauce knowledge.  Also, they have a ton of hot sauces that you can throw on your food to give it some extra spice or just sample to see what you like before you buy a bottle of the it.  Some people I've told about this did not seem impressed but to me this is nothing short of amazing!

Some Other Stuff:  Super nice staff.  The guy who's cooking everything and the younger dude working there are very friendly and easy to talk to.  The lady was nice but not as cool as they were.  Also their website is a clusterfuck but in an entertaining down home kind of way.
author: Ryan C.

description:
I like the range of flavors they offer. I had the following:
