KFC - I think it could be sweeter. It definitely has the spicy flavor but lacks sweetness thats common in regular KFC.

Chris's - Its basically all in one - sweet, salty, and very flavorful! Highly recommended if you're unsure what to order.

Lime - Personally my favorite because I love lime in almost everything! Salty and a hint of sour :) 

The wings could be better if they are a little crispier and yet maintain the flavor. 

Another tip: definitely a to-go/takeaway place!
author: Felicia P.

description: I was set on getting some wings today. My lunch was at 4:30. Drove down and got there at 4:50. On the door it said the hrs of operation. Closed at 6:30m today. But they were closed at 4:50. No reasons why they were closed. Not a note on the door say anything about why they are closed. Soooo disappointed in them. I was hungry for some wings. And so were my co-workers. So I'm just saying, I hate places like this! Don't say you're open and when people have their mind set going to your place, and to find out you're closed! That blows!
author: Tan C.

description:
Damnit, I'm in love with this place.  After hearing about it I had to try a good chicken wing place in the outer Richmond.  It absolutely didn't disappoint.  I tried a double order of the Korean Fried Chicken style wings and the sauce on them was remarkable.  The chicken itself was melt-in-your-mouth delicious.  I also ordered a Belgian waffle on the side.  It was a perfect compliment to the hot somewhat sweet sauce on the wings.  I would highly recommend it to anybody.  

On top of that they have an immense selection of hot sauces.  I'm not a big fan of sauces that will make you cry the next day but that place has all the ammo you need.

Also, they get +1 for using Square so they can accept credit card payments.  I really wish more stores in the Richmond would utilize that since I hate taking cash with me.
author: Paul C.

description: This place has THE best chicken wings I have ever had in my entire life. They have such unique sauces (which changes all the time--so you have more of a choice every time you come!) that you just can't find anywhere else! Whether you like it spicy or not, you'll love this place! They even once had wings with chopped mangoes on them and it was incredible. You're in for a treat here. :)
author: Trisha D.

description: WHAT A MEAL! I wasn't sure what to expect but I loved it! I had the Chris's & the Korean style wings with the tastiest waffle I've ever had! I don't know if it was the syrup or the waffle but OMG AMAZING! Coming back soon!
author: Jimmy B.

description: I came here for the first time a couple weeks ago and I completely thought it was a restaurant or to something of that nature.  I was wrong.  It is a specialty store that sells all kinds of bottles of hot sauce. They even have a hot sauce that's just as expensive as buying 2 pairs of Air Jordans.  Anyhow, my first experience was a good one.  Everybody was nice, from the cashier down to the owner.  The chicken wings that I ordered were definitely on point.  That Ghost Pepper wings though and I think I've said enough about those.  Got fries for my son and they were good too.  Don't know what that Hugo V. was talking about.  Of course he wants to be a food critic.  What he is, is a joke if you ask me.  The wings here are the best I've had since I've had wings at the Chieftain Irish Pub.  I think they are far above everyone else.  They care about the product they serve and that's what you look for at eateries.  It's about the integrity of the product being put forth and not the quantity.  I feel people get that misconstrued just like Hugo V.  Anyways, can't wait to make a trip down there.  It is worth the trip for some of their chicken wings.  Hot Sauce and Panko, keep it poppin' down there in the Richmond District.  Y'all doin' a great job!
author: Papa S.

description: even though i go here, which is like on the weekly, you really don't want to go here. no way.  not when i want to go here and eat wings, at least. it's too small for the both of us.  give me my space!  it gets messy what with all the wing sauce options.
author: David T.

description: I'd like to consider myself a true chicken wing connoisseur always trying wings from anywhere I can.... And this place blew my mind. Why did I spend $40+ trying all different kinds of flavors?! Because it was frckn amazing. This place is delicious, clean, and far above average. Keep up the magic!
author: Regina E.

description: A must eat if you love wings. Lots of flavors to choose from and get the waffle too! Weird hours so check before you go
author: annie n.

description: Chicken is fried up nice and crisp and tossed in flavorful sauce. Comes piping hot and tasty. Owner/chef very friendly (when time permits) to recommend his favorite hot sauces from the large shelves on retail display.
author: John H.

description: Food was awesome.  Bulgogi wings are aaaamazing.  Besides tons of hot sauce, there's tons of personality inside.  Staff was fun, gave perfect recommendations and really have pride in the place.  Go there.  Screw KFC.  In that order.  #priorities
author: Lawrence V.

description: Flavor is good but overpriced for how small the wings are
author: A L.

description:
It is my first time to try Hot Sauce and Panko's chicken wings.....It is beyond my expectation...to the level of outstanding!!!!! ..... Krispy outside and juicy inside...that's suppose to be.... two thumps up!!!!

I try Green wings, KFC wings and Buffalo wings (medium). They are bomb!!!!!

However, I have to wait about 20 mins more even it is not too crowd. I have to be patient though because it has only two people cooking there. But it is worth to wait for. 

The bottom line.... I found the place to get the best chicken wings here...YEAH!!!!
author: Alisa P.

description: Literally JUST sat in front of HSP pigging out on my green wangz and enticed two passerbys to come in and try it. Seriously, the chicken here never disappoints.  If only my stomach was larger.  Pro tip: get the gingleales here.  Perfect level of carbonation and clean flavor to finish off the meal.
author: Anna T.

description: love love love this place.   Gotta get the hot saucy wings and fluffy waffles with the bacon syrup. Generous portions and friendly owner =)
author: Lisa Z.

description: Good. My favorite was the honey one. Teriyaki one was too salty. Korean one was not my style. Waffle was a waffle, but softer.
author: Robert R.

description:
Small shop but great WINGS! There is a huge variety of different type of wings for a reasonable price. They have even a bigger selection of types of hot sauce! 

Food:
Sweet Buffalo wings- Nice and tangy with a bit of sweet to the wings
Thai Curry- Really good wings 
KFC- VERY GOOD!
Blue cheese with dijon- Too overpowering with blue cheese, I am not too big of a fan so be warned! 
Green Wings- TASTY! 
Bulgogi- interesting
Waffle- :]
author: Elliot T.

description: I may have found the perfect Chicken Wing - yes, wings and Pho are my recent addictions and Hot Sauce my have just created the perfect wing - it is their Honey Salty Crispy Pepper wing and it is just this side of perfection (is anything really perfect?) - what I find most amazing with this place, is Terrance's (I think that is his name) passion for creativity - just how many types of wings can one make - Terrance is on that journey.  This particular creation supersedes San Tung's wings (albeit they are outstanding too) by introducing the honey glaze - it perfectly coats the wing and when cooked, caramelizes just perfectly to give it a uniform "crust/crunch" that is so wonderfully juxtaposed to the soft, rich, juicy chicken meat you take in with each bite - by adding in the salt and pepper (so simple, and so good), you get a wing that has just the right balance between sweet and savory, crispy and juicy, and you just can't eat one - take my advice Terrance, patent this recipe and enter it into any chicken wing competition!!!!
author: Richard D.

description: Five stars for unique and yummy. Very heavy. The Mrs wouldn't eat any of it. I got five different kinds and loved all of them.
author: Alex M.

description:
This place is a joke. My friends and I have tried coming here twice and been turned away twice. The first time we walked up 30 minutes before closing. There was no one in the restaurant and when we tried to walk in the door, a lady told us they were closed. We looked at the sign on the door and it said they closed in 30 minutes, which we pointed out. She mumbled something and said closed and shut the door.

Yesterday, we decided to give it another shot. We came hours before "closing". Once again, no one is inside and we try to walk in and the same lady tells us they are closed. She mumbles something about someone not feeling well and turns around.

I would love to be able to comment on the food, but it appears to be impossible. I'd love to try the food and throw my money at them, but that is not an option. I have decided that this place is such a gamble that it is not worth trying to go.
author: K B.

description: Not cool - over thirty minutes before closing and they are not taking any more orders for the day because they are too "tired". Wish you told people this before we drove all the way here.
author: Priscilla T.

description: Food prepared by people passionate about what they do--a seemingly rare trait these days. Expensive but worth it.
author: Todd S.

description:
I think the different flavors of the wings were good, but I like my chicken wings more fried. The wings had a thin layer of crispiness due to a different cooking style. 

Green wings: just enough jalepeno and cilantro flavor
Thai wings: didn't really enjoy the lime flavor
KFC: sweet & sticky 
Bulgogi: favorite
author: Cindy H.

description:
this place is now one of my fav. places to eat in San Francisco!

two things...1) I fucking LOVE CHICKEN, u know how america makes fun of black ppl for liking chicken, let me tell u this, if u dont like chicken, youre a fool, A DAMMMN FOOL!!, like chappelle said, im also waiting for chicken to approach me to do a commercial, "ill do it FOR FREE CHICKEN!!

2) I fuckin LOVE HOT SAUCE, Ive done many many spicy challenges and i just have this natural urge for capsaicin overload, many days were spent sitting on a toilet with all them foul, rectum bur......anyways

the first thing youll notice is all types of different hot sauces they have, my buddy and i have personally bought some of the hottest sauces they had like Z:NOTHING BEYOND, DEFCON, HOTTEST FUCKING SAUCE:IT WONT KILL U, BUT ULL WISH IT DID, CANT WALK, DIABLO's FUEGO, ASS REAPER and that one bottle with a hospital red cross on it, forgot the name.....

these hot sauces are FUCKING HOT, like i wanna stab my eyes with forks and gauge them out n bleed til i die HOT, like somebody took some sand paper and rub it hard back n forth against ur anus til ur testicles explode HOT

EX. ghost chili, the hottest pepper in the world, has about 1 - 1.5 million scoville units (scoville is the measurement of capsaicin and its derivative molecules), most law enforcement grade pepper spray has 2 million scoville units, Z:NOTHING BEYOND has 4 million scoville units according to its manufacturers, other hot sauce bottles that we bought have similar units in range, u have been WARNED! after we bought it, we gave some to these white ppl at a bar right next to it, they were trippin balls out, white ppl cant 1) jump 2) dance and 3) handle spicy shit

now onto the wings, id say the best wings here are the super spicy wings, parmesan cheese, 10 spice and katsu (of course this is my personal preference, i dont think most ppl would go for the super spicy, i like it cause its super spicy), I REALLY LIKE the GARLIC PARMESAN CHEESE, id recommend that for EVERYONE, the first time i took a bite out of it smothered in hot sauce....i felt the tormented soul of AUNT JEMIMA cryin in her grave screamin LAWD HAVE MERCY!!!! with a waffle in her hand, its so crispy n cheesy n garlic-y?, katsu wings were also super bread crumb crispy, really awesome, 10 spice wings were super flavorful, ohh n i wish they put more of that spicy, sweet sauce on the KFC, but overall i like all of their wings, it blows wings n things outta the water, probably top 5 wings ive had period!

the waffle is pretty good, i didnt think it was that exceptional....but lets be fuckin real, its a WAFFLE, its pretty hard to fuck up a waffle, ive never had a waffle thats soggy and cold at any restaurant EVER, thats a basic, if u fuck up waffle, u might as well just close down the restaurant, just get the fuck outta town, u dont deserve to be in restaurant  business....

and not a lot of ppl know this, but there is this bar right next to it (i thought it was a coffee shop at first) and they let u bring ur wings and eat it there so usually my buddy and i get wings, get some beer and enjoy our sunday afternoon getting drunk b4 our wings arrive, one time we were eating like 40 wings and 10 bottles of hot sauce, the ppl inside were lookin at us like they were at a zoo, like witnessing two gorillas eat sloppy joes w/ nacho cheese, many napkins were sacrificed that day.....its okay, fucks were not given as well.

overall i love this freakin place, n u can earn points everytime u go there and get like free food once u have enough points, plus they really sell their gimmicks i.e. that chubby ipad cashier guy wearing one man wolf pack t-shirt, christopher walken's we accept walk-ins sign, they blogs dissin chick-fil-a, etc WELL PLAYED SIR, WELL PLAYED

4.5 stars

ps: parking blows here, just BMW it (Bart, Muni, Walk)
author: Michael K.

description: I'm addicted to this place. Before coming here, I wasn't the biggest fan of wings, but the fantastic flavors at Hot Sauce and Panko converted me. The KFC Wings are probably my favorite, followed by the Bulgogi. You also can't go wrong with their waffles.
author: Jackie S.

description:
Mmmmm belgian waffle with vegetaroam bacon on top. Who woulda thought?! 

I stumbled on this place one day while walking the dog & running other errands, completely NOT looking for somewhere to eat dinner. The owners were so friendly & funny & knowledgable that I ended up staying and getting something to eat (read above) and it was SO SO SO indulgent and yummy.

I'm kind of a baby when it comes to spicy stuff but my boyfriend is a fan of hot sauce and he loved the huge selection they had. They carry a lot of locally owned brands, which is always a plus.

If you're a meat eater - you'll love it here (I wouldn't know but my boyfriend thorougly enjoyed his fried chicken sammie). Wings, chicken, chili.. All the hearty stuff. 

If you're ever in the area, GO HERE! If not for the food, just for the owners alone..They're rad.
author: Adelaide M.

description: Hands down best wings in the SF.  When you eat these wings you find yourself asking that if there is a life after death and you were given one choice in food, would it be these wings?  The answer was yes when I was 12 wings down with a face covered in sauce.  Get the cilantro wings and you will thank me for life.
author: Zachery N.

description:
Best wings I've ever eaten!!!! Amazingly tender, fried, and spiced. The best part is the owner! He has a well curated hot sauce collection and puts his blood and sweat (hopefully not literally) into his recipes. He is almost a one-man show (minus help at the register), so cut them some slack for waiting while he makes your wings to order.

I have a pretty good heat tolerance (eat raw serrano and thai chili peppers) and I mean it when I say they do a mean hot sauce! Aside scoring ridiculously high on the Scoville spice scale, what makes the sauce great is the intensely delicious flavor. 

I typically only prefer hot wings, but my favorite item is actually the Green wings. Just to die for...

Don't pass up on their waffles either. Pairs nicely with the maple bacon syrup and can put out the fire in your mouth after eating their XXX hot wings!

Good thing for my health I live across town, otherwise I would be here weekly to get my fix!
author: N. A.

description: The BEST wings I've ever had! Make sure to get the waffle combo!
author: Harneet R.

description: I called in my order an hour in advance and when I came they didn't even have the order ready. What was the point of calling in and ordering? I came from across the bridge on my lunch trying to feed my office, and these people don't even have it together. It's hard to rate food when the service is crap. When I asked what happened to the order they both looked away as if they didnt even know what I was saying.
author: Zane T.

description: Love their wings and chicken waffle sandwich. We tried ghost peppers, Korean, honey lime wings. Simply great. Wings are best eaten fresh at the store instead of a take out. The staff is pleasant and the owner is always smiling.
author: Su R.

description: This is one of the true San Francisco gems.  When a place specializes in Wings it needs to nail them and Hot Sauce and Panko have done so on almost everything menu item I've tried.  The Green is my favorite!
author: Joe B.

description:
Wings and waffles, need I say more? 

This place is awesome. There is a wall full of hot sauce for sale and almost plenty of it is open for you to try with your meal. But you're not going to need any extra heat if you order the Buffalo Wings hot+. He's not messing around, it's hot. 

GREEN WINGS - my new favorite. They're crispy, well seasoned with a little kick coated in herby deliciousness to boost the flavor and freshness. Definitely get a waffle on the side! I put maple syrup and hot sauce on mine and it was excellent. 

And, it's pretty inexpensive.
author: Julia G.

description: I didn't even like chicken wings until I tried hot sauce and Panko. I have been coming every week since I have tried it and have fallen in love with every single flavor. The cashiers and chefs are so sweet and clearly love what they do and what they sell. I'm seriously addicted to these wings and every  heavenly and creative sandwich! EVERYONE MUST GO!!!!
author: Alice J.

description:
Look, I've had some wings that will knock your socks off for 50 cents a pop - at over $1 a wing you better be giving me something extraordinary, and Hot Sauce & Panko just came up short.

 I REALLY REALLY wanted to like this place, being that I live 2 blocks from the spot, but it just was not a good experience at all! "We are all out of sandwiches"... @ 3:00?! Certainly not the way to do good business in the food industry, especially if you only have 5 items total on your menu and you're not serving 4 of them.

Customer service, or even simple common courtesy, is not their specialty: No "Hello, how are you?", no "Welcome to Hot Sauce and Panko! Have you been here before?".

No problem, carry on. So I ordered the "Green Wings" and the "spicy" coleslaw. The coleslaw was somewhat soggy, not spicy at all, flavorless, and at $3 a pop is a scam. The wings, however, were a good size and had a decent flavor (which is what earned the 2 stars). 

I'm not sure where the 150 people that reviewed this place before me have been eating chicken wings, but if you think this is a 4 or 5 star wing joint, you need to step up your wing game and explore! 

SUMMARY: Not properly supplied, bad service, good sized chicken wings with OK flavor, at prices that don't nearly match the quality!

 The size of the wings is the best thing they've got going for 'em...
author: Matt D.

description: Serious, serious business.  The awesome cook/owner here masterfully creates a diverse variety of wings.  The barbeque wings are better than anywhere else, the buffalo wings are amazing, and the Asian inspired wings are consistently amazing, with the Red Rooster (Sriracha + Lime = The BOMB) being my favorite.  If you are in SF or even nearby and craving pretty much any style of chicken wing, you would be stupid to go somewhere else.
author: Pesoc R.

description:
I've only ever gotten their chicken sandwich.  But I've had it maybe 10 times.  
Absolutely the greatest $5 sandwich anywhere.   It is perfect every time.    All the wing sauces sound great but I haven't been able to bring myself away from the sandwich.   As someone who eats out for 99.5% of their meals, this is my favorite "cheap eats" in the city.   The proprietor is real friendly and accommodating to special requests as well.    If he was in the mission there would be a 3 block line out the door at all times.    I hope he's doing enough business out here in the Richmond, but I know I'm sure glad he's here. 
Can't speak highly enough about this place.
author: howard t.

description: Went to HS&P a while back one afternoon on a whim. It had been recommended to me by some friends even though they knew I didn't really like wings. But I'm a convert- I ordered two different kinds to try and they were great. I need to go back soon. As others have written they have a huge selection of retail (vinegar based) hot sauces for sale as well.
author: El T.

description:
I've been here three times now and have never been disappointed.  Order ahead of time and when you get there, the order is prepared fresh -- sauced as you wait -- and ready to go.  I've never had to wait more than 15 minutes and the owner is very nice and customer friendly.

KFC is my go-to wing.  I think it's the tastiest of the sauces I've tried.  Green is good, maybe a notch below KFC in my book.

I'm sad to see the 1/2 pans go, as that was my go to order.  However, I'll happily keep coming here.  The wing quality is excellent -- I have to drive about 30 minutes to get there but it still is well worth it.
author: Ryan Y.

description: I never really liked wings before, that is, until I discovered Hot Sauce and Panko wings. I now get cravings for them they are so good.  Their wings have just the right crispy texture and  I'm impressed  by their unique flavor options on the menu.  The Chris' honey pepper and Korean wings are incredibly tasty and by far the best ones they offer.
author: Kim W.

description: Great wings, tried korean, kolbi and green. Fries thin and full of potato flavor. Way cheap for excellent quality.
author: Kelly K.

description: Re-upping.  Very good wings.  Great neighbor.  It can still be a bit slow to get wings but they're small so only have so much capacity, so think that is what it is.
author: Kayvaan G.

description:
This place is really cool. A really neat addition to the neighborhood. Absolutely fantastic selection of hot sauces! 

 Surprisingly enough, they carry Morning Star veggi bacon! For the vegetarians, you know how superior the Morning Star veggi bacon is compared to a lot of the other brands out there. (In my particular situation, I'm not a vegetarian but my lady is... and she was excited) She got fake bacon and a waffle. The waffle was great and made fresh.

As for my order, I got the fried chicken sandwich which came with (real) bacon, american cheese, and a house-made slaw. The fried chicken was GREAT. Huge portions. The house-made slaw was excellent, it wasn't made with mayo like normal slaw, but actually, olive oil. The slaw also contained jalapenos, but wasn't overwhelmingly spicy, in fact, it was a great addition and a welcomed flavor to the sometimes bland coleslaw many people think of. 

   They also have a sampling table where you can try a majority of the hot sauces that grace the shelves. I gave the ghost pepper sauce a try.

 Owners are extremely friendly which is always a plus. 

 Overall I'm excited this place is around and can't wait to see some of the new hot sauces that roll through here. I'll definitely be back.
author: Jordan M.

description: The Green did not taste as good as they looked, they are a bit dry and not as flavorful . Chris's is pretty good! Juicy and tender. Will definitely go back, portion is not too big. I ordered two small order with different flavor, finished them all, just right amount of fullness. My male friend also ordered two small orders and was still hungry after finished them.
author: Diana C.

description:
Only thing better then the wings is the choice of hot sauces to sample in the shop or buy.
They have every type of hot sauce on the market for sale.  No more buying hot sauce for me in the grocery store or mail order.
author: Bob b.

description: It is tasty, and unique, and friendly, and an all around cool business.  But  their hours are screwy!  Closed Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday??  Then open for 7 or 5 hours at a time.   The silliness of their hours  inhibits my visits to this place, which is weak.  Too much goodness to only be accessible for 26 hours outa the week.
author: Bee L.

description:
A minor update for the sake of accuracy:  The wings are no longer huge; they're normal size.  Does it matter?  Not in the slightest.  In fact, I'd venture a guess that it cuts down on the cooking time and provides more surface area for the delicious, delicious coatings and sauces.  Not only that, to make up the size difference, you now get more of them.  What was 5 and 8 is now 8 and 12.

If this actually affects your decision to patronize this particular establishment, then I feel bad for you, you size queen, you.

Now if you'll excuse me, I need to finish of the few remaining wings left over from the two dozen I purchased earlier today.
author: N. P.

description: This place is so awesome- incredible ( and constantly changing) flavors of wings, cool neighborhood feel, staggering variety of hot sauces- by far my favorite place to eat in the City, and it's pretty much the first place I want to bring people when they visit from out of town.  I'm sure I'll be eating there in a couple hours from now- 10 out of 10
author: Brendan M.

description:
triple fried food.
each bite is honestly a struggle.
the utter bliss i get from eating it... versus the fact that every bite brings me that much closer to an immature death.
oh well.
would eat again.
at least i die fat and happy.
author: Andrew C.

description: Best wings I've every had.  Fantastic flavor combinations.  Chili crunch is my favorite - meaty, crunchy wings encrusted with honey, dried garlic, and about half a jar of chili flakes.  By the second bite you'll have a nice burn going.  I've tried lots of things on their menu and am never disappointed.  New and innovative flavors are constantly popping up.  Take your wings next door to Chomp-and-Swig and order a beer.  Pure synergy.  The only downside is limited parking, but that can't be helped.
author: Kate S.

description: I'm up here visiting University of San Francisco. I've had my fair share of wings and these were AMAZING. They're not like you're typical wings. I had the KFC (Korean Fried Chicken) and the crunchy Thai one. My mom and I enjoyed the KFC and my dad liked the crunchy one. They're so much better than the typical wings at Buffalo Wild Wings or Wing Stop. And they are the nicest people. If you're looking for a hole in the wall, this ones perfect. I'll definitely be eating here a lot if I go to USF.
author: Kaitlyn T.

description: LOVE THIS PLACE!!!!! The website says it opens at 12pm and we arrived around 11:50am only to find that there was already a small crowd. We've decided to go with small orders of some of the popular options on yelp such as GREEN, chris's, and sticky pepper. Plus i LOVE waffles so I had to get a waffle and we opted for the cosmid_seed waffle. This was for two people .. #noregrets. I'm a real big fan of spicy food so I was just excited to see the wall full of HOT SAUCE!! I knew I was in the right place :) The green was hands down my favorite because it had a bit of a spicy kick to it without overdoing it! Chris's was on the sweeter side but still one of our top choices! Next time, i'd probably pass on the sticky pepper though. It was a bit too salty for us and we couldn't taste the garlic because of that. The waffle .. oh it was quite EPIC!! BEST waffle there (although the cocoa powder was a little too much for us)! Super food coma at the end of lunch but SO WORTH IT!! We'll be back .. next time, i'm definitely going to try their wings with more of a spicy kick! ^.^
author: Jennifer W.

description:
It is yet another chilly, overcast and windy Tuesday afternoon in the Richmond. I scan the 1500 block of Clement street and fixate on the exterior of Hot Sauce and Panko. I spot shelves and shelves of liquid sun. I soak in the hot chili warning signs. This place sells HOT sauce. I. Want. Magma-esque. Hot. Sauce. My body lurches forward. I run. Faster. Is that glass? Bang! Ow! Despite the cold weather my rudolph nose leaves a fog mark on the glass. I scratch and claw at the "Closed" sign like a freezing prisoner starving for a "Ghost Chili" blanket to warm my innards. After banging my head against the door one last time I resolve to come back the next day during business hours.

Wednesday: My lover gets off work. We bundle up and run towards Clement street. The door to Hot Sauce and Panko is open. Running....running...we skid to a halt as some turtle slow pedestrians with a fraction of my spice craze crawl their way into the store. No biggie. This gives me time to salivate over the plethora of "tester" hot sauces available to try with tiny plastic sporks. I start to twitch. I start to itch! Where is it? Where is it? Yes! I see it. The Ghost Chili sauce! The unassuming bottle doesn't leave my peripheral vision as we order six buffalo hot wings, a side of potato salad, and a HUGE crispy salty chicken sandwich on a fresh white roll with american cheese, jalapeno coleslaw, and avocado instead of bacon.  Grand total? $11 something. Bargain. During the eight or ten minutes it takes for them to make our food I try eight or ten different hot sauces. I start out with some simple jalapeno/habanero sauce and then move towards brick red dollops of Dave's Original Insanity and Dave's Ghost Chili hot sauces. Aghh...delicious smoky pain. The man behind the counter flashes me a huge smile and tells me to drink some chocolate syrup. The folks working in the shop seem very passionate about chili's and are willing to talk to you about culinary pain-if you can manage to move your swelling tongue in conversation. 

We take our picnic meal to the freezing bay to watch geese poop and peck while we suckle our juicy hot wings. In my opinion the wings could have been a bit crispier but I thoroughly enjoy the peppery punch that accompanies their spicy and tangy flavor. I wonder if they would toss your wings in some Ghost Chili sauce if you asked them to. I wonder if they would give you an ice bath afterwards. No no, just jump in the icy bay. In my pained stupor I forgot to grab some to-go sauce for the chicken sandwich but it was delicious, ridiculously filling, and well lubricated on its own. I will most definitely be returning tomorrow to purchase some hot sauce to carry in my backpack for emergencies-or maybe I'll use it to make some home made pepper spray. Just kidding. Thank you for existing Hot Sauce and Panko.
author: Caity F.

description: This place is perfect. Hot wings, hot sauces, special sauces, witty signs, and waffles. D-Lish.
author: Chancelor D.

description:
MMMM MMM, Yum! I wanted just a bit more of the creamy aioli sauce on my massively gi-normous waffle sandwich, but oh, what a delicious thing that waffle sandwich was! We ordered ahead, like they suggest you do on their website, and got there in 15 minutes when our meals were just coming out. The wings were the kind my husband has been searching for for over a decade. And the plentiful supply of various syrups and sauces kept our kids busily happy.

Not too many places to sit, but we got lucky w/ the 4 seater inside. What I couldn't help loving even more than the food was the Mom & Pop in the back working heads down before our very eyes to create those delectables. Waving good-bye to us at the end w/ big ol' smiles... just so lovely.
author: Jill F.

description: Try the KFC and green wings. So good. And their selection of hot sauce is amazing
author: Dante Z.

description: Probably one of the best places for wings in the city. The red rooster wings and hot buffalo were sooooo good! I can't wait to go back and try the other styles that they offer.
author: Mark C.

description:
Constantly tasty and unique in flavors that the owner/cook puts his heart and soul into his cooking and seasoning.  I have tried almost all the flavors and look forward to more.  Thursday is my favorite day as the Belgian waffles are made to order.  Reasonable prices and made to order eating.  Call in and the order will be ready for you.  
Great to take out and use the chicken as a side or main dish.  Seats about 6-8.

Joanie
author: Joan L.

description: Best wings in SF and I have a yelp account so I MUST be an expert. Ten spice were quite nice. Waffle was very tasty as well
author: Tim M.

description:
Great service, great food.  The people that work here are wonderful.  They are incredibly friendly and the food they make is amazing.  Some of their combinations like the ultra goliath sandwich are a bit out there but the food is always fantastic.

Hot Sauce and Panko makes some of the best wings I have ever had and when it comes to wings I am damn picky.  I recommend the KFC wing as they are always on the menu and are amazing.

Check their website for whats new on the menu and I recommend calling ahead as they do not really have anywhere to sit and eat because they are not a full service restaurant.  They also have a killer collection of hot sauces and they are really entertaining to browse while you are waiting for your wings
author: Evan P.

description: Hold on to your seat kiddos, I found the place you can write home to your Momma about. In fact drop off a postcard & a fed ex box too. So apparently the secret to my heart is hot french fries & hot sauce. Who would of thunk that? So many choices of hot sauce to make your head spin. That did not deter to us from trying them all. The owner seeing the obvious elation on our faces presented us with free fries to sweeten the deal. Love love love this place! I command you to go there Now!
author: Sophia C.

description:
I've never been to Hot Sauce and Panko so when my friend asked if I wanted anything from there I was like "What the heck is that?!" It's funny how I've never heard of it cuz I literally live like a few blocks away!! Anyways I decided to check this place out on Yelp while I was at work. To my surpise, this place has 4.5 STARS!! After reading the reviews from my fellow yelpers I asked my friend to get me a sandwich and some chicken wangs...this was before 3 o'clock because after that all the sandwiches would be sold out according to the reviews. 

Well it turns out that they don't make the buns, but they do however make the sandwiches! yea pretty weird.

Alright so after seeing the pictures on Yelp, I asked my friend to get me the "rrbblt" sandwich and the "green wings" but of course I can't eat it until I get off work (bummer)! So I thought of course the sandwich and the wings won't be that good after just sitting in my friends car for a few hours, but whatever I wanted to try it out anyways. After I got off work, I met up with my friend at home and I just threw both the wings and the sandwich in the microwave, took it out and took a bite of the sandwich....MMmmmMmm I'm in sandwich heaven, the thinly sliced roast beef was cooked to perfection. The sweet savory cole slaw complimented very well with the roast beef ! What more could I ask for? All in all I give this sandwich 5 stars! The wings on the other hand were not only a bit salty, it was also a bit oily, other than that it did pack some great cilantro and jalapeno flavor!! YUMMMMYYYY!!! :D 3.5 stars!

I will for sure go back and visit and try some other sandwiches and perhaps some other flavored wings! 
Do I recommend this place to anyone you ask? Oh HELL YEAHHH!! GOOO BEFORE THE BUN RUNS OUT!
author: Janie L.

description:
The owners are super friendly and knowledgeable.  They have a great selection of hot sauces.  They helped me pick several bottles of hot sauces for my friends and coworkers.  All the hot sauces were a hit!  They said that the hot sauces were really hot and the flavors were incredible!  Great with soup or noodles!

They also have delicious piping hot waffles, tender on the inside and crispy on the outside!  I covered mine with butter, caramel and chocolate sauces!  DELICIOUS!
author: Sherry C.

description: i love chicken wings, and i love how many varieties there are! so far i've tried the green, kfc, panko parm, and chris's. least favorite was chris's... just didn't stand out to me. the kfc has a nice flavor and kick, and the green was a nice change of pace with the cilantro. i love the crunchy texture and dipping sauce of the panko parm! next on my list to try is the old bay... and more panko parm. can't wait!
author: Sabrina L.

description:
So much win!  Go to this place, give them your money, do it now!

I saw a blurb pop up about this place on the Richmond SF Blog, and knew I had to go before it blew up.  Then two days later it popped up on the Thrillist blog.  And it needed to be done.

We tried going Saturday evening after a mid-afternoon kegger and were dismayed to find them closed (7 or 8pm on a Saturday night?).  But not ones to be shot down easily, we returned for lunch Sunday.  And it was everything we'd hoped for!

There are places that aspire to be something cool, or trendy, or have the new big thing, and then there are places that just rock, that do exactly what you hope and do it right.  This is one of those places.  The banner out front is unassuming, the decorations inside are clearly there more because the owners find them entertaining than to purvey any attempt at trend or style.  The shelves after shelves of hot sauces for sale make me want to come back and try a new bottle every week.  The tasting bar of sauces came replete with obscure sauces and genuine tasting suggestions from the owner.  And a serious range from ass-in-the-tub light your face on fire sauces to milder flavored sauces, in addition to classic habanero lime flavors and your tame Tabascos.

We ordered a half pan between three of us ($7 apiece, easy).  Something like 35 wings? Just the right amount.  They split the pan into sections and served out...

The Buffalo Hot Wings (good, standard, but paled in comparison to the others),
The Brown Sugar and Ham Glaze (mother of sweet baby Jesus who knew brown sugar on wings could taste so good? Protip: pair these bad boys with the Louisiana Swamp Scum sauce), 
And the Korean Fried Chicken (I'm starting to believe these HS&P folk can do no evil).
The girlfriend is vegetarian, and was way stoked that they serve MorningStar artificial bacon (but that shit's for heathens, so that's all I'll say on that).

I hope for the best for this spot, and that they don't fall to the quick turnover that plagues restaurants in this city.

A couple kinks to work out:
-Seating: there's a bench inside and a small table outside.  We found ourselves stuck at the decision to take the wings home and sit comfortably vs eating there and enjoying the wings hot and the tasting bar to accompany our meal.
-Hours:  I don't know anything about time/money management, but I'd bet this place could make mad bank if they stayed open a little later, at least on the weekends.  Wings are drunchie heaven.
-Delivery: awww that'd just too cool.
-Menu: A little more clarity on what you're ordering.  I.E. descriptions of what the sauces are, or what goes into the different sides, and how many wings are included with different orders.  Also, plug for catering on the menu, I could see hiring HS&P for a party without a doubt.

Keep up the good work, best of luck guys!
author: Josh T.

description: Ordered Korean Fried, Kentucky Yaki, and Chili. Was all very excellent. Good for take out. Very good price. Nice people working there. (Kinda wished they were open more days and longer hours, but their limit makes them special)
author: Mark S.

description: I was looking for a good and cheap place to eat in the Richmond. Which is luckily not a problem. It seems new. It was exceedingly delicious. I hope to need to be back over there more often. There's like three tables. Two of which are outside. And I sat in the cold and ate chicken wings and spicy slaw and I haven't been that happy in a while.
author: W. Kamau B.

description:
HS&P

This place is amazing.  They've taken "chicken wing specialty" to a new level.  Besides the standard offering of sweet, medium, hot, and xxx hot - hot wings, they have an extensive menu of other styles of chicken wings that I just can't wait to go back and try.  Korean fried hot wings.  Mexicali fried hot wings, Brown sugar and ham glazed wings, Kuzu salt and pepper, thai peanut sauce, XO sauce; so many to try!  They also had a few sandwiches and they do chicken wings and waffles; with torani bacon syrup!  There is an impressive selection of hot sauces you can both purchase and sample/use at the condiments station.  The couple that run the place are very nice.  

Comments list.
* Strictly Take out.  Grab a pan and go picnic in the park or just eat on the curb.
* The meat was good, tender, but didn't slide off bone cleanly (like it does in *perfect* wings).  That's ok because I haven't seen anyone in SF get their wings like that.
* Spice on the "hot" hot wings was great.  My scalp was radiating sweat and capsaicin stimulated endorphins.  While I am guessing xxx hot is probably outside of my comfort zone, I could foresee it as not being spicy enough for some of the hard core chiliphiles out there; the ones who can EAT habaneros, but again, there is a great selection of hot sauces at your disposal to up the ante so it's probably an unnecessary point to make.  Not sure if the Ghost Chili hot sauce they sell was on the condiments counter.
* I would have liked for the wings to be crispier.  Do people double fry wings like they do fries?  Not sure how some places get them extra crispy.  That extra layer of crunch makes hot wings so much better.
* ok value?  hooters sells hot wings at 10 for $6.79.  but that's hooters =P  San Tung at ~12 for $9.00.  HS&P 5-6 for $5, or 10-11 for $10.  Not bad but they are also not at San Tung's level of crackilicious in my opinion, but those are altogether two different types of hot wings.
* Speaking of San Tung, they need (if they don't have it already) their version of San Tung dry fried hot wings.  Crackilicious!
* They have a "buy 9 or 10 orders of hot wings get one free" stamp card.
* You can call in and order giant pans of hot wings ($19.99 and $39.99) for parties or football games.
author: Nat L.

description: I really enjoyed eating there, although it was cramped and had little tables the atmosphere was awesome. The food was good, but I prefered San Tung chicken wings over this. Great deals on thursday if you open a card there, free waffle for your orders.
author: Allen C.

description: This place is perfect. I mean it. I live a stones throw away and watched this little place grow and open. We were hesitant about it at first, but decided to try it one day. I've never looked back. I dream about their sandwiches, literally. The vegetarian options are creative, delicious and huge. The sides are amazing, and it's so cheap, not to mention original. There are very few places like this. It isn't very big, but it's very cutely decorated and the owner is hilarious and super nice. They even have a bowl of water outside for my pup! I am craving it right now...
author: Dylan P.

description: The KFC's are so crispy and the sauce is sweet and spicy....mmmm. Also had the green's which could have been crispier like the KFC's, but probably just were finished cooking first. Tasty!
author: Brian A.

description:
I normally don't leave reviews, but this place was just THAT good.  I consider myself a wing connoisseur and I can without a doubt say these are some of if not the best wings i've ever had. 

Terrance knocks it out of the park and figured it out.  He uses fresh chicken that he brines and flash freezes himself ensuring BIG and JUICY wings.  The KFC wing has a secret coating that is unliked any other breaded wing you've had.  

If you're in the city and craving wings, this is the place to go.  Don't even think about going to Wing Wings, you'll be disappointed you didn't take my advice and some here
author: Joe S.

description: Came here cuz i saw the good reviews and its by the nearby.  I tried the KFC , korean wings and it tasted different than most korean wings but i dig it and the wings were cooked to perfection.  I also tried the bulgogi sandwich which was not bad considering it was under 4 bucks.  I think if they swapped the bread out to french bread it would make a whole lotta difference.  I'll be back to try the other wings when i get that craving...
author: Hugh L.

description: This place rocks my socks. Best wings I've had well, ever. Get the Panko breaded wings, sometimes they aren't on the menu, but if you ask they may make them for you. The wait can be a little long, but call in ahead of time if you are in a hurry, or just relax and wait for the glory that are these spicy little trapezoids of flavor and freedom
author: Dylan J.

description: I love this place.  Chris's wings are worth driving up from the South Bay for.  The staff is super friendly too.  I just wish they had more seating.
author: E M.

description: I wish there was more seating in this place. The indoor seating fits about 4 people closely. I loved the bulgogi chicken and the green chicken
author: Pamela I.

description: I really enjoyed their food, and the owners/workers were incredibly nice and the place was clean & comfy.  The "KFC" (Korean Fried Chicken" was spectacular, and I loved the chicken & waffle sandwich. They also have an amazing array of hot sauce - many of my favorite brands. This place knows what's up. I love Hot Sauce & Panko and I will absolutely be back!
author: Scott Z.

description: This place is unreal... KFC wings were fantastic. New mission; try every item on the menu by year end.
author: Robert C.

description: One of my favorite lunch places in SF. The fish sandwich is very yum. Sometimes, finding a seat can be difficult, but either way, it's worth it.
author: Albert S.

description: Can i say..the GREATEST WINGS in the Bay Area! With over 10000000 hot sauces to choose from ..and curry ketchup, try out the entire list of juicy plump wings and your mouth will be screamin "baby baby ooo baby!". I had the green wings, which is a jalapeno cilantro type wing with a small kick, and these were the best ones that i tried. my friends and i also had the kfc (korean fried chicken) wings: sweet tangy sauce drizzled over a perfected crisp. also had the katsu wings which are typical chicken katsu tasting, but as plump and perfectly fried as these were, i was still hooked. I def suggest the green wings. the 2 guys there are friendly and the place is relatively small (we stood at a table to eat), but youll be amazed by the plethora of hot sauces they allow you to purchase. im a believer, and i'll be their loyal customer for now.
author: Jason W.

description:
Amazing selection of hot sauce..  

Had the KFC (korean fried chicken) it was great
author: Christian K.

description: Best chicken wings in the Richmond District. Free waffle Thursdays is an added plus, and something not to miss out on. We must support our neighborhood couple runned establishments!
author: Mars F.

description: Fired up to watch Niners vs. Green Bay. I walked in at 445pm to place an order for pickup at 7:00pm. 2 hours later. The response was..."We are closed and not accepting anymore orders."  Biz must be good or they need some help. Bad customer service.
author: Braden E.

description: I found out about this place on yelp. Believe it or not, I've walked past this place without even knowing that it's even there! It's really tiny and it's a hole in the wall place. The first thing that you'd notice is the plethora of sauces lined up against the wall. I ordered: green wings, sticky pepper, goku (KFC). The wings are definitely tasty, but it's a bit on the greasy side. But hey, I don't expect to be eating healthy here. The individual sauces for each order is what brings the whole meal together. I'd definitely recommend this place if you're a wings person. 10/10 would return.
author: Harrison V.

description: Small mom and pop joint. Great wings I always get the pepper honey wings and the goliath is must try with chilli cheese fries. Whenever im working in the area I stop by for lunch
author: Patrick T.

description:
what an amazing concept! wings and waffles?!!?!?! genius!
i would be willing to go back and try other flavors. my fave was definitely the KFC. yummmmmmmm!
author: Aletheia W.

description: I love this place!  Since they've opened I get a waffle every weekend when my husband goes in and gets his wings.  They are super affordable and have great sauces ffor both the waffles and the wings.  LOVE IT!
author: Crystal T.

description: 3.5 stars. I got Green, Christs, KFC and plain waffles. They are okay good, need more salt on Greens. Nothing special, although it's not just an ordinary wings. Who says they're small wings........I ordered 3 orders of Small and they're A LOT!!!  Dang........I don't know how to finish them lol. I like Christs and Greens. Not a big fan of bim bim bap sauce (Korean dish), it's very similar on KFC. Overall okay if you need some emergency snacking or PMS-ing, hehehe.
author: Clemencia S.

description: At work we decided to try this place on our lunch.  The challenge is getting here from mill valley, getting the food back, and eating it in a hour. We weren't successful . We called in almost an hour ahead to ensure that the food would be ready. It wasnt. They said they had received a large order and it backed everything up . The food was good. They textures and flavors were there, and I was content. Although my first experience with this place was a rough one, I would still recommend giving HSaP a shot.
author: Bryan Y.

description: What can I say.  Home run.  I had no idea.  I'm not a wing fan at all for lots of reasons but these guys have changed me.  The wings are so meaty and the sauce is unreal.  My kids are appeased by the waffles.  Each order comes with an ample amount of chicken.  We love to sit outside on nice early evenings or just order in advance, tall them a time to be ready, then show up grab the wings and head back home.  For what they are doing here I'm in the 5 star camp all day.
author: jd h.

description: It's in the Outer Richmond, or is it just the Richmond. Let's call it the West Bay. The Bermuda Rectangle of the Sunset and Richmond. We got the KFC (Korean Fried Chicken), Green as well as Panko wings, and a fried chicken sandwich/slider.  The wings were huge. I've never seen wings that big.I don't know if that's good or bad, but they were nicely fried and tasty. The KFC was a lighter take on the traditional korean chicken wing, but it still had that sweet and spicy taste from the hot red bean paste. They have a large selection of hot sauces which covers one entire wall. Check it out. I need to try the waffles next time, and if you're craving wings, but without the "red hot" conventional taste, this is the place to go. If you throw you're Korean gang sign, or is it just a Richmond hang-sign thing, they will throw in a free roll of toilet paper.
author: Mike C.

description: Nicest owner!  Yummy meaty hot wings.   He makes them FRESH by the order-- and the waffles-- are heavenly-- with the ginger syrup.  Great place to pick up gifts for friends who love hot sauces.  There's a couple of tables where you can eat inside.  I'll definitely order their wing platters next time I host an event-- great deal.  Will definitely return for wings craving!
author: Tina C.

description:
Literally just walked out of this place and my taste buds have been satisfied! We ordered bulgogi, karaage and Korean fried chicken wings. My absolute favorite were the bulgogi with the sweet soy sauce and green onions...yum!  I wanted to get a waffle too, but since we are on a food tour, I had to pace myself. The wings are juicy, moist and meaty. These wings didn't come from skinny chickens.

I think the only cons are parking, but that's not really their fault and the place is small so it's much more of a takeout place rather than a sit down place.

The prices are very reasonable for wings especially when you see the amount of time, care and effort that they put into their food. When the owner was unhappy with a batch of wings he made for us, he told us he was going to make us a new batch. It's clear the owner takes pride in his craft and wants the food he puts in front of you perfect. Accommodating and friendly, I'll definitely be back to go try the green wings and maybe that waffle I wish I had ordered!
author: Joan T.

description: Liked it here!  Order over the phone for pick up!  Had yummy sandwiches and waffle.  Wings were good too!  Lots of hot sauces to choose from and experiment with.
author: Amorette K.

description: Wings were good but the waffles were better. Could use more seating (call ahead of arrival) and a larger variety of sauces like the ones on the shelves. Otherwise a awesome mix and definitely recommendable.
author: Alex P.

description: These are probably some of the best chicken wings in SF. We had the Green, korean Fried Chicken, and bulgogi wings. The waffles compliment the wings really well.
author: Joseph S.

description:
Great food, great people, great prices.  What else do you need?  

I recommend the Korean Fried Chicken, The Thai Peanut, The Brown Sugar and Ham glaze and the regular buffalo spicy.
author: Jonah N.

description: SO GOOD. Too bad there is no dining really inside but those wings are delicious and so many sauces and flavors to choose from and that deal where you can get six wings and a big waffle? Really Awesome.
author: Derek Alistair J.

description: Dems some great wings. Service is a bit slow, but that's what it takes to produce these juicy flavor bombs. I had the green wings and bulgogi wings.  The crispness and dry rub on the green wings were sensational. Both orders were so silly good that I didn't have room for the waffles. I need to go back and try the rest of the menu.  Great and fun place.
author: Kalen L.

description: noticed the extensive hot sauce collection and then the wings -- decided to try kfc (korean fried chicken) and ten spice.  the kfc is more the wet sauce and gochujang flavored, while the ten spice (home made recipe) is deep fried well and dry spice.  since made on the spot were crisp outside (but not extra thick crisp), moist inside, with nice complex flavor for the ten spice.  be sure to have them make it for you on the spot!
author: Rob C.

description: This place is heavenly. I always love me some wings, and Hot Sauce and Panko knows how to do them right! I love the chilli flakes flavored one.
author: Phuc N.

description:
This should be the standard against which all other wing vendors should be judged,... And found wanting.

Ridiculously good. Just so awesomely full of awesome awesomeness.

Get wings here. Get a beer next door. Life=win
author: Dave h.

description: The place is tiny. There are literally 3 tables. Two on the inside so you can fit maybe 6 people and then a four person table on the outside. So take these to go because eating there will make you feel large and cramped. You order at the counter and it's cool they have a little shelf with different hot sauces and it's a neat little selection of funny sauce names, hottest sauces you've ever had and stuff of that nature. We got 4 different types of wings, they either come in 6 piece or 12 piece orders. We got 12 each. We got the korean fried chicken ones, bulgogi flavored wings, green onion, and sriracha ones. They were all cooked well and the sauces were all amazing. My favorite was the green onion. They are great, small wings but the flavor more than makes up for it. We were good afterward, splitting 4 orders of 12 wings between 3 people. We were content, not full to the point of dying but not hungry either. Good wings to get to go, my friend lives down the street from here so we walked and picked them up at ate as his place. Hot sauce on them just makes it better as well. If you don't like heat then you a wuss but do what makes you happy.
author: Jeromy G.

description:
Absolutely fantastic! My buddy introduced me to this place a few months ago when we went to brewcraft next door.

I had to try the XXX hot sauce, but the owner/sauce-master adviced to try stage 1. I tried it and it kicked my tongue's ass! Now whenever I bring people I peer pressure them into trying X1 as a hazing ritual. I downgraded to HOT, which in my opinion is the best flavor for the wings. I don't know how he does it but the homemade hot-level sauce has this nice sweet-citrus flavor along with its kick.

My favorite of the open hot sauces (at the "flavor station") is the Holy Jolokia. But, I would just put that on some mild wings, bulgogi wings, or on a sample spoon because, honestly, this man knows how to brew up a fantastic adventure for the taste buds.

I go for the wings and waffles every time. The sweet potatoes are also quite good. The last time I was there a guy asked me what was good on the menu. I do not regret my response, "Everything."
author: RC K.

description: This was my first time visiting San Francisco and my girlfriend had a list of places she wanted to take me to eat. I'm an avid wing fan, as is she, and so we mainly went to wing places. I have to say that this place was great. I really like that you can get a waffle with your wings to kind of counteract the spiciness of some flavors, and believe me they can get spicy. I didn't try all of their wings, but I really liked the 1x hotness, it wasn't too hot and but it still left a burn. Got to check it out
author: Arrash D.

description:
Greatest wings on earth!

If you like chicken wings then this is the place (So many flavors to choose from)!  You will not find another place with such creativity and great tasting food.

Miso wings have peppers on top which are great way to control how spicy you like the wings.  I ate the peppers so got a nice little fiery taste my mouth while my girlfriend brushed them off for a mild taste.

They have non-spicy wings for the weak or for people who want to use the large selection of hot sauces they offer (That's what I did).

Waffles are wonderful.

The place is clean and the owner is super friendly.

This is what is so good about the SF Bay Area. Great innovation, good friendly service and most importantly.....good food!!!
author: Peter C.

description:
I love the food here.  Good wings places are solely lacking in the Bay Area, and this place definitely delivers.  I tried two kinds - the "hot" buffalo wings (you can choose from sweet, mild, spicy, and xxx) and the korean fried chicken (the menu said these were their most popular, so it seemed like a good bet).  Both were very tasty and nicely spicy without being overwhelming.  If you do like your wings super hot, there are about 20 hot sauces you can sample and/or add to your food.  I also tried the belgian waffle, which was a standard but very tasty waffle - although obviously regular fried chicken and waffles are the more standard pairing, I thought this pairing was excellent too.  There's also a selection of sauces for the waffles (syrup, caramel, a few fruit sauces, chocolate, etc.).  The prices seemed very fair, and the food was totally fresh (each item made to order) and delicious.

I'm docking a star here because of the hours.  It's hard to catch them for weeknight dinner after work (they close at 7), and to me at least, dinner isn't really even prime wing time.  I'd love it if this shop could extend its hours to evening/late night since that's really when I tend towards a chicken wings and waffles craving.

Edit - today tried the peanut-ginger and mexi-cali wings.  The peanut-ginger were awesome! Maybe my fav wings here - tasted just like the peanut sauce you'd get with chicken satay, plus lots of scallions. The mexi-cali wings were super hot, but flavorful...yum!
author: Sara C.

description: KFC wings - the Korean kind is so much tastier than the Kentucky kind.  There's a bit of heat to it, but it's manageable.  Ordered it with a waffle, because I LOVE a good fresh off the iron waffle with all my meals.  The sandwiches were huge, but the FC in it was a bit on the dry side - maybe because I need either more sauce/mayo or more tomatos.  Service was painfully slow because there's only ONE guy taking your order and he's the one making it too.  Tons of interesting hot sauces on display to look at and a few for you to taste while you wait.
author: Kid N.

description: Went to this place for the third time today, had previously had fine experiences. Today was a different story though. Both the lady at the cash register and the cook were surly and rude unwilling to even answer questions about their menu. Got the chicken slider and some shoestring fries. Had to wait 30 minutes for my sandwich, which I watched him microwave. If you are going to microwave the food, fine. But dont try to tell me that everything is made to order, then make me wait for a frozen chicken patty fries that have freezer burn, and microwave it infront of my face. thats just insulting. bad service, frozen food, mediocre wings, this place is a hole. go there if you want, but you've been warned,
author: Matthew T.

description: Fun, spicy, creative & every kind of hot sauce you can imagine! Yum :)
author: Sarah D.

description: Best wings ever... I am a weekend regular now. The KFC and Honey salt and pepper are my favorite. I wish they had more tables to sit at and space, but I walk home fast to eat them right away...
author: Linda A.

description: Very nice .... Tried the waffle sandwich and chicken yakun wings
author: Pras R.

description:
Really, really shocked that there is anything less than a 4 star review for this place, and that there are complaints about how terrible customer service is.  I love, love LOVE Hot Sauce and Panko -- it's one of my favorite spots in the city.  I've had out-of-town visitors trek across town and friends drive in from the South Bay for their wings -- they are that good.

If it wasn't so far away from my home, I'd be in serious danger of becoming obese from chicken wings.  I try to stop by every time I'm passing through the neighborhood, though I do try to exercise some restraint from time to time.

THE GOOD:
- Tiny, hole-in-the-wall mom & pop shop -- but maintains quality and cleanliness!  (I hate when mom & pops think they can be dingy and subpar just because they are a mom &pop.)
- Owner is friendly, approachable and genuinely enthusiastic about hot sauce and wings.  The selection of hot sauces is personally curated, and he can/will tell you about whichever one interests you.
- Mouth-wateringly delicious wings.  The plumpest, meatiest, juiciest wings I've had anywhere.  Mmmmm.  My favorite are the green wings (which have just a hint of spice -- and I usually don't like non-spicy wings)!
- If you're a serious chile-head, the hot wings are actually HOT.  I mean, really hot.  I'm no spice wimp, but the 'hot' level is about as much as I can comfortably handle.  (Levels of spice go from 'hot' to '3X.')  I've had two wings at the 1X level - it took me about 20 minutes and a half gallon of water to get that much down.  Would be a fantastic place for a hot wing throw down with some buddies!
- Fantastic selection of hot sauces.  I've yet to buy one but have eyed them longingly every time I've been in...

THE BAD:
- Limited seating because it's a hole-in-the-wall.  Call ahead and get your wings to go if you live close by.
- Only open until 8pm -- sometimes you just have a late night wing craving, but my guess is the location's not conducive to late-evening/night hours.
- Re: complaints about long waits and timing of the orders -- I've never personally had a problem, but I can see where it might be an issue.  It's a small operation, and I think they haven't been able to scale up production to meet the demand since they've become so popular.  But cut the man some slack -- I think he's been open for less than a year!  I think they'll fix the kinks as time goes own; I'd consider the inconvenience of waiting the growing pains of a burgeoning, popular business.  It's the price you pay for the best wings anywhere.

To all the haters who are complaining about how rude and uncaring the staff are:  I was in the shop one afternoon when a bunch of 12 year old boys came in and ordered the 3X with a lot of bravado.  They grabbed their wings and went outside, and one took a whole wing and gobbled it in about five seconds to show off to his buddies.  He immediately turned red with tears streaming down his face and started gasping for air.  He could barely talk; I think his tongue was numb from the spice!  Various staff members and the owner came out and made sure he had enough water and chocolate syrup (no milk around I guess) to try to help him cool down over the next 20 mins.  They really tried to take care of him -- I mean, you could have just shrugged and said, too bad, no one told you to order the 3X!

If you love hot sauce and/or hot wings, this is a MUST SEE & TASTE.
author: Coco L.

description: We survived the Goliath!  If you haven't had one yet, we highly suggest you have one at least once in your life; put it on your bucket list.  I love this place because it is a family making a business thrive and survive in an SF neighborhood.  Being an SF native, I'm all in to that.  But don't believe me, go, have the green or lime wings, it will set your mouth on fire, in a very good way.
author: Linda H.

description: Great selection of bottled hot sauces and sides. My meat eating friends love the wings, but nothing veg on the menu. I often grab a new sauce from the wall and use it for my veggie wings from Enjoy (around the corner on Geary) so I can still take part in the Sunday Football wing party.
author: V K.

description: a couple of regular flavors along with seasonal flavors--lways have a reason to come by to try the latest creations that hte master chef has to offer, or to get a hit of a dependable classic.  few can pull of fusion (ha, many fail) but this guy can.  works with an incredible spectrum of flavors and juxtapositions of such.  i've eaten things that i never thought were possible.  (where do you go to get your chiccaroon + ponzu sauce fix, who comes up with htat??! well Hot Sauce and Panko does).  their stuff at their best is delicate yet robust; i have refused to introduce their things to friends on a carry out basis because they really are that good and their food needs to be eaten on site, as prepared (although ideally in a different world they'd be structurally suited to support that).  hint: drive your beater and eat fresh hot wings in your car, assuming you get a parking spot 2 blocks away.
author: Ho Nam C.

description: SOOOO GOOOOD!!! i love this place. all of their wings are great, especially the KFC. the sides are all really delicious and the waffles are to die for. with my spoton app i get a free waffle on thursday, who can beat a free waffle. I go to this place once or twice a week, it is just around the corner from my home, but i wish i could go more, their hours are unique. All the hot sauces and syrups are delicious and i am always discovering something new. Great and speedy service too.
author: Scott B.

description: I've been here a few times and each time I had great customer service. Just this past Sunday i went in around 1:30pm to get some chicken wings and right when we got in we were greeted by the cashier and the guy in the back. I even downloaded the spoton app and when I actually used it the cook actually came out and said thank you. He even told me if I liked them on facebook I would be more spots. I ordered the Green and herb crusted panko and it was the best chicken wings I have ever had. I usually don't eat chicken wings however this place has me craving for them. After I received my order the lady at the cashier and the guy cooking the chicken wings both said thank you for coming. The cook also told me to come on Thursday to get a free waffle with a purchase of an order of wings.
author: Kevin N.

description: I work a couple of blocks from this place so it's convenient. The food is pretty good, too. First the wings. The KFC is really delicious. Don't like the name which gives me a greasy feeling. Green wings are also good. The habenero is never around, he sells out of the stuff which makes Lisa want it that much more. She likes hot stuff so I'll wait for her opinion. In the meantime the Thai curry is a bit too creamy for my taste. Just scarfed down the roast beef sandwich which was good enough but could use more MEAT. YK had the fried chicken sandwich was a bit dry but after she put on some of the Georgia Peach sauce and it rocked! The guy is super nice, very helpful and friendly. It's like going to your friend's house for a snack but your friend is a hot sauce fanatic and has his own deep fryer and he can't afford any furniture for you to sit down and his bathroom is so messed up that he won't let you use it. Sort of. If more people go to this place maybe he'll get more furniture and some help back there. If anyone knows where the Panko is, let me know. Anyway, will go back for take out.
author: bongo c.

description: norm told us about this place - lots of wings to choose from - we chose kfc and bulgogi wings for our first time - lots of sauces for sale too - will be back to try others soon
author: rob b.

description: So happy this place exists out in the avenues.  Super friendly and helpful owner, delicious wings, and myriad choices of hot sauces.  The potato salad with sliced chilies were a great complement to the spiciness of the wings.  When I questioned that I did not even know where to begin with all the hot sauce choices, I was given some fries to test out some of the wares.   The oaxaca(with cumin), millie's habanero, and gringo bandido were amongst my faves.  Oh, and I had a delicious fresh ginger ale that really topped everything off.
author: Leo S.

description: This review will probably be influenced in weird ways by the fact that I'm currently eating an order of the XXX wings. Right now I'm riding the euphoria of the pain. This place is amazing OH MY GOD THE PAIN WHO ARE THESE SADISTIC BASTARDS ZERO STARS I'm back. Yeah. Anyway, the wings are awesome. Try the new panko ones, or get the amazing green wings JUST FOR THE LOVE OF GOD AVOID THE XXX SPICY. MY LEG IS GOING NUMB.
author: J N.

description: Their waffles are ridiculous.  I've never gotten it when people go crazy for waffles like they are crack or something, but now I do.  Thank you for showing me the light.  Super friendly and helpful couple that own the place make supporting this business a no brainer.
author: Erick M.

description: yuck.   scary large wings that were limp.   grossed me out and couldn't eat more than one.   don't like my Buffalo wings with breading plus these needed some crisp!   prefer the wings from the joint on geary for sure.
author: Abe C.

description: I support Hot Sauce and Panko.  Great food.  Excellent sense of humor.
author: Riley D.

description: This place is great! I get wings for myself and a waffle for my wife almost every weekend. I have tried five different wing sauces and they have also been terrific. The waffles are delicious too. The best part of this place, however, is probably the owners. They are such nice people and I hope their restaurant is a huge success.
author: David T.

description: first, i will give this place a try again just because the sauces i've tried (hot buffalo and jalapeno) were solid.  guys, hot means hot!  not just a little bit of heat, so watch out.  but it was tasty.  however, i would love it more if the wings were crispy and hotter in temperature.  maybe this is the style, but for me, crispy wings are the best so will try it again and ask for crispy and see how it goes.  for the price of $4.99, you get 4-5 meaty wings, not bad.  and the owners were nice so i'd give it a try again.
author: Food Is L.

description: Exactly what is promised is what you get.  Its a tiny place so the wait is longer because it's that good.  The prices are reasonable.  Five BIG wings and a huge Belgian waffle for 5.99 is just slightly more than a trader joe's salad... and which would you rather have?  Just like Ike's, they suggest you call ahead and that WILL make your visit here five stars.  I ordered a half pan (19.99) + Belgian waffle 45 minutes ahead of time, went to pick it up and it was ready to go and when I got home, it was still hot.  so 23 dollars for a big lunch for two people.  definitely worth the price. Ordered the KFC, bulgogi, and green wings.  all delicious.  The bulgogi was my favorite.  sweet and spicy.  I'll be back to try more wings.   Best wings I have ever had, and I'm not usually a wing person.  You can either take that as I don't know good wings, or my personal belief -  that I've just never had any that were so good that I will go back for more :)   And the Belgian waffle was good.  I'm usually not a waffle fan either, but it was tasty contrast to the heat of the wings. kudos to hot sauce and panko!
author: Lindsay S.
